Professor Siddhartha Mukherjee from the School of Design at UPES has received the prestigious HUDCO award for his work titled "Dehradoon - An Illustrated Journey of a City," which he collaborated on with Ar Maulishree Mishra. This award recognizes Siddhartha Mukherjee's expertise in Urban Design, Regional Planning, Inner City Revitalization, and Conservation. The BBA in Finance Management program at UPES School of Business is a three-year undergraduate degree designed to provide students with comprehensive knowledge of finance and management. The curriculum includes financial accounting, corporate finance, and risk management, with an emphasis on practical learning through internships and real-world projects. Students develop analytical, quantitative, and strategic skills. The program offers career opportunities in various finance roles, supported by alliances with top industries. With UPES ranked among India’s top business schools, graduates are well-prepared for careers in a constantly evolving finance landscape. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in Classes X and XII.

Ashok Kumar Tyagi is an Industry Fellow and Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in energy-related legal frameworks. Ashok Kumar Tyagi holds a graduation and post-graduation in geology from Panjab University, with a focus on mineral exploration. Ashok Kumar Tyagi worked at ONGC from 1978 to 2013, contributing to various aspects of the oil and gas industry, including international collaborations and regulatory initiatives. Since 2018, Ashok Kumar Tyagi has been teaching energy sector laws at UPES, covering topics like O&G laws, coal mining laws, environmental laws, and renewable energy laws.

UPES offers an MBA in Business Analytics in collaboration with KPMG, designed to equip students with skills in data analysis for informed decision-making. The program combines core business courses with specialized analytics training, emphasizing data mining, predictive analytics, and machine learning. Students can specialize in Energy Analytics or Data Mining, gaining industry-relevant knowledge through projects, internships, and guest lectures. Graduates have opportunities as data analysts, business intelligence managers, and more, with high placement potential in reputed companies like Flipkart and Accenture. The program prepares students for a data-centric career in various industries.

Mr. Yogesh Bhattarai is a Partner at Trilegal in Mumbai, specializing in corporate law with a focus on mergers, acquisitions, and cross-border transactions. He advises clients on regulatory compliance and sector-specific issues across industries. Mr. Yogesh Bhattarai has represented major Indian and international companies, collaborating with private equity funds, and facilitating both inbound and outbound transactions in jurisdictions including China, France, Germany, and Singapore. His expertise extends to sectors such as manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, and healthcare, providing strategic advice on entry/exit strategies and complex financial structures.

The International Admissions webpage of UPES provides information for international and NRI students seeking admission to various programs. Dr. Mohammad Younus Bhatt is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, holding a Ph.D. in Economics with a focus on Environmental Valuation and Choice Modelling. His research scope includes climate change impacts and eco-tourism links in Himalayan communities. Contact: Younus.bhat@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Ph.D. program in Computer Science at UPES School of Computer Science offers a flexible research-focused experience for both full-time and part-time scholars, lasting from three to six years. GitHub India and the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to enhance entrepreneurship and employability for UPES students in software development. Amar Jindal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES. The B.Tech Civil Engineering program with a specialization in Environmental Engineering at UPES School of Advanced Engineering prepares students to tackle environmental challenges in urban infrastructure. UPES Law Review is a prominent annual journal published by the School of Law at UPES, Dehradun, and is UGC CARE listed (ISSN: 2347-9620). Submission guidelines detail requirements for articles and research papers, with deadlines set for May 30, 2024, for extended abstracts and August 15, 2024, for full papers.

UPES outlines various student committees that enhance campus life and foster student engagement. Dr. Pushpa Sharma is a Distinguished Professor at the Energy Cluster of UPES, specializing in Reservoir Engineering with 38 years of experience, including 28 years at ONGC as a Reservoir Engineer. Dr. Sharma has received numerous awards for outstanding contributions to the field and actively participates in course redesign and student mentorship.

Rajesh Maithani is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with a Ph.D. from Uttarakhand Technical University awarded in 2017. Dr. Maithani specializes in heat transfer and renewable energy, publishing over seventy research papers and holding more than 10 patents. His teaching philosophy emphasizes a student-centered approach focusing on critical thinking and problem-solving. Gurpreet Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with expertise as an artist and sculptor. The webpage discusses career opportunities for geology graduates, emphasizing the importance of a master’s degree, such as an M.Sc. in Geology, for advanced roles. The field plays a crucial role in addressing climate change and resource management, supporting sustainable development while offering a fulfilling professional journey.

Nagesh Lakhan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design at UPES, specializing in graphic design and branding. UPES faculty Dr. Anmol Srivastava and Pankaj Badoni presented a workshop titled "Into the Metaverse – AR/VR" at the Pune Design Festival 2022. The workshop discussed various technologies driving the Metaverse, such as Artificial Intelligence and blockchain, alongside concepts like digital twins and immersive experiences. Dr. Abhishek Kumar Singh is an Associate Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, specializing in Digital Media. Mechatronics Engineering, as explored by Dr. Asish Karn at UPES, merges mechanical, computer, and electronic systems, paving promising career paths in automation and advanced technologies. The UPES School of Engineering offers a range of minors that students can pursue alongside their core specializations. Dr. Abhishek Chandra is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Health Sciences and Technology, specializing in food technology and sustainable processing techniques. The UPES School of Law hosted the annual ADR fest 'Madhyastham' from April 1-3, 2022, focusing on Alternative Dispute Resolution methods. Dr. Amit Verma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, with significant contributions to healthcare and agriculture, such as skin cancer classification and potato blight disease management. UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a B.Tech in Electronics and Computer Engineering program designed to meet the evolving demands of technology. Shikha Saxena is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, with over 13 years of experience in academia and consultancy in public health nutrition. Pursuing a Bachelor of Pharmacy (B. Pharma) degree provides students with essential skills and knowledge in pharmaceutical sciences. The B.Tech Aerospace Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers specializations in Space Technology, Avionics, and Defence Technology, preparing students as industry-ready professionals. Effective interventions can alleviate the economic impact, enhance health outcomes, and support the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals.

Shirley Bhatnagar is an Associate Professor at the School of Design, UPES, specializing in industrial ceramics and traditional crafts, bridging art and design. Sugandh Agarwal, a student from UPES School of Computer Science, shares his journey from UPES to joining the Indian Army as an All India Rank 2 in Computer Science Engineering for the Technical Graduate Course-132 entry. Studying B.Tech with a specialization in Business Analytics at UPES equipped Sugandh Agarwal with essential skills in data analysis and operational synchronization. Participating in extracurricular activities and mentorship from UPES faculty enhanced Sugandh Agarwal's capabilities. Motivated by family heritage and guidance from Indian Air Force officials, Sugandh Agarwal successfully prepared for competitive exams, securing multiple recommendations from the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force.

Dr. Susmay Nandi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. He has published 21 papers and won several awards for his research contributions. Contact: susmay.nandi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Shivam Khullar is an Advisory Board Member at UPES and serves as the Head of Customer Solutions for CRM Platforms at Google. Shivam Khullar specializes in designing and building scalable, reliable enterprise products that enhance data management and optimize processes for organizations. With substantial experience in delivering Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Configure Price and Quote (CPQ), and Contact Channels Solutions for Silicon Valley technology companies, Shivam Khullar emphasizes team inspiration through meaningful purpose and a compelling vision.

UPES alumni reflect on their campus experiences, highlighting the vibrant life and memories created during their studies at UPES. Overall, the blog celebrates the enriching and diverse experiences at UPES.

Professor Pankaj Kumar Srivastava is a key expert in space technology and earth resource modeling at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. Pankaj Kumar Srivastava teaches remote sensing, geospatial courses, and geology, emphasizing interactive learning. Pankaj Kumar Srivastava has published over 50 research papers and has received various scholarships and awards for his contributions to the field.

The B.Tech. Electronics and Computer Engineering (Microelectronics) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering focuses on microelectronics, including chip design and ASIC and CMOS manufacturing. The program aligns with future industry trends in the growing chip fabrication market.

The B.Tech in Health Sciences program at UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology integrates technology with healthcare education. Offering specialisations like Pharmaceutical Biotechnology and Biomedical Engineering, the program combines engineering principles with healthcare management and practical training through labs and internships. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in X and XII with specific subjects. UPES's industry connections facilitate hands-on experience and job placements in healthcare technology and management. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary learning, preparing graduates for diverse career opportunities in healthcare innovation and technology. Applications are open until August 31, 2024, with valid JEE scores accepted.

UPES School of Law has appointed esteemed legal professionals as Professors of Practice (PoPs) to enhance academic excellence by providing students with insights from industry experts. This initiative aligns with University Grants Commission guidelines, allowing institutions to hire experienced practitioners. PoPs will offer comprehensive courses, facilitating a transition from theoretical learning to real-world application. Notable appointments include Mr. Sajit Suvarna of DSK Legal and Mr. Vineet Shingal of Khaitan & Co. This program intends to equip students with practical skills necessary for success in the legal profession, fostering a seamless shift from academia to industry.

Dr. Soumya Gupta is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, specializing in nutrition and diabetes education. She holds a B.Sc. from Banasthali University, an M.Sc. in Foods & Nutrition from GB Pant University, and a Ph.D. in Human Nutrition. Dr. Gupta’s expertise includes clinical nutrition, public health nutrition, and maternal and child health. She has over five years of academic experience, has published research on nutrition policies, and mentors students. Her teaching philosophy emphasizes active engagement and critical thinking in nutritional education. Contact: soumya.gupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Ramendra Pati Pandey is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES. His research focuses on immunology, particularly the transcription factor Foxo1's role in T helper cells and the therapeutic evaluation of compounds for diseases like typhoid and Chagas disease. Dr. Ramendra has received multiple awards, including Young Scientist Awards from various organizations and has significant experience in academia, including a post-doctoral fellowship in Brazil. He emphasizes student engagement in scientific projects and teaches immunology and microbiology using relatable analogies. His work includes developing vaccine delivery systems and repurposing drugs for COVID-19.

The Student Outcomes webpage of UPES highlights the university's successful placement track record, showcasing nearly 22,000 alumni who work globally and participate in regional chapters. UPES emphasizes industry partnerships for career readiness, supported by modern facilities on a 44-acre campus. Notable alumni achievements are featured, along with initiatives like NEST, which assists alumni with upskilling, careers, incubation, and further education opportunities. The university offers unique social internships to foster community engagement. Overall, UPES aims to transform higher education and empower students with practical skills for their future careers.

The B.Sc. (Hons.) in Geology with a specialization in Geoinformatics at UPES School of Advanced Engineering combines geological sciences with geoinformatics, equipping students with skills in GIS, Remote Sensing, and data analysis. The curriculum emphasizes practical applications, industry-oriented skills, and hands-on experience. Graduates enjoy diverse career opportunities in sectors like environmental consulting, urban planning, and disaster management, aligning with national initiatives such as Digital India and Smart Cities. Further studies are encouraged to enhance expertise. The program prepares students for emerging careers in geospatial technology and addresses Earth and environmental challenges effectively.

The B.Tech. Biotechnology (Pharmaceutical Biotechnology) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology offers comprehensive training in biotechnological applications within the pharmaceutical industry. The curriculum includes topics such as pharmacology, medicinal chemistry, and drug discovery, alongside hands-on experience in advanced biotechnology labs. Graduates are prepared for diverse careers as pharmaceutical researchers, bioprocess engineers, and regulatory affairs managers. The program emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration and addresses industry trends like biopharmaceuticals and personalized medicine, promoting a strong placement record in leading biotech companies. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in relevant subjects at the high school level.

Parminder Singh Sethi, a B.Tech graduate in Computer Science Engineering specializing in Cloud Computing and Virtualization from UPES, set a record for the "maximum patents achieved by an individual from a foreign patent agency," according to the Indian Book of Records. From November 14, 2019, to September 27, 2022, Parminder Singh Sethi secured 36 patents from the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and has since increased the total to over 55 granted patents and 170+ pending patents. Parminder's journey reflects perseverance in achieving innovation despite facing multiple challenges.

Dehradun-based UPES has announced the establishment of a new Centre of Excellence for AI, planning to invest INR 50 crores to promote cutting-edge research. This facility will enhance interdisciplinary research, consulting, and training in AI and Data Sciences, providing advanced infrastructure for over 50 researchers. The centre aims to facilitate academic programs and apply AI technologies in sectors such as BFSI, healthcare, defense, and manufacturing. Dr. Ravi S Iyer emphasized the importance of AI in the global economy and UPES's commitment to nurture skills and knowledge in this transformative field.

Dr. Nirlipta Priyadarshini Nayak is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Energy and Earth Sciences. With a focus on Carbon Storage and Clean Coal Technology, Dr. Nayak investigates Carbon Dioxide storage potential in Basaltic formations. Since joining UPES in 2015, Dr. Nayak has taught courses in Earth Sciences, fostering a supportive learning environment while promoting research in Mineral Processing and Carbon Utilization. Dr. Nayak's teaching approach emphasizes creativity and student engagement, aiming to enhance meaningful learning experiences. Dr. Nayak has published extensively in recognized journals and led multidisciplinary research projects.

UPES School of Design offers B.Des., M.Des., and integrated B.Des. and M.Des. programs with a focus on creativity and technology. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) has formed a collaboration with University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) to enhance education in oil and gas management. This collaboration focuses on creating a contemporary, industry-relevant educational framework.

Satarupa Lahiri is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES, holding a Ph.D. in History from Jawaharlal Nehru University. Specializing in military medicine, Satarupa Lahiri's research encompasses caste, gender, and environmental history, with a focus on public health and urbanization. Satarupa Lahiri emphasizes creating an inclusive learning environment and mentors students to inspire intellectual curiosity. Satarupa Lahiri's contact email is satarupa.lahiri@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES offers exceptional placement opportunities, highlighted by being the first Indian university awarded a 5-Star rating in employability by QS. Placement reports detail consistent growth and successful outcomes for graduates.

The M.Tech. in Renewable Energy program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a 2-year course designed for engineering and science graduates. The curriculum, developed with industry input, covers key renewable energy technologies, policy, and sustainability, with practical exposure through labs and field visits. Students can pursue funded research projects and internships, enhancing career prospects in solar, wind, and biomass sectors. The program's industry ties support high employability rates through the UPES placement cell. The MBA in Family Business and Entrepreneurship program at UPES School of Business equips students with skills to manage and grow family businesses. Dr. Balendu Shekher Giri is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with a master’s and PhD in Microbiology from Barkatullah University and CSIR NEERI. Dr. Om Prakash is a Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 20 years of experience in research, teaching, and academic leadership. He leads the Aerospace Engineering department and has completed numerous DRDO-funded projects. Dr. Om Prakash's research focuses on Nonlinear Flight Dynamics, Modeling, and Flight Stability of various vehicles. His educational approach combines theoretical and practical applications, enhancing aircraft performance. Dr. Om Prakash teaches core Aerospace courses and has received accolades from AIAA and IEEE. Currently, he supervises several Ph.D. scholars and engages in advanced aerospace projects.

Pariniti Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, specializing in fashion, accessories, product design, graphics, and UI/UX. The B.Sc. (Hons.) in Economics and Finance program at UPES focuses on mastering economic theories and financial principles through project-based learning and real-world case studies. The program prepares graduates for various careers such as Financial Analyst and Risk Manager, and advocates for internships and hands-on experiences. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in 10th and 12th grades, with a competitive selection process based on SAT scores and interviews.

The webpage from the UPES Editorial Team discusses the growing career opportunities in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) for the 21st century. It highlights that the World Economic Forum predicts a 41% job growth in these fields between 2020 and 2025, creating around 1 million new jobs. High demand, lucrative salaries, and the potential for significant societal impact make AI and ML attractive career paths. Common job roles include AI/ML Engineer, Data Scientist, AI/ML Researcher, and AI/ML Consultant. The webpage also encourages pursuing relevant courses to gain credentials in AI and ML.

Ms. Rachna Jha is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. She holds a graduate degree from National Law University & Judicial Academy, Assam, and a master's in Environmental and Natural Resources Law from TERI School of Advanced Studies, New Delhi. Her research interests include Environmental Law, Energy Law, and Natural Resources Laws. She emphasizes fostering curiosity and critical thinking in her teaching approach. Ms. Rachna Jha teaches various law courses and has presented at international conferences.

The webpage "Joining Hearts and Minds: Top Lessons from Women Leaders" by UPES Editorial Team discusses significant insights gained from female leaders, emphasizing empathy as a core tenet of effective leadership. Highlighting former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Arden's candid approach and resilience following personal tragedy, the webpage showcases diverse women leaders like Malavika Hegde and Lisa Mayer. They exemplify overcoming adversity, fostering inclusive environments, and supporting other women. Effective listening and emotional intelligence are identified as key traits, reinforcing that modern leadership is about community, vulnerability, and collective growth.

Geoscience education offers promising careers in Earth science, focusing on natural resource management, environmental protection, and climate change mitigation. Dr. Annapurna Boruah highlights that geologists and geoscientists are vital in climate research, carbon capture, sustainable energy, and hazard assessment. The Bureau of Labor Statistics projects a 14% job growth in geoscience within the next decade, with average salaries exceeding $83,000 annually. Opportunities in India, particularly within public sector undertakings like ONGC and BPCL, enhance the attractiveness of this field, making geology a dynamic and impactful career choice for future professionals.

Aditya Mukherjee's article emphasizes the growing significance of Electric Vehicle (EV) technology for career opportunities in India. As global demand for EVs surges, driven by environmental concerns and falling battery prices, the Indian EV sector is poised to create approximately 5 million jobs by 2025. Academic programs focusing on EV technology, like the B.Tech. in Electric Vehicles offered at UPES, prepare students for roles in design, development, and infrastructure of electric vehicles. The article highlights the importance of hands-on projects and government incentives to encourage adoption and reduce carbon footprints through EVs.

The webpage discusses the BA LL.B. (Hons.), a five-year integrated law program that combines humanities and legal studies, offering students the chance to specialize in various fields. Specializations include Constitutional Law, Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Taxation Law, Intellectual Property Rights, Energy and Environmental Law, Banking and Insolvency Law, Investment and Trade Law, Disruptive Technologies Law, and Industrial Relations and Constitution Law. The UPES School of Law is highlighted as a reputable institution for pursuing this comprehensive degree, equipping graduates for diverse legal careers.

Shivali Nain, an M.Sc. student specializing in Clinical Research from UPES (batch 2021-23), received the Best Oral Presentation Award at the International Conference on Nanopharmaceuticals and Neurological Disorders (ICNAND2023) held from February 2-4, 2023, at Indira Gandhi National Tribal University in Amarkantak, Madhya Pradesh, India. Shivali Nain's presentation focused on "Deciphering autism epidemiology in the Dehradun region," aiming to identify risk factors associated with autism and improve early diagnosis through field surveys, data collection, and statistical analysis. Dr. Shubham Dwivedi was the mentor for this project.

Dr. Suvendu Manna, a faculty member at the School of Advanced Engineering, achieved an Indian Patent (number 412047) in 2022 for a water filtration process utilizing nano adsorbent loaded porous clay pot filters. This innovation addresses sustainability in water purification. Dr. Suvendu Manna co-authored the patent with Amit Kumar Sharma and Ravi Kumar Patel, highlighting collaboration in advancing engineering solutions. The recognition underscores the commitment to research and innovation at UPES, contributing to academic excellence and advancements in environmental sustainability.

Dr. Laxmi Kirola, from the UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology, has received a grant from DST-SERB under the TARE Scheme, mentored by Dr. Sujata Mohanty from AIIMS Stem Cell Facility, Delhi. The funded project, titled "Human Induced Pluripotent Stem Cell-Based Functional Characterizations of Novel Identified Disease Causal Gene(s)/Variant(s) in Families with Juvenile Parkinson’s Disease," focuses on advanced stem cell research to enhance understanding of juvenile Parkinson’s disease, providing hope for affected individuals. This achievement highlights Dr. Laxmi Kirola's commitment to pioneering medical science.

Samiksha Puri and Nitika Bhambri, students of BSc. in Microbiology (2020-23), conducted a project on the application of microbial transglutaminase (MTGase) to enhance the texture and quality of Indian sweets. The project aimed to improve nutritional aspects, reduce costs, ensure physicochemical stability, and control the molecular composition of food products using MTGase. The study explored optimizing MTGase production through genetic engineering, combining it with modern food processing techniques to improve protein gel properties, thereby increasing consumer demand for protein-based foods. Dr. Smriti Arora mentored the project.

Ronika Tater shares her experience attending two international conferences organized by Harvard University: the Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations (HPAIR) and the Harvard US-India Initiative (HUII). Through LinkedIn connections, Ronika Tater discovered these conferences, which provide networking and insights on critical economic, political, and social issues. Although health issues prevented attendance at HPAIR, Ronika Tater participated in the virtual HUII session, engaging with notable delegates and speakers. Ronika Tater emphasizes the importance of such events for professional growth and expresses gratitude to supporters while expressing interest in future conferences.

Richa Choudhary is an Assistant Professor-Senior Scale at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 7 years of teaching and 3 years of industry experience, including a role as Associate Consultant at Oracle. Richa Choudhary holds a B.Tech in IT and an M.Tech in CSE from Kurukshetra University and is pursuing a PhD at UPES. Richa Choudhary focuses on data science, machine learning, and computational sustainability. Richa Choudhary promotes an interactive teaching style and has organized national and international hackathons, alongside several published research articles and awards in her field. Richa Choudhary can be contacted via email at r.choudhary@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Lateral Entry Policy at UPES allows candidates with a 3-year Engineering Diploma to enter B.Tech programs, beginning in the 3rd semester, provided they have at least 60% marks in relevant subjects. Admission is based on available seats from dropouts and is limited to a maximum of 10% of the total enrollment. Eligible applicants must adhere to specific program compatibility. Attendance is calculated from registration date, and students must complete the program within five years. A selection process includes a test-cum-interview, and selected students may take a special preparatory course. Reservation norms apply where relevant.

Dr. Vaibhav Tripathi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in entrepreneurial ecosystems and startup mentoring. With over 14 years of experience, Dr. Tripathi has established incubation centers and mentored over 50 startups. Dr. Tripathi teaches courses including Entrepreneurial Skills, Design Thinking, and Business Planning, and co-guides Ph.D. scholars. Research interests include the impact of entrepreneurship on economic development, especially in rural areas. Dr. Tripathi has published in Scopus-indexed journals and authored a book on successful entrepreneurs. He promotes experiential learning and received grants for entrepreneurship education initiatives.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) has partnered with the National Association of Software and Service Companies (NASSCOM) to provide students and alumni access to over 155 online courses across sectors like IT, Healthcare, and Banking. This collaboration offers free, short learning pathways curated by industry experts, along with micro-credentials and advanced courses. Participants can engage in masterclasses and nationwide hackathons, and opportunities for internships with leading companies. Additionally, learners stand to benefit from a government incentive scheme for course completion.

Ravinder Kaushik is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, specializing in Food Fortification, new food product development, and bakery products. Ravinder Kaushik's research addresses micronutrient deficiency, waste management, and analytical methods in dairy and cereal processing. With over ten years of teaching experience, Ravinder Kaushik has previously worked at Shoolini University and Amity University. Ravinder Kaushik employs a “flipping the classroom” philosophy to facilitate student learning. Ravinder Kaushik leads significant projects funded by the Indian government and collaborates with the World Food Program on fortified rice initiatives.

Vikrant Chandekar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design at UPES, specializing in design, game development, and digital art. His teaching philosophy incorporates a flipped classroom model, emphasizing interactive discussions and practical problem-solving. Vikrant's research interests include toy design, sustainable design, and integrating indigenous art into games. With extensive experience in digital art, he has worked with notable companies and contributed to design education. Vikrant teaches courses such as Concept Art for Games and Level Design. He published a book on illustration in 2022, enhancing knowledge in this field. Contact Vikrant at vchandekar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Surya Saxena is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, with a focus on Alternate Dispute Resolution, Legal Writing, Corporate Laws, and legal education. Dr. Surya Saxena emphasizes critical thinking and practical application in teaching, aiming to foster a vibrant learning environment. With approximately four years of academic experience, Dr. Surya Saxena has taught Arbitration Law, Competition Law, and Company Law. Dr. Surya Saxena’s research interests include arbitration and corporate law. As a published scholar, Dr. Surya Saxena actively contributes to legal discourse and mentors students on ethical practices.

Dr. Roohi Sille is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES. Her research focuses on Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, and Medical Image Segmentation, with numerous publications in SCI and Scopus-indexed journals. With nine years at UPES, Dr. Sille has held various roles including subject coordinator and course coordinator, emphasizing a student-centered teaching philosophy that incorporates project-based learning. Her courses include Operating Systems and Artificial Neural Networks.

Dr. Aarushi Batra, a faculty member at UPES, received the 'Best Presenter' award for her paper titled "Integrating Gender Perspective in Judicial Decisions in the Light of Low Representation of Women in Judiciary" at the National Conference on Working of the Indian Judicial System organized by the Indian Law Institute, Delhi, on April 22-23, 2023. Additionally, Dr. Aarushi was honored with the "Iconic Woman Creating a Better World for All" award at the 84th Annual Women Economic Forum in December 2022, where Dr. Aarushi presented on "Sports & Inclusion." Dr. Aarushi also chaired a technical session at the National Conference on Transforming India: Risk to Resilience at JNU on March 16, 2023.

The School of Advanced Engineering at UPES offers a Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) in Mechanical Engineering. Students are prepared for careers in various sectors, including automotive, aerospace, and manufacturing. For inquiries, UPES provides counseling and support services.

Urjasvi, Abhijeet Yadav, and Kartikey Bansal achieved recognition as Runners Up in the 2nd CS Ajmera Memorial National Moot Court Competition. This accomplishment highlights the academic excellence of these students from the School of Law at UPES. Their participation in a national-level competition showcases their skills in legal advocacy and critical thinking, contributing to the prestigious reputation of UPES and its programs.

Shruti Dasgupta is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. Shruti Dasgupta has a master's degree in Personal Laws and specializes in gender justice and women-related laws. Dr. Sivasundar Manisankar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in VLSI Design, Embedded Systems, and IoT. Dr. Sivasundar teaches various courses, including Embedded Systems and Digital Electronics.

The Ph.D. program in Electrical Engineering at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a structured curriculum for leadership in academia and industry over 3 to 5 years. The Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA) program in Cyber Security at UPES School of Computer Science provides students with a comprehensive understanding of cybersecurity alongside practical skills. Ankur Mittal is a Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with a Ph.D. in finance and qualifications in M.Com and MBA in Finance. Amar Shukla is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, specializing in Artificial Intelligence (AI). The QS World University Ranking is an annual evaluation that ranks universities globally and regionally, assessing institutions across 51 subjects. It has a significant impact on higher education by influencing student choices and institutional strategies. Launched 17 years ago, the QS rankings are recognized for their consistent innovation, providing authoritative insights into university performance worldwide. QS Ranking has become a leading resource for prospective students, helping them identify top universities for various academic disciplines.

Anushka Srivastava is an Assistant Professor at UPES, Dehradun, with a focus on law, finance, and sustainability. Anushka Srivastava holds a BBA LLB from Delhi Metropolitan Education and a Master of Law from UPES, where Anushka Srivastava was awarded the best PG student in 2022. Anushka Srivastava has experience in legal research, particularly on green financing's role in climate change. Anushka Srivastava teaches corporate governance, emphasizing ethical business management. Anushka Srivastava promotes a positive learning environment and has published research in esteemed legal journals. Anushka Srivastava's research interests include Corporate Law and Environmental Law.

Dr. Mrittunjoy Guha Majumdar is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at UPES, leading the Centre for Excellence for Quantum Technology. Dr. Mrittunjoy holds a doctorate from the University of Cambridge and has postdoctoral experience at Harvard University and the Indian Institute of Science. Dr. Mrittunjoy’s research focuses on non-classical correlations and quantum information processing. Dr. Mrittunjoy emphasizes competency-based learning and interdisciplinary approaches in teaching. Dr. Mrittunjoy has received multiple fellowships and awards, including the Trinity Barlow Fellowship and the Nehru Fellowship. Dr. Mrittunjoy teaches various physics courses, including Quantum Mechanics and Electromagnetism.

In a UPES web talk, Dr. C. P. Ramanarayanan, Vice-Chancellor of the Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, discusses the engineering behind Rafale jets. He emphasizes Rafale's capabilities, its classification among fighter aircraft, and the significance of technological advancements in warfare. Dr. Ramanarayanan highlights challenges faced during aircraft development, such as maintenance costs and geopolitical constraints. He promotes India's self-reliance in fighter aircraft technology through initiatives like the Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft program and urges educational institutions to develop qualified engineers. The session underscores the transformative role of engineering in modern defense technology.

Dr. Pragya Katyayan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Quantum Computing. Dr. Pragya completed a PhD in Computer Science from Banasthali Vidyapith and has over 30 research publications and multiple software copyrights. Dr. Pragya has 6 years of research experience, contributing significantly to government-sponsored projects on machine translation involving numerous Indian languages. Dr. Pragya is also an IBM Quantum certified Quantum Developer and Qiskit Advocate, having received multiple awards for excellence in Quantum. Dr. Pragya teaches courses in AI, Quantum Computing, and Programming.

Dr. Ashish Mathur is a Professor at UPES's School of Advanced Engineering, specializing in nanotechnology and sensor development. Dr. Mathur's innovative work includes advanced biosensors for cardiac risk detection and affordable healthcare solutions. Recognized with the DST-UKIERI and INSA Young Scientist Fellowship, Dr. Mathur's research has secured over INR 3.5 crores in funding and led to 120+ publications and 26 patents. Dr. Mathur teaches courses in Nanotechnology, Sensor Development, and Research Methodology while promoting critical thinking and real-world applications in the classroom. Dr. Mathur actively engages in scholarly activities and international collaborations to integrate research and practical solutions.

Kishore Jayaraman serves as the President for Rolls-Royce India and South Asia, overseeing strategic focus and expansion in Defence, Civil Aerospace, and Power Systems. Kishore holds multiple degrees, including a Master's in Mechanical Engineering from OSU Stillwater and an MBA from the University of Georgia. With 23 years at GE, including leadership in various global markets, Kishore has championed technology innovation, establishing Rolls-Royce's engineering capabilities in India. Additionally, Kishore is active on boards and industry committees, advocating for sustainability and ecosystem evolution.

The UPES fee structure for Global Programs outlines tuition costs for various engineering and business courses in collaboration with international universities. For engineering programs, annual fees at UPES range from INR 2,68,000 to INR 4,10,000, with scholarships available reducing partner university fees significantly. Business programs have fees starting at INR 3,32,000 for BBA and INR 8,02,000 for MBA, with similar scholarship opportunities. International credit transfer rules apply, and all fees are subject to change. Current exchange rates may affect final costs, so prospective students should check for updates.

The MA Journalism and Mass Communication (Digital) program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is a two-year course focusing on digital media and communication. It includes media writing, digital production, and industry engagement with experts. The curriculum emphasizes practical skills through internships and projects, preparing graduates for careers in digital journalism, content creation, and social media management. Graduates will possess skills in multimedia storytelling and digital marketing, making them competitive in the evolving digital media landscape. Admission requires 50% in previous academics, with selection based on personal interviews.

Jagadeeshwar Kodavaty is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. He specializes in hydrogel characterization, drug release kinetics, and rheology of soft materials. His previous experience includes roles at Sri Venkateswara Engineering College and Hindustan University. Jagadeeshwar Kodavaty’s teaching philosophy emphasizes diverse learning methods and active engagement through projects and real-world scenarios. He teaches subjects like process dynamics and engineering economics and has published numerous research papers, holding an h-index of 6 and an i10-index of 5. Jagadeeshwar Kodavaty can be contacted via kodavaty@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Memorandum of Understanding between Power Sector Skill Council (PSSC) and University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) enables students in B.Tech. Electrical Engineering, MBA Power Management, and M.Tech. Energy Systems to receive skill certification under the National Skill Development Council. This partnership aims to enhance students' employability in the power sector by providing faculty training, student internships, and research opportunities. Power Sector Skill Council is supported by the Ministry of Power, Ministry of New and Renewable Energy, and Indian Electrical & Electronics Manufacturers Association, focusing on skill development in power generation, transmission, distribution, and renewable energy.

The UPES Student Projects webpage showcases innovative and creative projects developed by students at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). These student-led initiatives highlight the application of problem-solving skills and hands-on learning, emphasizing solution-oriented thinking. The platform allows students to display their ingenuity and is a testament to the educational approach at UPES, facilitating a nurturing environment for practical learning and innovation. Users can browse various projects and learn about the valuable skills and knowledge developed through these initiatives at UPES.

Mekhla Harrison is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, and a contemporary Indian artist specializing in mural design and fine arts. She graduated from Sir J.J School of Art and earned a master's from College of Art, New Delhi. With over 20 years of experience, Mekhla has showcased her work in numerous exhibitions, focusing on sustainability and eco-friendly practices in art. Her teaching emphasizes a supportive environment encouraging creative expression and awareness of socio-political issues. Mekhla has received various awards, such as the Lalit Kala Academy Research Grant. She promotes handmade paper-making from wastepaper.

Dr. Binod Kumar Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in statistics, operations research, and business analytics. He obtained a PhD in Statistics from Banaras Hindu University and has over 16 years of teaching experience, previously at Amity Business School. Dr. Binod has published 48 research papers and authored two books. His teaching philosophy focuses on developing decision-making skills using real-life problems and statistical software. He teaches courses such as Quantitative Methods and Business Analytics. Dr. Binod has received several awards for his scholarly contributions. Contact: binodsingh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Com (Hons) in E-Commerce program at UPES School of Business is an undergraduate course designed for careers in the e-commerce industry. It covers digital marketing, supply chain management, web development, and provides practical training through internships. Students engage in live projects, industry visits, and guest lectures from experts. The curriculum incorporates technology trends, AI, and data analytics. Graduates can pursue careers as e-commerce managers, digital marketing specialists, and entrepreneurs, with starting salaries between INR 6-10 lakh per annum. Eligibility includes 50% marks in Classes X and XII, with selection based on a personal interview.

Professor Vinod Patidar is a faculty member at the School of Computer Science at UPES with 23 years of experience in teaching, research, and academic administration. He is known for his expertise in Nonlinear Dynamics, Chaos Theory, and Cryptography, with around 95 publications and 4350 citations. Professor Patidar has received multiple awards and grants, including the MOST CITED PAPER AWARD for his work in Image and Vision Computing. He utilizes an adaptive teaching approach that encourages student engagement and integrates research into the curriculum. Professor Patidar's research interests include Cryptography, Image Encryption, and Quantum Image Processing.

The UPES School of Liberal Studies offers two Master of Arts programs: MA in Journalism and Mass Communication (Digital) and MA in Digital and Mass Media (Broadcasting). Both programs focus on digital media, production, and broadcasting technologies, equipping students with skills for careers in digital marketing, media management, and broadcasting. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in class X, XII, and graduation. The program fees total approximately ₹5,00,800 for four semesters. Career opportunities include roles such as content managers, digital directors, and media educators. Admissions close on August 31, 2024.

UPES offers a diverse range of undergraduate programs across multiple schools, including engineering, business, law, design, health sciences, and liberal studies. Admission requirements vary by program, and prospective students can apply online. UPES is self-funded and maintains a strong placement record, with top recruiters like Amazon and Deloitte. Students are required to have a laptop or tablet meeting specific specifications. The university provides limited accommodation on-campus and has formal partnerships with banks for education loans. More details on application procedures, fees, and course eligibility can be found on the UPES website.

Mr. Sajit Suvarna is the Deputy Managing Partner at DSK Legal and an Advisory Board Member at UPES. He leads the Real Estate practice, providing expert legal advice to property developers, government entities, and financial institutions on complex real estate transactions, including acquisition, development, and regulatory compliance. Mr. Sajit Suvarna is recognized for his pragmatic approach and contributes to Smart City initiatives. He is also involved in historical acquisitions, like converting Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar's London residence into a memorial. Additionally, Mr. Sajit Suvarna frequently speaks at legal seminars on real estate and construction law.

Dr. Seim Timung is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in microfluidics, energy harvesting, and nanomaterials. He completed his PhD at IIT Guwahati, focusing on oil-water flow in microfluidics and developed a microfluidic solar harvester. Dr. Seim Timung has a Master of Technology in Petroleum Refinery Engineering and has published extensively, including a US Patent. He has received multiple awards for his research and emphasizes inclusive, student-centered teaching. Dr. Seim Timung has experience with software like Ansys Fluent and MATLAB, teaching various chemical engineering subjects at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels.

The webpage details an industrial tour undertaken by UPES Aerospace and Avionics Engineering students to Hyderabad from April 11-15, 2023. Led by faculty members Dr. Sudhir Kumar Chaturvedi, Dr. Om Prakash, Mr. Ramesh Kumar, and Dr. Geetanjali Raghav, the tour included visits to the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO), Bharat Dynamics Limited (BDL), and Skyroot Aerospace. Students gained firsthand experience in remote sensing technology, missile development, and rocket propulsion systems. The tour provided valuable insights into the aerospace industry and emphasized the importance of innovation, while students also explored Hyderabad’s cultural heritage.

The M.Sc. in Chemistry (Instrumental Chemical Analysis) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering prepares students for careers in analytical chemistry. The curriculum covers spectroscopy, characterization techniques, quality control, and data processing, equipping graduates with skills for industries like pharmaceuticals and environmental monitoring. The program includes hands-on experience, a dissertation, and support for CSIR-NET and GATE exam preparations. Graduates can pursue roles as Research Scientists, Scientific Officers, and Consultant Chemists, benefiting from UPES's strong placement network. Eligibility requires 50% in prior academic qualifications, with selection based on personal interviews.

Chandrayaan-3, India's third lunar mission led by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), aims to enhance research in biological and health sciences. The mission seeks to explore the Moon's capacity to sustain life and the effects of lunar radiation on biological organisms and biomedical devices. The designated landing site, Shiv-Shakti Point, symbolizes India's commitment to humanity's well-being. Additionally, insights gained may lead to advancements in medical imaging and telemedicine technologies. The mission aligns with Indian cultural traditions, emphasizing exploration and knowledge, particularly through the wisdom of the Vedas, fostering a deeper understanding of cosmic and biological connections.

Dr. Himanshu Chauhan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with over 16 years of experience in marketing and entrepreneurship across various sectors. He has established the Incubation Centre at Doon Business School and has worked with notable companies like Unisys and KPMG. Dr. Chauhan holds a PhD in destination branding, an MBA from the Faculty of Management Studies, University of Delhi, and an engineering degree from the National Institute of Technology – Bhopal. His research interests include slow tourism, frugal marketing, and sustainability in entrepreneurship. He teaches courses on marketing communication, brand management, and consumer behavior.

The UPES admissions webpage provides downloadable materials including brochures, employee documents, policies, and student downloads. Potential students can access information on various programs offered by UPES, such as B.Tech, MBA, M.Des, PhD, and more. The page facilitates downloads under multiple categories and includes contact information for inquiries. UPES emphasizes its academic offerings across different schools like Engineering, Business, and Law, aiming to support aspiring students in their application process. Important features include eligibility criteria, admission alerts, and a helpline for assistance.

The MBA in Oil & Gas Management program at UPES is designed to equip students with specialized skills for management roles in the oil and gas industry. The curriculum includes essential subjects such as Fundamentals of Oil & Gas Business and Understanding of Natural Gas Business, taught by industry experts. Practical exposure is emphasized through internships and industry engagement. The program prepares graduates for various roles, addressing industry trends such as digitalization and sustainability. UPES has strong placement connections, with starting salaries ranging from INR 6 to 30 lakh per annum, reflecting high demand for skilled professionals in this sector.

Dr. Sravendra Rana, Senior Associate Professor at UPES School of Advanced Engineering, is innovating self-repairing materials to enhance aircraft safety and reduce accidents. His research focuses on using non-toxic biomolecules to autonomously heal cracks in aircraft, which can prevent deeper damage and improve aircraft longevity. Dr. Rana employs Vitrimer materials known for their self-healing properties, addressing issues of waste and CO2 emissions in the aerospace sector. His work is funded by the Science and Engineering Research Board, receiving significant grants for developing this groundbreaking technology in aeronautics.

Harish Pant serves as an Advisory Board Member for the School of Engineering at UPES. With 38 years of experience in various sectors including Aerospace, Defence, and Automotive, Harish Pant has held senior executive roles at organizations such as Hindustan Aeronautics Limited and Suzuki Motor Company. A thought leader in advanced technologies like Blockchain and AI, Harish Pant is involved in business transformation, strategy, and leadership development. Currently, Harish Pant leads multiple start-ups and initiatives aimed at youth and societal development, including the Utkarsh platform for youth in Uttarakhand.

The webpage provides a comprehensive list of MBA specializations offered by the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in Dehradun, India. UPES offers 16 MBA specializations including Strategy and Consulting, Business Analytics, and Oil and Gas Management, tailored for diverse career interests. The MBA program at UPES emphasizes practical learning through live projects and internships, alongside a unique global program allowing students to spend one year at an overseas partner university. Recognized by UGC and accredited by NAAC, UPES aims to equip students with relevant skills for the evolving business landscape.

Dr. Kamlesh Kumar Maurya is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in organizational behavior and human resource management. His research focuses on employer branding, talent management, and employee engagement, with over seven publications in international journals. Prior to UPES, Dr. Kamlesh worked at VBSPU State University and has industry experience as an HR executive. His teaching philosophy emphasizes experiential learning and ethical leadership. He teaches courses including Human Resource Management and Entrepreneurship, and has received multiple awards for his research. Dr. Kamlesh can be contacted via email at kamlesh.maurya@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES and Oil India Limited (OIL), a government of India enterprise, have partnered to conduct joint research focused on petroleum exploration and bio-surfactant producing microbes for enhanced oil recovery. The collaboration includes contributions from OIL experts, who will provide guest lectures to students at the UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology. OIL is recognized as the second largest Indian government-owned company involved in crude oil and natural gas exploration and production, operating under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India.

Abhishek Verma discusses the advantages of video resumes, positioning them as an effective tool for job seekers to showcase their skills, qualifications, and personality to potential employers. Unlike traditional resumes, a video resume offers a personal touch and can create a strong first impression. Verma outlines essential steps to create an impactful video resume, including drafting a clear message, selecting an appropriate setting, using quality recording devices, editing carefully, and seeking feedback for improvement. Overall, video resumes can enhance a candidate's visibility in a competitive job market.

Rishabh Dua, a B.Des. student majoring in Transportation Mobility Design at UPES (University of Petroleum and Energy Studies), earned the 2nd prize for his innovative walker design at the Humanizing Work and Work Environment 2022 conference. The walker, aimed at assisting individuals with arthritis and mobility challenges, includes features such as a phone stand, a bottle holder, and a flip seat for convenience. Rishabh Dua's work highlighted the theme "Ergonomics for the New Normal," showcasing his commitment to improving accessibility and comfort in everyday mobility. Rishabh Dua is part of the academic batch 2021-23 at UPES.

Dr. Bappa Das is an Assistant Professor at the UPES School of Design, holding a PhD. With six years of industrial experience, Dr. Bappa Das promotes inclusive learning and student empowerment. Prior positions included roles at Jain University and MIT Institute of Design. Dr. Bappa Das's research interests include visual communication and user experience design. Teaching philosophy emphasizes a comfortable environment for discussion, real-world application of curriculum, and critical thinking. Courses taught include Visual Interface Design and Photography. Dr. Bappa Das has received awards for watercolor painting and photography. Contact at bappa.das@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Nitin Sharma is an Associate Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with extensive experience in the motorcycle industry. Nitin Sharma holds a degree in Product Design from the National Institute of Design and has worked for Honda 2 Wheelers and Hero Moto Corp. Nitin Sharma's research focuses on automotive design and user-centered solutions. Nitin Sharma's teaching philosophy emphasizes experiential learning and fostering curiosity among students. Nitin Sharma teaches product and transportation design, skill development in sketching, and material understanding. Nitin Sharma can be contacted via email at nsharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Niteen Ramchandra Yeole is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in research areas such as adsorptive separations, solid-state ion exchange, and energy conservation. Prior to UPES, Niteen Ramchandra Yeole worked at the Maharashtra Institute of Technology and conducted training programs in petroleum refining. Niteen Ramchandra Yeole's teaching philosophy emphasizes creative learning and industry-based assessments. Niteen Ramchandra Yeole has taught various Chemical Engineering subjects and received recognition for contributions in sustainable solutions. Niteen Ramchandra Yeole actively encourages student research and presentations. Contact at nryeole@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Sanjay Malla is a Professor of Practice at UPES School of Business, with 25 years in the Semiconductor and Computer hardware industry. Dr. Sanjay has an MBA from IIM-K and a doctoral degree in Strategic Management from S P Jain School of Global Management. Dr. Sanjay specializes in Operations Management, Corporate Strategy, and Data Analytics. Formerly, Dr. Sanjay served as CEO at Toradex Systems India and held managerial roles at international semiconductor firms. Dr. Sanjay emphasizes student engagement in teaching, preparing students for real-world challenges. Research interests include Organizational Development and Strategic Management.

Ajit Bhandari is an Associate Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with over 18 years of experience in design and education. Specializing in Industrial Product and Lifestyle Design, Ajit has collaborated with organizations like Walmart and the Ministry of MSMEs. Educated at NIFT, New Delhi, and currently pursuing an MBA from IIM, Ajit focuses on the interplay between design, business, and consumer behavior. Ajit’s teaching philosophy emphasizes practical skills and real-world projects. Awards include recognition from Pearl Academy and contributions to innovative educational initiatives. Ajit specializes in diverse design courses across various disciplines. Contact: ajit.bhandari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Aditya Rawat is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law at UPES. He holds a legal graduation from Symbiosis Law School, Pune and an LLM from National Law University Delhi, where he excelled academically, earning a gold medal. Aditya has experience in corporate law with Deloitte Advisory and international legal practice in Berlin. He is a doctoral candidate at NALSAR, focusing on legal pluralism and constitutional morality. His research interests include constitutional philosophy, human rights, and gender law. Courses taught include Gender Justice, Environmental Law, and the Indian Constitution. Contact: aditya.rawat@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES offers a unique six-week mandatory social internship program called Srijan for all first-year students, regardless of their field of study. The program aims to instill social awareness, empathy, and leadership skills by connecting students with grassroots social challenges. Through pre-internship courses, masterclasses, and reflection activities like blogging, students gain firsthand experience in the social sector. This opportunity helps students understand societal issues and develop a sense of service, ultimately nurturing future change-makers and compassionate leaders. Social internships bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world application in addressing systemic inequalities.

UPES School of Business offers a BBA in Foreign Trade with specialization in Analytics and Market Research. The program equips students with knowledge in international trade, analytics, and market research methods. Core topics include business analytics, consumer behavior, and strategic management. Students benefit from internships, industry projects, and expert seminars, enhancing practical experience. Graduates pursue careers as International Business Analysts, Trade Compliance Specialists, and more, with starting salaries ranging from INR 6-10 lakh per annum. The program prepares students for the growing demand in analytics and international trade within regional trade blocs.

Dr. Kailash Pandey is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in nuclear physics with a focus on theoretical calculations of nuclear cross-sections. With over 15 years of experience in teaching and research, Dr. Kailash Pandey has held prior positions at APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University and other institutions. Dr. Kailash Pandey's research interests include nuclear physics, material science, and solar energy, and Dr. Kailash Pandey emphasizes learner-centric teaching. Dr. Kailash Pandey has received a BRNS grant for developing vacuum photodiode detectors and is affiliated with several international organizations. Contact Dr. Kailash Pandey at kpandey@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Swati Rastogi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES. Dr. Swati Rastogi specializes in contactless image processing, vascular pattern detection, un/self-supervised learning algorithms, and machine learning, holding a doctorate in NIR touchless vascular image processing and pattern recognition from IIT Bombay. Prior to joining UPES, Dr. Swati Rastogi was a Visiting Faculty at NMIMS. Dr. Swati Rastogi employs an interactive teaching philosophy, actively engaging students and providing one-on-one assistance. Dr. Swati Rastogi can be contacted at swati.rastogi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The M.Tech in Computer Science Engineering (CSE) program at UPES is a 2-year course offering specializations in Artificial Intelligence and Cyber Security. Eligibility includes a minimum of 60% in relevant undergraduate degrees. The program integrates industry-relevant modules, hands-on training, and internships. The fee structure includes ₹1,76,000 for the first two semesters and ₹1,87,825 for the last two. UPES boasts a 96.55% placement record, with top recruiters offering packages up to INR 50 lakh. Students gain access to research facilities, esteemed faculty, and a strong alumni network, preparing them for diverse career opportunities in technology.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) launched the Srijan Social Internship program, requiring first-year students to engage in 6-8 week internships with social sector organizations. This initiative, emphasized by Uttarakhand Chief Minister Tirath Singh Rawat, aims to foster empathetic leadership and community service. Students like Emy Watson and Janhvi report significant personal and professional growth, learning essential skills such as multitasking and communication. Manish Madaan of UPES highlights the program's successful establishment of over 300 partnerships, presenting a transformative opportunity for students to impact lives positively and prepare for future careers.

Roushan Kumar is a Senior Associate Professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES. Dr. Roushan Kumar earned a bachelor's degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering, followed by a master's in Automotive Electronics and a Ph.D. from UPES. Dr. Roushan Kumar has over ten years of industry experience, particularly in automotive software development. His research interests include electric vehicles, battery technologies, and industrial automation. Dr. Roushan Kumar has published over 30 research papers and holds 12 patents. Dr. Roushan Kumar emphasizes a practical, multidisciplinary teaching approach, equipping students with essential skills for success.

Dr. Anand Gaurav is a Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, holding degrees from Sardar Patel University, Indian Institute of Information Technology-Allahabad, Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, and a PhD from Shobhit University. His research focuses on computer-aided drug design, specifically inhibitors for anti-inflammatory and anti-schizophrenia treatments. He has published over 50 articles and received multiple awards, including a gold medal at the 2023 Asian Youth Innovation Awards. Dr. Anand Gaurav's teaching philosophy emphasizes enabling knowledge acquisition and critical thinking in students. Courses taught include Medicinal Chemistry and Drug Discovery.

Dr. Soumyajit Chakraborty is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in development and public economics as an applied microeconomist. Dr. Chakraborty's research examines human capital accumulation and its connections with various markets in emerging nations, including healthcare and agronomic knowledge. Dr. Chakraborty holds a Ph.D. from the University of New Mexico, an M.Phil. from the University of Calcutta, and degrees from Visva-Bharati University. Dr. Chakraborty has received multiple awards for mentorship and research and teaches several economics courses, emphasizing liberal education and active classroom engagement.

The webpage outlines seven compelling reasons to pursue a degree in Public Administration, emphasizing its significance in social sciences. Aditya Mukherjee discusses career opportunities in governmental and non-governmental organizations, highlighting roles like public administration consultant, budget analyst, and research analyst. The degree provides essential skills such as leadership, communication, and analytical thinking, which are valuable in addressing societal challenges. Public Administration also focuses on ethics, social responsibility, and international perspectives, making it a suitable choice for those interested in grassroots development and civic engagement.

UPES offers LL.M. admissions for 2024 through the ULSAT-LLM entrance test. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in class X, XII, and LLB graduation. Admission is based on the ULSAT-LLM or CLAT-PG results. The online test lasts two hours, covering Constitutional Law, Jurisprudence, and other law subjects with a total of 150 questions. Aspiring candidates should apply online and can benefit from a demo test. Results will be announced later. Queries can be directed to UPES via their toll-free number or email.

Project Bodh, a Corporate Social Responsibility initiative by UPES, focuses on nurturing children's creativity and individual perspectives. To commemorate World Book Day, five students from local government primary schools participated in an environmental-themed painting competition. Winners received trophies, while all participants were awarded bags, books, and stationery. This program emphasizes the uniqueness of children's imaginations and experiences, fostering a sense of community engagement and environmental awareness among young students.

Tamas Haidegger is an advisory board member for the School of Engineering at UPES. He serves as the director of the University Research and Innovation Centre (EKIK) at Óbuda University and as a technical lead in medical robotics at the Antal Bejczy Center. Tamas Haidegger holds MSc degrees in Electrical and Biomedical Engineering and a PhD in medical robotics. His research focuses on medical technologies, including surgical robots and digital health. As a co-founder of HandInScan and member of various professional organizations, Tamas Haidegger has authored over 250 scientific papers, contributing significantly to biomedical engineering.

Professor David J. Wrisley, a Digital Humanities expert at New York University Abu Dhabi, discusses the evolving role of Digital Humanities in preparing students for a dynamic future. He emphasizes that Digital Humanities research enhances critical thinking and teamwork skills, essential for adapting to the rapidly changing technological landscape. The discipline integrates advanced technologies like Machine Learning and AI, fostering innovative research methods. Digitization has broadened access to historical documents, significantly impacting Humanities research. Professor Wrisley supports a transdisciplinary educational approach at UPES's School of Liberal Studies, promoting a well-rounded, research-driven learning experience.

Dr. Ram Krishna Shah is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Fluid and Thermal Science in Mechanical Engineering. Dr. Ram Krishna completed a Ph.D. at IIT Kanpur, focusing on thermal management techniques for high heat flux applications in power electronics and the electric vehicle industry. Dr. Ram Krishna's research interests include sustainable energy, multiphase flow, and microfluidics. Dr. Ram Krishna emphasizes practical learning in teaching, covering core courses such as Fluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer, while also training students in Computational Fluid Dynamics software. Dr. Ram Krishna has received multiple academic awards and published research in reputable journals.

Dr. Rohit Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. He holds a B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering and an M.Tech from IIT (ISM) Dhanbad, completing his PhD in Petroleum and Chemical Engineering at IIT (ISM) and Curtin University. Dr. Rohit Sharma's research focuses on flow assurance, enhanced oil recovery, and synthetic fuel development. He emphasizes interactive teaching methods and has taught various engineering courses. Dr. Rohit Sharma has published extensively, receiving multiple research awards, including the Inder Mohan Thapar Foundation Research Award. His contact is rohitsharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Sc. (Hons.) in Chemistry by Research program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a 4-year undergraduate curriculum under the NEP 2020 framework. Students can customize their education through electives in Polymer Chemistry or Industrial Chemistry, with options for multiple exit points after earning credits. The program includes extensive research opportunities, culminates in a thesis defense, and prepares students for careers in pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, and academia. Graduates are equipped for roles such as research scientists and quality control specialists, with strong placement support from UPES's industry connections. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII.

Vivek Anand, a B.Tech. CSE student specializing in DevOps, developed a blockchain-based Healthcare Data Management System. This project aims to enhance healthcare data security by utilizing blockchain technology to protect patient confidentiality and prevent unauthorized data manipulation. Implemented using Java, the system is designed to enable secure data management and facilitate seamless treatments and research in healthcare organizations. The application can be downloaded from Vivek Anand’s GitHub page.

Dr. Nishu Goyal is an Associate Professor in the Department of Allied Health Sciences at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, Dehradun. Nishu holds a B.Tech in Biotechnology from Indraprastha University, an M.Tech in Biomedical Engineering from IIT Bombay, and a Ph.D. in Systems Biology from NUS Singapore. Nishu's research focuses on metabolic modeling, environmental remediation, and biofuels, particularly using microorganisms like M. maripaludis to convert CO2 into methane. Nishu has received several awards, including the Springer Thesis Award and the President's Graduate Fellowship, and teaches various subjects in biotechnology.

UPES is ranked #1 in Academic Reputation by QS World University Rankings 2024 and offers diverse programs across various schools including Engineering, Business, Law, and Design. The university emphasizes academic excellence with distinguished faculty and over 70 global partnerships. UPES supports entrepreneurial growth through its Runway incubator, with over 75 startups funded. The campus fosters a vibrant community, promoting personal and academic development through numerous events. UPES has a legacy of 20 years, achieved 100% placement success in 2021-22, and offers customizable degree options for students. Applications are invited by August 31.

Dr. Bhupendra Singh from UPES has launched the startup "Sense3D," accepted into the Runway incubator's first cohort. Sense3D aims to enhance 3D graphics applications by integrating sensing capabilities, focusing on innovative game controllers for the mobile gaming market, projected at $3 billion in India and $197 billion globally. The startup's goals include creating cost-effective 3D applications for developers and optimizing user interactions in gaming environments. The products will be sold through online platforms and retailers, with an emphasis on innovation in gaming technology. A prototype video is available for review.

Dr. Pradeep Chauhan is an Assistant Professor-Selection Grade at the School of Business, UPES, with over 12 years of experience in logistics and supply chain management. Dr. Chauhan holds a Ph.D. in Logistics and Supply Chain Management and has worked with notable organizations including Kuehne-Nagel and Danone. His teaching focuses on courses like Introduction to Logistics and Global Supply Chain Management, emphasizing active student participation and experiential learning. Dr. Chauhan's research interests include physical distribution, transportation, and digitalization in logistics. He is also active in publishing research in reputable journals and participating in academic conferences. Contact Dr. Chauhan at p.chauhan@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Susmita Sharma Yadav is an Associate Professor at the School of Design at UPES, specializing in Art, Design-Studies, and User Experience for HCI. Dr. Susmita earned a PhD from IDC-School of Design, IIT Bombay, focusing on visual perception and eye-tracking. With extensive experience in academia and industry, Dr. Susmita has taught at various renowned design schools and consulted for e-learning firms. Research interests include Design Thinking, User Experience Design, and technology for social innovation. Dr. Susmita promotes an interactive, collaborative teaching philosophy, enhancing students' learning and critical analysis skills.

Santosh Anand is an Assistant Professor (Senior scale) at the School of Business, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Operation & Supply Chain Management from IIT Roorkee. He holds an M. Tech in Industrial Engineering & Management from IIT(ISM) Dhanbad and a B.Sc. in Production Engineering from BIT Sindri. Santosh Anand's research interests include sustainability, food security, and agri-fresh produce supply chains. He employs a teaching philosophy focused on active student engagement and real data application. Courses taught include Operation Research and Total Quality Management. Santosh Anand has received various academic honors, including MHRD Fellowships. Contact Santosh Anand at santosh.anand@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Rohit Tanwar is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES. Holding a doctorate in Computer Science and Engineering from Kurukshetra University, Dr. Tanwar has notable academic credentials including an M.Tech. from YMCA University and a B.Tech. from Kurukshetra University. With around sixty publications, four books, and several patents, Dr. Tanwar's research areas include Steganography, Internet of Things, Healthcare, and Network Security. Dr. Tanwar emphasizes a robust teaching philosophy focused on foundational knowledge and active student engagement. Contact Dr. Tanwar via r.tanwar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Devkant Kala is an Associate Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with expertise in marketing, consumer behavior, and tourism and hospitality. Dr. Devkant Kala obtained an MBA from HNB Garhwal University and a Doctorate from Uttarakhand Technical University. Dr. Devkant Kala has published in several reputed journals and focuses on dynamic aspects of tourism and technology adoption. Teaching courses like Marketing Management and Consumer Behavior, Dr. Devkant Kala emphasizes project-based learning and critical thinking. Dr. Devkant Kala edited a book on rural tourism and serves on editorial boards for multiple journals.

Deepanmol Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, specializing in pharmaceutical analysis with over 8 years of experience. He has worked with national organizations like the National Antidoping Agency and the National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research. Deepanmol Singh's research focuses on electroanalytical chemistry and developing methods for drug analysis and point-of-care devices. He adopts personalized teaching methods and has taught courses including pharmaceutical analysis and biochemistry. Deepanmol Singh received the S. L. Nasa award for excellence in teaching and has participated in national and international conferences.

Dr. Amit Kumar Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in microalgae biofuel production and waste management. Dr. Amit's research focuses on algae biofuels, plastic waste management, and biochar applications, with a significant emphasis on optimizing algal cultivation for bioenergy. Dr. Amit has 75 publications and serves as a reviewer for various academic journals. Dr. Amit teaches subjects like fuel chemistry and renewable energy technologies.
