Dr. Amit has received Junior and Senior Research Fellowships and has filed six Indian patents. Dr. Amit can be contacted via email at amitsharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage explains the key differences between a software engineer and a software developer. Software engineering involves applying engineering principles to create software, focusing on technology solutions, scalability, and technical expertise. Conversely, software development is about the creative process of building functional programs, including coding, testing, and enhancing software. Both roles are essential in software creation, but they differ in responsibilities and skill sets. The article emphasizes the relevance of education in these fields, suggesting that institutions like UPES provide essential training and future opportunities for students.

Dr. Surya Prakash is a Professor and Head of the Geo-Meteorological Risks Management Division and the CBRN, Industrial and Cyber Disaster Risk Reduction at the National Institute of Disaster Management under the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India. An expert in environmental earth science, Dr. Surya Prakash focuses on disaster management and engineering geology. Dr. Surya Prakash serves as the Chairman of the Internal Quality Assurance Cell and the Chief Information Security Officer of the Institute, in addition to being the National Coordinator for the International Association for Promoting Geoethics and a Board Member at the International Consortium on Landslides.

Abadhan Sabyasachi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES Dehradun, with a Ph.D. in progress from Hong Kong. Abadhan Sabyasachi holds a Master’s degree from IIT Guwahati and a Bachelor’s from BPUT Rourkela. Abadhan Sabyasachi's research includes Cloud Computing, Mobile Edge Computing, and Machine Learning, with publications in major conferences. Abadhan Sabyasachi emphasizes Outcome-Oriented Learning and uses various Learning Management Systems for teaching. Abadhan Sabyasachi has received multiple research grants and aims to promote innovative research at UPES while establishing collaborations with prestigious organizations. Contact Abadhan Sabyasachi at abadhan.sabyasachi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Amit Kumar Thakur is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Chemical Engineering. Dr. Thakur holds a B. Tech from BIT Sindri, an M. Tech from IIT Bombay, and a Ph.D. from UPES. His teaching approach emphasizes student engagement and experiential learning. Dr. Thakur's research interests include polymerization reactor modeling, pharmaceutical crystallization, and environmental remediation. He has contributed to various scholarly journals and received a SEED grant for enhancing herbal compound solubility. Dr. Thakur has also patented a reusable article for oil spill absorption. Contact Dr. Thakur at akthakur@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Bachelor of Design in Mobility and Vehicle Design at UPES School of Design offers an innovative curriculum focused on advanced technologies in transportation design. Students utilize state-of-the-art facilities and engage with leading industry partners like Maruti Suzuki and Tata Elxsi. The program emphasizes creative and functional vehicle design, preparing graduates for diverse roles, including Transportation Designer and Digital Sculptor, with an average salary of Rs. 6.50 Lakhs. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in X and XII, with selection based on national exams and a portfolio presentation.

The MBA in Digital Business with a specialization in Cloud Computing at UPES School of Business is designed for aspiring professionals aiming to excel in the digital landscape. The program integrates business principles with cloud technologies, focusing on areas like strategic management and data analytics. Participants gain hands-on experience through projects and internships, preparing them for roles such as Digital Strategist, IT Project Manager, and Cloud Architect. Alumni succeed in cloud-focused positions, leveraging industry-relevant skills. With a strong emphasis on practical learning and networking, graduates are equipped to drive innovation in today's rapidly evolving business environment.

Vikram Mathur is a Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with a background in architecture from the School of Planning & Architecture, New Delhi. With over two decades of experience in architecture and interior design, Vikram Mathur emphasizes personalized education, addressing diverse student needs. His extensive portfolio includes various projects for international clients. Vikram Mathur's research focuses on enhancing design education through pedagogical innovation. Courses taught include Design Process and various interior design disciplines. Currently pursuing a PhD, Vikram Mathur actively mentors students in design and professional development. Contact Vikram Mathur at vikrammathur@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BA in Digital Media and Mass Media (Broadcasting) with a specialization in Mobile Journalism (MoJo): Digital Video Production and Monetisation program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is designed for aspiring media professionals. The six-semester course provides training in digital broadcasting, audio/video production, content creation, and monetization strategies, leveraging state-of-the-art studios and industry expertise. Graduates gain skills for careers as mobile journalists, content creators, and social media managers, with placement assistance for up to five years. The program emphasizes hands-on experience and prepares students to thrive in the evolving digital media landscape.

The UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides robust placement opportunities through strong industry partnerships, ensuring students are equipped for successful careers. The institution has achieved a 5-Star QS rating for employability and reports high placement rates, with numerous recruiters actively participating in campus hiring. Critical programs like the EDGE initiative focus on skill enhancement, including soft skills and entrepreneurship, while mandatory summer internships foster practical experience. The School emphasizes a comprehensive placement process involving training workshops, mock interviews, and alumni mentoring, promoting substantial professional growth for graduates.

Kamal Raj Singh is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Computer Science, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies, focusing on medical image analysis, particularly in the cardiac MRI domain. Kamal Raj Singh is pursuing a PhD from the Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee. With over five years of academic experience and six months in the industry, Kamal Raj Singh's research interests include deep learning for biomedical imaging. Kamal Raj Singh has published numerous articles and ranked 7th globally in the M&Ms-2 Challenge 2021. Kamal Raj Singh emphasizes experiential learning in teaching.

The M.Tech in Computational Fluid Dynamics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a two-year graduate course designed to provide students with advanced skills in numerically simulating mechanical systems, including fluid dynamics and structural dynamics. The curriculum includes advanced courses, hands-on training, and a year-long thesis, preparing students for careers as Simulation Engineers and Computational Fluid Dynamics Specialists across various industries. UPES offers strong industry connections, state-of-the-art facilities, and dedicated placement support, enhancing employability. Eligible candidates should possess a B.Tech/BE in relevant fields with a minimum of 60% marks.

Dr. Jerry W. Sangma is an Assistant Professor at UPES School of Computer Science, holding a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering. His expertise includes machine learning, data streams, time series analysis, and deep learning. Dr. Jerry W. Sangma has prior experience as a Post Graduate Teacher in Computer Science at Kendriya Vidhayalaya, Shillong. He teaches courses on machine learning and natural language processing, and emphasizes imparting knowledge to inspire students. Dr. Jerry W. Sangma actively mentors students for their projects and fosters a supportive academic environment. Contact Dr. Jerry W. Sangma at jerryw.sangma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES offers a Master of Computer Applications (MCA) program with various specializations, including Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Cloud Computing and Cyber Security, and Data Science. The duration is three years, and admission requires a minimum of 50% in 10th, 12th grades, and graduation. Applications are open until August 31, 2024. The program boasts a 94% placement rate with over 560 recruiters. UPES emphasizes high-quality education, evidenced by its QS I-Gauge E-Lead certification. Scholarships are available for meritorious and economically disadvantaged students. Interested candidates can apply online or offline.

Dr. Madan Gopal is a Distinguished Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with extensive experience in academia, including a notable tenure at IIT Delhi. Dr. Madan Gopal has authored key texts on Control Systems and Machine Learning, widely used in universities globally. Dr. Madan Gopal supervises doctoral research and has a strong publication record. Current research focuses on Deep Learning, AI applications in various fields, and environmental sustainability. Recognized for contributions to education and research, Dr. Madan Gopal is involved in developing innovative AI curricula at UPES. Contact: madan.gopal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BBA in Digital Business program at UPES School of Business offers a comprehensive three-year education focused on integrating business principles with digital technologies. It specializes in Digital Marketing and Digital Media Laws, preparing students with practical skills through hands-on projects, internships, and an industry-relevant curriculum taught by experienced faculty. Graduates can pursue diverse careers, including roles as digital marketing managers, e-commerce specialists, and data analysts. The program emphasizes digital business trends like marketing automation and data-driven decision-making, positioning students for success in the evolving digital landscape. Minimum eligibility requires 50% marks in Classes X and XII.

Piyush Kuchhal is a prominent professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, with over 25 years of expertise in education, research, and administration. Holding a Ph.D. in Physics from IIT Roorkee, Piyush Kuchhal has served in leadership roles including Head of the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering. Research interests include electromagnetics, renewable energy, and application of Artificial Intelligence in energy systems. Piyush Kuchhal's teaching philosophy emphasizes customized instruction and innovative methodologies, contributing to curriculum development and student mentorship. Piyush Kuchhal has published over 110 papers and received several awards for academic excellence.

The B.Sc. in Physics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a 3-year applied science course offering flexible entry and exit options, enabling students to customize their education according to interests and career goals. The curriculum aligns with NEP 2020, allowing students to earn certificates, diplomas, or a full degree based on credits earned. Students can specialize in Astronomy & Astrophysics, Computational Physics, or Materials Science & Nanotechnology. The program promotes research, critical thinking, and practical training, preparing graduates for careers in academia, research, and various industries, with strong placement support from UPES.

Dr. Nanditha C K is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in mathematical biology with a focus on mathematical modeling of tumor growth and treatment, including chemotherapy and combination therapies. Dr. Nanditha C K employs control theory to propose optimal treatment strategies. As a dedicated educator, Dr. Nanditha C K promotes personalized instruction and a supportive learning environment to enhance student engagement in mathematics. Dr. Nanditha C K has received multiple awards, including the "Bank of Baroda Achievers Awards" and has published articles in respected journals. Contact Dr. Nanditha C K at nandithack@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Christer Sjöström is a prominent Advisory Board Member at UPES, serving as the Chairman of the Board for Nano Form Science AB. He is a Professor Emeritus specializing in material technologies at KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden, after a distinguished career in civil engineering and building materials. Dr. Christer Sjöström has extensive experience in international R&D, focusing on sustainability and energy technologies, and has contributed to various European research frameworks since the 1990s. His expertise includes the study of nano-porous silica materials for industrial uses and managing significant international projects.

Shradha Baranwal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, with a strong commitment to academia and research. Ms. Shradha started as a Law Researcher for Supreme Court Judges and has authored several papers in UGC-listed journals. She holds a law degree from the University of Delhi and an LL.M. from the National Law School of India University, and she is pursuing a doctorate at Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law. Ms. Shradha's research interests include law and religion, legal history, and gender issues, and she teaches various law subjects while actively engaging in scholarly activities and social service.

Rohit Srivastava is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Computer Science, UPES. Rohit Srivastava holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from SPSU, Udaipur, and has over 15 years of teaching experience. Rohit Srivastava specializes in Biometric Image Processing and Pattern Recognition, and has published more than 30 research papers with notable publishers. Rohit Srivastava is passionate about practical teaching methods and has supervised numerous undergraduate and postgraduate projects. Rohit Srivastava also holds copyrights for innovative applications and is actively involved in research and workshops. Contact Rohit Srivastava via email at r.srivastava@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Ankit Saxena reflects on his transformative MBA experience at UPES, emphasizing the importance of networking. Initially hesitant, Ankit engaged in activities enhancing his communication and critical thinking skills, notably during events like the World Water Summit and industrial visits. Interning in digital marketing during COVID-19 deepened Ankit's understanding of technology's impact on logistics. Academic events and supportive faculty, particularly Dr. Neeraj Anand, fostered Ankit's growth and confidence. Ankit underscores the value of connections and the university's commitment to student success, stating that his time at UPES shaped him into a people-oriented individual ready for future challenges.

Dr. Bikarama Prasad Yadav is a professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 16 years of industry and academic experience. Dr. Yadav holds a B.Tech in Safety & Fire Engineering, an MBA, M.Tech, and a PhD in Safety Engineering. A Fellow of the Institution of Engineers, India, Dr. Yadav focuses on safety, environmental stewardship, and innovative engineering practices. His research includes construction safety and risk management, with 70 publications and eight patents. Dr. Yadav emphasizes a student-centric teaching approach and leads courses in safety and fire engineering while holding several awards for his contributions to the field.

Christalin Nelson S is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 20 years of teaching experience. He has held various leadership roles, including Head of Department and International Exchange Coordinator. Christalin Nelson S's research interests include VANETs, AI, machine learning, and network security. Christalin Nelson S emphasizes continuous learning and ethical responsibility in teaching. Courses taught include programming languages, data structures, and network management. Christalin Nelson S has received awards for teaching and research contributions, including Best Paper Awards. Christalin Nelson S actively participates in scholarly activities and community outreach initiatives. Contact: cnelson@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Deepika from the School of Computer Science at UPES has won the 2023 JVCI Best Paper Award, receiving USD 1000. The award recognizes Dr. Deepika's paper titled "A fuzzy convolutional neural network for enhancing multi-focus image fusion," published in the Journal of Visual Communication and Image Representation. The research introduces a hybrid fuzzy convolutional neural network (FCNN) for automatic feature extraction and uncertainty removal, outperforming six benchmark methods in qualitative and quantitative analysis of multi-focus image datasets. This achievement highlights Dr. Deepika's contributions to the field of image processing and computer science.

Krishna Singh, a 19-year-old Electronics and Computer Engineering student at UPES, is gaining recognition for his creativity and innovation. He designed a CNC plotter showcased to Uttarakhand Governor Lt. Gen. Gurmeet Singh, who was impressed by Krishna's ingenuity. Krishna has also developed a device using pyrolysis to convert plastic into diesel, earning him accolades from former state education minister Dhan Singh Rawat. With a passion for problem-solving, he founded Pie Craft, a startup making projects for students, and he aspires to create a hardware solution venture. His accomplishments highlight his potential as a future innovator.

The School of Liberal Studies and Media at UPES prepares students to be future thought leaders through a multidisciplinary and learner-driven approach. Offering undergraduate and postgraduate programs in fields like Economics, Psychology, Political Science, and Mass Communications, the school addresses global challenges aligned with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. The faculty comprises experts from top universities globally, fostering an interactive learning environment. Opportunities for semester exchanges with international institutions enrich the educational experience. UPES emphasizes practical learning through internships and collaborations, equipping students for diverse careers in areas like Government, NGOs, and media.

Dr. Badri Singh Bhandari is a Professor of Practice at the School of Business, UPES, with 37 years of industry experience and over 15 years of teaching. Dr. Bhandari served in the Indian Economic Service and was a member of the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority. Dr. Bhandari holds an M.Com and Ph.D. from the University of Delhi and an MBA from the University of Strathclyde. Research interests include development economics, corporate finance, and regulatory economics. Dr. Bhandari emphasizes interactive teaching using case studies and discussions. Contact at badris.bhandari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage by the UPES Editorial Team discusses the benefits of pursuing a Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA) degree. It highlights the high demand for IT professionals due to the booming tech industry and the comprehensive curriculum that includes programming, database management, and web development. The degree serves as a foundation for advanced studies like a Master of Computer Applications (MCA), enhances essential soft skills, and provides internship opportunities for practical experience. BCA graduates can also explore global career prospects and entrepreneurial avenues, making it a valuable choice for aspiring tech professionals.

The Integrated Bachelor of Commerce (Hons.) - Master of Business Administration program at UPES School of Business combines undergraduate and postgraduate studies over four years. The curriculum covers foundational commerce subjects and advanced business areas like marketing and finance, emphasizing practical learning through projects and internships. Specializations include E-Commerce and Banking & Insurance. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in Class X and XII. Admission is via a personal interview or CUET (UG) cut-off. Students benefit from experienced faculty, industry interactions, and strong placement opportunities, with a significant percentage achieving successful careers in diverse sectors.

Manisha Solanki is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, Dehradun, since July 2017. Manisha Solanki is pursuing a Doctorate at Martin Luther University, Halle-Wittenberg, Germany. Manisha Solanki holds a Master's degree from Maharishi Dayanand University and a Bachelor's in Advertising Management and Public Relations from GJ University of Science and Technology. Manisha Solanki's research focuses on Social/Digital Media Marketing, E-Learning, and Sustainability. Manisha Solanki received the David A. Wilson Award for Excellence in Higher Education Teaching, along with several publications in sustainable practices and online education techniques.

Dr. Jayadev Parida, Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, specializes in Political Science and International Relations. Dr. Jayadev Parida holds a Bachelor's from Utkal University, an M.A. from Pondicherry University, and a Ph.D. from Jawaharlal Nehru University. Dr. Jayadev Parida's research interests include International Relations, Emerging Technologies, and Security. Prior to joining UPES in 2021, Dr. Jayadev Parida worked at Amity University and research organizations in New Delhi. Dr. Jayadev Parida emphasizes critical thinking and experiential learning in teaching and has received fellowships for research in Germany.

Avishek Majumder is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Computer Science at the Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. His academic background includes an M.Tech in Nano Science and Technology and a B.Tech in Electronics and Communication. Avishek Majumder has experience as a Research Associate in the Department of Computer Science at IIIT Delhi and has a strong research focus on cryptology, blockchain technology, and searchable encryption. His teaching philosophy emphasizes fostering intellectual curiosity and critical inquiry. Avishek Majumder can be contacted via email at avishek.majumder@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Vikas Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in Project Management and Operations Management. Vikas Kumar holds an MBA from AMU and a B.Tech in Chemical Engineering from Zakir Husain College, AMU. With over 20 years of teaching experience, Vikas Kumar has taught various management courses and conducted training for industry professionals. Research interests include environmental and economic impacts of energy projects. Vikas Kumar is also involved in academic administration and student mentoring, promoting active participation and experiential learning. Vikas Kumar can be contacted at vkumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology offers a PhD in Health Sciences program designed to develop advanced expertise in various disciplines, including biomedical engineering, health informatics, and public health. The curriculum integrates coursework, research methodology training, and dissertation work, supported by experienced faculty and state-of-the-art facilities. The program's eligibility requires a Master's degree with a minimum of 55% marks. The fee is INR 1 Lac per semester, with a 75% waiver for full-time students. Graduates are well-equipped for careers in academia, research, healthcare, and government, contributing significantly to advancements in health sciences.

David Jayne is a Professor of Surgery at the University of Leeds and an Honorary Consultant Surgeon at Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. His clinical focus includes robotic and minimally invasive surgery for colorectal cancer and pelvic floor dysfunction. David Jayne leads multiple NIHR portfolio clinical trials and is Clinical Director of the Leeds NIHR Surgical MedTech Co-operative, aimed at addressing unmet surgical needs. Additionally, David Jayne is Co-Director of the NIHR Advanced Surgical Technologies Incubator, which focuses on enhancing research capabilities in surgical technology development.

Manash Protim Mudoi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in polymer composite materials, unconventional energy, and environmental science. His research encompasses sustainable material development, adsorption in coal bed methane, and enhanced gas recovery. With nearly ten years of industry experience in oil and gas, Manash focuses on project-based learning and employs a "flipped classroom" approach. Courses taught include Advanced Thermodynamics and Chemical Process Safety. Notably, he received the SEED grant for research in polymer composites and collaborates with IIT Kharagpur on shale gas and CO2 sequestration projects. Contact: mpmudoi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Kanchan Deoli Bahukhandi is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 21 years of experience in environmental science and sustainability. She holds a doctorate in environmental science from the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology and has led several research projects funded by DST and U. COST. Dr. Bahukhandi focuses her research on hydrogeochemistry and pollution remediation and emphasizes innovative, practical learning in her teaching. She has received numerous awards for her contributions, directed multiple collaborative research projects, and published extensively in various journals. Contact: kanchan@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. P. G. Diwakar serves as the ISRO Chair Professor at the National Institute of Advanced Studies (NIAS), IISc Campus, Bangalore, India, following a distinguished 36-year career at ISRO. His expertise encompasses Space Technology & Applications, Digital Image Processing, Application Software Design, and Geospatial Technology. Dr. P. G. Diwakar has held key positions, including Associate Director of Earth Observation Systems and Scientific Secretary at ISRO, and has authored over 100 publications in national and international journals. Dr. P. G. Diwakar’s contributions significantly advance research in space-related fields and technology applications.

The webpage provides the medal winner list for UPES Convocation 2023, highlighting students who received Gold Medals, Silver Medals, Letters of Appreciation, and Institutional Medals across various schools such as Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Design, Health Sciences, and Law. Key highlights include Gold Medal winners like Saman Deep for M.Tech. Structural Engineering, Anmol Chhoker in B.Tech. Applied Petroleum Engineering, and Mohan Prabhu for MBA in Logistics and Supply Chain Management. Additionally, it features Silver Medalists and special mentions for exemplary students, emphasizing academic excellence at UPES.

The M.Sc. in Microbiology (Medical & Pharmaceutical Microbiology) at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology provides in-depth knowledge on the relationship between microorganisms and human health, infectious diseases, and pharmaceutical developments. The curriculum includes subjects like medical bacteriology, virology, and molecular biology, alongside hands-on lab experiences. Graduates can pursue careers in pharmaceutical companies, clinical research, and public health. Strong industry ties enhance learning through projects and internships, ensuring students are well-prepared for job placement. This program emphasizes research, practical training, and interdisciplinary collaboration to address global health challenges.

Aditya Mukherjee's article discusses the transformative impact of 5G technology on various sectors, particularly manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare. It anticipates that over 40 million smartphone users in India will adopt 5G within its first year. 5G will enable automation, improve connectivity, and support applications like IoT and AI. This technology promises enhanced production efficiency, lower costs, and advancements in smart city developments. In healthcare, 5G will facilitate automated diagnosis and telemedicine. The article emphasizes 5G’s potential to make India a digital superpower and revolutionize everyday life through improved broadband and connected devices.

Pooja Sarin is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, beginning in January 2024. Pooja Sarin is a Data Science Researcher pursuing a PhD at the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, focusing on applied machine learning for social media challenges. Pooja Sarin's research interests include Big Data, sustainability, generative AI, and blockchain applications. Pooja Sarin emphasizes active learning and critical thinking in her teaching philosophy. Pooja Sarin has conducted workshops on Cloud Computing and Big Data Analytics. Awards include the AIS Ephraim McLean Membership Scholarship and an Institute Fellowship at IIT Delhi. Contact Pooja Sarin at pooja.sarin@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Dhiraj Kumar is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Advanced Engineering, specializing in experimental aerodynamics and fluid mechanics. Dr. Dhiraj obtained a master's and Ph.D. in aerospace engineering from IIT Kanpur, where he worked on various aerodynamics projects, including wind tunnel testing. Dr. Dhiraj's research interest includes renewable energy harvesting and fluid-structure interaction. He teaches courses such as Fluid Mechanics and Aerodynamics and emphasizes practical problem-solving in teaching. Dr. Dhiraj has received academic fellowships, published research in international journals, and has expertise in multiple measurement technologies and LabVIEW programming. Contact Dr. Dhiraj at dhiraj.kumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES's Privacy Policy outlines the institution's commitment to safeguarding user information collected through its services. The policy details the types of personal and non-personal information UPES gathers, including names, contact details, and demographic data, as well as how this information is processed for operational purposes, such as service improvement and legal compliance. It emphasizes that UPES does not sell or share personal information with third parties for marketing, ensures data security measures are in place, and outlines users' rights regarding their data. Updates to the policy will be communicated to users. For inquiries, users can contact UPES at admissions@upes.ac.in.

The BBA Global Program at UPES School of Business is a three-year degree featuring two years at UPES and one year abroad at a partner university. The curriculum integrates management principles with international business dynamics, covering subjects like Finance, HR, and Digital Economy. Students gain practical exposure through internships and industrial visits, enhancing their employability in roles such as International Business Analyst and Global Supply Chain Coordinator. Graduates develop critical thinking skills for navigating global markets, benefiting from UPES's innovative environment and experienced faculty while preparing for opportunities in multinational corporations.

Viveck Vaswani is a film producer and Dean of the School of Contemporary Media at Pearl Academy. An alumnus of Campion School and Cathedral and John Connon, Viveck Vaswani began his career by acting in India's first TV soap opera 'Khandaan'. He has produced films such as 'Kis Bai Kiss', 'Gawaahi', and collaborated with Sippy Films on projects like 'Patthar Ke Phool'. Notably, Viveck Vaswani launched prominent actors including Raveena Tandon and Shah Rukh Khan, and has appeared in over 100 films throughout his career.

Soumitra Bhattacharya, Associate Professor at the UPES School of Design, discusses essential knowledge for design students, industry changes, and his creative process in an interview with Ekta Kashyap. Bhattacharya emphasizes the importance of storytelling in communication design and the shift towards digital and user-centered design, particularly in UI/UX. He shares insights from his book, "Soulflight: Reflecting Light and Life," which showcases his travels and personal journey. Bhattacharya advises students to embrace curiosity, diversify their skills, network extensively, and maintain a passion for design to succeed in this evolving field.

Dr. Shalini Singh is an Assistant Professor of International Business and Marketing at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), Dehradun, India. Dr. Shalini Singh earned a Doctorate in Marketing from DIT University and specializes in e-impulse buying. With 12 years of experience, Dr. Shalini Singh has published research in Scopus and ABDC-listed journals and has presented at prestigious conferences. Dr. Shalini Singh's teaching areas include International Business, Marketing Management, and Brand Management, emphasizing ethics and critical thinking in education. Dr. Shalini Singh is also engaged in research on sustainable tourism practices.

The MA Digital and Mass Media (Broadcasting) program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is a 2-year course encompassing four semesters, designed to equip students with essential skills in broadcasting. The curriculum includes media writing, digital production, and social media analytics, offering hands-on experience through internships. Graduates can pursue careers as television producers, broadcast journalists, or digital content creators, capitalizing on opportunities in major media houses like NDTV and ABP. The program emphasizes practical learning and industry integration, preparing students for the evolving media landscape. Admission requires 50% in previous academic qualifications and a personal interview.

Raj K Kovid is a Professor at the UPES School of Business, specializing in Strategy & Entrepreneurship. With extensive experience in academia since 2000, Raj K Kovid has published articles in leading international journals and developed cases available through Harvard and other platforms. Raj K Kovid's teaching emphasizes case studies and industry-related projects. Raj K Kovid has received a significant research grant from ICSSR for crop insurance management. Raj K Kovid also serves on editorial boards and has been involved in faculty development programs and international conferences, enhancing strategic management and entrepreneurship education.

The webpage discusses the advantages of pursuing a career in Allied Health Sciences at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, Dehradun. It highlights the globally renowned faculty, opportunities for international research exposure, and the ability for students to design their own degrees. The School provides tailored programs in fields such as Biotechnology, Biomedical Engineering, and Microbiology, emphasizing hands-on learning and real-world applications. With projected growth in biotechnology, biomedical engineering, and nutrition sectors, the UPES programs equip graduates to meet industry demands and contribute to future advancements in healthcare.

Rajesh Tripathi is the Program Lead and Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). With over 18 years in academia and media, Dr. Rajesh Tripathi holds a Doctorate in Strategic Management from Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology and multiple Master's degrees. He teaches Strategic Management, Business Ethics, and several media-related subjects. Dr. Rajesh Tripathi has published numerous research papers and mentors students on various topics. He has received several accolades, including induction into the Reynolds Centre of Business Journalism’s Circle of Achievement.

Global University at UPES promotes international collaborations for student mobility and cross-cultural learning. The university offers programs such as the Global Pathway Program, Semester Abroad Program, and Exchange Programs, allowing students to study at partner universities worldwide. UPES has over 50 global partnerships, enhancing students' academic and professional development through internships, co-teaching, and collaborative projects. The Department of International Affairs supports these initiatives, providing students with world-class services during their global journeys. UPES aims to empower students with knowledge and confidence through meaningful international experiences and exposure.

UPES has established a strategic alliance with Surana & Surana International Attorneys to enhance the curriculum and delivery of law programs, specifically the B.B.A., LL.B. (H) in Corporate Laws and B.Com. (LL.B.) in Taxation Law. Surana & Surana International Attorneys will assist with curriculum development, faculty internships, student internships, moot court competitions, and joint seminars. Founded in 1971 and based in Chennai, India, Surana & Surana International Attorneys is one of the largest law firms in South India, offering services in arbitration, corporate law, litigation, real estate, and more.

The UPES Achievements page outlines notable accomplishments of UPES students and alumni, showcasing academic excellence and professional success. It highlights awards, recognitions, and significant contributions in various fields, emphasizing the university's commitment to fostering talent and innovation. The page serves as a testament to the achievements within different schools, including Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Design, Health Sciences, Law, and Liberal Studies. Additionally, it offers insights into placements and alumni outcomes, reinforcing UPES's reputation as a leading educational institution.

Neha Verma is an Assistant Professor-Senior Scale at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, with 15 years of experience in Radio, TV, Dubbing, Voice Over, and Event Management. Neha Verma holds dual master’s degrees in Journalism and Mass Communication, and Business Economics, while pursuing a Ph.D. in Media Management. Neha Verma's research interests include the FM radio industry in India, focusing on aspects like media branding and social impact. Neha Verma teaches various courses, including Radio Production and Event Management, and has received several accolades for contributions to media literacy and event management.

Shraddha Manish Gupta is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, specializing in medicinal chemistry with a focus on Alzheimer's disease and drug repurposing. Shraddha's teaching experience spans over 15 years, previously working at DIT University and Monash University. Shraddha's research includes computer-aided drug design and neurodegenerative disorders. Courses taught include Medicinal Chemistry-I and Pharmaceutical Analysis. Shraddha has received several awards, including the Women Researcher Award at SHEN 2021. Shraddha actively participates in scholarly activities and has presented innovative research in international forums. Contact Shraddha at shraddham.gupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Family Business and Entrepreneurship (Family Business) program at UPES School of Business equips students with essential skills to navigate the unique challenges of family enterprises. The curriculum covers core business management topics alongside specialized subjects like governance, succession planning, and conflict resolution. Students engage in practical learning through internships, case studies, and interactions with industry experts, enhancing their understanding of family business dynamics. Graduates can pursue careers as family business consultants, in wealth management, or leadership roles in family enterprises, ensuring their long-term sustainability. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in academics.

Dr. Abhinav Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with extensive teaching and research experience. Dr. Abhinav Sharma earned a B. Tech. from H. N. B. Garhwal University and an M. Tech. and Ph. D. from Govind Ballabh Pant University. Dr. Abhinav Sharma has published 40 research papers, authored six books, and holds five Indian Patents. Research interests include Signal Processing, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning. Dr. Abhinav Sharma teaches courses such as Analog Electronics and AI. Dr. Abhinav Sharma's accolades include the Award of Excellence in Research and multiple research grants. Contact Dr. Abhinav Sharma at abhinav.sharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The M.Sc. Microbiology (Food & Environmental Microbiology) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology provides in-depth knowledge and skills to tackle challenges in food safety, quality assurance, and environmental preservation. The curriculum covers microbial ecology, foodborne pathogens, and bioremediation techniques, with practical lab work and collaboration with industry experts. Graduates can pursue careers in food industries, public health, and environmental organizations. The program offers advanced facilities and strong industry connections, ensuring high employability in food safety, environmental consulting, and biotechnology sectors. Eligibility includes a B.Sc. with relevant subjects and a personal interview for selection.

The Civil Engineering Department at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies offers B.Tech and M.Tech programs with an emphasis on aerospace engineering. Ranked 61st in India by NIRF 2022, the department features specialized laboratory facilities and practical exposure through industrial tours and guest lectures. Students can benefit from a Choice Based Credit System, diverse electives, and active student clubs. The program promotes interdisciplinary approaches and emphasizes professional ethics, preparing students for successful careers in civil engineering. Admissions are currently open.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) offers Bachelor of Legislative Law (LL.B.) admissions for 2024, closing on August 31, 2024. The LL.B. program equips students with knowledge applicable in various legal sectors, emphasizing both theoretical and practical aspects of law. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in Higher and Senior Secondary examinations. Admission can be through UPES's entrance exam (ULSAT) or using CLAT/L-SAT scores. The program provides various job opportunities in legal services, corporate law, and advocacy. Detailed fee structures and scholarship information are available on the UPES website.

The B.Sc. Mathematics in Computational Mathematics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides a robust understanding of mathematics and computational techniques, preparing graduates for careers in diverse fields such as science, finance, and engineering. The curriculum includes traditional mathematics, programming, and emphasizes research, enabling students to engage in hands-on projects. Graduates are equipped for roles like Data Scientist, Quantitative Analyst, and Software Developer. The program offers comprehensive placement assistance and fosters skills for competitive exams. Minimum eligibility requires 50% marks in Class X and XII. Selection is based on a personal interview.

Dr. Anmol Kumar Goyal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in aviation with extensive experience in Airport Operations, Licensing, and Safety. Dr. Anmol has over a decade of industry experience working with Jet Airways and Mangaluru International Airport. Research interests include Airport Sustainability and AI in Aviation. Dr. Anmol employs a student-centered teaching philosophy focused on practical application and collaboration. Courses taught include Airport Designing and Operations. Dr. Anmol holds several certifications, such as the DGCA BAMEC Paper II Certificate and has received multiple awards for exemplary performance in the aviation sector. Contact: anmolk.goyal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Supriya Singh Vats developed the Mitroz project, a nature-inspired multi-cuisine restaurant and café located in the Himalayan range. The design emphasizes eco-friendly practices, utilizing sustainable materials and an earthy color palette to create a harmonious dining experience with its natural surroundings. Mitroz features a diverse menu catering to various culinary tastes while promoting sustainability and local sourcing. Mentors for the project include Vikram Mathur, Rajan Iyer, and Siddhartha Mukherjee, all associated with UPES. The project showcases commitment to environmental consciousness in the hospitality sector.

The MBA in Logistics and Supply Chain Management at UPES School of Business provides students with comprehensive knowledge of logistics and supply chain essential in global business. This two-year full-time program includes internships, live projects, and guest lectures. Students can specialize in Logistics Planning/Supply Chain or Business Process in Supply Chain, addressing key aspects like procurement, warehousing, and operations. High demand for skilled professionals in this field leads to diverse career opportunities across industries. Graduates may secure roles with companies like Flipkart, HUL, and Deloitte, earning salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum.

Jostein Dahl Karlsen serves as CEO and President of the Gas & Oil Technology Collaboration Programme at the International Energy Agency. He previously worked as Senior Policy Adviser at the Norwegian Ministry of Petroleum and Energy, focusing on oil and gas technology R&D. Jostein Dahl Karlsen has overseen national research programs and advised on energy security and sustainability issues related to fossil fuels and technology collaboration. He has contributed to key IEA publications and served as Energy Advisor to the OECD. Jostein Dahl Karlsen has extensive experience in fostering Norway’s offshore competence through international collaborations.

Dr. Nitin Uniyal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Mathematics, Differential Geometry, and Cryptography. He earned his Ph.D. from HNB Garhwal Central University and has teaching experience in courses like Engineering Mathematics and Operations Research. Dr. Uniyal is actively involved in the Mathematics community through platforms like Mathstack Exchange and has received notable ranks in the CSIR-NET exam. His teaching philosophy emphasizes problem-solving and interactive methods to engage students. Dr. Uniyal's research interests include Matrix Methods Cryptography and Nature-based Optimization. Contact: nuniyal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES Centre For Innovation and Entrepreneurship (UCIE) aims to foster entrepreneurship in the Delhi NCR and Uttarakhand regions by supporting the UPES community and external entrepreneurs in commercializing innovative ideas. As a business incubator, UPES Centre For Innovation and Entrepreneurship focuses on technology areas like transportation, energy, and IT. Collaborating with UBI Global enhances UCIE's insights into India's incubation ecosystem. Key objectives include providing resources, mentorship, and networking opportunities for aspiring entrepreneurs. UPES Centre For Innovation and Entrepreneurship also conducts workshops, research on industry trends, and incubation services to empower startups and strengthen the local business ecosystem.

The B.Sc. (Hons.) in Economics with Data Science program at UPES combines economics and data science, providing a transdisciplinary learning environment that emphasizes practical, real-life application. The program features diverse courses, faculty from prestigious institutions, and opportunities for global exposure through collaborative research. With only 40 seats available, students are selected based on SAT scores and interviews. Graduates can pursue roles such as research analyst, data scientist, or policy analyst, with opportunities for advanced studies. Minimum eligibility requires 50% in 10th and 12th standards across any stream.

Siddharth Raje is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with over 21 years of professional and academic experience in design. Notable experiences include roles at NID, The Times of India, and several universities. Siddharth Raje’s research interests focus on design knowledge transfer in indigenous communities, and he emphasizes hands-on learning in teaching. Courses taught include Graphic Composition and Layouts, Publication Design, and Environmental Design. Siddharth Raje has received awards in photography and completed executive training in innovation. Siddharth Raje can be contacted at siddharth.raje@ddn.upes.ac.in.

N Prasanthi Kumari is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 19 years of teaching and research experience. N Prasanthi Kumari specializes in Electromagnetics, Antennas, Microwave Theory, Optical Communications, and Industrial Electronics. N Prasanthi Kumari's research focuses on Antenna Design, Metamaterials, and Low-power VLSI circuits. N Prasanthi Kumari employs design-based assignments in teaching, focusing on active learning. N Prasanthi Kumari holds a Long Service Award from UPES and has authored three books, published 25 papers, and guided several research projects. N Prasanthi Kumari can be contacted at prasanti@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Latika Choudhary is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law at UPES, holding degrees from NLU Odisha and NLU Jodhpur, specializing in Intellectual Property Rights, Patent, and Biotechnology Laws. Dr. Choudhary's doctoral research focused on Genetic and Stem Cell Patenting. With four years of experience at UPES and previous tenure at IMS Law College, Dr. Choudhary's research interests include Intellectual Property Rights and Biotechnology Laws. Dr. Choudhary promotes interdisciplinary learning and is researching circular economies and IPR in the European Union. Contact Dr. Choudhary at lchoudhary@ddn.upes.ac.in for inquiries.

Chanpreet Arora is the Senior Vice President and Head of Business at Voot (Viacom18 Media). She is also the Co-Founder and Mentor of Rezilient Digital and former CEO of VICE India. With over 19 years of experience in media strategy, revenue, and operations, Chanpreet Arora has launched and scaled prominent media brands in India. Alongside her corporate roles, Chanpreet Arora has been involved in academia, teaching at institutions such as the Reuters Institute at Oxford and MDI Gurgaon. Chanpreet Arora's work includes advising government bodies and leading significant industry restructuring efforts.

Dr. Anirudh Singh is an Associate Professor at the School of Business at UPES, specializing in the Oil & Gas sector with a focus on downstream operations. Dr. Anirudh Singh's research encompasses areas such as Petrochemical Business, City Gas Distribution, and Oil & Gas Transport. With over 16 years of experience in various established companies, Dr. Anirudh Singh effectively utilizes innovative teaching methods, including a flipped classroom approach. Dr. Anirudh Singh teaches courses on Oil & Gas Business fundamentals and has received several industry awards. Dr. Anirudh Singh can be contacted at anirudhsingh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Ms. Aakanksha Joshi is a Partner at Economic Laws Practice, specializing in Energy & Infrastructure, Hospitality, Corporate & Commercial, Private Equity, and Real Estate. Ms. Aakanksha Joshi has graduated from Government Law College, Mumbai and holds a Solicitor’s qualification from the Bombay Incorporated Law Society. Ms. Aakanksha Joshi advises on diverse transactions, including agreements and joint ventures in infrastructure and hospitality sectors, representing clients ranging from government bodies to international hotel management companies. Ms. Aakanksha Joshi has been recognized by various legal publications, including Chambers Asia – Pacific and Legal 500, as a leading legal professional.

The Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) program at UPES is a four-year, industry-oriented course that equips students with a strong foundation in design principles, aesthetics, and technical skills. It offers specializations in areas such as Animation and VFX, Graphic Design, UX/UI Design, and Product Design. The curriculum emphasizes experiential learning, incorporating internships and real-world projects. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in X and XII, with admission based on UPESDAT or national-level exams. The program provides robust placement opportunities, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for diverse careers in design.

Prof. Avishek Ghosal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business at UPES, specializing in Power, Energy Economics, Infrastructure, Strategy, Sustainability, and Digital Applications. Prof. Avishek has prior experience at Sterlite Energy, overseeing Thermal Power Plant operations. Research interests include Energy Policy, Risk Management, and Renewable Energy. Prof. Avishek emphasizes active and cooperative learning in teaching and offers courses like Power Economics and Renewable Energy. Recognized with teaching awards, Prof. Avishek engages in multidisciplinary projects and conducts training sessions for energy organizations. Contact Prof. Avishek at aghosal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Yajushii Arora, a 6th-semester student in Integrated BMSc-Microbiology at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, will present her research on "Role of Pesticides in Cancer Initiation and Progression" at the Young Scientist Conference (YSC) during the India International Science Festival (IISF) in Faridabad from January 17th to 20th, 2024. Yajushii is involved in the SHODH project "Correlation of pesticides and plasticizers in cancer," under the mentorship of Dr. Dhruv Kumar, reflecting her commitment to addressing critical health issues, supported by funding from UPES.

Anand Kumar, founder of Super 30, provided valuable insights for engineering aspirants during a webinar hosted by UPES. Anand emphasized the importance of hard work, dedication, and a persistent attitude for overcoming challenges and achieving success. He highlighted that successful engineers need creativity, problem-solving skills, and the ability to relate theoretical knowledge to real-world scenarios. Additionally, Anand encouraged female students to pursue engineering, noting that the industry is evolving. UPES supports women in engineering through scholarships and initiatives like 'Shakti' to promote educational empowerment.

The M.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics with a specialization in Nutraceutical and Nutritional Policy at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology offers a comprehensive education in nutrition's role in public health. This program includes theoretical and practical training, focusing on nutraceuticals, dietary supplements, and nutrition policy development. Graduates can pursue careers as Clinical Dietitians, Nutraceutical Product Development Specialists, and more. The program also emphasizes hands-on experience through internships and workshops, equipping students with skills for success in the evolving nutrition industry. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in relevant undergraduate programs.

Dr. Mamta Latwal serves as an Assistant Professor-Selection Grade at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. An expert in electrochemistry and nanomaterials, Dr. Latwal's research focuses on nanomaterials for applications in catalysis, sensors, and water treatment. Dr. Latwal promotes sustainable technologies and teaches Physical Chemistry, Engineering Chemistry, and courses relevant to industrial applications. Recognized for teaching excellence and research contributions, Dr. Latwal has published widely and engaged with professional organizations. Dr. Latwal emphasizes a teaching philosophy that nurtures critical thinking and connects learning to real-world applications. Contact Dr. Mamta Latwal at mlatwal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech in Aerospace Engineering (Avionics) program offered by UPES focuses on developing industry-ready professionals in avionics, space technology, and defence technology. The curriculum includes theoretical and practical learning, emphasizing electromagnetic waves, microwaves, radar, and avionics system design. Students benefit from faculty with national and international experience, internships, and hands-on labs. Graduates can pursue careers as Aircraft Designers, Avionics Engineers, and more, with opportunities in aviation, space, and defence sectors. The program boasts a 100% placement record, with leading companies offering competitive packages. Eligibility includes 50% marks in Class X and XII with specific subject criteria.

UPES offers Master of Science (M.Sc.) admission for 2024, with applications closing on August 31, 2024. M.Sc. specializations include Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Applied Geology, Data Science, Nutrition and Dietetics, and Microbiology, with eligibility criteria of 50% in 10th, 12th, and relevant graduation. Admissions selection relies on CUET (PG) scores and interviews. The university boasts a strong placement record, with over 94% placements and 560 recruiters in 2022-23. Interested candidates can apply online and inquire about scholarships and fees on the UPES website.

The B.Tech Chemical Engineering program at UPES offers a comprehensive education in chemical processes and equipment, focusing on thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and advanced topics like carbon capture and digitalization. Specializations include Energy Systems and Storage, Refining and Petrochemicals, and Digitalization of Process Technology, aligning with industry needs. The program ensures 100% placement, preparing graduates for roles across various sectors, including petrochemicals and pharmaceuticals. Faculty expertise and partnerships enhance learning opportunities. Admission requires a minimum 50% in relevant subjects, with selection based on various entrance tests. The curriculum integrates practical training and real-world applications.

Dr. Srinivasa Reddy Devarapu serves as an Associate Professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, bringing extensive industry and academic experience. He previously led the Petroleum Engineering Department at Koneru Lakshmaiah University and holds a Ph.D. from IIT Madras. Dr. Devarapu specializes in enhanced oil recovery, reservoir flow modeling, and eco-friendly drilling fluids. His teaching philosophy emphasizes continuous learning and active student engagement through innovative methods such as flipped classrooms. His research has been published in international journals and includes multiple patents, showcasing his impact on the petroleum engineering field.

Project Payal, initiated by UPES, focuses on providing education to underprivileged meritorious girls from nearby villages, aiming for their overall development. The initiative emphasizes that investing in girls' education is one of the most impactful ways to contribute to societal development. Project Payal addresses not only academic needs but also personal growth, empowering girls through education and support. This commitment reflects UPES's dedication to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and social impact initiatives. For more information, potential applicants can explore eligibility criteria and application options available through UPES.

Professor Alok Negi is an accomplished Assistant Professor specializing in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Analytics, and IBM Mainframe Technology at UPES. He holds a B.Tech in Information Technology, an M.Tech in Computer Science & Engineering, and a Ph.D. from NIT Uttarakhand. Professor Negi has industry experience as a Software Engineer and IBM Program Training Consultant. His research interests include AI, ML, and deep learning. He emphasizes a student-centered learning environment and employs innovative teaching methodologies, integrating real-world applications into his courses. Professor Negi has received awards for his scholarly work and serves as a reviewer for academic publications.

Dr. Varun Sapra is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with 18 years of academic and industry experience, holding a Ph.D. in Computer Science. Dr. Varun specializes in programming languages, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and software engineering, teaching both undergraduate and graduate courses. Dr. Varun actively engages in research with 40+ publications, 6 patents, and three edited books, focusing on machine learning applications. Dr. Varun's teaching philosophy emphasizes an interactive learning environment, promoting critical thinking. Dr. Varun supervises students and encourages participation in extracurricular activities. Contact Dr. Varun at varun.sapra@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Tauheed Alam is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Dr. Alam holds a Ph.D. in Criminal Law and has experience as a Legal Associate at Thomson Reuters and as a faculty member at Jamia Millia Islamia and Shri Ram Swarup Memorial University. His research interests include criminal law, Sharia law, and family law. Dr. Alam emphasizes a student-centered teaching philosophy, aiming to foster critical thinking and ethical development among students. He teaches courses such as Law of Crimes and Jurisprudence.

The collaboration between UPES and Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observations Sciences (ARIES) aims to enrich the B.Sc. Physics - Astronomy & Astrophysics program. This Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) enables UPES students to utilize advanced instruments at ARIES, enhancing their exploration of astronomical phenomena. Students can engage in practical learning experiences, gaining insights into significant astronomical events. This partnership strengthens UPES's commitment to academic excellence in the fields of physics and astrophysics, providing students with unique research opportunities.

Prof. (Dr.) Sanjay Biswash is a professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT(ISM) Dhanbad. He mentors over 120 students and specializes in mobile, network, and pervasive systems. His published work includes over 75 research papers and he is involved with the 6G Task Force USA. Prof. Biswash has held international positions, conducted workshops, and been a reviewer for top journals. His research interests encompass Fog and Edge Networks, cybersecurity, next-generation networks, and more. He has also secured multiple grants for international research projects.

Aditya Acharya, a student at UPES, achieved notable success by hosting "The Aditya Acharya Show," a podcast available on platforms like Apple Podcasts and Spotify. The podcast focuses on creating a student community through discussions of expert experiences, aiming to inspire and motivate listeners. It has garnered recognition as the most popular podcast in the "How To" category on Spotify and is also accessible on twenty-four additional platforms, including Ganna Podcast. Aditya Acharya’s initiative exemplifies innovation and leadership within the academic community at UPES.

Akhilesh Mohan Srivastava is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES. Dr. Akhilesh Mohan Srivastava holds a Ph.D. from IIT Indore and an M.Tech from Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University. With over 8 years of teaching and 4 years of industry experience, Dr. Akhilesh Mohan Srivastava specializes in biometrics, pattern recognition, computer vision, and machine learning, and has authored three books. Dr. Akhilesh Mohan Srivastava's teaching philosophy emphasizes experiential learning. His notable courses include Data Structures, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Contact Dr. Akhilesh Mohan Srivastava at am.srivastava@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES Editorial Team provides guidance for B.Tech graduates making post-graduation choices between M.Tech and MBA. Both degrees have distinct focuses: M.Tech emphasizes technical fields like artificial intelligence, while MBA centers on business management skills. The typical course duration for both is two years, with eligibility requirements differing. Career prospects for M.Tech graduates include roles in research, software engineering, and government positions, whereas MBA graduates often pursue management, consultancy, or entrepreneurial paths. Salary ranges for both degrees are between 3 to 10 lakh per annum. The decision should align with individual aspirations and desired career trajectories.

Dr. Sumeet Gupta, a faculty member at the School of Business, has been appointed as an Expert Panel Member for the University Grants Commission (UGC) Research Scheme Assessment. Dr. Sumeet Gupta's responsibilities include evaluating several research schemes, notably the Dr. S. Radhakrishanan Post-Doctoral Fellowship, the Dr. D.S. Kothari Research Grant for newly recruited faculty members, research grants for in-service faculty members, and fellowships for superannuated faculty members. This role emphasizes Dr. Sumeet Gupta's expertise and contribution to academic research within the higher education sector.

Dr. Ramesh Kumar Saini is an Associate Professor in the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, specializing in plant biotechnology. Dr. Saini holds a Ph.D. in Biotechnology and has an extensive publication record with 85 articles and over 6,300 citations, ranking Dr. Saini among the world's top 2% of scientists per Stanford University. Research interests include nutraceutical extraction, bioavailability of dietary components, and novel food processing methods. Dr. Saini has received multiple accolades, grants, and serves as an editorial board member for various journals, contributing significantly to the fields of food science and sustainable nutrition.

Dr. Himani Kaushik is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. She holds a PhD and master's degrees from Jawaharlal Nehru University and a bachelor's in Political Science from SGTB Khalsa College. Dr. Himani Kaushik previously worked at G D Goenka University, Delhi University, Niti Aayog, and the Indian Institute of Public Administration, focusing on public administration and policy. Dr. Himani's research interests include global politics and labor migration. Courses taught include Feminism and Feminist Politics, India’s Foreign Policy, and Political Theory. Dr. Himani aims to enhance students' understanding of political concepts and critical evaluation skills. Contact Dr. Himani at himani.kaushik@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES alumni Arjun Kurunji and Harshul Verma from the UPES School of Design are innovating in automotive design with cutting-edge projects. Kurunji, currently at Maruti Suzuki, designed the Koenigsegg Vision GT, blending heritage and modern aesthetics in electric vehicle design. Rajesh Mokale is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in Organizational Behaviour and Human Resource Management. Rajesh Mokale emphasizes proactive learning through contemporary examples and aims to understand the macro, meso, and micro factors affecting employees and organizational behavior. Rajesh Mokale has developed course content for subjects including Corporate Social Responsibility and Succession Planning. Research interests include Organizational Theory and Employee Relations. Rajesh Mokale’s teaching philosophy focuses on experiential learning through case studies to solve managerial problems. Contact Rajesh Mokale at rajeshk.mokale@ddn.upes.ac.in for further inquiries.

The International Conference on Nanostructuring by Ion Beams (ICNIB 2023) held on November 2-4, 2023, at UPES included an opening address by Vice Chancellor Dr. Ram Sharma, emphasizing UPES's rapid growth. The conference featured thirteen international experts discussing the role of energetic ions and photons in various applications, including nuclear materials, cancer therapy, and advancements in semiconductor and satellite technologies. UPES faculty and students are engaged in collaborative research with institutions like BARC and IPR, highlighting UPES's dedication to innovative research within the field of nanostructuring.

The B.Tech. Chemical Engineering (Energy Systems and Storage) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a four-year undergraduate degree focused on chemical engineering, specializing in energy systems and storage technologies. The curriculum covers core chemical engineering principles and advanced topics like renewable energy, fuel cells, and batteries. Emphasizing practical experience through labs, internships, and projects, the program prepares students for careers in energy sectors, addressing global energy challenges. Graduates can pursue roles in various industries, with strong placement support provided by UPES, ensuring readiness for the dynamic energy landscape.

The Ph.D. program in Microbiology at UPES School of Health Science & Technology focuses on advanced training in applied scientific knowledge and translational research. The curriculum includes areas such as microbial genomics, drug discovery, and the microbiome's impact on health. Students conduct research on antibiotic resistance and participate in international collaborations. The program emphasizes hands-on experience, with graduates positioned for careers in healthcare, academia, and industry. Key dates for July 2024 intake include the application deadline on June 3, 2024, and sessions commencing on August 12, 2024.

Ritesh Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES with a B. Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering and is pursuing a dual degree (M. Tech and PhD in Information Technology, specializing in Robotics) at the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad. His thesis focuses on “RSSI-based indoor localization methods using Machine Learning/Deep Learning.” Ritesh Kumar's research interests include indoor localization, Internet of Things, aerial robotics, and machine learning. He emphasizes an inclusive teaching approach to promote curiosity and critical thinking. Ritesh Kumar has received notable fellowships and has coordinated various educational workshops.

UPES lab technician Aakansha Simra, alongside co-founder Pratiksha, launched W&W Organics to create organic soap solutions for skin issues, inspired by Aakansha’s search for safe skincare. With support from UPES’ start-up incubator, Runway, Aakansha secured ₹10 lakh funding from The India Network's founder Rahul Narvekar. W&W Organics aims to produce eco-friendly soap bars marketed in paper packaging to minimize plastic waste. The product line will cater to men, women, and children, emphasizing natural ingredients and environmental responsibility, encapsulated in the motto "By nature, for nature."

India is poised to become a global leader in pharmaceutical manufacturing, leveraging its capabilities during the COVID-19 pandemic to produce vaccines like Covishield and Covaxin. With the highest number of FDA-approved facilities after the US, India accounts for 20% of the world's generic drug production. The 'Make in India' initiative aims to enhance self-sufficiency in drug manufacturing from Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient production to final formulations. The UPES School of Health Sciences has tailored its programs to align with industry needs, supporting India's rise as the pharmacy of the world.

UPES Editorial Team discusses alternative career paths for law graduates who do not wish to pursue traditional lawyer roles. The article highlights five unconventional options: Politics, where legal education aids in legislative effectiveness; Legal Writing and Content Creation, which addresses public access to legal knowledge; Policy Analyst, supporting leaders with data-driven insights; Entrepreneurship, leveraging common skills found in law; and Teaching, mentoring future law students. UPES School of Law encourages exploring diverse career opportunities, emphasizing the importance of identifying personal strengths to build a fulfilling career.

Alind is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Alind earned an M.Tech degree in 2015 from Indian Institute of Technology Delhi and a B.Tech in 2012 from Uttar Pradesh Technical University. Currently pursuing a PhD, Alind has over five years of academic experience. Research interests include Optimization and Game Design and Development. Teaching emphasizes practical outcomes in Software Engineering and Application Development. Alind has published research papers and applied for patents, reflecting a commitment to innovation and intellectual property protection. Alind can be contacted at alind@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at UPES focuses on maintaining and enhancing educational standards through various accreditations, including IACBE, NBA, and NAAC. The cell is composed of members such as Dr. Ram Sharma, Vice-Chancellor, and other esteemed faculty across different schools including Health Sciences, Computer Science, and Business. The IQAC's responsibilities include ensuring quality in academic processes, enhancing research and development, and promoting student welfare. UPES's commitment to excellence is evident in its student outcomes, placements, and rankings both nationally and internationally.

Dr. Ajay Mittal is a distinguished professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Petroleum Engineering. Dr. Ajay Mittal holds a Ph.D. in Petroleum Engineering and has extensive experience in the oil and gas industry. Dr. Ajay Mittal's key research interests include Enhanced Oil Recovery, Nanomaterials, and Petroleum Economics. Dr. Ajay Mittal teaches various courses, such as Drilling Technology and Oil & Gas Marketing, while employing a student-centered teaching philosophy. Dr. Ajay Mittal has received multiple awards for excellence, including the GD Asia MD Operational Excellence Award and has contributed significantly to academic publications.

The UPES blog discusses advanced engineering career paths and emerging sectors. The blog aims to guide students through diverse engineering careers and innovations while highlighting the importance of research and experiential learning at UPES. Dr. Ajay Kumar is a prominent professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in mechanical engineering. With over 22 years in academia and 27 filed patents, Dr. Ajay Kumar has published more than 75 papers focused on areas such as Finite Element Analysis, engine emissions, and the development of high-performance composites. He has supervised six PhD students and numerous M.Tech theses. Dr. Ajay Kumar emphasizes innovative teaching methods and outcome-based education. He has earned multiple awards for teaching excellence and contributed to various international conferences and scholarly bodies like ASME and ASHRAE.

Venkatesh Varala is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with a strong background in Design Research, specializing in User Experience Design and Product Design. Venkatesh's prior experience includes a researcher role at IIT Guwahati and a design internship with Sanmina-SCI Systems USA. Research interests encompass Design Semantics, HCI, Mixed Reality, and Behavioral Science. Venkatesh employs active educational methods, emphasizing critical thinking and hands-on learning in User Experience Design courses. Contact: vvarala@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Integrated BBA-MBA program specializing in Finance Management at UPES provides students with comprehensive knowledge in business and finance. The curriculum covers financial institutions, behavioral finance, and analytical skills essential for finance careers. Students engage in projects, internships, and networking with industry professionals, enhancing employability in roles like financial analyst, investment banker, or risk manager. Graduates can expect diverse job opportunities in multinational corporations and fintech firms, with starting salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in Classes X and XII, evaluated through entrance exams like UPESMET.

UPES has partnered with KPMG in India to enhance its MBA Strategy and Consulting and MBA Business Analytics programs. This collaboration aims to meet the growing demand for industry-ready management professionals, with the consulting sector growing at a CAGR of 15%-20% over the past decade. MBA aspirants will benefit from lectures by KPMG experts, real-world case studies, and mentorship. Students will earn an MBA from UPES and a certificate from KPMG upon completion. The KPMG curriculum will contribute approximately 12 credits through four specialized courses across the program's first three semesters.

Four UPES law students, Manya Jain, Juhi Mathur, Kadari Niharika, and Trisha Agarwala, participated in a Semester Abroad Program at The University of Law, London, on full scholarships. Their experiences included overcoming challenges, appreciating diverse cultural interactions, and engaging in a collaborative learning environment. The students highlighted London's beauty, the unique academic structure at ULaw, and the value of group work in legal studies. They expressed gratitude for the transformative opportunity provided by UPES, emphasizing the personal and educational growth gained during the semester abroad.

Dr. Prateek Raj Gautam is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at UPES, with six years of teaching experience. His research focuses on CDMA, IDMA, WSN, IoT, AI/ML, Computer Vision, and Digital Twin, emphasizing real-world applications in core engineering subjects. Dr. Prateek Raj Gautam has taught various undergraduate and postgraduate courses, including Digital Electronics and Machine Learning. He has received MHRD and UGC fellowships, published research in reputable journals, and presented at international conferences. Dr. Prateek Raj Gautam is currently exploring deep learning applications in WSN Localization and Biomedical fields.

The webpage discusses the journey of a product designer, highlighting Manas Ranjan Mishra's insights on transforming ideas into impactful products. Siddharth Kumar is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Design, specializing in Architecture and Industrial Design, with a focus on Material Exploration and New Product Development. Research interests include foldability systems, biomimicry, and assistive technology. Siddharth Kumar teaches courses such as Advance Design Tools and Packaging Design, promoting practical learning through workshops and real-world product development.

Ishan Maheshwari is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. He holds an LL.B. from NALSAR University of Law (2015) and an LL.M. in International Human Rights Law from NLSIU (2021). Ishan Maheshwari’s research interests include International Humanitarian Law, Human Rights Law, and Environmental Law. He employs a Socratic teaching method and covers courses such as Family Law and Labour Law, aiming to engage students in philosophical legal discussions. Contact: ishan.maheshwari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Sc. (Hons.) UPES provides details about the ULSAT 2024 entrance exam for LL.B. admissions. Candidates must have a minimum of 50% marks in higher secondary education (X and XII).
