Candidates can apply online, with certain exemptions from the ULSAT based on CLAT or board merit. For assistance, UPES can be contacted via their toll-free number or email.

The webpage provides details about the Master of Laws (LL.M.) program at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) for the 2024 admission cycle. Students can apply online and are encouraged to explore scholarship opportunities.

The B.Tech. Sustainability Engineering (Sustainability Management) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering focuses on sustainable development's social, environmental, and economic dimensions. The curriculum includes international exposure through partnerships with universities and emphasizes real-world applications, aligning with the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals (UN-SDGs). Graduates are well-prepared for careers as sustainability specialists, consultants, and managers across various sectors. The program stresses practical skills, industry internships, and a strong placement record, positioning graduates to effectively address sustainability challenges and contribute to environmental management. Minimum eligibility includes 50% marks in Classes X and XII.

Taranpreet Singh recounts the journey of winning the prestigious L. Austin Grant of $500 while studying at UPES. Austin Weeks Undergraduate Grant, which supports geoscience students globally. Mr. Anil Raturi is a distinguished Advisory Board Member of the School of Law at UPES and a former Director General of Police (DGP) of Uttarakhand. Anil Raturi, who joined the Indian Police Service (IPS) in 1987, became DGP in 2017, making him the fourth police officer of Uttarakhand origin to hold this position. Anil Raturi is an alumnus of Delhi University with a B.A. (Honours) and M.A. degrees. Additionally, Anil Raturi is an accomplished author, having written the novel "Bhanwar Ek Prem Kahani," which was released by Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami.

Dr. Geetanjali Raghav is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over ten years of experience in renewable energy, particularly in solar thermal energy systems and energy audits in rural Uttarakhand. Dr. Raghav focuses on empowering rural women and enhancing their participation in the energy sector. Courses taught include Thermodynamics, Thermal Engineering, and Renewable Energy. Dr. Raghav has received awards for research and actively participates in consultancy projects to improve energy efficiency in water supply systems. Additionally, Dr. Raghav serves as a mentor for student projects within ASHRAE, promoting professional development.

The Ph.D. in Geoscience program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides a rigorous research-oriented curriculum focused on understanding Earth components and processes. Candidates explore diverse topics such as seismic activity, climate change, and natural resource management through interdisciplinary studies. The program features extensive research opportunities, geological fieldwork, and advanced geo-data analysis. Graduates can pursue careers in academia, research, environmental consulting, and the energy sector, contributing significantly to geoscience advancements. Key admission dates for the July 2024 intake include the last application date on June 3, 2024, and the session commencement on August 12, 2024.

The webpage by Anmol Kumar discusses the integral role of aviation management in modern air travel, highlighting its significance in ensuring safe and efficient airline operations. It covers key areas like airport operations, air traffic management, and freight trends, emphasizing that effective management enhances passenger experience and safety while adhering to international regulations. The Indian aviation outlook predicts substantial growth, with plans to increase the number of functional airports and air traffic, projected to make India the third largest domestic aviation market by 2024. The future of aviation management rests on innovation and safety standards, driving the industry's evolution.

UPES Management Entrance Test (UPESMET) 2021 is a centralized exam for admissions into management courses at UPES School of Business. The exam assesses candidates on General English, Quantitative Aptitude, General Awareness, and Analytical Reasoning, totaling 140 questions with no negative marking. Eligibility requires candidates to have a minimum of 50% marks in higher secondary and graduation from a recognized university. The test can be taken online, offering flexibility for candidates. Collaborations with industry leaders ensure that UPES School of Business remains aligned with current market trends, preparing students for various business environments.

The Department of Energy Engineering at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, offers three undergraduate and four postgraduate programs focused on energy sector needs. Established programs include B.Tech in Applied Petroleum Engineering, Chemical Engineering, and various M.Tech and MSc degrees, emphasizing clean energy and sustainability. The curriculum integrates hands-on learning with modern technologies like AI and Data Analytics. The department aims to produce skilled energy professionals through partnerships with industry and an emphasis on innovative research and ethical practices, fostering a comprehensive educational environment to meet global energy challenges.

Peer Mohideen Sathikh is an Advisory Board Member at UPES and an Associate Professor at Nanyang Technological University, where he serves as Director for Industry Engagement and Cross-college Collaboration. With a PhD from Nanyang Technological University and multiple advanced degrees in design, Peer Mohideen Sathikh specializes in the design of operation-critical control centers for rapid transit systems. A seasoned industrial designer and entrepreneur, Peer Mohideen Sathikh co-founded Teknovate Plastics and has received numerous accolades, including a Public Administration Medal from the Government of Singapore for contributions to design education. Peer Mohideen Sathikh's research focuses on immersive experience in mobility and transportation design.

The BBA in Aviation Management with a specialization in Aviation Service Operations at UPES School of Business is a comprehensive three-year program designed to blend business management principles with aviation industry knowledge. The curriculum includes courses in finance, marketing, operations, and human resources, focusing on managing service operations in aviation. Students participate in internships, live projects, and receive industry exposure through guest lectures. Graduates are well-equipped for careers as airline operations managers, airport executives, and aviation consultants, with starting salaries ranging from INR 4 to 10 lakh per annum. This program addresses the demand for skilled aviation professionals.

Dr. Piyush Kumar, Assistant Professor Selection Grade at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, has made a significant academic contribution by publishing the book “Oxides for Medical Applications” through Elsevier. This comprehensive work focuses on various oxide materials exhibiting optical, magnetic, and electronic properties, which are essential for biomedical applications. The book serves as a valuable resource for researchers and professionals in the field of medical applications of materials. More information about the book can be found at Elsevier's website.

UPES offers Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) admissions for 2024, with a deadline of August 31, 2024. The B.A. programs span three years and cover disciplines like journalism, mass communication, and digital media, emphasizing a broad curriculum to prepare students for diverse career opportunities in humanities and arts. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% marks in Class 12. The admission process involves an online application and a personal interview. UPES boasts strong placement record, partnering with over 560 recruiters, ensuring practical exposure and career readiness for graduates. Scholarships may be available for eligible students.

Ms. Richa Bahuguna is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, with over 6 years of experience in Pharmaceutical Sciences. Ms. Richa Bahuguna earned an M.Pharm in Pharmaceutics from Uttarakhand Technical University in 2015 and is pursuing a Ph.D. under Dr. Rajendra Awasthi. Ms. Richa Bahuguna's research focuses on transdermal drug delivery and nanotechnology. She has received numerous awards, published research articles, and is an active participant in various conferences. Ms. Richa Bahuguna employs dynamic teaching methods, emphasizing active learning in her courses that cover novel drug delivery systems and pharmaceutics.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) offers a four-year Bachelor of Pharmacy (B. Pharm.) program at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, focusing on pharmaceutical sciences. The curriculum includes subjects such as pharmaceutical chemistry, pharmaceutics, pharmacology, and pharmacognosy, blending theory with practical experience through internships and clinical rotations. Graduates can pursue diverse careers such as pharmacists, pharmacy technicians, or pharmaceutical researchers. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in relevant subjects at the Higher Secondary level. The program emphasizes industry collaboration, innovative research, and personal development, boasting a 99% placement rate with leading pharmaceutical companies.

The M.Sc. in Health Sciences program at UPES offers specializations in Nutrition & Dietetics and Microbiology. The curriculum includes comprehensive training in clinical nutrition, therapeutic diets, microbial genetics, and food microbiology. Students develop skills for careers as nutritionists, dietitians, or microbiologists in healthcare, research, and food industries. The program emphasizes research, practical experience, and evidence-based practices. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in relevant academic qualifications. Tuition fees vary by specialization, and students benefit from internship opportunities. The program promotes holistic health and safety through nutrition and microbial studies. Admissions close on August 31, 2024.

The B.Tech in Applied Petroleum Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a four-year course with specializations in Energy Systems and Storage, Intelligent Petroleum Systems, and Gas Engineering Informatics. The curriculum includes foundational engineering, advanced petroleum topics, and practical experiences through internships and projects. Key subjects incorporate AI, drilling, and reservoir engineering. UPES has strong industry connections, ensuring 100% placement with top employers like Schlumberger and Exxon Mobil, and offers global exposure through partnerships with renowned universities. Graduates are prepared for diverse roles in the energy sector, equipped to meet industry demands and technological advancements.

Dr. Kuldeep Kumar Roy is a Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES with over 15 years of experience in teaching and research. Dr. Roy holds a B.Pharm., M.Pharm. in Pharmaceutical Chemistry, and a Ph.D. in Medicinal Chemistry. His research focuses on pharmaceutical research and drug discovery for diseases of unmet need. Dr. Roy has published over 45 peer-reviewed articles, holds three international patents, and has received several awards, including the 2022 Startup Research Grant from the Government of India. He emphasizes active student involvement in his teaching philosophy.

The B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering - Advanced Manufacturing program at UPES prepares students for modern manufacturing and robotics through specialized courses like Advanced Manufacturing Processes and CNC Machine Tools. Students gain practical experience via industry collaboration, notably with BOSCH, and the program emphasizes innovative techniques like additive manufacturing. Graduates are equipped for careers in sectors such as aerospace and automotive, supported by strong placement opportunities. Faculty expertise includes backgrounds from IIT and top international universities. The curriculum includes hands-on projects and access to advanced labs, ensuring students are industry-ready for the evolving manufacturing landscape.

Amogh Aggarwal, a student from the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, has achieved significant recognition by securing admission to the master's program in Astrophysics and Cosmology at the University of Bologna in Italy. Amogh's notable internship with the Belle II project played a crucial role in this selection, highlighting Amogh Aggarwal's dedication and skills in the field of astrophysics. This opportunity marks a key milestone in Amogh Aggarwal's academic and professional pursuit within astrophysics, demonstrating his commitment to advancing his expertise and knowledge.

Dr. Shreya Banerjee is an Assistant Professor-Senior Scale at the School of Computer Science, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), Dehradun, India. Dr. Shreya Banerjee's research focuses on quantum systems and their applications in technology, with expertise in quantum algorithms and non-local correlations. Dr. Shreya Banerjee has 2+ years of post-PhD experience and has taught Data Mining and Business Intelligence. Dr. Shreya Banerjee’s scholarly work includes presentations at multiple conferences and awards such as the MITACS Accelerated Postdoctoral Fellowship. Dr. Shreya Banerjee's contact information is shreya.banerjee@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Diana George discusses the relevance of Data Science in Economics, highlighting their interconnectedness through analytical skills and data analysis. Data Science emerged in the 2000s, expanding its scope beyond traditional statistics. Economics relies heavily on data to derive financial insights. Graduates with a combination of Economics and Data Science skills are poised for a promising career, benefiting from the growing demand for data scientists, higher earning potential, and enhanced understanding of machine learning. This educational combination also fosters strong communication and presentation skills, vital for succeeding in various industries such as finance and public policy.

Dr. Vivek Panwar is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics at UPES University, with expertise in integral transforms. Dr. Vivek holds a Doctorate from South Asian University, along with an M.Sc in Applied Mathematics and B.Sc in Mathematics from the University of Delhi. Dr. Vivek employs innovative teaching methods, focusing on student-driven learning. Dr. Vivek has published 13 research articles and is an active member of the Indian Mathematical Society. Contact: vivek.panwar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Swati Sarkar is an Assistant Professor in Interaction Design at UPES School of Design. The Bachelor of Design (Product) program at UPES's School of Design prepares students for careers in product design by emphasizing collaboration, research methods, and user needs. The webpage discusses the significance of pursuing a Master of Design (M. Des.) degree for enhancing design careers. The M. Des. program at UPES spans two years, covering specializations such as communication design, interaction design, product design, and transportation design. The program fosters creativity, innovation, and networking opportunities, bridging theory and practice, while promoting multidisciplinary learning to prepare students for a dynamic industry landscape.

Vikas Thapa is an Assistant Professor in the School of Design at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Vikas Thapa emphasizes experiential learning in teaching and covers courses such as Introduction to Robotics and Internet of Things (IoT) Fundamentals.

Dr. Saswati Dutta's research focuses on sustainability and innovative engineering solutions.

Dr. Bhuwan Chandra Joshi is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Optimization theory. Sandhya S. is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. An expert in Pharmacognosy, Sandhya S. specializes in pharmacognostic standardization, bioassay-guided fractionation, and herbal formulation development, focusing on gastrointestinal infections. With over 21 years of experience, Sandhya S. previously held academic positions in India and worked as a Hospital Pharmacist. Sandhya S. has received multiple awards, including the Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Best Scientist Award. Sandhya S. employs innovative teaching methods to enhance student learning in Pharmacy, including discussions and quizzes. Sandhya S. has published extensively and presented at numerous conferences.

Dr. Ashish Mishra is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, holding a Ph.D. in Aerospace Structures from IIT Madras. Dr. Ashish Mishra's research focuses on lightweight solutions for ballistic armor using experimental and numerical methods. Dr. Ashish Mishra has authored articles in international journals and has been involved in various competitions, winning accolades including the Defence India Start-up Challenge. Dr. Ashish Mishra teaches courses in mechanics and materials, advocating critical thinking and real-world applications. Dr. Ashish Mishra supervises Ph.D. candidates and engages in collaborative research efforts.

The B.Sc. Microbiology (Food & Environment Microbiology) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology focuses on the study of microorganisms in food safety, quality, and environmental applications. The curriculum includes topics on foodborne pathogens, environmental microbiology, and practical laboratory skills. Graduates can pursue careers in food industries, public health, environmental agencies, and biotechnology. The program emphasizes research, technology use, and industry connections, offering insights from organizations like AIIMS and Sun Pharma. Future trends include advancements in microbiome research and biotechnology, enhancing food safety and environmental sustainability efforts.

Siddharth Gupta, an alumnus of UPES who graduated in 2015 with an MBA in Logistics and Supply Chain Management, is recognized as one of the Top 30 Indian Entrepreneurs Under 30 by Wynsell in 2021. The BA/BBA/B.Com. LL.B. Hons. in Taxation Law program at UPES School of Law provides in-depth knowledge of taxation laws, including financial accounting, direct and indirect taxation, and auditing. Graduates will be equipped for careers as tax consultants, analysts, or government auditors. The program emphasizes practical application and prepares students for the evolving landscape of tax law, including digital and international taxation. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in higher secondary exams, with selection based on performance in designated entrance tests.

The M.Sc. Data Science program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a 2-year master's course focused on mathematics, data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning. It includes practical learning in programming languages like Python and R, and emphasizes data visualization and real-world projects. Students can undertake a dissertation on a self-selected data science topic in the second year. The program prepares graduates for careers as Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and more, with strong industry connections for excellent placement opportunities. The curriculum covers essential topics such as big data analytics and predictive analytics, ensuring comprehensive training.

The B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering in Defence Technology program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering focuses on developing expertise in defence systems and technologies essential for India's security. The curriculum includes weapon systems, military communications, and cybersecurity, preparing graduates for careers in defence organizations and industries. Emphasizing hands-on experience and robust industry partnerships, the program provides opportunities for internships and collaborative projects. Graduates are equipped for roles in aerospace and defence sectors, with potential career paths including engineers in missile systems and cyber defence. The program aligns with the dynamics of modern defence technology and manufacturing initiatives in India.

Ruby Yadav is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in media law and constitutional law. Ruby Yadav has a strong academic background and research experience, focusing on the legal aspects of communication and media, including freedom of the press and intellectual property. Prior to joining UPES in January 2019, Ruby Yadav worked at Law College Dehradun. Ruby Yadav teaches various courses, including constitutional and environmental law, and advocates for active student engagement and a student-centered approach. Ruby Yadav has authored two books on media law and received the Vice Chancellor’s Gold Medal for LL.M. from HPNLU.

Monica Pradyot is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. She graduated with a BBA LL.B. in Corporate Laws in 2015 and completed her LL.M. in Energy Laws in 2017. Currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Energy and Environment Laws, Monica specializes in Taxation Law and has four years of teaching experience. She has worked in banking and finance at D H Law Associates and has served as a visiting faculty for five years. Monica's research interests include sustainable policies, taxation, and energy law. She has published numerous papers and is active in student mentorship and club activities.

Dr. Tirumala Rao Kotni is an Assistant Professor in the Chemical Engineering Department at UPES, Dehradun. Dr. Tirumala Rao Kotni completed doctoral studies at IIT Delhi, specializing in dewetting in thin liquid films influenced by viscosity. Dr. Tirumala Rao Kotni's research includes numerical simulations, protein aggregation, and kinetic Monte Carlo simulations. Dr. Tirumala Rao Kotni holds an M.Tech in Chemical Engineering from NIT Trichy and a B.Tech from M.V.G.R. College of Engineering. Dr. Tirumala Rao Kotni's teaching interests encompass fluid mechanics and chemical process safety, underpinned by a commitment to mentoring students in their academic pursuits.

UPES School of Law, ranked 20th overall in India by BW Legal World 2023, offers innovative legal education focusing on outcome-based learning and adaptability in a digital age. Programs include B.Com. LL.B., BA LL.B., and LL.M. with collaborations for international exposure. The school emphasizes competency-based and collaborative education tailored to individual needs, preparing students for emerging legal challenges. With strong industry ties, UPES ensures job placements, boasting a highest CTC of 20 LPA in 2023. Admissions for the upcoming academic year close on August 31, 2024.

Dr. Ram Sharma, Vice Chancellor of UPES, emphasizes the importance of learning, hard work, and personal growth in his message to students. Dr. Ram Sharma encourages embracing lifelong learning and recognizing individual potential, citing stories from Jain philosophy, Buddhism, and Hermann Hesse's "Siddhartha" to illustrate the value of open-mindedness, self-belief, and humility. He urges students to take responsibility for their actions and remain dedicated to their academic journey. Dr. Ram Sharma concludes by welcoming students to explore and realize their infinite capabilities through hard work and exploration.

The B.Sc. Physics by Research in Material Science and Nanotechnology program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a four-year course focused on providing hands-on training in material synthesis and characterization. The curriculum includes fundamental and advanced topics, preparing students for careers in diverse industries such as defense, healthcare, and clean energy. Graduates will be equipped to pursue roles as metallurgists, research associates, or scientists. The program emphasizes practical skills and research methodologies, and offers strong placement opportunities due to industry connections and support from experienced faculty.

Dr. Akmal Husain is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. He holds a Ph.D. from the Indian Institute of Technology, Banaras Hindu University, focusing on non-linear wave propagation in gas dynamics. Dr. Akmal Husain teaches Engineering Mathematics, Discrete Mathematics, and conducts lab courses in Python and MATLAB. His research encompasses partial differential equations and non-linear wave problems. Previously, Dr. Husain worked at Ideal Institute of Technology and Aligarh Muslim University. He has received a UGC research fellowship and a DST Junior Research Fellowship. Contact Dr. Akmal Husain at ahusain@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dehradun, known as India’s Education Hub, attracts students globally due to its rich history, beautiful landscapes, and a strong educational framework. The city boasts numerous esteemed institutions, leading to a significant rise in management and engineering colleges. Dehradun offers a moderate climate, exciting excursions, and activities for nature and adventure lovers. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) stands out for its holistic educational approach, providing world-class facilities and numerous extracurricular activities. UPES also participates in the Study In India initiative to support international students with scholarships and fee waivers.

The webpage discusses various career paths for M.Sc. Organic Chemistry graduates, highlighting the skills and qualifications necessary for success in diverse fields. Career options include positions such as Quality Control Chemist, Toxicologist, Patent Agent, Pharmaceutical Chemist, and Teacher/Professor. Each role utilizes the analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills developed during the M.Sc. program. The article emphasizes the versatility of an M.Sc. Organic Chemistry degree, encouraging graduates to explore opportunities across industries, including pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, and education, while seeking mentorship and networking for career development.

Dr. Mohammad Ahsan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with a Ph.D. from the National Institute of Technology Hamirpur, India, completed in 2021. Dr. Mohammad Ahsan's research interests encompass Social Media Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Information Diffusion in online social networks, and Healthcare. Dr. Mohammad Ahsan emphasizes student-centered learning, practical application, and ethical responsibility in teaching. Dr. Mohammad Ahsan has taught courses including Data Science and Data Mining, and Dr. Mohammad Ahsan has published research in international forums. Contact Dr. Mohammad Ahsan via email at md.ahsan@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Sudeshna Chowdhury is an Associate Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES, with a Master's degree in journalism from Indiana University specializing in Global Journalism. Sudeshna Chowdhury has extensive journalistic experience across various media outlets including Deutsche Welle, The Atlantic, and Thomson Reuters Foundation. Sudeshna Chowdhury’s research interests include Gender, War, Peace, and Narrative Journalism. As a Professor of Practice, Sudeshna Chowdhury emphasizes hands-on reporting experience and professionalism in student output. Sudeshna Chowdhury has also served as a communication lead at the FAO of the UN and worked as a UN correspondent.

Aditya Mukherjee's article discusses the benefits of pursuing a Graphics and Communication Design course. This course enhances creativity and equips students with skills in typography, branding, digital design, and multimedia storytelling. Graduates can explore diverse career paths such as graphic designer, web designer, animator, and art director, providing ample job opportunities in growing sectors like interior design and fashion. The course aligns with technological advancements, including virtual reality and the Metaverse, making it increasingly relevant in today's job market. Innovative and relaxed work environments are a hallmark of creative studios, offering a fulfilling career for aspiring designers.

Dr. Durga Madhab Mahapatra is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. He holds a Ph.D. in Bioprocess Engineering from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore, where he received a Gold Medal. With over 16 years of research experience, Dr. Mahapatra focuses on Algal Bioprocess Development, Biomass Valorization, and Wastewater Treatment. He has published over 80 peer-reviewed articles and edited eight books. Dr. Mahapatra has received various awards including the GYTI National Award and the ACS Best Oral Presentation Award, and he currently teaches courses related to Bioprocess Engineering and Environmental Management.

The International Connect page of the Department of International Affairs at UPES emphasizes the importance of international exposure for students and staff. UPES offers opportunities for international student mobility, collaboration with over 50 global partner universities, and joint research initiatives. The International Credit Transfer Program allows students to study part of their courses at prestigious institutions in countries like the UK, Germany, Canada, and Australia. Additional programs include faculty and student exchange initiatives, co-teaching with global faculty, and collaborative projects providing internships and research opportunities, fostering global academic experiences at UPES.

UPES provides comprehensive support for students, including mental health services via a full-time psychological counselor, health and medical services with an infirmary and medical insurance, and a Dean of Student Welfare Department for academic and non-academic inquiries. Financial support through scholarships is available based on merit and needs. UPES organizes remedial coaching for students scoring below 40% in Mid-Term Exams to enhance their learning and skills. The Student Engagement and Experience department aims to foster involvement throughout the academic year. Contact Dr. Veena Krishnan at vkrishnan@ddn.upes.ac.in for mental health support.

Neeraj Rathore is an Assistant Professor-Senior Scale at the School of Business, UPES, with over 15 years of academic experience. Neeraj Rathore specializes in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Web Programming, Data Mining, Python Programming, Data Visualization, and DBMS. Neeraj Rathore holds a Master of Technology in Computer Science & Engineering and is pursuing a Ph.D. in the same field. Neeraj Rathore's research focuses on salient object detection in images. Neeraj Rathore emphasizes interactive teaching, student participation, and real-world applications. Neeraj Rathore has published works in various reputable journals and conferences. Contact Neeraj Rathore at neeraj.rathore@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Sujata Bali is a Senior Associate Professor at the UPES School of Law in Dehradun, India, specializing in Corporate Governance and Banking laws. Dr. Sujata Bali has a Ph.D. in Law, focusing on banking frauds in India. Dr. Sujata Bali employs Socratic teaching methods and has interests in legal education, women's rights, and environmental concerns. Dr. Sujata Bali received the UGC Senior Research Fellowship and the Best Faculty - Excellence Award in 2019. Dr. Sujata Bali has publised works on life skills in legal education and cyber crimes against women, and teaches various law courses.

UPES School of Computer Science offers a B.Tech in Computer Science & Engineering with a specialization in DevSecOps, launched in 2017 in collaboration with Xebia. The program provides comprehensive training in essential tools and skills, including CI/CD, containerization, and cloud technologies, ensuring students are industry-ready. Graduates can expect career opportunities with top companies like SAP, IBM, and Amazon, with an average salary of 8.72 LPA. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in high school, with selection based on UPESEAT, JEE Mains, or alternative credentials. The curriculum blends computer science fundamentals with specialized DevSecOps courses.

The B.Sc. in Chemistry program at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies provides a comprehensive understanding of chemistry principles, covering organic, inorganic, physical chemistry, polymer chemistry, and industrial chemistry. The four-year undergraduate program emphasizes hands-on laboratory experience, equipping graduates with practical skills for diverse careers, including research scientist, analytical chemist, and chemical engineer. The program prepares students for global opportunities and fosters a continuous learning mindset. UPES boasts strong placements and industry relationships, enhancing career prospects for graduates in dynamic scientific environments, making the B.Sc. in Chemistry a gateway to significant career paths.

Soumitra Bhattacharya is a notable faculty member at UPES, recognized for his literary work, "Soul Flight." This book chronicles Soumitra Bhattacharya's transformative journey over the past two decades, featuring a blend of external explorations and profound introspections. It showcases Soumitra Bhattacharya's experiences across India and the globe, highlighting breathtaking landscapes and diverse cultures. "Soul Flight" aims to provide readers with insights into Soumitra Bhattacharya's personal growth and reflections throughout his travels, enriching the understanding of his dynamic experiences.

Vijay Mahajan is the founder of PRADAN, an NGO that has improved livelihoods for over a million poor households since 1983. After leaving PRADAN, Vijay founded the Basix Social Enterprise Group in 1996, supporting over five million households through microfinance and livelihood services. Vijay is an alumnus of IIT Delhi, IIM Ahmedabad, and Princeton University. He has served on numerous policy committees and boards of NGOs. Recognized as an outstanding social entrepreneur, Vijay became the CEO of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation and Director of the Rajiv Gandhi Institute for Contemporary Studies in New Delhi in 2018.

Dr. Annapurna Boruah is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. She holds a PhD from M S University of Baroda, completing a post-doctoral fellowship at IIT Kharagpur. Dr. Boruah specializes in geosciences, energy exploration, and CCUS. With over ten years of academic and research experience, she has published extensively, including in Nature Publisher. She is engaged with the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas's "i-HAV" initiative, founded the start-up ENXARTH, and has received multiple awards. Dr. Boruah emphasizes research-based teaching, aiming to inspire students in petroleum engineering and earth sciences.

Sandeep Athavale is an Advisory Board Member at UPES and serves as Principal Scientist and Chief Mentor for the ION EduGame program at TCS Research. He leads the Purposeful Games lab, focusing on the application of games in education and healthcare. Sandeep holds a PhD in Educational Game Design from IIT Bombay and has been involved in game design, development, and education. He has numerous publications and patents, and has experience in innovation labs and IT management. Sandeep earned his Bachelor's in Electronics Engineering and Master's in Business Administration from Pune University.

Uday Bhaskar Sharma of UPES presented "A Frobenius-Type Formula for Compact Lie Groups" at the 'Groups and Representations' conference. The presentation explored a generalized formula for connected compact Lie groups, orthogonal groups, and FC groups, in collaboration with Dr. Shripad Garge from IIT Bombay. The topic falls within group theory, discussing the commutator map for finite groups and utilizing Frobenius' formula to compute cardinalities using irreducible character values. This contribution highlights UPES’s commitment to advancing mathematical research and scholarship in the field.

Ishanth Bansal, a third-year law student at UPES, founded two nonprofits: ‘Shuruwat Foundation Uttarakhand’ and ‘Youth Warriors’. Inspired by his community service aspirations and the challenges faced during the COVID-19 pandemic, Ishanth aims to create a fair society by uplifting underprivileged children and empowering youth to advocate for their rights. Ishanth's initiatives emphasize social responsibility and community engagement, with a dedicated team of UPES peers managing operations and fundraising efforts. Balancing academic pursuits in BBA LLB with governance, Ishanth demonstrates leadership and commitment to societal betterment through his nonprofit work.

Liberal arts education is becoming increasingly popular in India, emphasizing a broad, interdisciplinary curriculum across humanities and sciences. Top liberal arts courses include Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Liberal Arts, Bachelor of Social Sciences, and Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) in Liberal Arts, with various subjects and degrees. Graduates can pursue careers in education, media, public service, and research among others. Notable institutions include Ashoka University and FLAME University. Eligibility typically requires completion of 10+2. Course fees range from INR 50,000 to INR 8,00,000 annually, depending on the college.

Dr. Keshav Madhav is an Assistant Professor at UPES University in the School of Law, specializing in Constitutional Law and Family Law. Dr. Keshav Madhav holds a BBA LLB(Hons) from ICFAI University Dehradun, an LLM from Amity Institute of Advanced Legal Studies, and a Ph.D. from Radha Govind University. Dr. Keshav Madhav previously taught at Amity University and Starex University, covering subjects such as Constitutional Law and Indian Penal Code. Dr. Keshav Madhav has published articles in reputed journals and received an Academic Excellence Award for the LLM.

Project Raftaar is an initiative by UPES aimed at enhancing the personality development of students in eight government primary schools through sports and cultural activities. The program emphasizes the importance of extra-curricular activities in fostering discipline, concentration, and time management in children. An annual inter-school competition is a key feature of Project Raftaar, attracting over 300 participants and providing a competitive platform for students. This focus on holistic development is part of UPES's broader commitment to corporate social responsibility.

Dr. Utsab Debnath is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. Dr. Utsab Debnath has over 13 years of research experience and over six years of teaching experience. Dr. Utsab Debnath holds a Ph.D. in pharmaceutical chemistry and has expertise in medicinal chemistry, focusing on anti-infective and anti-cancer agents. Dr. Utsab Debnath received several prestigious awards including the National Postdoctoral Fellowship and Direct Senior Research Fellowship. Dr. Utsab Debnath engages students using a Constructivism framework in teaching pharmaceutical inorganic and organic chemistry, medicinal chemistry, and drug design. Contact: utsab.debnath@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Rajendra Awasthi is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, with over 18 years of professional experience. Dr. Awasthi holds a Ph.D. in Pharmaceutical Sciences and specializes in novel drug delivery systems. He has authored over 180 publications with an impact factor greater than 350 and holds multiple patents. Dr. Awasthi has supervised students at the Ph.D. and postgraduate levels and promotes an interactive learning environment. His research focuses on nanomedicine and pharmaceutical product development. He is recognized among the top 2% of scientists globally by Stanford University.

Dr. Sonal Gupta is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in energy markets, risk management, and sustainable development. Dr. Sonal Gupta's research focuses on data-driven methods to achieve net zero emissions and integrate electric vehicles into power systems. As a British Council Women in STEM fellow, Dr. Sonal Gupta has experience at Reliance Energy Trading Limited. Dr. Sonal Gupta emphasizes innovative teaching that incorporates digital tools, enlightening students on energy economics. Dr. Sonal Gupta has published in reputable journals and represented UPES internationally, promoting sustainable energy knowledge exchange. Contact Dr. Sonal Gupta at sgupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Snehlata Shrivastava is an Advisory Board Member at UPES and a retired Indian Administrative Service officer. She served as the first woman Secretary-General of Lok Sabha from 2017 to 2020, overseeing the administrative functions of the lower house of Parliament and engaging in international parliamentary diplomacy. With 35 years of government service, Snehlata Shrivastava held key positions in various ministries, including the Ministry of Home Affairs, Ministry of Finance, and Ministry of Law and Justice, retiring as the Secretary of the Department of Justice in 2017.

Alok Singh, Aman Bijalwan, Siddharth Dubey, and Krishna, students from UPES pursuing B.Tech. in Electronics & Computer Engineering and M.Tech. in Automation and Robotics, are developing an electric scooter project in the UPES Robotics lab. The electric scooter is designed as a plug-in chargeable mobile two-wheeler, aiming to reduce air pollution by using a 1000W hub motor instead of an engine. The scooter frame is designed for stability and durability, and it features easy battery replacement for maintenance. The project is mentored by Dr. Piyush Kuchhal.

Anushree Sah is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Computer Science, UPES. Anushree Sah holds a B.Tech in Computer Science, an M.Sc. in Web Technology, and a PhD in Computer Science Engineering. With over 16 years of IT and education experience, Anushree Sah has worked with prominent companies such as Oracle and Western Union. Anushree Sah specializes in Programming Languages, Web Technologies, and Cloud Computing and is dedicated to fostering student growth and independence in learning. Anushree Sah has authored several research papers and actively mentors students in their academic pursuits.

The UPES blog page on law highlights various facets of legal education and career opportunities for law students. Notable articles include career prospects following LL.M. in Criminal Law, the strategic benefits of Moot Court competitions, and insights on legal technology advancements such as AI and ML. It also covers experiences of UPES law students participating in international programs and showcases recent accolades achieved by UPES alumni in competitive exams. The page serves as a resource for current students, alumni, and prospective law students, emphasizing skills development and alternative law careers.

Puja Tiwari is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in behavioral finance, securities analysis, and portfolio management. Puja Tiwari's research focuses on the psychological factors influencing individual investors' decisions, examining personality traits, biases, gender, and financial literacy. Prior to UPES, Puja Tiwari was a research scholar at Banaras Hindu University. Puja Tiwari has received the UGC NET-JRF award and has published in peer-reviewed journals, presenting papers at national and international conferences. Puja Tiwari can be contacted at Puja.Tiwari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Harshit Mohan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES. He holds a B.Tech in Electrical Engineering from AMU and advanced degrees from IIT Roorkee. Dr. Mohan has authored over 20 articles, holds three patents, and received the DST Nidhi Prayas 2021 scheme with INR 1 million in funding. His research interests include Power Electronics, IoT, and Entrepreneurship. Dr. Mohan’s teaching philosophy focuses on problem-solving and real-world applications, and he teaches courses in Electrical Machines, Power Electronics, and MATLAB, among others.

The webpage provides details about the leadership at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), led by Chancellor Dr. Sunil Rai. UPES emphasizes personalized education, leadership development, and ethical training across diverse fields such as engineering, business, and law. The university aims to produce skilled professionals through collaboration with industries and research centers, enhancing placement outcomes. UPES is committed to transforming lives through innovative education and offers a supportive environment for critical thinking and practical application of learning. The leadership vision focuses on providing high-quality academic programs and fostering societal contributions through education.

Shivam Anand, a student of B.Des. Transportation Mobility Design at UPES, received the CII Design Excellence Award 2021 in the MOT-IoN category for an innovative mobility solution enhancing public transportation post-pandemic. Anand's project features the conceptual design of MOT-IoN Autonomous self-driven vehicles, which include a live environment reaction system for safer interactions with pedestrians. The vehicle's interior emphasizes human comfort and sustainability, utilizing materials like 80% ocean-reprocessed plastic and providing amenities such as regional temperature control, wireless charging, adjustable hand rests, and integrated medical emergency services.

UPES student Aditya Vats, a 19-year-old literary prodigy, received the Sahitya Vidhya Samman from Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami. Vats, an MBA Integrated student at UPES, has a diverse background as a writer, civil services aspirant, and social worker. His notable works include "The Garhwal Diaries," documenting Uttarakhand's history. Vats has won several awards, including the Spectrum India award for 'Budding Writer' and accolades at Model United Nations summits. He credits his great-grandfather for his writing inspiration, and engages in various extracurricular activities, including social initiatives and debates.

Ishika Punhani and Vinay K, students of B.Tech. in Computer Science with a specialization in Cyber Security & Forensics from UPES, secured an internship at IIRS, ISRO. During their internship, Ishika Punhani and Vinay K developed an innovative computational model named "Landscape Forensics," which utilizes machine intelligence to predict risks associated with disasters such as landslides, cloudbursts, floods, and forest fires. This initiative enhances disaster preparedness and represents a significant technological advancement in disaster risk management. Their mentor for this project was Saurabh Shanu, Assistant Professor-Selection Grade.

The UPES Editorial Team describes the vibrant Holi celebration at UPES, where students enthusiastically participated in festivities after a two-year hiatus. Holi, symbolizing the victory of good over evil, was marked by joyful gatherings, dancing, and playful color splashing on campus. Student Kartik Khanna appreciated the event's planning, while Jigyasa Pahwa reflected on the festival fostering unity and camaraderie among students. Rebecca Mishra highlighted that the celebratory atmosphere made students feel like a family away from home, with UPES ensuring a joyful and safe experience. Holi is celebrated with music, food, and colorful festivities at UPES.

Dr. Inder Singh is an Associate Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with over 20 years of experience in academia and industry. He specializes in Big Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and Natural Language Processing. Dr. Inder has published numerous research papers, supervised Ph.D. scholars, and mentored various projects. His teaching philosophy emphasizes experiential learning and student-centered approaches. Dr. Inder has received multiple awards for his contributions to research and teaching excellence. He teaches courses in Programming Languages and Analytics, contributing to student development and curriculum innovation. Contact: inder@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Shatrughan Yadav is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Management from the Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee. His research focuses on workforce diversity and diversity management. Dr. Shatrughan Yadav teaches Human Resource Management, Organizational Behavior, and related subjects. He has received the UGC-JRF for his doctoral research and an ICSSR travel grant for presenting at an international conference. Dr. Shatrughan Yadav has published multiple articles in reputable journals and attended significant academic conferences, enhancing his scholarly contributions to the field of management.

Nayantara Kotoky is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Computer Science, UPES, having joined in May 2023. Nayantara specializes in Machine Learning, focusing on its applications in Public Policy Making and Cognitive Neuroscience. Prior to UPES, Nayantara was a postdoctoral fellow at the Fraunhofer Institute in Stuttgart, Germany, and has taught various subjects in computer science. Nayantara’s research includes applying machine learning to public policies and addressing issues in neuroscience. Nayantara has received multiple scholarships and presented work at international conferences. Email contact: nayantara.kotoky@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The M.Sc. Mathematics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a two-year postgraduate course aimed at developing strong mathematical skills and problem-solving abilities. The curriculum emphasizes both pure and applied mathematics, preparing students for advanced studies and research opportunities. Key features include a research-focused dissertation, strong industry placement support, and exceptional faculty guidance. Graduates can pursue diverse careers as data scientists, financial analysts, and researchers, or further education through a PhD. The program fosters analytical thinking and prepares students for challenges in various industries, making it a valuable choice for aspiring mathematicians.

Dr. Rajeev Gupta is a distinguished professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in material science and nanotechnology. With 26 years of experience, Dr. Gupta has significantly contributed to research in polymer-based nanocomposite materials and has authored several books on topics like Nanoscience and Electronics Engineering. Dr. Gupta's teaching philosophy emphasizes a supportive environment and critical thinking, employing innovative teaching methods. Dr. Gupta has published over 40 research articles and supervised 10 Ph.D. students, earning recognition at national and international levels. Dr. Gupta can be contacted at rajeev@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES has partnered with JSW MG Motor India (MGI) to implement the MG Nurture Program, focusing on Connected, Autonomous, and Electric Vehicles (CAEV). This collaboration involves the UPES School of Advanced Engineering and MGI working together to enhance industry-relevant education. The partnership includes specialized training for UPES faculty at MGI centers, enabling them to deliver an elective program that boosts employability through additional skill training. The initiative aims to equip students with knowledge and skills essential for success in the evolving automotive industry and future career opportunities.

Dr. Akashdeep Bhardwaj is a Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, specializing in Cybersecurity and Digital Forensics. He holds a Post Doctorate from Majmaah University, Saudi Arabia, and a Ph.D. from UPES Dehradun. Dr. Akashdeep has 24 years of IT experience, having worked with companies like British Telecom and Fiserv. He teaches Cybersecurity courses and has published over 120 research papers. He is an Associate Editor for several journals and is involved in IoT security consulting. Dr. Akashdeep emphasizes an interactive learning environment to enhance students' practical skills in Cybersecurity.

The Department of Applied Sciences at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) focuses on equipping engineering students with essential Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics principles. Established in 2018, the department offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and Ph.D. programs, emphasizing research in diverse fields like material science and nanotechnology. Renowned faculty lead projects funded by national and international organizations, fostering industry-ready skills through state-of-the-art labs. The Department's mission centers on holistic training and innovation to prepare students for real-world challenges while promoting sustainable practices and lifelong learning.

Deepak Kumar Sharma serves as an Assistant Professor (SS) at the School of Computer Science, UPES, Dehradun, India. Deepak holds an M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering from Jaypee University and is pursuing a Ph.D. at UPES. Deepak's research interests include Blockchain, data mining and warehousing, data analytics, and information security, with four patents granted in these areas. Deepak has taught various computer science subjects, coordinated academic events, and conducted numerous workshops. Deepak also has experience as an Assistant Professor at Ganpat University and was recognized as a Gold Partner Faculty by Infosys Ltd.

B.Tech. student Siddhivinayak Dubey from UPES shared his experience landing a job at Microsoft with a 50 LPA package. The competitive environment during placements motivated Siddhivinayak to excel, aided by industry-aligned training at UPES. He emphasized the importance of practical learning and co-curricular activities, such as leading the Lazarus Performing Arts society, which developed his teamwork skills. Siddhivinayak highlighted that interviewers were interested in his extra-curricular experiences in addition to technical skills. He aims to enhance his tech knowledge and contribute positively to society through problem-solving.

The Student Affairs section at UPES outlines essential guidelines for maintaining discipline, including adhering to IT and social media policies, prohibitions on ragging, and a smart casual dress code. It emphasizes the importance of a safe environment, detailing grievance redressal mechanisms, anti-discrimination policies, and measures against sexual harassment. Student responsibilities include proper internet usage and care for university equipment. Violations of these policies can result in penalties. The webpage serves as a critical resource for current and prospective students regarding university conduct policies and support systems.

The MBA in Oil and Gas Management (Natural Gas & Trading) program at UPES School of Business integrates general management education with specialized knowledge in Oil and Gas Management. The curriculum covers vital subjects such as Natural Gas Business and Refining Management, taught by global instructors. Students gain hands-on experience through internships and industry projects, enhancing their employability in key roles like Energy Analyst and ESG specialist. Graduates enjoy strong placement rates with firms like ONGC and Exxon Mobil, earning initial salaries between INR 6-30 lakh. The program addresses industry's evolving needs, embedding IT skills and digital tools to prepare students for a gas-based economy.

Syed Sajid Hussain is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Computer Science, specializing in computer vision and deep learning with a focus on biomedical imaging, particularly MRI, USG, and echocardiography. His research involves developing software tools for radiologists to detect and classify brain tumors. Syed Hussain previously worked at MAILAB in South Korea and as a research fellow at ICMR. He teaches courses like Pattern Recognition and Deep Learning, utilizing an innovative teaching method that incorporates real data and problem-solving. Syed Hussain received the Best Coder award at MAILAB. Contact: syed.hussain@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Mr. Pankaj Badoni is an Associate Professor at UPES with over 10 years of experience in teaching, specializing in game development, augmented reality (AR), and virtual reality (VR). He focuses on outcome-based learning and has taught courses such as Computer Graphics and Game Programming. Pankaj has authored games and applications available on the Play Store and received notable awards like the Best Teacher Award in 2019 and 2020. He is currently involved in interdisciplinary projects and mentoring students, fostering their skills for personal and professional success. Contact Pankaj Badoni at pbadoni@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech. Aerospace Engineering program at UPES focuses on developing industry-ready professionals through comprehensive training in Avionics, Space Technology, and Defence Technology. The curriculum combines theoretical lectures with analytical skills necessary for spacecraft and satellite design. Courses include Orbital Mechanics, Aerodynamics, Flight Mechanics, and Propulsion. The program is delivered by experienced faculty and supported by a dedicated Research Centre equipped with advanced computational facilities. Admission typically requires eligibility criteria completion, and details on fees and selection are provided on the university's website.

UPES emphasizes academic excellence through a distinguished faculty with experience from top global institutions, including Oxford and Harvard. The university nurtures a strong research culture, producing significant publications and impactful contributions, with 42 faculty members recognized among the world's top 2% researchers. UPES integrates industry practices into education, particularly in law, enhancing students' practical skills. UPES's partnerships with prestigious organizations like CERN support innovative research initiatives. The university's scholarship output has increased over 370% since 2018, showcasing its commitment to research and teaching excellence.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) offers a comprehensive Master of Design (M.Des.) in Communication Design that prepares students to excel in visual storytelling and design. This multidisciplinary program covers advanced visual design techniques, user experience (UX) design, digital media, animation, and design thinking. Graduates can pursue careers as graphic designers, UX designers, art directors, or animators. The program emphasizes creativity and problem-solving, equipping students with in-demand skills needed across industries. Interested individuals are encouraged to contact UPES for more information about the program and how to apply.

The B.Tech in Civil Engineering with a specialization in Construction Management at UPES School of Advanced Engineering prepares students to manage construction projects effectively. The program focuses on project management, general management practices, and technology-related subjects, providing a comprehensive understanding of construction project handling. Graduates can expect career opportunities as Project Managers, Construction Managers, and more in various sectors. The curriculum emphasizes hands-on learning and industry-relevant skills, ensuring job readiness. With the rising demand for infrastructure and advanced construction technology, the program offers promising future prospects in sustainable and technologically advanced development.

Sanjiv Subba is a faculty member at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Ring Theory. His research focuses on semicommutative rings, ring endomorphisms, and the extension of domains using nilpotent elements. Sanjiv Subba is passionate about applying mathematical insights to coding theory and cryptography. He previously taught at Sikkim Government Science College and teaches courses such as Advanced Algebra and Discrete Mathematics at UPES. Sanjiv Subba advocates for a teaching philosophy that fosters curiosity and real-world problem-solving. He is NET qualified and actively engaged in scholarly publications and conferences. Contact Sanjiv Subba at sanjiv.subba@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Sudipa Nag is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES. She holds a Master's in Developmental Psychology from Gauhati University and a Ph.D. in Organizational Behavior from IIT Guwahati, focusing on influence strategies and gender differences. Dr. Sudipa Nag has extensive research experience in Organizational Behavior, Neuropsychology, and Positive Psychology. Previously, Dr. Sudipa Nag was a Research Assistant at IIM Ranchi, classifying human emotions using thermal imaging. Dr. Sudipa Nag teaches Applied Social Psychology and emphasizes student-centered, real-world learning. Dr. Sudipa Nag's work appears in journals such as IIMB Management Review.

Dr. Ranjit G. Gurav is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, recognized among the top 2% of global scientists in Biotechnology and Environmental Sciences. He specializes in bioenergy, biochar, biopolymers, biomass valorization, and water treatment, with research funded by notable institutions totaling 100K USD. Dr. Gurav has published 117 Scopus-indexed articles and holds multiple patents. His teaching philosophy focuses on interactive, collaborative learning, fostering diversity and real-world application. He has received prestigious awards and fellowships and actively collaborates with international institutions, enhancing research impact and student mentorship.

UPES offers a variety of minors for students in the School of Health Sciences and Technology. These minors aim to enhance soft skills and entrepreneurship through real-life business situations via case studies, club activities, and guest lectures from industry leaders. Available courses include B.Pharm., B.Sc., B.Tech., M.Sc., and PhD. Students can participate in exploratory courses through the School for Life to further develop their competencies. For additional information on eligibility, admissions, and to apply, interested individuals can contact UPES through various communication channels provided.

Deepasha Baral is recognized for her achievement as a member of the American Association of Petroleum Geologists (AAPG) Leadership Students, an elite group fostering leadership among geoscience students. The AAPG Leadership Chapter provides valuable professional development, networking, and practical experiences in petroleum and geosciences. Selection for AAPG Leadership is highly competitive, emphasizing academic performance, leadership potential, and commitment to geosciences. Being chosen indicates Deepasha Baral is among the top talents in her field, equipped with the skills necessary for success in petroleum geology.

UPES implements quality assurance systems to enhance students' learning experiences. The university collects feedback from alumni, faculty, students, and employers to improve teaching, learning, assessment, and support facilities. Participating in feedback helps UPES elevate its standards through constructive criticism. Stakeholders can submit feedback forms related to teaching, learning, and course structure via email to iqac@upes.ac.in. Resources available include feedback analysis reports and NPS student feedback reports from 2018-19. The webpage emphasizes the importance of active participation in surveys for continuous improvement.

Professor Vijaysekhar Chellaboina serves as the Professor and Dean of the School of Computer Science at UPES. He earned a B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Madras, an M.S. from the Florida Institute of Technology, and a Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering from Georgia Tech. His research includes stability theory and control systems, with publications exceeding a hundred journal articles and books. Previously, Vijay has held positions at multiple universities and is a recipient of the US NSF CAREER and TCS Distinguished Researcher awards. He emphasizes student-centric, project-based learning in his teaching philosophy.

UPES Editorial Team discusses the benefits of pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) degree. BBA is a flexible and comprehensive course that offers various specializations like finance, marketing, and entrepreneurship. It provides multiple career options across industries, including banking, retail, and IT, and serves as a foundation for further studies like MBA and CA. BBA is recognized for its affordability and high return on investment, as it enhances employability and entrepreneurial skills. The degree offers a competitive advantage in the job market and equips graduates with essential business acumen and opportunities for professional growth.

UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a three-year B.Sc. (Hons) in Applied Sciences and Geology, allowing students to customize specializations. The program follows a Choice Based Credit System, supporting students in Joint Admission Test preparation and industry placements. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in relevant subjects. Fees vary per semester, starting at ₹62,000. Graduates can pursue careers in healthcare, research, data analysis, and more, with UPES having a 99% placement record through partnerships with notable companies. The curriculum emphasizes practical experience, preparing students for various career paths and further studies.

Sandip Kumar Chaurasiya serves as an Associate Professor at UPES School of Computer Science with over 13 years of teaching experience. Chaurasiya specializes in wireless sensor networks, Internet-of-Things, and metaheuristic algorithms, having published numerous articles in international journals and authored books. With a teaching philosophy focused on project-based learning, Chaurasiya aims to foster creativity and lifelong learning among students. Chaurasiya teaches fundamental courses, including Discrete Mathematics and Compiler Design. Chaurasiya can be contacted via email at schaurasiya@ddn.upes.ac.in for further information.

The MBA in Logistics and Supply Chain Management (Business Process in Supply Chain) at UPES School of Business equips students with essential skills for management roles in logistics, e-commerce, manufacturing, and more. The program emphasizes practical learning through internships, live projects, and industry interaction. Specializations include Business Process Disruptions, TQM, and Six Sigma, expanding career avenues in supply chain roles such as supply planner and procurement manager. Students benefit from advanced facilities and can explore international opportunities through exchanges. Graduates have a promising job outlook, with competitive salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum.

UPES has developed Executive Education Programs to address the growing demand for leaders in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) roles. This initiative is part of the RISE Center, established in collaboration with Aspire Circle, aimed at preparing Chief Impact Officers, Chief Sustainability Officers, and other impact-focused leaders. The center will offer the ESG, Sustainability, and Impact Specialist Program (ISP), focusing on areas like Impact Finance and Corporate Governance. The ISP consists of 20 thematic sessions and is designed for mid to senior-level professionals in ESG roles. The first sessions are scheduled for September and November 2024.

UPES has introduced Srijan Social Internships for first-year students as part of the School for Life initiative. These internships, lasting 6-8 weeks, involve full-time work with social sector organizations to raise awareness of India's social issues and develop empathy and leadership skills. The Srijan model consists of a pre-internship course covering key development challenges, hands-on experience during the internship, and post-internship sharing of learnings with peers and faculty. This program aims to enhance classroom engagement and potentially lead students to careers in the social sector or social entrepreneurship.

The BBA in Aviation Management (Travel and Ground Handling Operations) at UPES provides a comprehensive education integrating business management principles with aviation industry knowledge. The program emphasizes leadership, practical exposure, and ethical standards while covering finance, marketing, operations, and human resources. Students specialize in airport and ground handling operations, preparing for careers in airlines, airports, and consulting. The curriculum includes internships, real-world projects, and industry insights. UPES graduates benefit from strong placement opportunities with major companies and can expect competitive salaries, making this program ideal for aspiring aviation management professionals.

Dr. Rupendra Kumar Pachauri from the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES participated in a research collaboration with the Asian Institute of Technology in Bangkok, Thailand, from July to September 2022. The focus of Dr. Pachauri's research was on "Networked DC Micro-grids: Transactive Energy System," which aims to connect decentralized energy sources to the power grid, enhancing efficiency and reducing reliance on fossil fuels. This work addresses issues of resilience during power outages and explores fair cost allocation within micro-grid models, ultimately contributing to the global reduction of carbon footprints and the integration of renewable energy sources.

The NIRF Ranking Report by UPES includes detailed rankings from 2017 to 2024 across various categories such as Engineering, Management, and Law. Each report provides specific data and download options for disciplines like overall performance, campus placement, and sponsored research details. UPES emphasizes academic excellence with its diverse programs, including B.Tech, MBA, and Ph.D. As an institution, UPES is committed to enhancing placements, entrepreneurship, and research capabilities through continuous improvement and strategic development. The reports are essential for prospective students seeking insights into UPES's academic standing and opportunities.

The MBA in Aviation Management (Aviation Enterprise Management) program at UPES School of Business is a two-year, full-time course focused on the aviation industry. The curriculum covers airline operations, airport management, aviation safety, and finance, emphasizing strategic planning and technological advancements. Key components include internships, live projects, and a dissertation. Graduates are prepared for management roles across sectors like airlines and airports, with opportunities in airline management, aviation consulting, and more. Recent placements include companies like GMR Group and Vistara Airlines, with starting salaries ranging from INR 6-10 lakh per annum. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in Class X, XII, and graduation.

UPES emphasizes adapting education to the rapid evolution of technology, integrating advancements like AI, virtual reality, and smart manufacturing into its curriculum. The institution offers specialized programs across various disciplines, including engineering, computer science, business, health sciences, and law, ensuring students are equipped with skills relevant to emerging industries. Collaborations with industry leaders like KPMG and GE Healthcare enhance learning in areas such as genomics and digital media. Through innovative projects and a focus on entrepreneurial mindset, UPES prepares students to meet future technological challenges and opportunities in a digital-first world.

The UPES webpage discusses the benefits of pursuing a B.Tech in Biotechnology, emphasizing the significant career potential in this rapidly advancing field. Biotechnology integrates various sciences to develop solutions for healthcare challenges, such as genetic testing, pharmaceuticals, and diagnostics. The COVID-19 pandemic has intensified the demand for biotechnology professionals. A B.Tech in Biotechnology from UPES equips students with essential knowledge in genomics and biosimilars. Career opportunities include roles as Biochemists, Biomedical Engineers, Clinical Technicians, and Medical Scientists. The program focuses on both theoretical concepts and practical applications in the biotechnology sector.

Nilav Mazumdar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with over 10 years of industry experience in creative communication, brand strategy, and advertising, having worked with notable brands like Mondelez, FICCI, and Tata Motors. He has over 5 years of teaching experience and focuses on areas such as rural communication, digital futures, and the interplay of music and visuals. Nilav Mazumdar's teaching philosophy emphasizes creating a comprehensive learning environment for personal growth and strategic thought. Courses taught include Advertising, Visual Communications, and Creative Writing. Contact: nmazumdar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Devaleena Kundu is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES. She completed her doctoral research in English Literature at The English and Foreign Languages University (EFLU), focusing on immortality, the undead, and cultural criminology. Devaleena received the Fulbright-Nehru Doctoral Research Fellowship in 2016 to study at the University of California, Berkeley. She teaches courses on Literature and Cultural Studies and emphasizes interdisciplinary learning. Her research interests include Death Studies, Gothic Horror, and Popular Culture, with publications on death, gender, and cultural representations. Devaleena Kundu can be reached at devaleena.kundu@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Prof. S. K. Khare is an Advisory Board Member at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES. He is an Institute Chair Professor of Biochemistry at IIT Delhi, with over 30 years of experience and 215+ research publications. Prof. Khare holds multiple positions in scientific advisory boards and editorial roles. He is recognized globally for his contributions to extremophiles and enzyme technology, receiving numerous awards, including IITD Basic Science Research Award. Prof. Khare is an elected fellow of several prestigious societies and currently serves as Vice-President of the Biotech Research Society of India.

Aditi Pateriya is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, with over 3.5 years of academic experience. Aditi Pateriya has qualified UGC-NET and is pursuing a Ph.D. focused on animal cruelty legislation in India. Aditi Pateriya holds a Post-graduate degree with Distinction in Constitutional and Administrative Law from NUALS, Kochi, and a B.A.L.L.B. (Hons.) from Nirma University. Aditi Pateriya’s research interests include Constitutional Law, Human Rights, and Animal Law. Aditi Pateriya has published papers in UGC-CARE listed journals and actively participates in various scholarly activities and faculty development programs.

Dr. Sanjeev Kumar serves as a Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 23 years of higher education experience. Dr. Sanjeev holds a Ph.D. from Jawaharlal Nehru University and degrees from Dayalbagh Educational Institute. Dr. Sanjeev's research focuses on Computational Neuroscience, Intelligent Computing, and Stochastic Modelling, contributing to over 40 publications and 7 patents. Dr. Sanjeev employs diverse teaching strategies to enhance student engagement and problem-solving skills, teaching courses such as Data Structures, Software Engineering, and Artificial Intelligence. Dr. Sanjeev has received multiple awards, including the C.V. Raman Award and recognition in the India Innovation Challenge.

The Master of Computer Applications (MCA) program at UPES offers advanced training in software development, programming, and IT. With a requirement of a minimum of 50% in prior academic qualifications, UPES employs a personal interview and CUET (PG) cut-off for selection. The fee structure totals approximately ₹1,20,000 per semester. The program equips graduates for careers in various sectors such as finance and healthcare, providing placement opportunities with leading companies and specialized courses like Artificial Intelligence and Cyber Security. UPES boasts a 94% placement rate and offers numerous scholarships and global study opportunities.

Swatanter Kumar is a notable advisory board member at UPES, having a distinguished career as a former Supreme Court Judge and the Chairperson of the National Green Tribunal. He served as Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court and is known for impactful rulings on environmental issues, including the Ganges and Yamuna cleaning efforts and oil spill cases. Swatanter Kumar established consultative processes for stakeholders in environmental justice and led significant conferences on the environment. His contributions have earned him 12 awards, demonstrating his influence in Indian law and environmental jurisprudence.

The MBA in Oil and Gas Management with a specialization in Petroleum Marketing and Business Development at UPES School of Business offers students a comprehensive education in general management and the oil and gas industry. The curriculum includes courses in refinery management, financial management, and marketing research, alongside practical experiences like internships and industry projects. This program prepares graduates for diverse career opportunities in consulting, energy analysis, and business development within the oil and gas sector. Graduates are highly sought after by major companies, with starting salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum.

The School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES focuses on preparing students for emerging healthcare roles in Biotechnology, Genomics, and Health Informatics. The curriculum incorporates industry insights, promoting research, patents, and international collaboration. UPES offers a range of programs including B.Sc., M.Sc., B.Pharm, and PhD, emphasizing project-based learning and interaction with industry experts. Admissions are open until August 31, 2024, with a commitment to 100% placements and strong industry ties. UPES ranks 1st among private universities in India for academic reputation and stands 46th overall in the NIRF 2024 rankings.

The MBA in Metaverse and Web 3.0 program at UPES focuses on equipping students with knowledge and practical skills related to the metaverse and its impact on industries. The curriculum includes hands-on learning through Meta labs, industry collaborations, and exposure to legal and ethical aspects of the metaverse. Graduates can pursue diverse careers such as Chief Metaverse Officer and Virtual Sales Specialist. The program addresses emerging technologies like Blockchain, AR, and VR, preparing students for robust opportunities in a rapidly growing job market projected to reach $800 billion by 2024, with major companies actively hiring.

The B.Tech. Applied Petroleum Engineering (Energy Systems and Storage) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering equips students for careers in the energy sector, focusing on petroleum engineering applications. The curriculum merges theoretical lectures with hands-on experience in areas such as reservoir engineering, drilling techniques, and sustainable energy practices. Graduates are prepared for roles like Reservoir Engineer or Production Engineer and can address modern energy challenges, including renewable technologies and energy storage.
