Industry collaborations enhance placement opportunities, reflecting UPES's commitment to producing skilled professionals for the evolving energy landscape.

The webpage by Dr. Ravi S. Iyer discusses the ethical dilemma surrounding ChatGPT, developed by OpenAI, designed to generate human-like text. Although ChatGPT enhances efficiency in tasks such as resume writing and debugging code, concerns arise about its reliance on internet-sourced information, leading to potential plagiarism and biases. A data breach and calls for regulation spotlight security issues. Experts caution against over-reliance on AI, noting risks to creativity, critical thinking, and academic integrity. The need for responsible technology use and potential regulation is emphasized in the evolving landscape of AI applications.

UPES provides a comprehensive guide for students interested in BCA (Bachelor in Computer Applications) and its various specialisations, essential in today’s tech-driven job market. The BCA program offers core teachings in computer fundamentals and multiple specialisations including Web Development, Mobile Application Development, Data Science, Cyber Security, Digital Marketing, Full Stack Development, AI & Machine Learning, Database Management, Multimedia & Animation, and Digital Forensics. Each specialisation focuses on specific skills relevant to industry demands, aiding graduates in securing positions in diverse sectors. Eligibility includes 50% marks in class XII with mathematics or computer science. Starting salaries for BCA graduates range between ₹3.55 LPA and ₹5 LPA.

Project Naman, initiated by UPES, honors the sacrifices of soldiers from the Kumaon and Garhwal Regiments by providing support to their bereaved families. The project offers financial assistance, funds the education of one martyr's child annually, aids job placement for dependents, and provides training for widows under the Shakti empowerment initiative. Additionally, UPES offers full higher education scholarships to five martyrs' children from Uttarakhand each year. This initiative is linked to the annual Shaheed Memorial T-20 Cricket Tournament, fostering community support and sponsorship by UPES and its employees.

Dr. Rahul Kumar is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, holding an M. Tech from the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay and a PhD from Jaypee University of Engineering & Technology. With 13 years of academic experience, Dr. Rahul Kumar specializes in particle engineering through crystallization and has published numerous papers and presented at various conferences. Dr. Rahul Kumar’s teaching philosophy emphasizes clarity in course objectives and involves practical projects for enhanced learning. Dr. Rahul Kumar has received research grants and collaborates on projects related to solubility and drug delivery systems.

Dr. Bhavana Gupta is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in material design for environmental and energy challenges. With a PhD from the Indian Institute of Technology, BHU in 2013, Dr. Bhavana Gupta has international research experience from institutes in Japan, Israel, France, Poland, and China. Her research interests include material synthesis, electrochemistry, energy storage, and soft robotics. Dr. Bhavana Gupta teaches physical chemistry and related courses, emphasizing student engagement and contemporary research. Dr. Bhavana Gupta has published over 60 articles and received several prestigious fellowships and awards.

Tulika Jesrani serves as the Director and General Counsel at Kimberly-Clark (India), where she is a member of the Country Leadership Team and the Board of Directors. With over 17 years of experience in diverse sectors including FMCG and Pharma, Tulika Jesrani previously held the position of Associate General Counsel at L’Oréal for India and Bangladesh. She has expertise in legal support, risk management, and intellectual property protection strategies, having also worked at Piramal Healthcare and various law firms. Tulika Jesrani has received multiple awards, including the “Women in Law Excellence” award in 2021 and emphasizes continuous learning and digital transformation in law.

The LL.B. (Hons.) 3-year program at UPES School of Law offers a comprehensive legal education designed to prepare students for a successful career in various legal professions. The curriculum includes subjects such as constitutional law, criminal law, corporate law, and international law, prioritizing experiential learning through moot courts, internships, and legal clinics. Graduates benefit from strong industry connections and a high placement rate of approximately 80%. Admission eligibility includes a minimum of 50% marks at the higher secondary level, with selection based on a personal interview and CUET cut-off. Scholarships are available for eligible candidates.

Dr. Rakesh K. Meet is an Associate Professor at the School of Business, UPES. With 28 years of experience, Dr. Rakesh has held leadership roles in various multinational companies, including Vodafone India. Dr. Rakesh possesses triple Master’s degrees and a Ph.D. in Management from UPES. Research interests include consumer technology adoption and sustainable marketing. Dr. Rakesh employs the Socratic method and project-based learning in teaching Marketing and General Management courses. Dr. Rakesh has received multiple awards in academia and industry. Contact Dr. Rakesh at rakeshk.meet@ddn.upes.ac.in for more information.

Dr. Neha Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, with extensive experience in the legal profession, including six years as a practicing lawyer before the Supreme Court of India and various judicial authorities. Dr. Neha Singh has served as a legal advisor for the National Highways Authority of India and other government bodies, focusing on land acquisition and corporate laws. Dr. Neha Singh holds an LL.M. in intellectual property laws and a Ph.D. from Manav Rachna University. Research interests include corporate laws, women's rights, and technology laws. Dr. Neha Singh authored multiple scholarly works and emphasizes a transformative teaching philosophy.

The B.Tech. Automotive Engineering (E-Mobility) program at UPES addresses the demand for sustainable transportation, focusing on electric vehicles. The curriculum covers electric mobility technologies, including energy storage and power electronics, with hands-on projects and internships to enhance practical skills. Graduates can pursue careers as electric vehicle design engineers, powertrain engineers, and more in the automotive and energy sectors. The program boasts strong industry connections for placements, supported by experienced faculty and state-of-the-art facilities. The rising demand for electric vehicles and advancements in battery technologies position this program favorably for future career prospects in the e-mobility sector.

UPES offers a two-year M.Tech program in various engineering disciplines, including Chemical Engineering, Petroleum Engineering, and Robotics Engineering. Eligibility requires a minimum of 60% marks in 10th and 12th grades and a relevant B.Tech or BE degree. The program features a mix of coursework and research, focusing on industry needs. Fees vary by specialization, with comprehensive placements and internship opportunities provided. The curriculum emphasizes practical skills through hands-on projects, modern facilities, and expert faculty from reputed institutions. Graduates have diverse career options across numerous engineering sectors. Admissions are open until August 31, 2024.

Dr. Ram Kunwer is an Assistant Professor-Selection Grade at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. Dr. Ram Kunwer completed a B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from Krishna Institute of Engineering and Technology (KIET) in 2010, an M.Tech in Industrial Tribology from Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi (IITD) in 2012, and a Ph.D. in Packed Bed Thermal Energy Storage System for Concentrated Solar Power Applications from UPES in 2022. Dr. Ram Kunwer's research interests include Thermal Energy Storage and Solar Thermal Systems. Dr. Ram Kunwer has published around 19 articles and holds three design patents. Contact Dr. Ram Kunwer at rkunwer@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage describes nine impactful engineering projects presented by students of the UPES School of Engineering. These projects address community needs in five adopted villages, focusing on drone technology, electric cycles, waste management, water security, first aid, fire safety, women's empowerment through cultivating medicinal plants, solar dryers, and alternative energy sources via biochar briquettes. Vice-Chancellor Dr. Sunil Rai and Dean Professor Gurvinder Singh Virk highlighted the significance of these initiatives for village development. The projects aim to enhance community welfare through innovative engineering solutions, showcasing UPES’s commitment to social responsibility.

Prof. Phani Tetali is a distinguished professor at the School of Design, UPES, with over 30 years of experience in animation, education, and cartooning. He holds a B.Tech. from IIT BHU and an M.Des. from IIT Bombay. Prof. Phani Tetali founded 'Animatix' and created India’s first Hindi cartoon series, 'Tara Ki Duniya.' He has held leadership roles in major animation studios in India and has taught various subjects related to animation and design at IDC School of Design, IIT Bombay. Prof. Phani Tetali is also on the Board of Studies for multiple esteemed universities in India.

Dr. Ranjan Mishra, a Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, has 25 years of experience in teaching, administration, and research. Dr. Ranjan Mishra holds graduation, post-graduation, and doctoral degrees from top universities. Dr. Ranjan Mishra has published two textbooks and over 50 research papers, mentoring two PhD scholars. Prior to UPES, Dr. Ranjan Mishra worked at several prominent institutions and led multiple academic initiatives. Dr. Ranjan Mishra specializes in communication technologies and aims to foster an engaging learning environment. Dr. Ranjan Mishra has received multiple awards for academic excellence. Contact Dr. Ranjan Mishra at rmishra@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The MBA in Operations Management program at UPES equips students with skills in areas like supply chain management, quality management, and project management over two years. The curriculum includes internships for real-world experience, enhancing career prospects in roles such as operations manager, supply chain manager, and business analyst. The program emphasizes practical learning through industry collaborations and case studies. Graduates benefit from increasing demand in fields like e-commerce and data analytics, with placement opportunities at leading companies and competitive starting salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks across academic levels.

Pushpendu Sinha, Rishabh Kinger, Siddharth Raj, Vivek Negi, and Varun Singh Kushwaha, students of B.Tech. in Applied Petroleum Engineering from UPES, conducted a project on Flex Fuel with Ethanol Blending. The project involved creating flex fuel by blending various proportions of ethanol with gasoline, resulting in four distinct grades: E10 (10% ethanol, 90% gasoline), E20 (20% ethanol, 80% gasoline), E30 (30% ethanol, 70% gasoline), and E40 (40% ethanol, 60% gasoline). This initiative aims to enhance fuel options and promote the use of renewable energy sources in transportation.

The B.Tech. Electrical Engineering in Microelectronics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering focuses on integrated circuit design and microelectronics, preparing students for careers in the evolving electronics industry. The curriculum emphasizes ASIC and CMOS technologies, VLSI design, and hands-on experience with FPGAs. Graduates will be ready for roles in semiconductor manufacturing, telecommunications, and embedded systems with companies like Intel and Qualcomm. The program ensures strong placements through industry connections and practical training. Eligibility requires 50% marks in X and XII, with selection based on competitive exams.

Ladenla Lama is an Assistant Professor at UPES School of Business, specializing in Development Economics and Industrial Economics. Her research focuses on Low Carbon Energy Industries in India, particularly Solar Photovoltaics and Wind Turbine Manufacturing. Before joining UPES, Ladenla Lama conducted doctoral research at the Centre of Development Studies, Trivandrum. She teaches courses in Microeconomics, International Business, Indian Economy, and Foreign Trade Policy. Ladenla Lama has received several awards, including the 2016 University Silver Medal and National Fellowship. Her scholarly work includes research on gender inequalities and the impact of government policies on socio-economic development. Contact information: ladenla.lama@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Himanshu Tolani is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, specializing in applied statistics with a focus on public health and social sciences. With a solid academic background, Dr. Himanshu is engaged in doctoral research that integrates statistical theory with practical applications. Dr. Himanshu has experience in various organizations, including ICMR and NITI Aayog, where Dr. Himanshu utilized advanced statistical techniques to improve healthcare outcomes. Dr. Himanshu’s teaching emphasizes active learning and critical thinking, offering courses in statistics and biostatistics aimed at enhancing decision-making in healthcare. Dr. Himanshu’s research interests include advanced statistical analysis and public health, with a commitment to contributing to evidence-based healthcare policy.

Mr. Suvojit Dhara is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at UPES, specializing in Data Science and multi-criteria decision-making. He holds a B.Sc. (Hons) in Mathematics from Jadavpur University and both M.Sc. and Ph.D. in Mathematics from IIT Kharagpur, where he received the Institute Silver Medal. Mr. Dhara has authored numerous publications in reputable journals and focuses on teaching Java Programming, Python Programming, and Database Management Systems. His teaching philosophy promotes critical thinking and practical applications, creating an engaging learning environment. He received the Prime Minister Research Fellowship during his doctoral studies.

Shreya Mahajan is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Law, UPES. Shreya Mahajan is a lawyer and public policy enthusiast with over 5 years of experience in various national institutions and governmental universities. Shreya Mahajan has held positions such as Examination Head and Research Coordinator. Research interests include criminal laws, family laws, and gender justice. Shreya Mahajan employs humor in teaching to foster critical thinking and creativity, focusing on Evidence laws, criminal laws, arbitration, IPR, and gender socio-legal aspects. Shreya Mahajan holds multiple distinctions and has received recommendations from esteemed institutions.

The Masters of Design (Product) program at UPES School of Design offers a comprehensive curriculum focusing on user research, product development, manufacturing processes, sustainability, and more. Students engage in collaborative projects with industries and organizations, gaining hands-on experience. The program features advanced facilities and partnerships with leading companies, enhancing learning and career prospects. Graduates can pursue roles such as Product Integration Planners, Product Designers, or Product Developers, with notable placement opportunities in prestigious firms. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in relevant academic qualifications, and selection involves performance in entrance exams and interviews.

The Ph.D. in Renewable Energy at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a comprehensive program focusing on renewable energy technologies, policies, and environmental impacts. Spanning 3 to 5 years, the program combines coursework, teaching assistantships, and original research, culminating in a dissertation. Candidates will study core areas such as solar, wind, bioenergy, and energy policy, supported by a stipend of up to ₹30,000. The program offers state-of-the-art facilities and mentorship from experienced faculty, preparing graduates for diverse career opportunities in academia, research, and the energy industry. Applications for July 2024 intake are open until June 3, 2024.

Miles Ronald Cole Hewstone is a Distinguished Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES. He has made significant contributions to social psychology, focusing on prejudice, stereotyping, and intergroup relations. A fellow of multiple prestigious societies, Professor Hewstone's career includes positions at the University of Bristol, Universität Mannheim, Cardiff University, the University of Oxford, and the University of Newcastle. His research interests include intergroup contact and conflict reduction. Professor Hewstone has received several prestigious awards, including the BPS President Medal and the Gordon Allport Intergroup Relations Prize for his impactful research and public policy contributions.

Dr. Suneet Kumar Gupta is a Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, holding a PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Dhanbad. With over 15 years of experience, Dr. Suneet Kumar Gupta specializes in healthcare solutions through deep learning, focusing on neural network compression and acceleration. He has hosted five international conferences and contributed to over 50, alongside completing funded projects in deep learning and IoT. Dr. Suneet Kumar Gupta promotes interactive learning, critical thinking, and problem-solving in the classroom. His research interests include applied deep learning, AI in healthcare, and wireless sensor networks.

Kirtika Puniani, Saumya Purohit, Shrestha Jaiswal, and Deepak Varshney, B.Tech. CSE students specializing in Cloud Computing and Virtualization Technology, developed CataComb, a secure cloud-based solution for sensitive data storage. The project addresses data privacy concerns by employing Cloud-Huffman coding for encryption, ensuring only the user can access their stored files, including documents, photos, and passwords. CataComb enhances data security through double authentication and modern encryption techniques, significantly reducing data breaches, and enabling users to securely access their data from anywhere, thereby providing peace of mind in a technology-driven world.

Ouroz Khan is an Assistant Professor for the Psychology and Behaviour program at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES. Ouroz Khan holds a degree in Psychology from the University of Allahabad and a postgraduate degree in cognitive science. Ouroz Khan is currently pursuing doctoral research at the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, focusing on human judgment and decision-making, particularly in loss aversion. Ouroz Khan has received multiple awards and grants, and has presented research at international conferences. Ouroz Khan emphasizes innovative learning, interdisciplinary collaboration, and holistic student development in teaching philosophy. Courses taught include Sports Psychology and Psychological Assessment.

Tejal and Jey Khopey, students from the School of Design at UPES, won the first prize in the Product Design Category for their innovative concept "BinPan" at Pune Design Festival 2022. The product, developed under the mentorship of Professor Manas Ranjan Mishra, is designed to efficiently clean small spaces while optimizing storage for cleaning equipment. "BinPan" offers a hands-free, user-friendly solution that simplifies the cleaning process and enhances user engagement, eliminating the need for multiple cleaning tools.

Five students from UPES School of Law achieved remarkable victories in the CCI-HNLU 13th Justice Hidayatullah National Moot Court Competition 2023 and the International Mediation Competition hosted by MediateGuru. Anshika Agrawal, Yashaswani Parashar, and Utsav Vats excelled in the national competition, while Raj Pipara and Vaishnavi Panyam triumphed internationally. The wins secured the students cash prizes, trophies, and paid internships with prestigious law firms. UPES provided comprehensive support, enhancing students’ confidence and skills, proving that dedication can lead to success, even competing against top law institutions.

Ali Imran Naqvi is an alumnus of UPES, graduating in 2007 with an MBA in Power Management. He is currently the Chief Executive Officer of Gensol Engineering Ltd. and has been honored as part of the SQ India 40 Under 40, recognizing his contributions as a leader in the Indian Solar Industry. This accolade highlights Ali Imran Naqvi's role as a pivotal figure in advancing solar energy initiatives in India, marking him as a significant innovator in a rapidly evolving sector.

Siddhant Agarwal is a Developer Relations Lead - APAC at Neo4j and a UPES alumnus, graduating in 2015 with a B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering, specializing in Oil & Gas Informatics. Siddhant Agarwal was a finalist at the CMX Community Industry Awards 2021, recognized for community building efforts in the categories of "Community Professional of the Year for a Developer Relations Community" and "Community Professional of the Year." As an impactful public speaker, Siddhant Agarwal has presented at over 2,000 forums, influencing over 500,000 students, developers, and individuals in his career.

Dr. Sudha Shashwati is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). A psychologist specializing in gender, culture, and mental health, Dr. Sudha has published her research in prestigious journals and presented at numerous conferences. With around 7 years of teaching experience at top institutions, Dr. Sudha focuses on curriculum innovation and qualitative research. Awards include university gold medals and a Junior Research Fellowship. Dr. Sudha is also a certified trauma therapist and sexuality educator, committed to holistic well-being and gender sensitization. Contact: sudha.sahoo@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Sustainable Development Goal 13: Climate Action focuses on urgent climate action to combat climate change. The goal includes strengthening resilience to climate hazards, integrating climate measures into policies, enhancing education on climate change, and mobilizing $100 billion annually for developing countries. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) promotes eco-friendly innovations through student-led initiatives like edible cutlery, tree plantation drives, and a pilot-scale integrated wastewater reclamation plant utilizing microalgae for sustainable resource use, significantly contributing to climate action strategies and environmental sustainability.

UPES is enhancing its Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiatives to address education, health, safety, and women's empowerment in Uttarakhand. Initiatives include establishing LearnShalas in government schools to improve learning environments, combating period poverty by providing menstrual cups to women, and implementing a Skill Development Program for support staff. UPES also promotes digital literacy through DigitalDhaam and facilitates community donations via DaanUtsav. These efforts aim to achieve greater social equity and support vulnerable communities by fostering sustainable development aligned with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

Silky Goel is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in Medical Imaging Analysis, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning. Silky Goel holds a B.Tech in Computer Science from Uttarakhand Technical University and an M.Tech in Computer Engineering from IIIT Bhubaneswar, and is currently pursuing a PhD at UPES. With over 7 years of experience, Silky Goel teaches courses such as Data Structures and Computer Organization, and actively mentors projects submitted to conferences. Silky Goel has authored various research publications in computer vision and image processing. Contact Silky Goel at sgoel@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech. Biomedical Engineering (Biomaterials) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology focuses on the study, development, and application of innovative materials for medical and technological advancements. The curriculum blends chemistry, physics, and engineering, preparing students for careers in healthcare, research, and materials manufacturing. Collaborations with GE Healthcare provide real-world experience and enhance problem-solving skills. Graduates can pursue careers in medical device development, pharmaceuticals, or academia, with high demand for expertise in biodegradable materials, smart biomaterials, and 3D bioprinting. The program ensures quality education benchmarked against leading universities.

UPES has partnered with NSE Academy Limited to introduce the NSE SMART Fin Lab, which offers finance students practical learning experiences in investing and trading. Within the UPES MBA and BBA programs, students will gain hands-on practice in a simulated equity and derivatives market. The collaboration includes short-term and long-term programs focusing on financial technology, blockchain management, data science, machine learning, and more, aimed at enhancing skills in the finance and technology sectors. All programs will be delivered in offline mode, providing students with valuable industry-relevant knowledge.

The Ph.D. in Chemistry program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a comprehensive 3-4 year doctoral degree focusing on advanced scientific understanding. It includes coursework, research adviser selection, and a significant dissertation. Students engage in diverse chemistry disciplines and develop critical thinking and research skills, preparing for various careers in academia and industry. Graduates are equipped for roles in chemical research centers, pharmaceuticals, and more. Admission details for the July 2024 intake include important dates and requirements, emphasizing UPES's commitment to academic excellence and industry connections.

Dr. Balwinder Singh is an Associate Professor at the School of Law at UPES, with over 11 years of teaching and research experience. Dr. Balwinder Singh actively publishes work on contemporary legal issues, focusing on personal laws, constitutional law, and human rights. Dr. Balwinder Singh has authored notable books on various legal topics and teaches courses including Family Laws and Constitutional Law. Dr. Balwinder Singh has received several awards for contributions to legal research and has been involved with NGOs supporting women's and children's welfare. Contact Dr. Balwinder Singh via email at balwinder.singh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Ratnesh K Pandey, Assistant Professor-Selection Grade at UPES, has received a 34 lakh grant from the Board of Research in Nuclear Sciences (BRNS) to investigate radiation damage in materials for fusion reactors over three years. This research aims to address challenges in developing materials capable of enduring extreme conditions in fusion reactors, focusing on the behavior of materials under radiation. The study will enhance understanding of radiation damage and inform the development of resilient materials, contributing to advanced fusion energy technologies and supporting the transition to sustainable energy solutions.

Project Vikalp, initiated by UPES in 2015, focuses on empowering rural women from nearby villages through various initiatives. The project promotes the production of recycled paper products, ICT-assisted art and craft design, and cultivates medicinal and aromatic plants. Women entrepreneurs receive guidance from UPES experts to market their products, further fostering economic independence and skill development within the community. This Corporate Social Responsibility effort highlights UPES's commitment to social impact and sustainable development in the region.

Babita Kotakki, a student from the School of Health Sciences & Technology at UPES, received a Certificate of Distinction in the Green Olympiad for Youth. This award highlights Babita Kotakki's exceptional contributions to environmental awareness and education, showcasing her commitment to sustainability. Babita Kotakki's achievement emphasizes her dedication to environmental conservation and active promotion of eco-friendly practices. As a participant in this esteemed competition, Babita Kotakki stands out as a promising advocate for environmental stewardship, inspiring peers to engage in protecting the planet for future generations.

Navin Pal Singh is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Law, UPES, Dehradun, with a focus on Constitutional law, Criminal law, Election laws, and Procedural laws. With approximately 8.5 years of experience in academia and litigation, Navin has appeared before the Supreme Court and High Court of Delhi. Navin holds an LL.B, LL.M (NET), and is pursuing a Ph.D. Navin teaches core law subjects and has published numerous research papers in reputable journals. Navin's teaching philosophy emphasizes critical thinking and raising awareness of legal rights and responsibilities among students. Contact: npsingh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES Design blog highlights the importance of neurodiversity and inclusion in the workplace, addressing conditions like Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and ADHD. Featured articles cover various design career paths, including product design and fashion styling, and provide insights on the Master of Design (M.Des.) and Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) programs. Recent posts discuss sustainable fashion, the intersection of design and innovation, and successful product design characteristics. The blog emphasizes the creative potential in design education and its relevance in rapidly evolving industries, showcasing achievements of UPES design students and their global opportunities.

Dr. Meenakshi Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with a Doctorate in Management, an MBA in Marketing, and a Master’s in Economics. Dr. Meenakshi Sharma possesses 15 years of academic experience and 6 years in the industry. Research interests include Consumer Behavior, Digital Marketing, and E-learning. Dr. Meenakshi Sharma has taught at various institutions and coordinated multiple academic activities. Courses offered by Dr. Meenakshi Sharma include Marketing Management, Consumer Behavior, and Market Research. Dr. Meenakshi Sharma's email is m.sharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Snigdha Paul, a research scholar in Food Science and Nutrition at UPES, achieved first prize in the International Young Researchers' Conclave held by R&D, CIDRI, and UPES Dehradun on January 19-20, 2023. Snigdha Paul presented a research poster titled "A Novel Vitamin D and calcium-fortified geriatric Food." The Conclave showcased innovations from young researchers globally, aiming to inspire innovative thinking and promote Sustainable Development Goals. Key themes included Healthcare and AI, Energy and Environment, Advanced Materials, and Machine Learning, fostering dialogue between industry experts and participants.

The BBA LL.B. (Hons.) program at UPES is a 5-year integrated course combining Business Administration and Law, designed to equip students with critical skills for diverse careers in legal and business sectors. Candidates require a minimum of 50% marks in class X and XII for eligibility. Admission is through ULSAT or merit from other recognized tests. The course offers ten specializations. The total fee ranges from ₹1,74,000 to ₹2,31,928 over ten semesters. UPES School of Law boasts a 80% placement record and partnerships with global institutions, providing students with valuable international exposure and opportunities.

The UPES Sample Papers webpage provides access to sample papers for various courses including B.Tech, Law, B.Pharma, B.Des, and M.Des. The page serves as a resource for aspiring students to prepare for examinations across different academic programs offered by UPES. It ensures that prospective applicants can familiarize themselves with the format and content of these courses' assessments. The webpage emphasizes the importance of these resources for students in enhancing their learning and preparation strategies for university-level examinations. Furthermore, contact details and support options are available for prospective students.

Smriti Arora is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, Dehradun. She is a microbiologist and biotechnologist specializing in bacterial genetics and viral disease enhancement using flaviviruses like Zika and Dengue. Smriti received a PhD from the Indian Institute of Science and has experience in industry and academia, having worked at Dubiotech and CSIR-IGIB. Her research interests include antimicrobial resistance, microplastic pollution, and COVID-19 epidemiology. She actively engages students through innovative teaching methods and has received multiple awards, including the Best Review Award from FEMS Microbiology Society in 2022. Contact Smriti at smriti.arora@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Sarthak Patel, a Ph.D. scholar from UPES School of Design, achieved third place at the International Conference HWWE 2023 for his innovative SEED-funded project aimed at transforming agriculture in Uttarakhand's mountainous regions. Guided by mentors Dr. Samrat Dev and Rakesh Sah, Sarthak developed a lightweight, cost-effective soil tiller tailored for mountain farming, which promises to empower local farmers and enhance sustainable agricultural practices. This accomplishment highlights Sarthak Patel's commitment to impactful research and his potential to contribute to the agricultural industry in India.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) blog highlights the collaboration between UPES and KPMG in India, focusing on developing industry-ready management professionals through MBA programs in Strategy and Consulting and Business Analytics. The blog features various topics related to business education, including the relevance of networking during studies, career opportunities post-B.Com. in Banking and Insurance, and the future of Human Resource Management amid technological advancements. It serves as a resource for students, detailing programs, placements, and the vibrant campus life at UPES, emphasizing the integration of real-world learning with academic excellence.

Monika Manglik is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with 9 years of teaching experience. Dr. Manglik specializes in reliability theory and has published research in international and national journals. She focuses on reliability analysis of complex systems, such as hydroelectric power plants and electric vehicles. Dr. Manglik's teaching philosophy emphasizes a positive, inclusive learning environment, encouraging student participation and collaborative learning. She teaches various mathematics courses and has also guided students in research projects. For inquiries, Dr. Manglik can be contacted via email at mmanglik@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Amritansh Bhanot is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. He holds a doctoral degree from BITS, Pilani, and a master’s in Pharmaceutical Chemistry from Punjabi University. Dr. Amritansh Bhanot's research focuses on Medicinal Chemistry, Drug Discovery, and diseases including Cancer and Tuberculosis. Prior to UPES, he served as an Assistant Professor at Lovely Professional University and Himalayan Institute of Pharmacy. Dr. Amritansh Bhanot teaches courses such as Pharmaceutical Chemistry and Pharmaceutical Analysis, and is involved in a Rice Fortification Project funded by the World Food Programme.

The webpage by UPES Editorial Team outlines various career options available after earning a BA in English. Graduates can pursue careers in content writing, editing, teaching, digital marketing, and translation. Key points include the importance of strong writing skills, attention to detail, creativity in storytelling, and the ability to inspire others. The article emphasizes that an English degree opens doors to diverse fields, enabling graduates to engage audiences through compelling narratives and contribute meaningfully across multiple industries. The conclusion encourages graduates to embrace their skills and explore the myriad of professional paths available to them.

Harsiman Jit Singh, a student from the School of Computer Science at UPES, has achieved significant recognition through the attainment of 2 patents and the publication of influential international research papers. Notable works include "A Novel Multivariate Recurrent Neural Network-based Analysis Model for Predicting Stock Prices," presented at CISCT, showcasing advanced RNN architectures with an accuracy of 88.91%. Another paper addresses healthcare data security, proposing a machine learning framework for protecting Electronic Health Records. Harsiman's contributions demonstrate expertise in computational technologies with practical implications in finance and cybersecurity.

The LL.M. in Intellectual Property Rights program at UPES provides advanced knowledge of copyright, trademarks, patents, and trade secrets. The curriculum prepares graduates for diverse roles, including IP attorneys and consultants, capitalizing on increasing industry demand due to technological advancements and globalization. The program emphasizes practical skills, with expert faculty and opportunities for internships through UPES's strong corporate ties. Graduates can secure positions in law firms, corporations, and government bodies. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in relevant education, with selection based on ULSAT-LLM, CLAT-PG, or CUET performance.

UPESMET 2024 provides information on MBA admissions for the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Candidates must have a minimum of 50% marks in Class X, XII, and graduation from a recognized university. Admission is based on the UPES Management Entrance Test or national level exams followed by a personal interview. The online test lasts 2 hours, covering General English, Quantitative, General Awareness, and Analytical Reasoning with a total of 140 questions. Interested candidates can apply online and are advised to take a demo test for practice. For queries, applicants can contact UPES through provided helplines and email.

The B.Tech Computer Science Engineering (CSE) program at UPES is a four-year course focusing on specializations like Cloud Computing, Artificial Intelligence, and Cyber Security. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII with relevant subjects. Admission pathways include UPESEAT and other entrance exams. The fee structure varies by semester, totaling approximately ₹2,71,744 for the final semester. The program combines theoretical knowledge with practical training and internships, enhancing employability. Notable placement assistance helps graduates secure roles with top MNCs, with packages reaching up to ₹50 LPA.

The Integrated B.Com (Hons) - MBA in E-Commerce program at UPES offers a dual degree that equips students with knowledge in digital marketing, online business strategies, and technology integration. The curriculum includes subjects such as e-commerce security, supply chain management, and data analytics, emphasizing practical experience through internships and live projects. Graduates are prepared for careers in e-commerce management, digital marketing, and entrepreneurial ventures, with strong placement opportunities at companies like Amazon and Infosys. The program highlights future trends in e-commerce, including AI, M-commerce, and sustainable practices, ensuring graduates are competitive in the evolving job market.

The BA (Hons.) in History program at UPES explores the History of Modern South Asia and Global History, focusing on areas like Global Intellectual History and Indian Political Thought. This four-year research honors program emphasizes empirical research, prepares students for diverse roles including civil services, and offers opportunities for international exchange. With a distinguished faculty and unique resources such as the Archival Ideation Lab, students receive hands-on training in archival research and access to rare documents. Graduates are equipped for careers in academia, journalism, public policy, museum work, and international organizations. Admission requires 50% in 10th and 12th grades.

The blog post by the UPES Editorial Team discusses career opportunities available after obtaining a Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) in Aviation Management. This degree equips students with business acumen and specialized knowledge in aviation operations, airport management, and airline marketing. UPES offers two specializations: Aviation Services Operations and Travel and Ground Handling Operations. The aviation sector is expected to experience significant growth, increasing demand for professionals in airline management, airport operations, aviation safety, consulting, and air cargo logistics. Graduates also develop essential skills in leadership, communication, and technical proficiency.

Prof. Rahul Nainwal is the Director of the School of Business at UPES, bringing over twenty years of expertise as an entrepreneur and design thinker. He holds a B.Tech from NIT Rourkela and an MBA from IRMA, along with advanced qualifications in Design Thinking, Strategic Management from Harvard, and International Relations from Oxford. Prof. Rahul co-founded iVolunteer and has been instrumental in initiatives like the India Fellow Social Leadership program and CashRelief.org, focusing on social innovation and financial inclusion. Recognized as a TED Fellow and Ashoka Associate Fellow, Prof. Rahul's research interests include cash transfers and entrepreneurship.

Dr. Hardik Daga is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. He holds degrees from National Law Universities and specializes in International Trade Law, with a Ph.D. focusing on this area. Dr. Daga has published research in recognized journals and presented at the WTO and WIPO in Geneva. His teaching experience includes roles at JNVU Jodhpur and IMS Unison Dehradun. He employs a Flipped Classroom technique in teaching courses like Law of Contract and Environmental Law. Dr. Daga is also interested in the intersection of trade, investment, Intellectual Property Rights, Human Rights, and Environmental Law.

The webpage from UPES details the minors available within the School of Business, including specializations in Artificial Intelligence, Digital Marketing, Digital Transformation, Start Your Start-up, Business Analytics, Financial Analysis and Services, Family Business and Entrepreneurship, International Business, and Operations/Project Management. Each minor covers essential topics, equipping students with skills in areas such as data management, digital business strategies, marketing analytics, financial services, and operational efficiency. The program aims to enhance students' career prospects by providing practical learning experiences and knowledge relevant to current industry demands.

Dr. Neeraj Chugh is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from UTU. He has over 20 years of experience in academia, previously working at ICFAI University and MIT Rishikesh. Dr. Chugh's research interests include machine learning, ad hoc networks, and IoT, with publications in SCI and Scopus-indexed journals. He emphasizes project-based learning and teaches various programming languages and core subjects. Dr. Chugh actively mentors students in research and participates in academic conferences. Contact email: nchugh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES School of Design offers minors that complement core design specializations, including Service Design, Psychology, Film & Video Communication, Social Impact Design, Robotics, Accessory Design, Exhibition Design, Immersive Media Design, and Artificial Intelligence. Each minor focuses on unique skills and knowledge areas, such as user experience in service design, human behavior in psychology, filmmaking techniques, design for societal impact, robotics principles, accessory development, spatial storytelling, immersive technologies, and AI applications. These programs enhance students' learning and prepare them for diverse creative and technological challenges in the design field.

Avita Katal is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in the School of Computer Science. With a Master of Technology and Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science and over ten years of experience, she holds a Post Graduate Certificate in Academic Practice. Avita specializes in Cloud Computing and has research interests in energy efficiency and curriculum development. Avita is recognized for exceptional teaching with multiple Academic Excellence Awards and has published extensively, contributing significantly to the fields of cloud computing and education. Avita Katal emphasizes a student-centered teaching philosophy, fostering critical thinking and practical applications.

The B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a comprehensive curriculum designed to equip students with essential skills in machinery, systems, and processes related to various industries. The program includes hands-on training in mechanics, thermodynamics, and advanced topics like nanotechnology and robotics. Specializations in Energy Systems, Automotive, Aerospace Engineering, Mechatronics, and Defence Technology are available. Graduates have a strong placement record, with opportunities in companies like Maruti, Siemens, and Cognizant. The program emphasizes innovation, interdisciplinary skills, and has a 100% placement rate, ensuring students’ relevance in a competitive job market.

Sachi Choudhary serves as an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 10 years of teaching, mentoring, and research experience. Her expertise includes Core Computer Science, Image Processing, Machine Vision, and innovative waste management solutions. Sachi Choudhary promotes interactive and hands-on learning, emphasizing practical applications of engineering concepts. She teaches programming languages, data structures, and artificial intelligence, among others. Sachi Choudhary holds a patent and multiple design registrations, and has published numerous research papers in recognized journals, showcasing her commitment to advancing knowledge in her field. Contact Sachi Choudhary at scshukla@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Rakesh Ahirwar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design at UPES, with a Master of Design degree from IIT Delhi. Rakesh has experience as a Senior UX Consultant and Lead UI/UX Researcher, focusing on user research and interactive user interfaces. Rakesh has held roles at Soft Computing Pvt. Ltd, ImaginXP, and Chitkara University, where Rakesh mentored students and led design initiatives. Rakesh’s research interests include wearable devices and apparel design. Rakesh emphasizes student-centered learning and practical applications in teaching and offers courses on design for multimodal systems and prototyping user interfaces.

Gunjan Kumari is an Assistant Professor in Economics at UPES, Dehradun, with a Master's and Bachelor's from Banaras Hindu University. Gunjan Kumari qualified for the Junior Research Fellowship in 2017 and is pursuing a doctoral degree in Economics at IIT Bombay, focusing on labour, agricultural, and development economics. Gunjan Kumari aims to create an engaging learning atmosphere and teaches Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, and Financial Econometrics. Gunjan Kumari's research interests include agricultural household strategies for mitigating shocks and the impact of labour allocation on income risks, with presentations at various conferences. Contact Gunjan Kumari at gunjan.kumari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Integrated B.Com. (Hons.) - MBA in Banking and Insurance program at UPES combines undergraduate and postgraduate studies, focusing on business management, banking, and insurance. Key subjects include accounting, finance, risk management, and regulatory frameworks. The program emphasizes soft skills, practical experience through internships, and industry exposure. Graduates acquire competencies for diverse roles such as banking managers and risk analysts. The program prepares students for industry demands amidst digital transformation and evolving regulatory landscapes, with increasing opportunities in areas like fintech and sustainable finance. UPES offers career guidance and strong placement support, with notable employers actively recruiting graduates.

Dr. Sambhavi Shukla is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at UPES, holding a Ph.D. in Computational Electromagnetics from Birla Institute of Technology, Pilani. She has over three years of teaching experience and has published extensively, with 10 SCIE-indexed papers and multiple conference presentations. Her research focuses on the Internet of Things (IoT), photonics, and biosensors. Dr. Sambhavi advocates for practical application in teaching, covering courses like Python Programming and Digital Electronics. She has received several awards for her research and has a keen interest in integrating AI with IoT. Dr. Sambhavi can be contacted at sambhavi.shukla@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The MBA in Business Analytics with a specialization in Cognitive Analytics at UPES School of Business, in collaboration with KPMG, provides students with essential skills in data visualization, natural language processing (NLP), and cognitive analytics. The program focuses on practical applications and real-world experience through internships and projects. Graduates are prepared for various roles, including Cognitive Analytics Consultant and Data Visualization Expert. Admissions require a minimum of 50% marks in Class X, XII, and Graduation from any recognized university. Selection is based on UPESMET or national level exam performance, followed by a personal interview.

Arunima Vashisht, a B.Des. student specializing in Interior & Retail Space Design at UPES, completed a notable project titled "Work from Home Space POD." This project addresses the needs of remote workers in tier 1 and tier 2 cities, creating a versatile space that caters to work, personal, and wellness requirements. Targeted at individuals from teenagers to middle-aged professionals, the design repurposes office pods to enhance post-Covid safety while adapting to changing workplace norms. The project emerged in response to challenges related to privacy and focus in remote work, highlighting the demand for dedicated personal spaces.

Dr. Kaustav Padmapati, an esteemed faculty member of the School of Liberal Studies at UPES, received the prestigious Cross-Cultural Fellowship 2023 from the Institut für Auslandsbeziehungen (IFA) in Germany. This fellowship supports professionals and volunteers from various countries. Dr. Kaustav will serve as a visiting CCP Fellow at Humboldt University of Berlin, focusing on Gender and Media Studies for South Asia from May 22, 2023, to August 12, 2023. During this period, Dr. Kaustav will conduct research, participate in academic activities, and attend workshops related to gender and media.

The B.Tech Biotechnology (Genomics & Biosimilars) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology equips students with expertise in genomics and biosimilar development. The curriculum includes electives focusing on gene expression, genome editing, tissue engineering, and analytical techniques. Students access advanced laboratory facilities and collaborative work environments. The program prepares graduates for careers in biotech and pharmaceutical sectors, emphasizing industry relevance and high placement rates. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in X and XII with relevant subjects. Admission is based on performance in UPESEAT, JEE Mains, or equivalent assessments.

The BA/BBA/B.Com. LLB Hons. in Banking and Insolvency Laws at UPES School of Law provides a comprehensive curriculum covering banking laws, insolvency laws, debt recovery, consumer protection, and international banking regulations. It emphasizes practical skills through case studies and internships, ensuring graduates are prepared for roles in banking and financial institutions, corporate law, and government roles. With a strong focus on emerging trends like fintech and the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, the program offers excellent career prospects in a dynamic legal landscape. Minimum eligibility includes 50% marks at higher secondary levels and selection via standardized tests.

Bharti Goyal Maan is the Vice President of SAP Business & COE at Capgemini, where Bharti drives growth and customer success. With over 22 years of experience, Bharti has worked with industry giants like SAP and IBM. An INSEAD alumnus, Bharti is passionate about technology, sustainability, and empowering girls through initiatives like Sri Vidya Scholarships. Bharti enjoys outdoor activities, reading, and Bollywood cinema. Bharti actively participates in various industry groups and runs carbon removal initiatives, emphasizing the potential of technology in creating a sustainable future.

Dr. Samar Layek is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in materials science under extreme conditions. With an M.Sc. and Ph.D. from IIT Kanpur, Dr. Layek has extensive research experience, including work at Tel-Aviv University and the University of Cambridge. His research focuses on quantum materials, magnetism, and superconductivity. Dr. Layek promotes active learning in his teaching, offering courses in physics and condensed matter. He has received multiple awards, international fellowships, and has published 45 research articles in SCI-indexed journals. Dr. Layek also supervises research scholars at UPES.

Dr. Saswati Datta is an Assistant Professor and prominent researcher in Geotechnical Engineering at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. She earned her BE from IIEST and MTech and PhD from IIT Kharagpur. With over 15 years in academia, Dr. Datta leads programs and coordinates MTech, focusing on sustainable geotechnical solutions and innovations. She holds multiple patents and has received various awards, including the Icon of India Award-2023. Dr. Datta teaches a range of courses and actively mentors students, contributing significantly to interdisciplinary research and professional societies. Her contact is saswati.datta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Charusheel Tripathi is an Assistant Professor in the School for Liberal Studies at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), specializing in Political Science. Dr. Charusheel holds a Bachelor's degree in Political Science from Lady Shri Ram College, and completed her Master's, M.Phil, and Ph.D. at Jawaharlal Nehru University. With experience at Amity University and Sri Aurobindo College, Dr. Charusheel's research interests include Political Theory, Public Policy, and Governance. Dr. Charusheel emphasizes critical reasoning and experiential learning in teaching. Dr. Charusheel received Junior and Senior Research Fellowships between 2017-2022. Contact: charusheel.tripathi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Rahul Kumar Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over nine years of academic experience, including five years of teaching excellence. Rahul Kumar Singh specializes in Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis, and Data Analytics, having authored around 35 research papers in recognized journals. Rahul Kumar Singh emphasizes outcome-based learning and active student engagement in teaching. Courses taught include Machine Learning and Neural Networks. Rahul Kumar Singh has received multiple awards for outstanding contributions and is also involved in extensive scholarly activities, significantly impacting the academic community. Contact Rahul Kumar Singh at rk.singh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The "Summerise: Rise Up! Create Your Own Art!" workshops at the School of Design at UPES feature a series of eight engaging sessions aimed at students in grades 10-12. Each workshop, including screen printing, stop-motion animation, and upcycling, offers hands-on experiences guided by expert faculty. Fees are ₹11,000 (₹7,000 for UPES affiliates). Participants will gain practical skills and creative insights, culminating in project presentations. Workshops start June 10-14, 2024, with materials provided; participants should bring specific items as noted. Email summerise@ddn.upes.ac.in for inquiries.

DA Siddharth is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Design, specializing in Automotive and Product Design. Siddharth holds degrees in Automotive Engineering and Transportation Design from IED, Italy, and has five years of industry experience working with major clients like Tata Motors and Hyundai Motors. With six years in academia, Siddharth emphasizes teaching foundational concepts and creative ideation. Research interests include Form Development and Design Pedagogy. Courses taught by Siddharth include Traditional and Digital Sketching, Blender, and Design History. For inquiries, Siddharth can be contacted at dasiddharth@ddn.upes.ac.in.

India HCI 2023 is a premier Human-Computer Interaction conference hosted by the School of Design at UPES Dehradun from November 23-25, 2023. Celebrating 14 years, the event promotes advancements in HCI on a global scale, featuring high publication standards through ACM and SCOPUS. The conference included panel discussions, keynote sessions, workshops, and tracks on Arts and Start-Ups. The theme focused on “HCI for Enabling Creativity,” encouraging bold research presentations. Attendees included notable experts and provided a platform for knowledge sharing across disciplines, significantly impacting the HCI research community in India.

Dr. Ved Prakash Bhardwaj is an Associate Professor at UPES Dehradun's School of Computer Science. He earned a Ph.D. and M.Tech in Computer Science from Jaypee University of Information Technology and a B.E. from Rajasthan University. With over 8 years of teaching experience, Dr. Bhardwaj has published extensively in reputable journals and conferences. His research interests include Interconnection Networks and Parallel Computing. He emphasizes personalized teaching and guides graduate and post-graduate projects, mentoring one Ph.D. scholar while holding multiple patents and certifications to enhance educational practices. Contact: vpbharadwaj@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Mariyam Ilyas Siddiqui presented a research paper titled "Ms. Marvel: A Study of the Portrayal of American Muslims in Today's World of Science Fiction" at the Northeast Modern Languages Association Annual Convention 2023. The paper was part of the 'Muslims in America' session and focused on the representation of American Muslims in science fiction, highlighting themes of resilience. The convention took place from March 23-26, 2023, in Niagara Falls, NY, and aimed to examine representations of marginalized bodies in literature that demonstrate persistence and perseverance.

Dr. Sachin Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in mechanical engineering. He holds a Ph.D. from IIT Dhanbad and an M.Tech from NIT Jalandhar, with over ten years of experience. Dr. Sachin Sharma's research focuses on heat transfer and optimization, with 40 published papers and 10 patents. He has served as an Academic Coordinator at LPU, manages the mechanical engineering program at UPES, and has received multiple awards for research excellence. Dr. Sachin Sharma is dedicated to innovative teaching and mentoring students in practical applications of engineering concepts.

Ravi Yadav is an Assistant Professor at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies in Dehradun, specializing in Fog Computing, Trust Management, and Blockchain. Ravi Yadav completed a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Banaras Hindu University, with an M. Tech from KNIT and a B. Tech from Galgotia’s College. Ravi Yadav's teaching approach focuses on linking theory to practical applications, promoting student feedback. Courses taught by Ravi Yadav include Operating Systems and Data Structures. Ravi Yadav has received multiple academic honors, including the UGC-NET JRF and GATE scholarships, and is an active member of IEEE and ComSoc. Contact Ravi Yadav at ravi.yadav@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Navjot Hothi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Theoretical High Energy Physics, Quantum Chromodynamics, Regge Trajectories, Exotic Hadrons, and Physics Education Research. Dr. Hothi previously taught at Bahra University, Chitkara University, and Kumaun University. Her teaching philosophy focuses on simplifying complex physics concepts and fostering cognitive skills. She teaches various physics courses, including Nuclear and Particle Physics and Quantum Mechanics. Dr. Hothi has received several fellowships and actively shares innovative teaching methods, creating around 25 audio and video lectures to support student learning, particularly during the COVID pandemic. Contact: n.hothi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The LL.M. Alternate Dispute Resolution program at UPES School of Law offers comprehensive training in dispute resolution techniques, including mediation, negotiation, and arbitration. The program emphasizes experiential learning through simulated scenarios, enhancing students' practical skills. Key topics include negotiation strategies, commercial arbitration, and mediation processes. Graduates can pursue diverse careers as mediators, arbitrators, and legal consultants across various sectors such as corporate law, healthcare, and public policy. The program's strong placement support facilitates access to top legal firms and institutions. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in prior education, with selection based on entrance exam performance.

The article by Rahul Nainwal discusses strategies that organizations and leaders can implement to enhance teamwork in the workplace, particularly in a post-pandemic context. Effective teamwork is influenced by leaders who demonstrate collaboration and invest in team relationships, while also setting clear goals and responsibilities. Companies, like Google and Mastercard, exemplify successful team cultures that prioritize employee engagement. Additionally, Human Resource Management (HRM) has evolved to foster motivation and conflict resolution, promoting a culture of collaboration through engaging activities. Ultimately, organizations need to cultivate trust and partnership for improved team performance.

Dr. Aswani RS is an Associate Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, specializing in Environmental Politics, Geopolitics, Sustainability, and Maritime Security. Dr. Aswani holds a Ph.D. and M.Phil. from the University of Kerala and has received multiple awards, including the Best M.Phil. Dissertation. Since joining UPES in 2017, Dr. Aswani has created curricula on Environment and Sustainability and teaches courses including International Relations and Geopolitics. Dr. Aswani has contributed to numerous journals and engages in scholarly activities, conferences, and invited talks focusing on climate change and maritime security in the Indian Ocean Region.

Dr. Anju Pandey is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in environmental law, economic development law, and technology law. With over four years of teaching experience, Dr. Anju has authored significant texts, including "Environmental Law and Policy in India: Contemporary Issues and Challenges," and "E-waste Management: Governance and Policy Options." Dr. Anju earned a PhD from Central University of Rajasthan, focusing on genetically modified food and patent laws. Courses taught include Environmental Law and Policy, Jurisprudence, and International Commercial Arbitration. Dr. Anju emphasizes a learner-centered teaching philosophy. Contact at a.pandey@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Ph.D. in Law at UPES School of Law offers a prestigious doctorate designed for those pursuing careers in legal academia, research, or consultancy. The program emphasizes comprehensive understanding of legal systems, research methodologies, and critical thinking skills. With a duration of 3 to 6 years, candidates must hold a Master’s degree with at least 55% marks. The two-step admission process includes an entrance test and an interview. UPES School of Law promotes interdisciplinary research and offers robust support, ensuring high-quality supervision and enhanced career prospects in law. The program also emphasizes faculty research and scholarship opportunities.

The BBA Foreign Trade - International Trade Negotiations program at UPES provides an in-depth education in international business and global trade practices. The curriculum covers international trade principles, economics, finance, and cultural considerations, emphasizing supply chain management and trade regulations. Students gain practical skills through internships, projects, and industry engagement. Graduates can pursue careers as international trade specialists or export/import coordinators, among others, in various organizations. The program also focuses on adapting to globalization, digital marketing, and sustainable trade practices. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in Classes X and XII, with selection based on entrance exam performance.

Parag Trivedi, User Experience (Ux) Director at Microsoft, discussed the evolving role of designers at the CII Design Talk Series, emphasizing the importance of user needs in design. Trivedi highlighted that Ux design encompasses the entire user journey, stressing empathy and understanding user emotions. With advancements in technology such as Artificial Intelligence and multi-modal interactions, Trivedi noted that designers must keep users at the center of innovation, adapting solutions in real-time based on user behavior. The talk aimed to inspire Indian stakeholders to invest in design for economic growth and improved public services.

UPES Editorial Team outlines the pathway to becoming a fashion stylist, emphasizing the importance of education in fashion design, particularly through the UPES School of Design. Fashion stylists craft visual aesthetics for diverse clients including celebrities, corporate professionals, and athletes. Different stylist roles, such as celebrity, runway, corporate, e-commerce, and image consultants are explained. The article suggests gaining hands-on experience through internships, developing a niche, and even starting a styling business after education. The growing demand in the styling industry due to digital media offers new opportunities for aspiring fashion stylists.

Abhay Kapatia, Sanidhya Soni, and Omendra Singh Tomar, students pursuing B.Tech. in Computer Science with a focus on Cloud Computing and Virtualization Technology, developed a Microservice Based SaaS Application for Unified Communication in Campus. This project aims to enhance communication and collaboration among academic institutions' students, faculty, and staff by providing real-time messaging, file sharing, and collaborative document editing. The application features microservices architecture for easy updates and scalability, integrating seamlessly with existing campus systems for an improved user experience. This innovative platform ultimately boosts productivity and engagement across the campus.

Dr. Gaurav Pandey is an Assistant Professor (senior scale) at UPES's School of Advanced Engineering, specializing in clean energy, oil and gas storage, and climate change. Dr. Pandey earned a joint Ph.D. from IIT Madras and NUS in 2020, after completing an M.Tech in Petroleum Engineering in 2015. He has published 13 peer-reviewed papers and contributed eight book chapters. Recognized with multiple awards, including the "Bhagyalakshmi and Krishna Ayengar Award," Dr. Pandey teaches Drilling Engineering and Enhanced Oil Recovery. He leads research collaborations globally and actively reviews for several prestigious journals.

Ravindra Singh Rawat is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, and a founding member of the School for Life. Ravindra designed and leads the Life Skill course 'Working with Data'. Ravindra holds dual post-graduation degrees in Business Administration and an M.A. in Economics, and is pursuing a Doctorate on 'Resurgence of MSMEs with Digital Technologies in Uttarakhand'. Ravindra has over ten years of academic and corporate experience. Research interests include digitalization in education and MSMEs. Ravindra emphasizes a strong teacher-student connection and practical learning. Ravindra received the Catalyst Award, 2023, and regularly publishes research papers.

The Annual Quality Assurance Report (AQAR) of the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) highlights the strategic initiatives and achievements related to quality improvements in education. The AQAR encompasses data on academic programs, student outcomes, placements, and institutional development, aimed at enhancing educational standards. The report serves as a reflection of UPES's commitment to continuous improvement and adherence to accreditation standards set by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC). For further details and related documents, interested parties are encouraged to visit UPES's website.

The webpage provides information about the M.Tech. program in Energy at the School of Advanced Engineering, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), Dehradun. It offers details about admissions, eligibility criteria, and academic opportunities in energy engineering. The program focuses on preparing students for careers in the energy sector, emphasizing innovative and sustainable energy solutions. Interested candidates can apply through the UPES online portal and contact the university for more information. The site includes contact details for queries regarding the program and admissions.

The Bachelor of Design (User Experience and Interaction Design) program at UPES is a four-year undergraduate degree focused on interaction design. It covers user-centered design, UX research, UI design, usability engineering, and emerging technologies such as AR/VR and AI. The program includes a valuable Industry Internship, allowing students to gain practical experience with leading UX companies. State-of-the-art facilities enhance learning, and an exchange program with UE Germany provides international exposure. Graduates have promising career opportunities in UX/UI design, with potential employers including Microsoft and Google, attracting average salaries of Rs. 6.48 lakhs per annum.

Ms. Sakshee Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. She holds a gold medal in law from Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law and a master's degree with specialization in Criminal Law and Human Rights from the Indian Law Institute, Delhi. Ms. Sakshee Sharma's Ph.D. research at Himachal Pradesh National Law University focuses on gendered cyber harassment. With five years of teaching experience, including 2.5 years at IMS Unison University, Ms. Sakshee Sharma's research interests span Human Rights, International Criminal Law, and Cyber Crimes. Ms. Sakshee Sharma emphasizes nurturing curiosity and critical thinking in students through her teaching philosophy.

The Leadership Conclave 2021, organized by UPES student team Fearless Falcons, will take place virtually on August 28-29, 2021. Led by UPES students Anmol Singhal and Disha Tripathi, the event will feature influential leaders and interactive activities, catering to students from various institutions, including BITS Pilani and Indian Institute of Management. Activities include "Stock Triumph," "Pitch Arena," and "What Would You Do," aimed at enhancing critical thinking and leadership skills. The conclave seeks to inspire students to find purpose and make impactful contributions in their lives. Registration details are available online.

The Ph.D. in Mathematics at UPES School of Advanced Engineering spans 3-4 years, focusing on pure mathematics, applied mathematics, and statistics. Key areas include Algebraic Geometry, Number Theory, Fluid Dynamics, Cryptography, and Time Series Analysis. The program emphasizes analytical thinking, resilience in research, technical writing, and interdisciplinary collaboration. Graduates gain skills applicable in data science, finance, cybersecurity, and healthcare. Future career paths encompass roles in academia, industry, consulting, and technology. Admission for the July 2024 intake requires application by June 3, 2024, with key dates outlined for the selection process.

Manish Kumar Giri is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES. Manish Kumar Giri holds a Master of Engineering and Bachelor of Engineering from Government Engineering College, Ujjain, and SSCET Junwani Bhilai, respectively, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Electronics and Communication Engineering from the National Institute of Technology Raipur. Manish Kumar Giri's research focuses on machine learning applications in wireless communication. Manish Kumar Giri teaches courses including Internet of Things and Machine Learning and has received the MHRD scholarship and UGC-NET fellowship. Manish Kumar Giri can be contacted via email at manishk.giri@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage discusses World Pharmacist Day, celebrated annually on September 25, focusing on the critical role of pharmacists in the global healthcare system. It emphasizes pharmacists' evolution from simple medication dispensing to becoming vital healthcare providers, educators, and advocates. The article highlights the need for formal recognition of pharmacists in public health, the integration of public health principles into pharmacy education, and utilizing implementation science to enhance pharmacy practice in resource-limited settings. This year's theme is "Transforming Global Health," particularly poignant amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Activities organized by UPES School of Health Sciences include a quiz, elocution, and discussions.

Rahul Kumar is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at UPES Dehradun since July 2023. He is pursuing a PhD at Delhi Technological University under Prof. Shailender Kumar. Rahul Kumar holds an M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering and has over 5 years of teaching and research experience. His research interests include Computer Vision, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning, with publications in SCI/SCIE indexed journals. Rahul Kumar teaches core subjects such as Design and Analysis of Algorithms and Database Management Systems, and has also served in various administrative roles. Contact: rahulkumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Anwesha Pathak is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in space and air laws. Currently pursuing a PhD on the legal status of geostationary orbit and space debris, Anwesha holds an LLM in Constitutional and Administrative Law, where she earned a Silver Medal. With extensive teaching experience, Anwesha has worked at Ajinkya DY Patil University and New Law College. Anwesha has research interests in space law, media law, and intellectual property rights, contributing to various legal publications. As a teaching philosophy, Anwesha promotes critical thinking and ethical practice through interactive learning methods.

Prof. (Dr.) S. M. Tauseef is an Associate Dean (R & D) at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES. He serves on the editorial board of the journal Process Safety and Environmental Protection and has published several books including "Biogas Energy" and works on environmental safety. Prof. S. M. Tauseef has conducted research projects on virtual reality in education and groundwater enhancement, with funding from various agencies. He holds patents for innovative waste treatment systems and has contributed significantly to academic research in environmental science and engineering.

Dr. Giampaolo Zuccheri is an Associate Professor at the University of Bologna, Italy, in the Department of Pharmacy and Biotechnologies. He specializes in Nanobiotechnology and has previously been a visiting scientist at École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne. Dr. Giampaolo completed a B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Industrial Chemistry at the University of Bologna and earned a Ph.D. from the University of Calabria. His research focuses on macromolecular characterization techniques, nucleic acids, and protein unfolding, and he has published extensively and received multiple academic awards.

UPES has established a partnership with Zeon Lifesciences Limited aimed at conducting joint research projects, facilitating student exchanges, and providing internship opportunities. This collaboration involves UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology, which will host joint conferences and share academic information and materials. Zeon Lifesciences Limited specializes in research-driven manufacturing across various sectors, including Nutraceuticals, Ayurvedic products, Immunity boosters, and Medical Nutrition. The partnership underscores a commitment to quality and innovation in health and wellness offerings.

Dr. Shailesh Pandita is an Assistant Professor - Senior Scale at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies, with a Ph.D. in Marketing Management specializing in consumer adoption behavior. Dr. Pandita has experience at the Faculty of Management Studies, The ICFAI University. His research focuses on consumer behavior in the ride-sharing economy, with interests in the sharing economy and tourism management. Dr. Pandita teaches Sales & Distribution Management and Marketing Management, promotes interactive learning, and has received notable awards, including the Infosys Foundation prize for excellence. Contact: shailesh.pandita@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Ph.D. program in Mechanical Engineering at UPES School of Advanced Engineering spans 3 to 4 years, combining advanced coursework and independent research. The curriculum covers mechanical engineering principles and research methodologies, allowing for specialization in areas like robotics and thermodynamics. Candidates benefit from state-of-the-art labs, industry collaborations, and faculty mentorship. Graduates are prepared for diverse roles in academia, advanced manufacturing, aerospace, and renewable energy sectors. Key admissions timelines include the last application date on June 3, 2024, with classes commencing on August 12, 2024.

Sajal Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in intellectual property laws, particularly in Air and Space Laws. Sajal Sharma's research focuses on protecting intellectual property in commercial outer space activities. With prior teaching positions at multiple universities in Bengaluru, Sajal Sharma emphasizes real-world applications and innovative projects in teachings on intellectual property and cyber laws. Sajal Sharma conducts research on intellectual property in outer space and legal frameworks for emerging technologies like artificial intelligence.
