Sajal Sharma can be contacted at sajal.sharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Nanda Pardhey is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law at UPES, specializing in Business Law and Science and Technology Law, particularly in Biotechnology Law, Medical Law, and Intellectual Property Rights. Dr. Nanda's research engages with agricultural biotechnology, health and environment issues, and family law, emphasizing women's and children's rights. Dr. Nanda has extensive teaching experience and uses practical applications to enhance student learning. Dr. Nanda has published over 20 academic works, including journal articles and a book chapter. Dr. Nanda holds a Ph.D. in Biotechnology Law and can be contacted at npardhey@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Parminder Singh Sethi, a UPES alumnus and Principal Software Engineer at Dell, holds over 78 patents from the US Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and has more than 180 pending patents in areas including hardware design, security, UI/UX, blockchain, and AI/ML. Notably, Parminder set a record in India for the highest patents granted by a foreign patent agency. His innovation journey, begun during his college years, emphasizes problem-solving and creativity. As a ‘Mentor for Change’ under the GoI initiative, Parminder encourages curiosity in aspiring innovators and promotes continuous learning, alongside his passion for space exploration.

Amrendra Tripathi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, pursuing a PhD in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE). He holds an M.Tech in CSE from Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology, Allahabad. His research interests include Signal Processing, Image Processing, Cloud Computing, and Machine Learning, with multiple publications in high-impact journals. Amrendra Tripathi has over 10 years of academic experience, previously working at DIT University, Dehradun. He emphasizes active learning in teaching, covering various computer science subjects. Amrendra Tripathi can be contacted at an.tripathi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage provides a comprehensive guide on how to become a nutritionist in 2024, emphasizing the importance of nutritionists in promoting healthy lifestyles and addressing lifestyle diseases. UPES offers interdisciplinary programs in Health Sciences & Technology, focusing on nutritional science, food management, and practical experiences. Nutritionists work in various settings, including hospitals and schools, providing dietary guidance, and addressing food-related health issues. Different career paths for nutritionists include clinical, community, management, and consultant dietitians. The webpage encourages enrollment in the B.Sc. in Food, Nutrition, and Dietetics at UPES.

Dehradun is recognized as India's premier education hub, often referred to as the "school capital of India." Over the past decade, Dehradun has seen significant growth in educational institutions, particularly in management and engineering. The city offers diverse opportunities for part-time jobs and promotes careers in wildlife, healthcare, law, and more. With a rich environment for adventure sports and recreational activities, Dehradun supports both mental and physical well-being. UPES provides a well-structured curriculum designed to prepare students for industry demands, emphasizing solid career pathways through successful placements.

The B.Sc. Mathematics by Research in Data Science program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a robust foundation in mathematical, statistical, and computational techniques essential for Data Science. The curriculum emphasizes project-based learning, big data technologies, multivariate statistics, and critical thinking, preparing graduates for various roles including Data Scientists and Business Intelligence Analysts. The program encourages advanced studies and provides dedicated placement support, facilitating career opportunities in sectors like healthcare and finance. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in Class X and XII. Selection is based on a personal interview.

Pavan Chavali is the Managing Director of Goldstone Technologies Ltd. With 20 years of experience in the IT industry, Pavan Chavali specializes in data analytics, team building, and operational management. Pavan Chavali has expertise in P&L management, service strategy, account management, and managing outsourced projects. Pavan Chavali excels in leading global teams, vendor management, strategic planning, and executing business goals. Passionate about environmental sustainability, Pavan Chavali contributes to the electrification revolution and has a strong track record in service delivery for large organizations, driving quality control and project management initiatives.

Nandini Chatterjee Singh is a cognitive neuroscientist serving as Senior Project Officer at UNESCO MGIEP in New Delhi, India, focusing on learning through literacy, emotion, and music. Nandini earned a PhD in physics from the University of Pune, with post-doctoral research at UC Berkeley on auditory learning in songbirds. Nandini established India’s first cognitive and neuroimaging lab at the National Brain Research Centre, researching neurodiversity, dyslexia, and the emotional effects of Indian ragas. Nandini's current work involves designing social and emotional learning courses using neuroscience and digital pedagogies, including developing the EMC2 framework.

On World Press Freedom Day, Professor KG Suresh of UPES School of Modern Media emphasizes that "fake news" is an oxymoron; if information is fake, it cannot be classified as news. He highlights journalism as a crucial pillar of democracy, despite concerns about the industry's integrity and the emergence of "fake content" during the COVID-19 pandemic. Suresh calls for protecting journalists, advocating for their support through insurance and welfare funds, and stresses the importance of qualified professionals in journalism compared to “citizen journalism.” The ultimate goal is fostering media that operates without fear or favor.

Dr. Shuchi Upadhyay Tiwari is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, specializing in Food Nutrition, Dietetics, and Food Science with over 15 years of clinical and teaching experience. Dr. Shuchi is a gold medalist in MSc, recognized for outstanding contributions to nutrition. Dr. Shuchi's work includes collaborations with UNICEF and significant research on food waste utilization and probiotic product development. Dr. Shuchi has authored over 50 publications and has previously held leadership positions in several academic institutions. Dr. Shuchi emphasizes experiential learning in teaching various nutrition and food science courses.

The B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering with a specialization in Big Data at UPES School of Computer Science provides students with a robust understanding of big data technologies, including Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases. The curriculum incorporates hands-on training on the Cloudera platform, interaction with industry experts from Xebia, and opportunities for internships and real-world projects. Graduates can pursue careers as data engineers, analysts, machine learning engineers, and more, with an average package of 8.70 LPA. The program is aligned with emerging trends in big data and prepares students for a dynamic workforce.

Dr. Amaresh Jha is a faculty member at UPES with notable achievements in digital marketing, artificial intelligence, and human-machine communications. In the academic year 2022-23, Dr. Amaresh Jha published five patents focusing on customer-centric online shopping and integrated augmented reality into digital marketing strategies. Additionally, Dr. Amaresh Jha contributed a chapter titled "Immersive Marketing on Metaverse" to the book "Confronting Security and Privacy Challenges in Digital Marketing," published by IGI Global, highlighting Dr. Amaresh Jha's expertise in this dynamic field.

The webpage discusses the transformative experience of Syed Mohd Raza Taqvi in the Berkeley Haas Global Access Program, highlighting the diverse international environment with students from all seven continents. Syed Mohd Raza Taqvi emphasizes how global exposure has significantly impacted personal and professional growth, underlining the importance of gaining international experience in today's interconnected world. Relevant themes include diversity in education, the benefits of cultural exchange, and the necessity of global perspectives for career advancement, which resonate with the increasing demand for global competencies in the job market.

The webpage focuses on career prospects for students pursuing an LLM in Criminal Law. Mansha Dhingra highlights the growing demand for specialized lawyers due to increasing white-collar crimes in India. Key roles for criminal lawyers include Parole and Probation Officer, Private Investigator, Government Advocate, Criminal Psychologist, and Lecturer. Each role involves unique responsibilities such as legal representation, investigation, and teaching. The article emphasizes that an LLM in Criminal Law offers a promising and diverse career path, encouraging lawyers to enhance their skills in this lucrative field.

Rohit Saran is the Chief Editor of Times Internet and is recognized as one of India’s leading journalists. With over 25 years of experience, Rohit Saran has held key positions including Managing Editor at The Times of India and Executive Editor at The Economic Times. Rohit Saran has edited various notable publications such as Khaleej Times and Business Today, and has launched several media products, including India’s first mobile-oriented news service. Rohit Saran is distinguished for expertise in data journalism and has developed numerous data-driven storytelling initiatives throughout a prolific career in journalism.

The School of Liberal Studies at UPES offers a B.Sc. (Hons.) program with specialisations in Economics with Data Science, Economics and Finance, and Psychology and Behaviour, focusing on an interdisciplinary approach that integrates research and liberal arts. Eligible applicants must have a minimum score in Class XII or valid SAT results. The program spans four years, with annual fees ranging from ₹1,83,000 to ₹2,19,000. Career paths include research, finance, journalism, and academia. Scholarships are available for meritorious students and those from economically weaker sections. Admission closes on August 31, 2024.

Dr. Mohit K. Gupta is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in nuclear non-proliferation and energy law. He contributes to the India-U.S. Civil Nuclear Cooperation Agreement and serves on the World Institute of Nuclear Security. With 12 years of teaching experience, Dr. Gupta has lectured extensively in India, focusing on Environmental Law and Intellectual Property. His research interests include procedural laws, national security, and international relations. Dr. Gupta has authored three books, presented over 100 papers, and received various awards, including a Gold Medal for public international law. He can be contacted at mohitk.gupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES School of Business offers a Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) program designed to equip students with business principles and practical skills. Admissions for the program close on August 31, 2024. The 3-year curriculum includes finance, marketing, management, and entrepreneurship, with opportunities for specializations like oil and gas management and international business. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII and an entrance exam. The program boasts strong placement records, with 100% placements for eligible students and top salaries reaching ₹30 lakhs per annum. Scholarships and comprehensive industry exposure enhance educational outcomes.

Dr Minhaj Abdullah, a faculty member at UPES, was awarded the Golden Pixels Award in Animation Teaching in May 2022 by AVGC and the Maharashtra Cosmopolitan Education Society in Pune. This prestigious recognition praised Dr Minhaj Abdullah's exceptional skills in 3D modeling and animation within academic settings. The award ceremony took place at Azam Campus, presided over by Dr P.A. Inamdar, with Ashish Kulkarni, Founder of Punnaryug Artvision Pvt. Ltd., as the chief guest. The Golden Pixels Award honors outstanding contributions to animation education.

UPES provides information about upcoming and past events relevant to students, alumni, and parents. The webpage highlights various academic programs offered by UPES, including degrees in engineering, business, computer science, design, health sciences, law, liberal studies, and online courses. In addition to events, UPES emphasizes essential services such as admissions, student outcomes, placements, and campus life. Contact details for inquiries, including a toll-free helpline and email addresses for enrollment and international admissions, are also provided. Potential attendees can easily find event details and access guidance for their educational pursuits at UPES.

Dr. Prashant Shukla is an Associate Professor in the Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences at UPES Dehradun, specializing in drug delivery and pharmacokinetics. With over ten years of experience in academia and industry, Dr. Prashant Shukla has worked as a Scientist and Assistant Professor at notable institutions. His research focuses on nanotherapeutics and targeted drug delivery, particularly for inflammatory diseases like psoriasis. Dr. Prashant Shukla emphasizes a student-centered teaching approach and has received several accolades, including the CDRI Director's Special Incentive Award. Dr. Prashant Shukla's contact email is prashant.shukla@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Dhruv Kumar is a Professor and Cluster Head at the Allied Health Sciences, School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, Dehradun, recognized among the top 2% of influential scientists in Oncology. Dr. Dhruv Kumar holds a B.Sc. in Chemistry, M.Sc. in Bioinformatics, and a Ph.D. in Cellular Biology. Research focuses on cancer, specifically mechanisms regulating autophagy and metabolism, alongside COVID-19 drug repurposing. Teaching includes undergraduate to Ph.D. courses in Cancer Biology and Bioinformatics. Dr. Dhruv Kumar has received multiple awards and leads various government-funded projects, mentoring Ph.D. students in Cancer and Infertility research.

The BBA in Operations Management program at UPES School of Business prepares students with comprehensive knowledge and skills in operations management, covering topics such as supply chain management, inventory management, and data analytics. This three-year course includes two mandatory internships for practical experience. Graduates can pursue various career opportunities, including roles as operations managers and supply chain analysts, with high demand from companies like Flipkart and Accenture. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Class X and XII, and selection is through entrance exams like UPESMET-UG. The program offers global opportunities and industry alliances.

The article by Dr. Ritam Dutta emphasizes the significance of literature courses in enhancing critical thinking skills. It explores how literature mirrors human life and shapes identity through storytelling. Literature fosters a deeper understanding of human nature, develops empathy, and nurtures communication skills. Key concepts include symbolism, narrative biases, and the need for critical analysis. The article highlights that critical thinking is essential in today’s complex world, impacting decision-making and problem-solving. Ultimately, literature equips students with tools to navigate life’s complexities, making its study indispensable for personal and professional growth.

The BBA in Logistics Management (Service Operations and Procurement) program at UPES School of Business offers a comprehensive curriculum focused on service-based logistics, combining logistics, supply chain management, and service operations. Students gain skills in service quality management, customer relationship management, and procurement processes. The program includes practical learning through internships and projects, preparing graduates for careers in logistics and the service sector, such as supply chain analyst and project manager. Emphasizing industry trends and experiential learning, this program positions graduates for success in a competitive job market, with starting salaries ranging from INR 4-10 lakh per annum.

Dr. Melissa Reneaux is an Assistant Professor at UPES, leading the Psychology and Behaviour program in the School of Liberal Studies. With a background in physics, Dr. Melissa Reneaux uses mathematical principles to study neuropsychiatric disorders, particularly focusing on dopamine's role in working memory impairments related to schizophrenia and exploring the impacts of inflammation on depression. Dr. Melissa Reneaux's research includes suicidal ideation among young adults and gender-based violence. Dr. Melissa Reneaux employs problem-solving methods in teaching psychology courses and has received multiple academic awards for excellence in her studies and research.

Mr. Manoj Kumar Bhatt is the Chief Executive Officer and Founder of Social Alpha, a platform dedicated to innovation and venture development for science and technology start-ups that address critical social, economic, and environmental challenges. Since 2016, Social Alpha has supported over 200 start-ups, providing access to R&D infrastructure, pilot sandboxes, technical and business expertise, early-stage risk capital, and entrepreneurial mentoring. Additionally, Mr. Manoj Kumar Bhatt serves on several boards and is a Trustee of the Tata Institute for Genetics and Society and a Senior Advisor to Tata Trusts.

The article by Preeti Aneja discusses how Client Counselling Competitions (CCC) at UPES School of Law enhance essential skills for law students, such as interviewing, counseling, and communication. CCC simulates real attorney-client interactions, allowing law students to manage client needs and legal challenges effectively. Participants learn to establish trust, assess their skills, and receive feedback from judges. Notable alumni Ananya Gupta and Lovepreet Singh share insights on effective client engagement. The Client Counselling Association organizes the National Client Counselling Competition, fostering legal knowledge while preparing students for real-world applications in law practice.

Dr. Sanjay Chaudhary is an Industry Fellow at the School of Business, UPES, with 17 years of corporate experience. A graduate of prestigious Indian and international institutions, Dr. Sanjay Chaudhary specializes in operations, supply chain, and analytics. He is an active member of academic associations and has published numerous articles in international journals. Dr. Sanjay Chaudhary employs experiential learning methods in teaching and focuses on courses such as E-commerce and Supply Chain Management. He has received multiple awards, including the Best Paper Award and the Covid Warrior recognition. Dr. Sanjay Chaudhary's research interests include e-governance and sustainability.

The webpage discusses the impact of digital twins in healthcare, emphasizing how artificial intelligence enhances efficiency, speed, and accuracy in medical applications. The content showcases various programs offered by the School of Health Sciences & Technology at UPES, including degrees such as B.Pharm, M.Sc., and PhDs in health sciences. It highlights advancements in pharmacology, food technology, and cancer economics while providing insights into collaborative projects with institutions like AIIMS and Taipei Medical University. The blog aims to inform students and professionals about emerging trends and career opportunities in health sciences and technology.

The UPES Editorial Team's article discusses emerging engineering technologies that will shape the future, emphasizing a balance between societal benefits and profitability. Innovations such as the crewless AI-driven Mayflower ship, magnetic slime robots, tidal energy systems, and smart farming are highlighted. Key future technologies include tidal energy, IoT applications, novel materials, and mechatronics, with commercial prospects growing significantly. The article illustrates a trend focused on efficiency, sustainability, and addressing human needs through advanced engineering solutions.

Dr. Vinita Singh, a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Law at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), specializes in Legal History and Indian History. Dr. Vinita Singh emphasizes a teaching philosophy focused on making history relatable and applicable, fostering critical thinking in students. Dr. Vinita Singh's research interests include Legal History, International Relations, and Gender, and Dr. Vinita Singh actively participates in seminars worldwide. Contact: vsingh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech. Electrical Engineering (Wearable Devices) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering focuses on equipping students with skills in designing and developing wearable technologies. Students will explore areas like sensor technology, wireless communication protocols, and embedded systems, emphasizing healthcare, fitness, and fashion applications. The program prepares graduates for careers as wearable device engineers or in research and development, with strong placement prospects in companies like GE Healthcare and Apple. Admission requires at least 50% marks in Class X and XII with significant emphasis on physics, chemistry, and mathematics.

Dr. Soumen Rej is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with a Ph.D. from the Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur. Dr. Soumen Rej teaches Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Applied Econometrics, and Energy Economics. Contact: soumen.rej@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Maria Devi Angerhofer is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, Dehradun. Maria Devi Angerhofer's research interests include Constitution, Indian Penal Code, and Administrative Law. Maria Devi Angerhofer promotes active classroom discussions on current social legal issues and teaches courses in Constitution and Criminal Law. Contact Maria Devi Angerhofer at maria.devi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Alind Gupta is an Assistant Professor of Law at UPES, Dehradun, with a B.A.LL.B (Hons.) from National Law University, Delhi, and an LL.M. from National Law School of India University, Bengaluru. Sam Babu K C is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, with expertise in comparative constitutional governance, energy transaction, litigation, and international relations. Mr. Sam has presented scholarly papers at various national and international seminars. Contact: sambabukc@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Rafique Khan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in corporate law, IT law, contract law, and legal research and writing. With advanced degrees in law, Rafique Khan employs innovative and student-centered teaching methodologies. Rafique Khan has previously taught at Karnavati University and Jamia Millia Islamia. Vibhav Pratap is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, holding a PhD in Management from the Institute of Management Studies, Banaras Hindu University. Vibhav Pratap's research focuses on "Working Capital Management - A System Dynamics Approach." Vibhav Pratap's qualifications include an MBA in Finance & Marketing and an M.Com from IGNOU. Vibhav Pratap has experience as a lecturer at Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University and Central University Jharkhand. Vibhav Pratap's teaching encompasses Finance, Working Capital, and Risk Management, emphasizing interactive learning and critical thinking. Vibhav Pratap actively publishes research papers in respected journals.

Dr. Anuradha Saini is an Assistant Professor (Sr. Scale) at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. Dr. Anuradha Saini specializes in green extraction of bioactive compounds, valorization of food industry waste, and encapsulation delivery systems. Dr. Anuradha Saini's teaching philosophy emphasizes a student-centered environment tailored to diverse learning styles. Dr. Anuradha Saini has previously worked at Amity Institute of Biotechnology, and Chaudhary Charan Singh Haryana Agricultural University. Dr. Anuradha Saini has received the Director’s Quality Publication Award and is active in research dissemination through publications and conferences. UPES School of Business emphasizes holistic student development and successful placements, being the first Indian university awarded 5-Stars on Employability by QS. In 2022-23, UPES achieved impressive placement statistics, offering extensive training through the EDGE program, covering essential skills for career readiness. The School also mandates summer internships to enhance practical exposure for students in diverse sectors like Aviation, Law, and Business Analytics, ultimately preparing graduates for dynamic professional environments and internships that lead to potential job offers.

Dr. Aditi Zear is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES. Dr. Aditi Zear has taught courses such as Database Management Systems and Design and Analysis of Algorithms. Dr. Aditi Zear's teaching philosophy focuses on student support and constructive feedback to foster learning and development.

The B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering (Refining and Petrochemicals) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering prepares students for careers in India's growing petrochemical sector, with a focus on refining technologies, petrochemical processing, and data analytics. The curriculum includes hands-on experience through internships and industrial visits, enhancing employability in diverse roles such as Process Engineer and Data Analyst. Graduates benefit from robust placement opportunities with major companies like Reliance Industries and ExxonMobil. The program aligns with global trends towards sustainability and energy innovation, equipping students to address industry challenges effectively. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in classes X and XII.

Mekhlla Harrison is a faculty member at UPES, recognized for securing the SEED Grant to establish a Handmade Paper Unit on campus. This initiative promotes environmental sustainability by transforming waste paper into handmade paper, fostering environmental awareness and responsibility. Mekhla Harrison's involvement in the Sustainability Fair 2022 further underscores her commitment to sustainability and eco-friendly practices at the School of Design.

The webpage discusses the Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Psychology and Behaviour program offered by UPES. Authored by Dr. Sudipa Nag, the article outlines how the program explores human behavior, cognition, and research methods across diverse psychological fields. Students develop skills in experimental design, statistical analysis, and critical thinking, preparing them for careers in areas such as psycho-social consulting, human resource management, and healthcare. The program also includes components like internships, practical experiences, and specializations, ensuring graduates are suitably equipped for various professional opportunities in psychology and related fields.

The LL.M. in Environmental & Energy Law program at UPES School of Law offers students comprehensive knowledge and practical skills in energy and environmental law. The curriculum integrates theoretical understanding with industry applications, covering key areas such as International Environmental Law, energy policies, climate change, and sustainable development. Students participate in case studies, internships, and projects to gain practical experience. Graduates are prepared for careers as environmental lawyers, policy analysts, and sustainability consultants. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in previous academic qualifications, and selection is based on performance in relevant entrance exams.

UPES offers B. Pharm admissions for the academic year 2024 through the UPESPAT examination. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in X and XII, with subjects including Physics, Chemistry, and Biology/Math. Selection considers UPESPAT scores, JEE-Mains, Board Merit, or NEET. The online exam lasts 2 hours, comprising 125 questions across Mathematics/Biology, Physics, Chemistry, and English. Candidates must take a demo test and will receive login credentials one day prior to the exam. For inquiries, contact UPES at 18001028737 or enrollments@upes.ac.in.

Kushmandini Gupta and Tulika Baranwal, B.Tech. CSE students specializing in Cloud Computing and Virtualization Technology, developed an Inventory Management System using Microservices. The project aims to provide a centralized, automated solution to manage inventory, improve accuracy, and increase visibility for small businesses. It adopts a microservices architecture to enhance flexibility, scalability, and resilience, contrasting with traditional monolithic systems. Features include real-time inventory tracking, order management, and reduced manual errors. The project utilizes the Spring Boot framework and Docker for deployment, ensuring efficient operations and adaptability. Download the application on GitHub.

Kishor Tikale is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with a postgraduate degree in Product Design from the Indian Institute of Science. Kishor Tikale has 17 years of industry experience, including roles at Reva Electric Car, Videocon Industries, and General Motors, where Kishor Tikale focused on digital sculpting and vehicle packaging. Kishor Tikale teaches courses like Vehicle Packaging and Digital Sculpting and is pursuing a PhD on digital modelling in automotive design. Recognized for modeling a campus utility vehicle prototype, Kishor Tikale emphasizes collaborative learning in teaching philosophy. Contact Kishor Tikale at kgtikale@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Harshal Verma, an alumnus of the School of Design at UPES, achieved recognition for the Mob-I Micromobility concept, which was featured in Autoevolution. This innovative design aims to provide a seated riding solution for the elderly and disabled, promoting sustainable transportation by reducing reliance on internal combustion engine vehicles. Harshal Verma is currently working as an automotive designer and 3D modeller as a freelancer. The Mob-I concept emphasizes a forward-thinking approach to last-mile transit options. The project highlights Harshal Verma's contributions to sustainable transit solutions.

Dr. Ashish Karn, a faculty member at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, has received a competitive research grant for the project "Early Science Technology Engineering Education and Mathematics (ESTEEM) of India Research Centre." This initiative focuses on research areas including mathematics, astronomy, sustainable agriculture, and food preservation systems relevant to India. Additionally, Dr. Ashish Karn was an invited speaker at an international conference dedicated to Indian Knowledge Systems, showcasing expertise in these fields.

Dr. Ravi Rawat is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, specializing in Medicinal Chemistry, synthetic organic chemistry, and computer-aided drug design. He holds a Bachelor's in Pharmaceutical Sciences from the University of Health Science, a Master's in Medicinal Chemistry from NIPER, and is pursuing a Ph.D. at Birla Institute of Technology. Dr. Rawat has over 5 years of teaching experience, created courses on Udemy, and received various fellowships and research grants. His research interests include drug design, organic synthesis, and pharmacoinformatics, with a commitment to fostering an interactive learning environment.

Nishu Chawat discusses the essential skills for success in parliamentary debates, particularly for law students at UPES School of Law. The article emphasizes that debating improves logical argumentation, confidence, and teamwork. It explains the Asian Parliamentary Debate format, where two teams of three members debate motions. Chawat shares personal experiences and insights on effective debating strategies, including defining the motion, active listening, critical thinking, and collaboration. The UPES Debating Society (DEBSOC) offers numerous opportunities for students to engage in competitive debates, enhancing their legal advocacy skills crucial for future careers in law.

Ishan Gupta, Kaushik Dutta, Lakshya Agarwal, and Aditya Rajput, B.Des. User Experience and Interaction Design (UX/UI) students at UPES, achieved recognition for their project Renteco, a hyperlocal rental service enhancing accessibility to used college essentials while promoting eco-consciousness. Their accolades include the CII Young Designer Award 2022 and the 'D' Source DIC-BHU Award at IIT Bombay 2022, as well as an honourable mention at the Student Service Design Challenge 2022 during Barcelona Design Week. Renteco operates within a circular economy by renting previously used items and ensuring responsible recycling.

The MBA program in Metaverse and Web 3.0 at UPES provides comprehensive education on technologies and concepts driving the next internet generation. The curriculum includes blockchain technology, decentralized applications, and business models related to Web 3.0. Students engage in major projects, internships, and industry visits for practical experience, preparing for careers in various sectors such as gaming, e-commerce, and digital marketing. Graduates can pursue roles like Blockchain Developer and Web 3.0 Analyst. Admission requires 50% marks across academic levels, along with performance in UPESMET or equivalent exams, followed by a personal interview.

Abhijit B is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law at UPES, holding a graduate degree from the National University of Advanced Legal Studies and a postgraduate degree from Gujarat National Law University. Previously, Abhijit worked as a corporate lawyer and taught at Ramaiah College of Law and Presidency University. Abhijit's research focuses on constitutional law, freedom of speech, and federalism. His teaching philosophy emphasizes experiential learning, encouraging analytical thinking and class engagement. Abhijit has received multiple awards for his research and has published works in areas like media law and constitutional frameworks. Contact Abhijit B at abhijit.b@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Ayushi Malik, an M.Tech. Computer Science student specializing in Cyber Security and Forensic at UPES, has made significant contributions through published research papers at international conferences. Additionally, Ayushi Malik has been granted a patent by the Indian Copyright Office for her innovative biometric framework in banking, highlighting her commitment to advancing cybersecurity practices in financial transactions.

UPES School of Business collaborates with ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants) to deliver superior accounting education. With ACCA's worldwide recognition in over 180 countries, students are equipped for diverse roles in multinational companies, including Financial Analyst, Auditor, and Taxation Expert. The collaboration aims to blend academic excellence with global standards, ensuring students' successful careers in finance and accounting.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Team UPES for their board game Aarogya during Toycathon 2021, describing it as a 'union of ancient knowledge and modern innovation'. Modi suggested enhancing the game to raise awareness of malnutrition among youth, while faculty and students collaborated across disciplines for its development. Dr. Sunil Rai praised the interdisciplinary innovation at UPES.

The B.Tech. Electronics and Computer Engineering (Wearable Devices) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is designed to equip students with essential skills for designing innovative wearable technologies. Graduates will be adept at addressing industry challenges and will have excellent placement opportunities with top companies like GE Healthcare and Apple. This achievement signifies the culmination of Dr. Dabashish Majumdar's 30 years of work experience and contributes to the field of Transportation Design, showcasing Dr. Dabashish Majumdar's expertise and dedication in the area.

Dr. Neeraj Kataria is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES. Dr. Sunil Rai, President of UPES, emphasizes the university's commitment to helping students achieve their dreams through personalized educational plans, continuous mentoring, and a flexible learning environment. UPES Editorial Team provides a comprehensive guide for students interested in pursuing a Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) degree. Dr. Gagan Deep Singh, Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Computer Science, conducted a nine-day workshop on "Artificial Intelligence and Coding" at the District Institute of Education and Training in Dehradun from March 2 to 10, 2023. He can be contacted at p.gupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Kanchal Gupta is an Associate Professor at the School of Law, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), with over 17 years of teaching and industry experience, including 4 years as an advocate. LL.B. program and leads the Legal Aid Clinic, organizing awareness camps and workshops. Dr. Kanchal Gupta has authored multiple publications and is recognized with the Best Faculty Award 2021. The B.Tech in Cloud Computing and Virtualization Technology program at UPES is a four-year undergraduate course that equips students with essential skills in cloud computing and virtualization. Students benefit from internships and industry collaborations, preparing them for careers as Cloud Solutions Architects and Cloud Security Specialists, with average salaries starting at Rs. 10.25 lakhs per annum.
