The webpage discusses the expanding opportunities in the field of health science through an M.Sc. in Health Science program at UPES. It emphasizes emerging trends such as interdisciplinary approaches, global health perspectives, digital health technology, AI in diagnostics, and public health informatics. Students can specialize in areas like Dietetics and Nutraceutical Policy, which focus on holistic well-being and nutrition strategies. Completion of graduation with at least 50% marks is required for eligibility. The program aims to prepare students to navigate and shape the future of health science effectively.

Dr. Ankit Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES. He earned a B.Tech in Computer Science from UPTU, and an M.Tech and Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from NIT Kurukshetra. His research focuses on Automatic Speech Recognition, Speaker Recognition, and Machine Translation, with a specific emphasis on low-resource languages. Dr. Ankit Kumar has published over 10 papers and is an active reviewer for several scientific journals. He advocates for Project-based Learning in his teaching and has a decade of experience in academia, previously affiliated with KIET, Ghaziabad.

Dibyajyoti Dash, a distinguished alumnus of UPES, graduated in 2020 with an MBA in Energy Management and currently serves as a Senior Business Analyst at Ernst & Young (EY). Dibyajyoti Dash presented a research paper at Columbia University, New York. With significant expertise in analyzing energy markets, including electricity, natural gas, and renewables, Dibyajyoti Dash specializes in energy transition strategies and sustainability initiatives. Recognized for innovative thinking, Dibyajyoti Dash effectively aligns analytics with business strategies, contributing substantially to the energy management field.

The MBA Business Analytics program at UPES, in collaboration with KPMG, focuses on integrating business administration with analytical techniques to tackle complex business challenges. The curriculum covers data mining, predictive analytics, and machine learning, equipping students with essential skills to derive insights from data. Practical experiences are emphasized through projects, internships, and industry interactions. Graduates can explore careers as data analysts, business intelligence managers, and consultants. The program has promising job placement opportunities with top companies and offers advanced training in analytics tools. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in academics, with selection based on entrance exams and interviews.

Mansha Dhingra discusses the importance of mentoring in enhancing a mentee's career success, particularly for first-year university students. High-quality mentoring programs help students navigate academic challenges, develop self-confidence, and foster effective study habits. Mentors provide guidance, emotional support, and facilitate networking opportunities, aiding students in their transition to university and the professional world. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) has instituted a structured mentoring program to support students' personal and professional growth, emphasizing the mentor-mentee relationship's value in building trust and respect. The program aims to cultivate leadership skills and prepare students for future careers.

UPES has invested ₹50 crore in establishing a Center of Excellence for Artificial Intelligence at the School of Computer Science. This initiative aims to advance research, support innovation, and provide specialized training in AI and Data Sciences. The center will feature advanced facilities, including high-end servers and GPUs, catering to over 50 researchers, and will focus on practical applications in industries like healthcare, law, and manufacturing. Dr. Ravi S Iyer emphasizes the goal of empowering students with hands-on experience and fostering collaborations with government and industry to drive AI adoption. The initiative positions UPES as a leader in AI research and education in India.

Snigdha Mishra from UPES's School of Health Sciences & Technology has published significant research in BMC Biology, focusing on her post-doctoral work at Mariana F. Wolfner's lab, Cornell University. The paper titled "Female factors modulate Sex Peptide’s association with sperm in Drosophila melanogaster" highlights the role of seminal protein Sex Peptide in regulating post-mating reproductive events in Drosophila melanogaster. The findings emphasize the importance of female factors in sperm storage, challenging male-biased interpretations of this process. The publication can be accessed through BMC Biology's official link.

Prachi Mishra is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law at UPES, specializing in the intersection of Law and emerging technologies. Ms. Mishra's research focuses on the regulatory analysis of AI and blockchain in healthcare within smart cities. With previous teaching experience at Symbiosis Law School and ICFAI University, Ms. Prachi has court experience and has delivered guest lectures internationally. She teaches Constitutional Law and Technology Law, integrating theory with practical applications. Ms. Prachi is active in academic circles and has published extensively on legal aspects of technology. Contact can be made via Prachi Mishra's university email.

Dr Manjeet Singh Goyat from the School of Advanced Engineering has received significant recognition for his research in nanocomposites. In 2023, Dr Manjeet Singh Goyat was awarded two grants from the Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB) in India: approximately INR 26 Lakhs for a project addressing delamination issues in carbon fiber reinforced polymer composites, and approximately INR 16 Lakhs for research on high-performance 3D epoxy nanocomposites. These achievements highlight Dr Manjeet Singh Goyat's contributions to advanced engineering and materials science.

UPES collaborates with Coursera to offer UPES students access to over 3,900 courses from 190 prestigious universities and industry partners, including Google, IBM, BCG, and Amazon Web Services. This partnership enhances learning through a modular approach, equipping UPES students with fundamental knowledge and industry-ready skills to improve employability. Coursera’s offerings allow students at UPES to strengthen their problem-solving abilities and prepare for various career opportunities.

The UPES Admission Alerts webpage provides information on admission updates for various academic programs at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), including undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral options across schools like Engineering, Business, Design, Computer Science, and Law. The page features key links for eligibility criteria, application processes, and important dates. Aspiring students can also access resources such as counseling, FAQs, and international admissions. Contact information and helplines are available for assistance, ensuring prospective students can easily obtain necessary information regarding their admission journey.

Mitali Madhumita, a faculty member at UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology, published a research paper titled "Ultrasonic modulated rice bran protein concentrate: Induced effects on morphological, functional, rheological, and thermal characteristics" in 2023. Co-authored with Navratan Sharma, Yogesh Kumar, and Pramod K Prabhakar, the study focuses on the treatment of rice bran protein concentrate using ultrasonication. It investigates the microstructural changes that enhance the functional properties of plant proteins, contributing significant insights for the food industry and researchers. The publication link can be found in the research article.

The webpage details various additional fees associated with courses at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Key charges include a one-time Training and Certification Fee of ₹28,000, a Personality Development Courses Fee of ₹21,000 for UG students, and a Convocation Fee of ₹2,000. Refundable security fees amount to ₹20,000, with hostel accommodation fees ranging from ₹1,74,000 to ₹2,41,000. Additional costs cover medical insurance, technology, and transportation fees. Students are also subject to possible levies or taxes imposed by authorities.

Sugandha Sharma is a faculty member in the School of Computer Science at UPES who received the “Iconic women creating a better place for all” award at the Annual Women Economic Forum 2022 (84th Global Edition). Additionally, Sugandha Sharma served as a guest speaker at this international event, highlighting her contributions and recognition in the field.

Mohit Singh is an alumnus of the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), graduating in 2017 with an MBA in Power Management. He is currently the Assistant Vice President of Climate Connect Digital. Mohit Singh was honored with the Solar Quarter 40 Under 40 Award as a Young Indian Solar Pioneer, recognizing his contributions to solar energy in the Indian renewable sector. Out of numerous nominees, Mohit Singh was the youngest to receive this award, with the physical event set for October 2023.

Dr. Anil Kumar is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Thermal Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee. With over ten years of teaching and research experience, Dr. Kumar specializes in thermal energy systems for industrial applications, focusing on heat transfer, computational fluid dynamics, and nanofluids. Dr. Kumar has published over 50 research papers and has been involved in numerous collaborative projects. His teaching philosophy emphasizes student potential, and he teaches courses such as Energy Engineering and Advanced Heat Transfer.

Dr. Thandavarayan Ramamurthy is an INSA Fellow and Senior Scientist at the National Institute of Cholera and Enteric Diseases (NICED) in Kolkata, specializing in Clinical Microbiology, Environmental and Food Microbiology, Immunology, and Molecular Biology. Dr. Ramamurthy develops therapies for Cholera and Enteric Diseases and has received numerous national and international awards. Dr. Ramamurthy earned a B.Sc. from Presidency College, an M.Sc. from the Center of Advanced Study in Marine Biology, and a Ph.D. from the same institution. Dr. Ramamurthy has supervised 12 Ph.D. students and published over 300 research papers.

Dr. Madhuben Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 20 years of experience in teaching and research. Dr. Madhuben Sharma holds a doctorate in surface water assessment from TERI School of Advanced Studies and focuses on statistical techniques in water resources engineering, specifically analyzing water quality in Uttarakhand's major water bodies. Dr. Madhuben Sharma leads a UCOST-funded project on water quality assessment of the River Yamuna. Dr. Madhuben Sharma's teaching emphasizes real-life projects and includes courses on health, safety, and environmental engineering.

UPES launched the 'Runway' Start-up Incubator Program in 2021, supporting over 200 start-ups with funding exceeding INR 1 crore and a INR 5 crore grant from NIDHI i-TBI. The program aims to transform students into entrepreneurs by providing mentorship from industry experts, alumni, and faculty through tailored sessions. Runway focuses on nurturing innovative ideas, facilitating successful business transitions, and fostering a community of job creators. Success stories include startups like Indian Hemp Store and Flux Motors. For more details, visit the Runway Incubator website.

Rashi Agarwal, a BSc student in Food Nutrition and Dietetics at UPES, achieved first place in the Oral Presentation category at the 11th International Advanced Diagnostic Techniques Conference (ADT). The presentation focused on "Formulation and Characterization of Carrot and Simbal Doda Fermented Beverage." The conference, themed ‘Emerging Trends in Neuro-Rehabilitation: An Allied Healthcare Perspective,’ was held from February 22 to 24, 2023, and organized by Chitkara School of Health Sciences, Chitkara University, Punjab. This recognition highlights Rashi Agarwal's academic excellence and contributions to the field.

Abhay Kapatia, Sanidhya Soni, and Omendra Singh Tomar, students pursuing B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering with a specialization in Cloud Computing and Virtualization Technology, developed a Microservice Based SaaS Application for Unified Communication in Campus. This project addresses communication challenges in academic institutions, enhancing collaboration among students, faculty, and staff via features like instant messaging and document editing. Built on microservices architecture, the application allows independent service scaling and easy integration with existing campus systems, ultimately improving campus experience and engagement. The application is available for download on GitHub.

Jahnavi Kumar, a second-year student at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), is being recognized for her academic accomplishment in the field of history. Jahnavi Kumar's paper, titled "Questioning Consensus: Mapping social progress in the face of internal dissent within the All India Women's Conference (AIWC)," has been selected for presentation at the 14th Annual History Conference at Texas A&M University. This selection highlights Jahnavi Kumar's high-quality research and reinforces her position among international scholars in the field of Liberal Studies.

The MBA in Digital Business (Web Design and Development) at UPES School of Business addresses the demand for professionals skilled in digital strategies and web design. This program combines core business knowledge with specialized training in fintech, digital marketing, and analytics, informed by industry collaborations. The curriculum includes internships, projects, and courses on emerging technologies. Graduates can pursue roles as UI/UX Designers, Web Developers, or Digital Marketing Managers, with starting salaries ranging from INR 4-15 lakh per annum. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in previous academic qualifications and consideration of entrance exam performance.

Tushar Chaudhary, a B.Des. student specializing in Transportation & Mobility Design at UPES from the 2019-23 batch, has undertaken a project to design an electric version of the TVS XL. The project aims to meet the needs of both personal and commercial users by incorporating ample storage and customizable features. It focuses on understanding customer preferences to develop electric variants of the TVS XL that align with market specifications. Tushar Chaudhary's mentor for this project is Kishor Tikale, a Senior Associate Professor.

The International Legal Conference hosted by the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) focuses on Advanced Technologies, Security, and Society. This event, organized by the Social Justice Center and School of Law students, welcomes attendees interested in exploring contemporary legal issues related to technology and security. The conference is scheduled for March 27, 2022, at the Schwarzmann Center, Bandra West. UPES emphasizes creating a personalized learning environment with mentoring opportunities for law students, ensuring engagement in relevant societal issues.

Dr. Pankaj Kundan Dadure is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in Natural Language Processing, Mathematical Information Retrieval, and Visual Question Answering. Dr. Pankaj holds a Ph.D. from the National Institute of Technology Silchar and an M.Tech from the National Institute of Technology Arunachal Pradesh. Dr. Pankaj emphasizes practical knowledge and critical thinking in teaching, covering courses such as Linux OS and Shell Programming and Cyber Security. Dr. Pankaj's research includes enhancing NLP applications and bridging language barriers, with multiple accolades for contributions to Artificial Intelligence and NLP. Contact information: pankajk.dadure@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Ajay Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, with over twelve years of teaching and industry experience. Previously a Civil Judge in Haryana, Ajay Kumar has taught at prestigious institutions like the Faculty of Law, University of Delhi. Ajay Kumar holds an LL.M. from the Indian Law Institute and is pursuing a Ph.D. from Himachal Pradesh National Law University. Research interests include Criminal Laws, Family Laws, Human Rights, and Property Laws, with published work in prominent journals. Ajay Kumar emphasizes mentoring students for Judicial Services examinations and has extensive experience in organizing legal academia events.

UPES offers a Master of Technology (M.Tech) in Electrical Engineering through its School of Advanced Engineering. The program is designed to equip students with advanced knowledge and skills in electrical systems and technology. Admission criteria typically include a relevant undergraduate degree, and the curriculum emphasizes both theoretical and practical applications in the electrical field. UPES is located in Dehradun, India, and provides various resources for prospective students, including counseling and assistance with the application process. For more details on admissions and specific program features, prospective students can check the UPES website.

Ishika Punhani and Vinay K, B.Tech. CSE students from the 2020-24 batch, secured a copyright from the Government of India for their "Intelligent Border Surveillance" Software. The software aims to enhance border security by developing an algorithm that utilizes Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) and Multi-Agent Modeling for optimal border patrol strategies. Grid systems partition the area, while route layout algorithms optimize patrolling. This achievement is a significant advancement in strengthening border security and surveillance measures, reflecting the capabilities of emerging technology in national defense.

The Ph.D. program in Safety Engineering at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a comprehensive curriculum blending coursework with teaching assistantships. Covering advanced topics like hazard identification, risk assessment, and safety management, the program emphasizes mentorship and research methods. Ph.D. candidates benefit from financial support, state-of-the-art laboratories, and global faculty expertise. Graduates are prepared for diverse careers in research, academia, and industry, addressing critical areas such as environmental safety and sustainable practices. Admission for July 2024 includes a research proposal submission and interviews, with key dates specified for prospective applicants.

Dr. Adesh Kumar is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in VLSI Design and Embedded Systems with over 100 research papers published. Dr. Adesh Kumar has supervised 12 PhD scholars and chaired more than 200 international conference sessions. With 15 years of experience, including 13 years at UPES, Dr. Adesh Kumar's teaching philosophy integrates digital learning and practical applications. Dr. Adesh Kumar teaches multiple courses including VHDL and Embedded System Design and has received several awards for research and service, emphasizing software-hardware integration in his scholarly activities.

Devaleena Kundu, a faculty member at the School of Liberal Studies, presented a paper titled 'Graves Matter: Photographing Cemeteries and their Imperial Legacy' at the University of Edinburgh's Symposium on 'Photographs and Afterlives.' The presentation explored the transformation of mourning rituals and commemoration through the lens of colonial-era cemeteries in India, showcasing the evolving aesthetics of these sites. This achievement highlights Devaleena Kundu's contributions to academic research and scholarship within the field of liberal studies.

The webpage provides an overview of the leadership team at UPES, detailing key figures such as Dr. Sunil Rai, President, and Dr. Ram Sharma, Vice Chancellor. It outlines the governance structure, including various councils and committees, with notable members such as deans and professors from diverse schools including Computer Science, Design, Health Sciences, and Law. The page emphasizes the university's commitment to quality education and effective governance, showcasing the distinguished experience of its leadership in academia and industry.

The B.Tech. Applied Petroleum Engineering (Gas Engineering Informatics) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering integrates petroleum engineering principles with advancements in gas engineering and informatics, focusing on areas such as reservoir engineering and data analytics. The curriculum emphasizes modern technologies like GIS and SCADA to prepare students for careers in the growing gas sector. Graduates are equipped for roles in exploration, production, and analytics, contributing to innovative solutions in sustainable energy. UPES's industry connections ensure strong placement opportunities, making graduates valuable assets in leading energy firms. The program requires a minimum of 50% in relevant academic subjects for eligibility.

The "Life at Campus" blog on the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) website showcases vibrant campus life and student engagement. Highlights include celebrations such as Holi, collaborations with NGOs for community service, and popular hangout spots for UPES students. The blog features alumni reminiscing about their experiences and discusses why Dehradun is an attractive destination for students globally. It emphasizes the unique opportunities at UPES, including academic programs across various disciplines and global exposure, appealing to prospective students seeking a dynamic educational environment.

The Master of Computer Application (MCA) in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at UPES School of Computer Science is a comprehensive program integrating theoretical knowledge with practical application. The curriculum emphasizes statistics, probability, and machine learning model implementation, alongside hands-on projects and internships. Graduates are prepared for diverse career opportunities, including roles such as Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and AI Research Scientists. The program offers robust placement support, with average salaries of 4.92 LPA and top packages reaching 11.2 LPA. The focus on ethical practices and innovation positions students for success in the evolving AI and ML landscape.

Richard Van der Laken is a creative director based in Amsterdam and a co-founder of What Design Can Do (WDCD). Richard Van der Laken, along with Pepijn Zurburg, established De Designpolitie and the graphic design collective Gorilla, winning awards and gaining recognition in major galleries like the Design Museum London and MoMa New York. At WDCD, Richard Van der Laken organizes design challenges, publications, and events globally, including in Amsterdam, Brazil, and Mexico. Richard Van der Laken often shares insights at prominent conferences such as TED and Design Indaba.

UPES alumnus Aryan Singh co-founded 'FitBread' along with Akshit Saxena and Aditya Kashyap, aiming to provide preservative-free, nutritious whole-wheat bread. Incubated by the UPES Council for Innovation and Entrepreneurship, FitBread sources ingredients locally, supports women employment, and enhances bakery skills, promoting financial empowerment in Uttarakhand. The product range includes six flavors made with common household ingredients, aligning with a commitment to wellness and community. FitBread aspires to expand across India, addressing the market's limited variety in bread offerings.

Dr. Satya Krishna Nippani is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 24 years of experience in Physics education. He focuses on technology-based curriculum delivery and academic success, contributing to undergraduate and postgraduate curriculum development. Dr. Nippani’s research interests include Polymer Electrolytes, Batteries, and Solar Cells. He employs a student-centric teaching philosophy and has taught various Physics courses. Dr. Nippani has received multiple accolades, including nominations for teaching awards and appreciations for developing laboratory resources. He can be contacted at nsatyakrishna@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES School of Design offers exceptional placement opportunities, supported by strong industry partnerships. Recognized with a 5-Star Employability rating by QS, UPES ensures students gain adequate exposure to secure professional roles. The School features state-of-the-art technology and learning infrastructure, focusing on skills essential for future careers. Mandatory summer internships last 8 weeks to 6 months and connect students with leading organizations. The EDGE program enriches students' employability through various training initiatives. Notable placements include Aryan Singh at SLB and Apoorva Jha at Accenture, both earning 33 LPA.

The B.Sc. Microbiology (Medical & Pharmaceutical Microbiology) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology provides in-depth training in the relationships between microorganisms and human health. The curriculum covers pathogen identification, management, and pharmaceutical microbiology techniques, with practical laboratory training. Graduates can pursue careers as medical or pharmaceutical microbiologists in healthcare, research, and regulatory sectors. The program emphasizes hands-on learning, industry collaborations, and advanced technologies. Strong career prospects exist in diagnostics, vaccine development, and addressing global health challenges. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in relevant subjects at X and XII levels.

Dr. Vipin Gaur is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. He is a highly cited experimental high-energy physicist with over 18,000 citations and significant contributions to international projects like "Belle" and "Belle II," which led to the 2008 Nobel Prize in Physics. Dr. Gaur has over 17 years of experience and supervises students for funded MS and PhD positions in the US. He teaches Thermal Physics, Computational Physics, and Engineering Physics, emphasizing logical thinking and problem-solving. Dr. Gaur has received multiple grants and awards for his excellence in research and teaching.

Dr. Bommuluri Bhavana Rao is recognized for her significant contributions in law, receiving the Global Legal Excellence Award at the World Conference in Bangkok, January 2023. At the same event, Dr. Bommuluri Bhavana Rao presented a paper on enhancing capabilities for women entrepreneurs. In March 2023, Dr. Bommuluri Bhavana Rao was a keynote speaker discussing the India-UAE Economic Partnership in Dubai. Additionally, Dr. Bommuluri Bhavana Rao spoke at multiple international conferences in 2023, covering law, sustainable business, and social justice, and was awarded the Singapore Award for Excellence in Teaching and Research in Law.

The School of Liberal Studies and Media at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in Dehradun offers multidisciplinary undergraduate and postgraduate programs in disciplines such as Economics, Psychology, Political Science, History, Literature, and Media and Mass Communications. Emphasizing empirical learning, the school fosters a problem-solving mindset aligned with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. The faculty includes members from prestigious global institutions, enhancing interactive learning. UPES also provides unique global exchange opportunities, allowing students to broaden their perspectives through partnerships with universities in Italy, Sweden, Poland, France, and the USA. Admissions close on August 31, 2024.

The Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) in Digital Marketing at UPES combines business administration with digital marketing skills over three years. The curriculum includes courses in marketing management, social media marketing, SEO, e-commerce, and data analytics, emphasizing hands-on projects and internships. Graduates are prepared for careers as digital marketing specialists, social media managers, and more, benefiting from strong industry connections supporting placements. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in Classes X and XII, and selection is based on entrance exam performance. The program aligns with industry trends and equips students for success in the dynamic digital marketing landscape.

Dr. Anita Sengar is an Associate Professor and Cluster Head at the School of Business, University of Petroleum & Energy Studies, Dehradun. Dr. Anita Sengar holds a Ph.D. in Management from the Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, an MBA in Marketing, and a Bachelor of Engineering in IT. Research interests include rural marketing, e-learning, sustainability, and customer engagement. Dr. Anita Sengar has received various honors, including the Noel Deerr Gold Medal Award and significant research funding. Key publications focus on renewable energy technology adoption and barriers to energy generation in rural areas. Contact Dr. Anita Sengar at asengar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage discusses four emerging career paths for chemical engineers, highlighting increased opportunities beyond traditional roles in refineries and petrochemical plants. Dr. Rahul Kumar explains the shift toward renewable energy, including biomass and hydrogen development, and the rising importance of chemical engineers in pharmaceutical research, environmental solutions, and supporting rural economic growth. With India’s target for ethanol blending and the need for sustainable extraction processes, chemical engineering positions are vital for national development. UPES School of Engineering offers programs to prepare aspiring chemical engineers for these evolving industries.

UPES achieved remarkable success in placements, offering over 2500 job offers from more than 480 companies despite challenges posed by the pandemic. The School of Computer Science consistently reported 100% placements, while the highest package reached 27 LPA from the School of Business. The Career Services department utilized virtual recruitment processes, conducting interviews through online assessments and training students with employability boot camps. Industry giants like Accenture and Amazon were among the recruiters. UPES also supports alumni with reskilling and professional development opportunities, exemplifying its commitment to student and graduate success.

Dr. Sunil Barthwal is a Professor at the School of Business at UPES with over 23 years of experience in teaching management programs in India and the Middle East. His research focuses on AI's impact on marketing, advertising, social media, consumer culture, environmental values, and sustainability. Dr. Barthwal teaches courses such as Marketing Management and Digital Marketing and has received awards for innovative teaching methods and research initiatives. He is involved in training programs and contributes articles to major newspapers. Contact Dr. Sunil Barthwal at sunilb@ddn.upes.ac.in for more information.

Dr. Mandira Agarwal is a distinguished professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 30 years of teaching experience. Her expertise includes Economics and Risk Management, Health, Safety and Environment in the energy sector, and unconventional energy resources. Dr. Agarwal has been involved in various significant projects and has published over 30 research papers. She employs a student-centered teaching philosophy, focusing on teamwork and real-world problem-solving. Dr. Agarwal has received awards for Corporate Social Responsibility and has been recognized for her contributions to academic programs and industry training. Contact: magarwal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BA - LLB (Hons.) program at UPES School of Law is a 5-year integrated degree combining arts and law, covering subjects like Economics, Sociology, and various law fields. Eligibility requires 50% marks in class X and XII, with admissions through ULSAT or CLAT. The program features a fee structure of approximately ₹1,82,000 per semester and offers 10 specializations in the third year. Graduates have diverse career opportunities in corporate, criminal, and environmental law. UPES collaborates with The University of Law for enhanced exposure. The School of Law boasts a placement rate of around 80%.

Sandeep Sawant serves as the Director of Product Development at BMC Software and is an advisory board member at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). With over 33 years of experience in the global IT products and services industry, Sandeep Sawant specializes in managing large offshore delivery centers and enhancing complex program delivery. Sandeep Sawant's expertise includes developing ITSM tools, leading DevOps Consulting Services, and improving operational quality and governance. Sandeep Sawant has successfully executed customer satisfaction strategies and managed high-value proposals across international markets including the USA, UK, and Australia.

Dr. Shefali Arora is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Organic Chemistry, particularly Natural Product Chemistry and Pharmaceutical Chemistry. Dr. Shefali completed a Ph.D. at IIT Roorkee and has over 20 years of teaching and research experience, publishing 65 papers and holding a patent. Dr. Shefali employs a “flipped classroom” teaching philosophy to enhance student learning. Recognized for excellence, Dr. Shefali received multiple awards and grants for contributions to research and education. Dr. Shefali's research interests include Ion Selective Electrodes and biological activity of heterocyclic compounds. Contact: shefali.arora@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BA (Hons.) in Political Science program at UPES offers a comprehensive education blending theoretical foundations and empirical research in Political Science and Public Policy. The curriculum emphasizes interdisciplinary learning, covering contemporary Indian politics, Comparative Politics, Political Economy, and International relations. Students engage in field-based projects and masterclasses with practitioners, enhancing problem-solving skills and employability. Graduates pursue careers in government, NGOs, and academia, with opportunities for higher studies and international exchange programs. The program aims to equip students with critical analysis skills, preparing them to tackle socio-political challenges effectively. Admission requires 50% in 10th and 12th grades.

Abhijit Anand serves as an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. He holds a BALLB from Dr. Ram Manohar Lohiya National Law University and an LL.M. from the Tata Institute of Social Sciences. With over five years of teaching experience, Mr. Anand previously worked at Karnavati University and Glocal University. His research interests include caste implications on law, education, and prisoners' rights. Mr. Anand employs the Socratic method in his teaching and teaches courses such as Law of Crimes and Indian Evidence Law. He has also published articles in reputed journals. Contact: Abhijit.anand@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Awadh Pratap Singh, a faculty member at UPES's School of Liberal Studies, presented an abstract titled "Computing and Predicting Efficiency of Educational Institutions Using Machine Learning Data Envelopment Analysis" at the International Conference on Nonlinear Applied Analysis & Optimization in December 2022, held at IIT (Banaras Hindu University). The study introduces a novel approach that integrates Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) with machine learning (ML) algorithms, specifically support vector machines and random forests, to evaluate the efficiency of decision-making units, exemplified by an analysis of Indian Institutes of Technologies (IITs). The proposed bi-objective fuzzy DEA model aims to provide clearer efficiency rankings of decision-making units.

Dr. Gaurav Mittal is a Professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES. Dr. Mittal earned a B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Kharagpur, a Master’s in Computer Applications from IIT Delhi, and a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from Case Western Reserve University, specializing in Combustion. Dr. Mittal has worked at The University of Akron and Graphic Era University. Research interests include Experimental & Computational Combustion, Chemical Kinetics, and Gas Turbine Combustion. Dr. Mittal teaches Thermodynamics and Fluid Mechanics, emphasizing project-based learning. Dr. Mittal has received funding from agencies like NASA and NSF. Contact: gauravmittal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage provides contact information for the Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). The Director of IQAC is Mr. S Raghavan. Users can fill out an enquiry form, providing their first name, last name, email address, mobile number, course type, and selected course. UPES is located at two campuses in Dehradun and has a corporate office in New Delhi. Additional contact details include a toll-free number (18001028737) and email addresses for enrollment and international queries (enrollments@upes.ac.in and international.admissions@upes.ac.in).

Anuj Prasad is the Founder and CEO of Desmania Design and serves as an Advisory Board Member at UPES. With over 30 years of experience in industrial design, Anuj Prasad holds a master's in product design from NID. He co-founded Desmania, which has become a leading design firm in India, providing comprehensive design services across various industries, including FMCG and automotive. Desmania features the largest integrated design facility in Manesar, Gurgaon, and has been recognized as the best Industrial Design Studio in India for the past four years. Anuj Prasad's current initiative includes the Innovation Lab, DIL, focused on integrating new technologies for social impact.

Dr. Rakesh Kumar Mishra is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES. Dr. Rakesh Kumar Mishra earned a Ph.D. from the Institute of Nano Science and Technology and the Indian Institute of Science Education and Research. With seven years of interdisciplinary research training, Dr. Rakesh Kumar Mishra specializes in Chemical Biology, drug delivery systems, and inflammatory diseases. Previous roles include associate professor at Dattakala College of Pharmacy and postdoctoral research at St. John’s University. Dr. Rakesh Kumar Mishra's research interests include Novel Drug Delivery Systems, Ulcerative Colitis, and Drug Repurposing.

Dr. Ravi S. Iyer discusses the concept of Digital Twins in healthcare, emphasizing their potential to transform patient care through personalized, digitized, and preventative solutions. A PwC report anticipates a shift in healthcare focus by 2035. While Digital Twins offer benefits in diagnosis, efficiency, and medical education, significant challenges remain, including implementation costs, data management, and privacy concerns. The technology’s application in treatment is still underdeveloped, warranting cautious optimism. The Digital Twins market is projected to grow at a 32.3% CAGR from 2020 to 2025, underscoring the urgency for research and advancements in this niche.

UPES alumni Divyanshu Gupta, Hari Priya, and Kartikey Kesarwani achieved notable success in the Bihar Judiciary Examination 2022, with Divyanshu securing 2nd rank. Divyanshu, inspired by his family's struggles, emphasizes the role of UPES in enhancing his legal skills through numerous moot court competitions. Hari Priya, ranking 117th, credits her practical training and encourages perseverance among law aspirants. Kartikey, with Rank 31, attributes his success to discipline and organizational skills. All alumni express gratitude towards UPES for shaping their careers and contributing to their aspirations for societal change through the legal profession.

Dr. Anupam Bhandari is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in ferrohydrodynamics and fluid mechanics. Dr. Bhandari actively engages in environmental initiatives like the Chipko Movement and has received awards for his research in ferrofluids. His teaching philosophy focuses on fostering critical thinking and effective communication skills among students. Dr. Bhandari has taught courses such as Engineering Mathematics and Differential Equations. He also has notable scholarly activities, including collaborating with international researchers and participating in national science congresses. Dr. Bhandari can be contacted at abhandari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Anchal Pathak is an Assistant Professor specializing in Human Resource Management and Organizational Behaviour at UPES. With approximately nine years of academic, research, and administrative experience, Dr. Pathak has held positions at Bule Hora University, Doon Business School, and IMS Unison University. A prominent researcher, Dr. Pathak has published numerous peer-reviewed articles, authored textbooks, and holds eleven patents. Research interests include employee engagement, HR analytics, and leadership. Dr. Pathak's teaching philosophy emphasizes imparting moral values and experiential learning in HRM and Organizational Behaviour courses.

UPES offers integrated degree programs combining undergraduate and postgraduate courses across various disciplines, including engineering, business, law, design, and health sciences. The university operates two campuses in Dehradun: Bidholi Campus focusing on engineering, health sciences, and design, and Kandoli Campus specializing in law and business. Admissions require meeting specific eligibility criteria, and applicants can apply via the UPES website. UPES facilitates educational loans through partnerships with several banks and boasts a strong placement record with top recruiters. Detailed information on fees, scholarships, and academic calendars is available on the UPES admissions webpage.

The webpage outlines the available minors for the academic year 2024 at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Students can choose from a variety of minors across different schools, including Aerospace Engineering, Applied Petroleum Engineering, Business Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Graphic Design, Commercial Law, and Health Sciences. Each minor is available to students from corresponding schools as well as interdisciplinary options. The webpage encourages prospective students to apply and provides resources such as eligibility criteria, counseling, and contact information for admissions.

Dr. Nilakshi Yein is an Assistant Professor in the School of Design at UPES. She holds a PhD in Design from the Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati and specializes in Serious Games, User Experience, and Interaction Design. Dr. Nilakshi Yein's innovative research focuses on elderly balance and Exergame interventions. Prior to UPES, Dr. Nilakshi Yein coordinated various user experience design roles at Amity University. Her teaching emphasizes project-based and collaborative learning. Dr. Nilakshi Yein teaches multiple courses, has received the IEA/Kingfar Award 2021, and actively engages in scholarly publication and peer review.

UPES School of Law student Shubhransi Kumar participated in a transformative five-month semester exchange program at the University of California, Berkeley. During this program, Shubhransi took courses such as Foundation of Legal Studies and Human Rights, enhancing her academic and personal growth. Shubhransi highlights the independence gained and the multicultural interactions with international peers. Key experiences included visiting the Superior Court in California and networking events that clarified her career goals. Despite initial academic challenges, Shubhransi thrived, balancing studies with travel and extracurricular activities, ultimately reflecting on significant personal development.

The M.Sc. Applied Geology program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a two-year postgraduate degree focusing on practical geological applications. The curriculum covers mineralogy, petrology, sedimentology, structural geology, and specialized topics like computational geoscience and geohazards, totaling 80 credits. The program emphasizes hands-on experience through fieldwork and research projects. Graduates are prepared for careers in mining, oil and gas, environmental management, and more, with opportunities to work with major companies like Exxon Mobil and Shell. The program supports further studies at global universities and is aligned with industry trends towards sustainability and innovation.

The webpage discusses the differences between the LL.B. 3-Year and LL.B. 5-Year programs at UPES. The 3-Year LL.B. is designed for students with a prior undergraduate degree, focusing on legal subjects and requiring entrance exams like PU LL.B. and DU LL.B. In contrast, the 5-Year LL.B. integrates general education with law and is for those coming directly from high school, necessitating entrance exams such as CLAT and AILET. Key distinctions include education level required, course structure, duration, and potential career pathways, helping students make informed decisions based on their background and aspirations.

UPES alumni Divyani Singh and Anshul Saxena have launched Cognecto, a tech start-up that recently secured ₹4 crore in seed funding led by Inflection Point Ventures. Their entrepreneurial journey emphasizes resilience and collaboration, inspiring future entrepreneurs. Divyani and Anshul continue to support their alma mater by recruiting talented UPES students.

The School of Modern Media at UPES offers exceptional placement opportunities, with a focus on holistic student development. Mandatory summer internships facilitate real-world experience, with 2400+ online internship opportunities provided. The EDGE program enhances employability skills, offering workshops on communication, personal branding, and interview preparation, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for the competitive job market.

The BBA in Human Resource program at UPES School of Business is a three-year course offering comprehensive knowledge in human resource management, including topics like recruitment, performance management, and employment law. Mansha Dhingra discusses the promising future of the sustainable and renewable energy sector, emphasizing the increasing career opportunities for energy engineering graduates. Vaishali Singh is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in Intellectual Property Law. Kushmandini Gupta and Tulika Baranwal, students at UPES specializing in Cloud Computing and Virtualization Technology, developed an Inventory Management System using Microservices. Key benefits include scalability, flexibility, and streamlined operations, enabling informed decision-making and optimal performance under varying demands. Abhijit Kumar is an Assistant Professor-SG in the School of Computer Science at UPES, Dehradun, India, since July 2016. The B.Tech. Aerospace Engineering (Space Technology) program at UPES focuses on equipping students with essential skills in space technology. The B.Tech. Biomedical Engineering (Medical Devices) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology focuses on training students to design and develop innovative medical devices. Graduates can pursue diverse career paths such as Research Scientist, Quality Manager, or Science Educator. With robust placement support, UPES enables graduates to secure positions in various industries, contributing to significant advancements in the field of chemistry.

The National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) evaluates Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs) in India to determine their quality status. The assessment includes various criteria such as educational processes, curriculum coverage, faculty performance, research capabilities, infrastructure, and student services. The findings are documented in the Self Study Report (SSR) and the Annual Quality Assurance Report (AQAR). Information is provided on eligibility criteria, contact details for enrollment, and support for aspiring students looking to apply to the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) for various academic programs.

The M.Sc. Chemistry program at UPES offers three specializations: Organic Chemistry, Polymer Science, and Instrumental Chemical Analysis. Students gain knowledge in bio-organic molecules, polymer fundamentals, and analytical techniques. Career opportunities include roles as Research Scientists, Scientific Officers, and Quality Managers in various industries. The program provides excellent placement support, preparing graduates for further studies or careers in R&D, academia, and more. Eligibility criteria include 50% in 10th, 12th (PCM/B), and graduation in a relevant subject.

UPESEAT 2024 provides essential information for B.Tech. admissions at UPES. Biomedical Engineering program specializing in Medical Diagnostics at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology offers comprehensive training in medical diagnostics, covering anatomy, laboratory techniques, and diagnostic imaging methods. UPES and Silvercord Films launched the music video "India Leads the World" on World Music Day to celebrate India’s growth and spirit. The video features performances by UPES students, faculty, and staff, including senior leaders, showcasing diverse art forms like Bharatnatyam and contemporary dance. Sharad Mehra, Chairman of Hydrocarbons Education Research Society, introduced the project, while Dr. Ram K Sharma, Vice Chancellor of UPES, emphasized India's role as a global inspiration. The music, composed by Nishant Ramteke, is available on YouTube and Spotify. UPES, established through the UPES Act of 2003, is a top-ranked private university in India.

Subhajit Basu, affiliated with the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, has achieved a significant milestone by publishing a research paper in Nature Communications. The study, led by Maritvanerk oliviammetcalf from the Max Planck Institute of Marine Microbiology, investigates how reactive oxygen species (ROS) impact mineralization processes in intertidal flats. It emphasizes the effects of ROS, such as hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), on biogeochemistry in the Wadden Sea, influencing microbial mineralization rates, aerobic respiration, sulfate reduction, and hydrogen accumulation. The publication is available at https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-023-35818-4.

The Faculty List page of UPES highlights the esteemed faculty members associated with various schools within the university. Aishwarya Vatsa is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Law, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Komal Bhambri, an Applied Mathematics and Statistics student at UPES, has been selected for the prestigious OFCM 2023 program organized by MTTS. The OFCM program is renowned for attracting top mathematics students in India, offering rigorous training and enrichment opportunities. Komal Bhambri's selection underscores her strong academic abilities and dedication to mathematics. Participation in the OFCM will allow Komal Bhambri to enhance her mathematical skills, collaborate with peers, and engage with experts, furthering her development as a mathematician.

Dr. Biplab Dhar is an Assistant Professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in Mathematics, particularly Computational Oncology and Mathematical Epidemiology. Dr. Biplab earned a doctorate from the National Institute of Technology Silchar, India, focusing on tumor-immune interactions. With nearly three years of experience, Dr. Biplab previously taught at the University of Science and Technology Meghalaya and DIT University. Dr. Biplab's research interests include numerical simulations of biological models and innovative mathematical solutions. Dr. Biplab is also committed to fostering an engaging, supportive learning environment while teaching courses in advanced mathematics.

The webpage discusses the "Living Conversations" course offered by UPES School for Life, aimed at enhancing students' conversational skills, which are increasingly important in today's workforce. The course includes innovative activities like a Mini Film Festival and Joke of the Day to encourage creativity and humor. Pooja Khanna highlights how these skills improve employability, stressing that exceptional communication is a key trait sought by employers.

Siddharth Dubey is an M.Tech. student in Automation and Robotics Engineering at UPES, graduating in 2023. The drone is equipped with cameras for real-time observation and analysis of agricultural land from an aerial perspective. The project emphasizes technological innovation in agriculture, improving information accessibility for farmers. Dr. Piyush Kuchhal serves as the mentor for this project.

Prof. Dr. G. G. Gangadharan is an esteemed member of the Advisory Board for the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES. He is a recognized expert in Ayurveda, specializing in pulse diagnosis and the treatment of lifestyle disorders. Dr. G. G. Gangadharan has conducted significant research in traditional medicine, advocating for the integration of Ayurveda into contemporary healthcare. Gangadharan holds a PhD and several prestigious fellowships.

Dr. Shubham Dwivedi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. A trained Pharmacologist, Dr. Shubham earned a PhD from BITS-Pilani, focusing on preclinical models for drug screening against autism. Dr. Shubham's research involves neuropharmacology, cancer interaction, and the development of in vitro models using zebrafish. With over 8 years of research experience, Dr. Shubham has published in prestigious journals and guided multiple students. Dr. Shubham emphasizes interactive learning and has introduced research presentations to enhance student engagement. Noteworthy awards include the Trainee Professional Development Award from the Society for Neuroscience.

Dr. Nilanjana Banerjee is an Associate Professor and Cluster Head at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. Her research focuses on Alternate Energy Resources, Biomass, and Reactor Design. Dr. Banerjee advocates for equity in education through diverse teaching methodologies, including project-based learning and open-resource assessments. She teaches Chemical Reaction Engineering and oversees multiple academic programs. Dr. Banerjee has received various awards and is involved in significant scholarly activities, collaborating with prestigious institutions globally.

Dr. KSR Murthy is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in nanomaterial synthesis and adsorption for environmental applications. His award-winning research includes pH-responsive luminescence sensing, photoredox catalysis, and eco-friendly gel development for oil recovery. With 10 years of teaching experience, Dr. Murthy emphasizes student-centered learning and engages students in practical applications of chemistry. He has guided numerous BTech, MTech, and PhD students and has published extensively on environmental resource management. Dr. Murthy actively participates in national and international research conferences. Contact: srmurthy@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage details the fee structure for international admissions at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Dr. Anish Kumar Vishwakarma serves as an Assistant Professor-Senior Scale at the School of Computer Science at UPES. Dr. Anish Kumar Vishwakarma earned a Ph.D. from Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology, with research in machine learning for no-reference video quality assessment. Dr. Anish Kumar Vishwakarma's postdoctoral work at IIT Madras focused on advanced analytics for combat sports. Research interests include computer vision, machine learning, and deep learning. Dr. Anish Kumar Vishwakarma teaches courses in digital electronics, microprocessors, and machine learning. Dr. Anish Kumar Vishwakarma has received several best paper awards at international conferences.

The B.Tech. Electrical Engineering - AI & ML Applications program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering equips students with skills in electrical engineering integrated with artificial intelligence and machine learning. The curriculum includes statistics, data science, soft computing, and hands-on projects, preparing graduates for careers in various sectors like automation, robotics, and data analysis. The program offers comprehensive training for roles as AI engineers, machine learning specialists, and in research and development. Graduates are positioned for opportunities with leading companies such as Microsoft and IBM, ensuring a promising career in Industry 4.0. Minimum eligibility includes 50% marks in Classes X and XII.

The B.Sc. Chemistry program specializing in Polymer Chemistry at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides a thorough understanding of polymeric materials and composites. The curriculum emphasizes hands-on laboratory experience and advanced characterization techniques, culminating in a dissertation for in-depth research. This program is the first of its kind in India and offers strong industry connections, enhancing career opportunities in material science and polymer technology. Graduates can pursue roles such as Research Scientists, Quality Managers, and Consultant Chemists in various industries. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII (PCM/B), with selection through personal interviews.

Udit Raj Sharma, a faculty member at UPES School of Law, received the Distinguished Best Researcher Award at the International Conference on Sustainability and Subsistence held on June 5-6, 2022. Udit Raj Sharma's research paper, "FROM HANIF QURESHI TO NAGARAJA: ANALYZING THE TWIST IN THE TAIL JURISPRUDENCE BY INDIAN SUPREME COURT TOWARDS ECOCENTRISM AND ANIMAL WELFARE," was presented during the conference, which focused on human rights and environmental issues. The award was presented by Justice Surya Kant of the Supreme Court of India.

The Student Space at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) provides essential information and resources for students, alumni, and parents. Dr. Reshu Gupta is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 20 years of teaching experience. Her Ph.D. focused on heat transfer in fluid flows. Dr. Gupta's research interests include fluid dynamics, differential equations, heat and mass transfer, nanofluids, and artificial neural networks. She teaches various subjects, including linear algebra and differential equations, and emphasizes a supportive learning environment. Rajeshwari Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with over 18 years of experience in the IT industry and academia. Rajeshwari Sharma specializes in IT services, operations, and software development, contributing to training, curriculum design, and implementation of technology projects. Previously, Rajeshwari Sharma was the IT Head at All India Management Association. Rajeshwari Sharma's research focuses on E-Learning, Gamification, and Analytics in education. Rajeshwari Sharma emphasizes a transformative teaching philosophy, fostering critical thinking and inclusivity among students, while teaching technology and analytics courses. Rajeshwari Sharma received a Gold Medal from NIIT Ltd.

Dr. Devendra Saini of UPES developed a new fault identification algorithm significantly improving fault location accuracy for Indian Railways' electric traction lines. This innovative algorithm reduces fault identification time from hours to minutes, pinpointing faults within a 200-meter radius compared to the existing 0.5 – 6 km range. Initially trialed in 2018, it became an integral part of the system in 2019 after validation and has been documented in prestigious journals like IEEE Transactions on Transportation Electrification. Dr. Saini acknowledges Southern Railway for facilitating this impactful research, enhancing railway efficiency.

The B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering in Mechatronics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering combines mechanical engineering, electronics, computer engineering, and control systems, preparing students for careers in robotics and automation. The curriculum integrates theoretical knowledge with practical skills, emphasizing computer programming and industrial applications relevant to the IoT and automation. Graduates can pursue roles such as Robotics Engineer, Automation Engineer, and Biomedical Engineer, benefiting from strong placement opportunities with top companies like Honeywell and Siemens. The program adapts to future industry trends in significant sectors like manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare.

Dr. Ajay Kumar, a faculty member at UPES in the School of Advanced Engineering, has achieved recognition by being included in the World’s Top 2% Scientists. Kothari research grant aimed at newly recruited faculty members. Dr. Ajay Kumar's contributions enhance the academic stature of UPES and reflect the institution's commitment to research and excellence in engineering education.

The BA Digital and Mass Media (Broadcasting): Digital Audio Broadcasting program at UPES School of Liberal Studies trains students in Radio Production, Podcasts, and Distribution over six semesters. The program focuses on practical skills in digital audio, storytelling, production, and distribution, supported by industry professionals and state-of-the-art facilities. It includes strategic partnerships for podcasting courses and offers placement assistance for five years. Graduates can pursue careers in digital media, with earnings ranging from 4 to 10 lakhs annually, and have been placed at top media companies globally.  Eligibility requires 50% in 10th and 12th grades.

The B.Sc. Computer Science program at UPES School of Computer Science offers a comprehensive curriculum designed for students aiming to excel in the computer science field. Admission is open until August 31, 2024, with eligibility requiring 50% marks in Class X and XII, including Mathematics or Computer Science. The program covers essential subjects like programming, algorithms, and artificial intelligence, while providing practical experience through labs, internships, and industry projects. Students can specialize in areas such as Artificial Intelligence, Cyber Security, and Data Science. Strong industry links support excellent placement opportunities for graduates.

The UPES Global Pathway Program offers students the opportunity to begin their studies at UPES and transfer to internationally recognized partner universities in the UK, Germany, Australia, Canada, or the USA. Students can earn degrees from these institutions while benefitting from a synchronized curriculum. Successful candidates receive degrees from the partner university and a UPES diploma. The program facilitates credit transfers, post-study work visas, and potential cost savings. Eligibility requirements include specific academic and English proficiency standards, with support from the Department of International Affairs for transfer processes.

The UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a variety of engineering programs, including undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. It aims to nurture engineers with both theoretical knowledge and practical skills to tackle global challenges, supported by academic and industry partnerships. The school is ranked 42nd in India by NIRF in 2024, with a 100% placement rate, and the highest CTC of 33 LPA recorded in 2023. The curriculum includes international opportunities through partnerships with universities in Australia and the UK, as well as global programs and internships for students.

Dr. Sumit Kumar Pachauri serves as an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. Dr. Sumit Pachauri's doctorate focuses on Media, Caste, and Cultural Nationalism in Post-Liberal India. His teaching areas include Indian History, Legal History, and Gender Studies. Dr. Sumit Pachauri is an active researcher, having published in international journals and presented at numerous conferences. Contact Dr. Sumit Pachauri at spachouri@ddn.upes.ac.in for inquiries.

Mr. Vineet Shingal is a Partner in the Corporate and Commercial practice group at Khaitan & Co. in Mumbai. Dr. Ashish Aggarwal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with 14 years of experience, joining in 2013. Dr. Ashish Aggarwal has received awards for contributions to student placement preparation and has mentored award-winning project teams. Contact Dr. Ashish Aggarwal at aaggarwal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Bhawna Yadav Lamba is a Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Organic Chemistry and Polymer Technology. She has received multiple awards for her contributions to sustainability.

Dr. Tanveer Kaur is an Assistant Professor at UPES (University of Petroleum and Energy Studies) in Dehradun, specializing in Patent Law with a Ph.D. from Kurukshetra University. With an LL.M and a BA.LLB, Dr. Tanveer focuses on teaching Company Law and Law of Tort, fostering critical thinking and engagement in students. Dr. Tanveer's research interests include Company Law, Intellectual Property Law, Contract Law, and Tort Law, with significant contributions to legal education. Dr. Himanshi Jangir is an Assistant Professor in the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, specializing in bioengineering and nature-inspired design. Dr. Himanshi Jangir holds degrees from IIT Kanpur and received several awards, including the Outstanding Doctoral Thesis Award. Dr. Himanshi Jangir emphasizes experiential learning in teaching sustainable bio-design.

Surendar Varadharajan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), specializing in safety engineering. With 8 years of experience, Surendar Varadharajan focuses on high-energy materials, risk engineering, and fire safety. Surendar Varadharajan's research involves studying industrial explosion risks and accident investigations. Surendar Varadharajan emphasizes experiential learning in his teaching and has received the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons fellowship for research in process safety. Contact Surendar Varadharajan at v.surendar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The MBA in Logistics & Supply Chain Management (Logistics Planning/Supply Chain) program at UPES School of Business prepares students for mid and senior management roles in logistics and supply chain across various industries. Students specialize in demand planning, Lean Supply Chain Management, and related areas. Graduates pursue careers as demand planners, supply chain analysts, and more, with placements in top companies like Flipkart and Accenture. The program combines theoretical knowledge with real-world applications, enhancing employability in the evolving logistics sector.

Nilesh Gupta serves as the Chief Cloud Officer at 3i Infotech, where he leads the Cloud First and Edge Solutions strategy, focusing on enhancing clients' cloud and digital transformation journeys with initiatives like "Cloud Adoption in a Box." Dr. Arundhati Tarafdar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with 11 years of experience in academia, industry, and entrepreneurship. Dr. Shweta Agarwal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, where she specializes in Business Analytics. The UPES School of Business in Dehradun prepares students for leadership roles in the global digital economy with a curriculum emphasizing new technologies and innovation. The Faculty Achievements page of UPES showcases the notable accomplishments and contributions of its faculty members. The Department of Sustainability Engineering at UPES offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctorate programs focusing on Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) and Civil Engineering. Facilities include advanced labs for fire safety, health engineering, and fluid mechanics. UPES CSR is dedicated to enhancing the lives of young students through education and support initiatives. It completed infrastructure projects at Rajkiye Prathamik Vidyalaya Bakarna and Govt. Dr. Manika Kamthan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in law, gender, and disaster studies. Dr. Manika has published extensively, completed an ICSSR project on law and disasters, and received multiple awards, including a Doctoral Research Fellowship. Dr. Manika teaches several law courses at UPES.

Dr. Akarsh Verma, a faculty member at UPES in the School of Advanced Engineering, was recognized among the world's top 2% scientists for 2021, as reported by Stanford University and Elsevier on October 10, 2022. UPES promotes academic excellence and recognizes outstanding faculty achievements, enhancing its reputation as a leading institution for advanced education.

Dr. Divya Tripathi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Dr. Divya Tripathi previously worked as a postdoctoral researcher with the World Health Organization and the Defence Research and Development Organization. Dr. Divya Tripathi's research interests include biomedical devices, polymer chemistry, and artificial intelligence. Dr. Divya Tripathi emphasizes individualized learning in her teaching philosophy and teaches various biomedical engineering courses.

Pankaj Jhunja serves as an Advisory Board Member at the School of Design, UPES. Pankaj Jhunja is the Head of Sustainability for Tata Passenger Electric Mobility and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles. With a background in Mechanical Engineering and a Master's in Industrial Design, Pankaj Jhunja has over 32 years of experience in design, innovation, and strategy. Pankaj Jhunja promotes sustainability initiatives, focusing on ESG targets through circular economy practices and resource efficiency. Pankaj Jhunja also actively advocates for industry standards and represents various professional bodies in national and international forums.

The BBA in Oil and Gas Marketing with a specialization in Petroleum Business at UPES School of Business offers a comprehensive curriculum combining General Management and Oil and Gas Management. Maithilee Laxmanrao Patawar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES Dehradun, currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science and Engineering specializing in Word Combinatorics at IIT Guwahati. Maithilee’s research focuses on Word Combinatorics and Discrete Applied Mathematics, with notable publications in international journals and a Best Paper Award at an IEEE conference. The M.Tech Sustainability Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is India's first dedicated program aiming to empower graduates with essential knowledge and skills for environmental sustainability. The curriculum aligns with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, covering interdisciplinary topics such as environmental management and safety engineering. Graduates have excellent job prospects in renewable energy, environmental consulting, and sustainable infrastructure. The program emphasizes practical learning, industry collaborations, and research opportunities, leading to outstanding placement records. The BBA Events, Public Relations, and Corporate Communications program at UPES School of Liberal Studies addresses the demand for skilled digital communicators in India's communications industry. The program offers two specializations: Social Media, Marketing, and Analytics, and Media Management, Marketing Campaigns, and Strategic Communications. It provides practical industry insights, hands-on learning, and prepares graduates for diverse career opportunities as Digital Marketing Managers and Public Relations Specialists in media agencies, PR firms, and corporate communications. Graduates enjoy promising placement options with leading media houses, starting salaries ranging from INR 4-10 lakh per annum.

UPES offers a dynamic career environment for motivated professionals and faculty aiming to inspire future leaders. The university boasts a vibrant, inclusive culture focused on academic excellence and personal development. Open positions include academic roles such as Assistant Professor and Associate Professor across various disciplines, requiring a Ph.D. and relevant Master’s degrees. Responsibilities include teaching, evaluating students, guiding research, and contributing to departmental activities. UPES is located in Dehradun and emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration to advance education and research within its community, making it an attractive destination for prospective employees.

Microfest 2023, held on September 21 at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES Dehradun, celebrated "International Microorganisms Day." The event emphasized the importance of microorganisms in health research and established an annual tradition. Activities included speeches by Dr. Padma and guest speaker Prof. V. Samuel Raj, who addressed drug-resistant tuberculosis. The event featured dance performances, a quiz competition, and creative contests like agar art. A Q&A session facilitated interaction, and the festivities concluded with awards for competition winners, highlighting the vibrant spirit of the microbiology department at UPES.

The BBA degree offers versatile opportunities across diverse sectors.

Dr. Girish Chandra Kothyari is a Senior Associate Professor at UPES's School of Advanced Engineering, specializing in Active Tectonics and Tectonic Geomorphology. Dr. Kothyari has taught various geoscience courses and actively engages in scholarly activities.

Akshara Nair is a B.Des. student specializing in Interior & Retail Space Design (2018-22) at UPES, who conceptualized a Folding Bed for Capsule Hotels. The project aims to improve guest experiences by providing a multifunctional sleeping solution in compact accommodations. The project was mentored by Professor Rajan Iyer.

The BBA (Analytics and Big Data) program at UPES offers an undergraduate degree focused on data analysis and analytics tasks, integrating business administration with technical data skills. The program includes specialized courses in Text Mining, Data Visualization, and Big Data Platforms, equipping graduates for roles like Data Analyst and Data Scientist across industries such as finance and healthcare. Students benefit from internships, live projects, and industry exposure, utilizing modern facilities. The program cultivates essential programming skills and analytical techniques to drive data-informed decision-making, aligning with the growing demand for professionals in data analytics.

Dr. Kapil Gupta is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Computer Science, UPES, Dehradun, with a Ph.D. from PDPM - Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design & Manufacturing, Jabalpur. Dr. Gunjan Vasant Bonde is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies, Dehradun. Dr. Gunjan earned a B. Pharm. and M.
