She joined UPES in 2015, teaching Organic Chemistry and Green Chemistry among other subjects. Dr. Jain has received research fellowships from UGC India and is involved in projects on wastewater reclamation and biodiesel production incorporating AI. Dr. Jain promotes a student-centered teaching approach and can be contacted at sjain@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The MBA in Strategy and Consulting at UPES, in collaboration with KPMG, offers a specialized curriculum focusing on corporate strategy and innovation. This program blends academic expertise with KPMG's industry insights, preparing students for roles like Strategy Consultant and Business Analyst. Core courses cover Strategic Management, Consulting, and Innovation, with practical components such as case studies and real-world projects. Graduates are positioned for successful careers in consulting and corporate strategy, benefitting from strong placement opportunities with leading firms. The program emphasizes skills in strategic thinking and change management, aligning with evolving industry demands.

The Bachelor of Business Administration in Aviation Management program at UPES School of Business provides a thorough foundation in business principles and specialized aviation knowledge over three years. Students can choose specializations in Aviation Service Operations and Travel & Ground Handling. The program emphasizes critical thinking, leadership, and teamwork, alongside practical experiences like internships and industry collaborations. Graduates have diverse career opportunities in airlines, airports, and consulting, with notable companies like GMR Group and Indigo Airlines actively hiring. The curriculum also integrates advanced technology and industry software to enhance employability.

Rahul Gusain, Vaishnav Balodhi, Devyansh Samyal, and Mayank Verma, students pursuing B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering with a specialization in DevOps at UPES, developed a Deep Learning-based Fish Breed Classification project. Utilizing a dataset from Kaggle, the project trains a model to classify nine fish types, including Black Sea Sprat and Horse Mackerel, by analyzing images. Deep learning, a subset of artificial intelligence, enables the model to recognize and provide details about different fish breeds. The project showcases advancements in image recognition and classification techniques through deep learning methodologies.

Dr. Debjani Mukherjee is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in Business Communication. Dr. Debjani Mukherjee holds a PhD in Media and Communications from the University of Auckland and has extensive teaching experience at various universities. Dr. Debjani Mukherjee's research interests include the intersections of business, technology, sustainability, and media culture. Dr. Debjani Mukherjee emphasizes critical thinking and effective communication in teaching, and Dr. Debjani Mukherjee has received several scholarships and grants for research on urban biodiversity and human-wildlife conflict. Dr. Debjani Mukherjee operates an independent media production company, Red Earth Media.

Vibhakar Saxena, a B.Des. student specializing in Transportation & Mobility Design at UPES (2019-23), completed a project on the Boat Friskyz Headphone design. This project focused on innovative headphone concepts based on design research and development, specifically aiming to address the problem of headphone wire stretching shock. The design features a stretchable capability that reduces the impact of shocks on headphone wires. The project was guided by mentor Dr. Debashis Majumder, a professor at UPES.

Shreya Sachdeva, a second-year B.Sc. Physics (Hons.) student at UPES, has been accepted into the "Summer School for Women in Physics 2024" organized by ICTS-TIFR in Bangalore from June 3rd to June 14th, 2024. Shreya Sachdeva expresses gratitude for the support received and looks forward to the program's hands-on experiments and engaging discussions that promote the pursuit of physics among women. This initiative aims to inspire participants by showcasing the excitement and interconnectedness of physics, fostering curiosity and passion for the field.

Professor Shikha Dimri is a founding faculty member at the UPES School of Law, specializing in Law of Contracts, Commercial Laws, International Business Law, Torts, Consumer Protection, and Transfer of Property Law. With 16 years at UPES, Shikha Dimri has held various administrative positions, contributing to curriculum development and academic planning. Shikha Dimri's teaching philosophy emphasizes student-centric learning and meaningful engagement. Shikha Dimri has published two books and numerous research papers, particularly focusing on women's property rights and labor reforms in India. Shikha Dimri can be contacted via email at shikha@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Hanumat Sastry G is a professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with expertise in algorithms, optimization, natural-inspired computing, machine learning, and data science. He has over a decade of experience in curriculum development, ensuring high standards in industry-academia collaborations. Dr. Hanumat Sastry has held various leadership positions and supervised Ph.D. scholars while actively contributing to research, publishing in respected journals. He emphasizes a hands-on, project-based teaching philosophy. Recognized for his contributions, he was awarded by IBM-ICE and received a research fellowship at Dravidian University. Contact: hsastry@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES Star blog features highlights of notable achievements and initiatives at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Key articles include discussions on UPES's sporting successes in 2022, insights from Commonwealth Games silver medallist Navneet Singh on sports scholarships, and a food start-up incubation aiming to empower local communities. Other articles explore advancements in self-repairing materials for aircraft and showcase UPES alumni's innovative automotive designs. The blog emphasizes UPES's role in fostering holistic development and academic excellence across various disciplines, encouraging community engagement and entrepreneurship.

The BBA in Analytics and Big Data (Programming for Analytics) at UPES School of Business trains students in essential programming skills for data analytics, focusing on languages like Python and R. The three-year program combines theoretical knowledge with practical experience, including internships and projects. Graduates gain skills in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and machine learning, preparing them for roles such as Data Analyst and Data Scientist in various industries. The program emphasizes real-world applications and offers insights from industry experts, making it a valuable qualification in the growing analytics field.

Bhalchandra Shingan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Natural Gas Engineering. He holds a master's degree in Gas Engineering & Management from the University of Salford and is pursuing a Ph.D. on optimizing liquefied natural gas processes. Dr. Shingan has teaching expertise in Natural Gas Engineering, City Gas Distribution, and Petroleum Engineering Economics. His work experience includes being a Trainee Chemical Engineer. His research interests focus on LNG, pipeline engineering, and optimization. Dr. Shingan emphasizes an inclusive, engaging teaching philosophy that fosters critical thinking and lifelong learning.

Pooja Khanna, an employability coach at UPES, highlights the power of storytelling in job interviews. Storytelling fosters emotional connections and helps candidates engage recruiters through personal anecdotes. Scientific research shows storytelling triggers brain chemicals that enhance focus, trust, and creativity. Khanna advises candidates to prepare short, honest stories reflecting their experiences, categorized using Aristotle’s Ethos, Pathos, and Logos principles. Using the ‘SHE’ model, candidates should deliver succinct and engaging narratives to convey skills and values, effectively persuading recruiters. Mastering storytelling can significantly improve a candidate's chances of success in interviews.

UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology provides exceptional placement opportunities with a focus on equipping students with industry-relevant knowledge. The university was awarded 5-stars for employability by QS Rating and emphasizes industry partnerships for successful student placements. The school has strong internship programs, mandatory for all students, averaging eight weeks to six months, enhancing exposure to corporate life. Students benefit from comprehensive training through the EDGE program, which enhances skills in entrepreneurship, employability, and critical reasoning. In 2022-23, notable recruiters and competitive salary packages reflect the school's commitment to student success in health sciences.

The BBA (Green Energy and Sustainability - Green Energy Business) program at UPES prepares students for careers in non-conventional energy sources and sustainability. This three-year full-time program includes hands-on experience through internships, live projects, and guest lectures. Students gain insights into solar energy, regulatory frameworks, and carbon management, enhancing career prospects in green energy sectors. Graduates can pursue roles like Renewable Energy Project Developer and Sustainability Consultant. The course emphasizes practical learning with a focus on technology and industry collaboration, leading to opportunities in a growing field driven by sustainability trends. Networking and research opportunities further enrich the program.

The UPES blog highlights the successful India Immersion Program that welcomed 13 Russian students and 4 faculty members from HSE University, focusing on cultural exchange and understanding of India’s societal context. Over 15 days, participants engaged in academic sessions, community visits, and workshops led by experts like Dr. Anil Prakash Joshi. Ksenia Pugina and Alina Khitraia, students from Russia, praised the program for its enriching cultural and academic exchanges, while UPES included activities like yoga and sports in scenic locations. The initiative aimed to foster global leadership skills among students through immersive experiences in India's diverse culture.

Dr. P.C. Bahuguna is a senior associate professor at the School of Business, UPES, with over 20 years of academic and industrial experience, including roles at ITC and Panacea Biotech. Dr. Bahuguna specializes in HR management, organizational behavior, and strategic talent management. As head of the research wing, Dr. Bahuguna oversees over 30 research scholars, aiming to foster a productive research environment. Dr. Bahuguna's teaching philosophy emphasizes student engagement and experiential learning, and Dr. Bahuguna teaches several courses, including Organizational Behavior and Human Resource Management, while actively publishing in reputable journals and participating in scholarly activities.

The BA Digital and Mass Media (Broadcasting) program at UPES School of Liberal Studies focuses on Digital Studio Management, Live Broadcasting, and Floor Production. The program emphasizes practical training over six semesters, offering skills in video production, mobile journalism, and digital content monetization. Students benefit from state-of-the-art facilities, mentorship by industry professionals, and a specialized podcasting course. Graduates can pursue careers as live show producers, video production coordinators, and more, with placement assistance for five years. The program addresses evolving media trends, preparing students for roles in digital marketing, SEO, and content creation.

The webpage highlights student achievements and certifications at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). It showcases notable accomplishments of students across various disciplines, such as engineering, business, law, design, and health sciences. The UPES emphasizes the impact of its academic programs and extracurricular activities in shaping successful careers for students. The platform also provides resources for admissions, campus life, and placements, reflecting UPES's commitment to student success and industry readiness.

The BA Journalism and Mass Communication (Digital) - Social Media and Search Engine Optimization program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is a 3+1 years degree designed to equip students with essential skills for the media industry. The program focuses on practical application and includes training in social media tools, content creation, and SEO. Graduates can pursue careers as social media managers, SEO analysts, and more, with placement opportunities at prominent media houses. The curriculum blends theory with hands-on experience, preparing students for dynamic roles in digital media amidst evolving technology trends.

The Rise of Sustainable Fashion by Ekta Kashyap discusses the urgent need for sustainable practices in the fashion industry to combat textile waste and environmental degradation. The fashion industry contributes significantly to global pollution, with fast fashion exacerbating resource depletion. Brands like Louis Vuitton, H&M, and India's PECKD are adopting sustainable strategies, including using eco-friendly materials and promoting recycling. E-commerce platforms facilitate renting and selling used clothes to reduce waste. Education in sustainable fashion is essential for aspiring designers, with courses available at institutions like UPES to equip them with the necessary skills.

UPES organized a two-day fair in collaboration with Dehradun-based NGOs to celebrate the joy of giving, showcasing products made by underprivileged communities, including orphaned children and marginalized women. Held on October 26 and 27, the event featured handicrafts, candles, and competitions such as Rangoli-making. Students actively supported this initiative aimed at raising awareness and promoting small-scale businesses. NGOs like I.D.E.A.L Foundation, Building Dreams Foundation, Him Foundation, Shuruwat Foundation, and Vichar Samiti contributed to the fair, focusing on social development and environmental conservation, aligning with UPES's commitment to community welfare and inclusivity.

Aayush Bijalwan, a graduate of UPES' School of Design, won the prestigious TVS Ntorq 125 Call of Design Season 2 competition. Aayush's winning design, featuring a comic book theme titled "Rise of the Ntorqians," captured the essence of TVS' race-themed aesthetics. For this achievement, Aayush Bijalwan received a TVS Ntorq 125 Race Edition motorcycle and a cash prize of Rs 30,000. The competition also recognized other designers, with notable runners-up receiving cash awards. A distinguished panel from TVS Motor Company evaluated the entries, reflecting UPES' commitment to excellence in design education.

The Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme at UPES, initiated by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, aims to boost PhD enrollments in Electronics and IT. UPES offers 5 allocated PhD seats, inviting applications from qualified Indian scholars. Benefits include a monthly fellowship, research grants, support for international conferences, and incentives upon degree completion. Research areas encompass VLSI, IoT, AI, machine learning, data science, cybersecurity, and more. Eligibility requires a post-graduate degree with at least 55% marks in relevant fields. The application deadline is September 5, 2024, with exams on September 7, 2024.

UPESMET-UG 2024 is the entrance examination for the BBA and Integrated BBA+MBA programs at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Applicants must have a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII. Selection is based on UPESMET-UG, UGAT’24, or CUET’24 scores. The online exam lasts 1.5 hours and consists of four sections totaling 120 questions. Key processes include taking a demo test, booking an exam slot, and receiving credentials via email. Results will be announced later. For inquiries, contact UPES at 1800-102-8737 or enrollments@upes.ac.in.

UPES design students Ekta Kashyap, Ishaan Gupta, Kousik Dutta, Lakshya Agarwal, and Aditya Rajput developed “Renteco,” a hyper-local renting service for college essentials. Mentored by experts from IBM and IKEA, Renteco emphasizes sustainability by renting only used items. The project won multiple accolades, including the CII Young Designer Award 2022 and recognition at the Student Service Design Challenge 2022. The team utilized a gamified system to promote renting among peers, seeking to shift mindsets about consumption. Their dedication involved intensive collaboration over six months to create a viable and innovative service.

UPES promotes gender diversity and inclusivity through various social initiatives, including merit-based scholarships for girl students under Project Shakti, sport scholarships (Vijay), and freeships (Jyoti) for economically disadvantaged students. UPES also supports martyrs' families via Project Naman and other initiatives like Project EDUDHURMA and Project Abhilasha, aiming to positively impact hundreds of families. Scholarships range from 20% tuition fee reduction for meritorious girls to up to 100% for sports achievers. UPES is dedicated to creating a supportive educational environment for underprivileged and deserving students.

UPES offers an MBA program for the 2024 academic year, with admissions closing on August 31, 2024. The MBA provides various specializations including Marketing, Finance, HR, Operations, and Digital Business among others. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in Class X, XII, and graduation from a recognized university. Admission is through UPESMET or national level tests like CAT or GMAT. The fee structure varies by specialization. UPES boasts a 100% placement rate for 2022-23, with top recruiters including Infosys and IBM, and ranks 41st in the NIRF management category in 2024.

Rodolphe Gelin is an AI expert at Renault, Paris, with a career beginning at the French Atomic Energy Commission focusing on robot control and rehabilitation robotics. Rodolphe Gelin managed teams in robotics, virtual reality, and cognitics. In 2009, Rodolphe Gelin led the ROMEO project at SoftBank Robotics to create a humanoid robot for elderly assistance. Since 2019, Rodolphe Gelin has specialized in deep learning for autonomous and connected vehicles, emphasizing the development of trustworthy AI at Renault.

Vishu Mittal, an accomplished alumnus of the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), graduated in 2013 with a B.Tech in Electronics Engineering. In 2012, Vishu Mittal was selected for the prestigious MITCAS global link program and completed an internship at École Polytechnique de Montréal, Canada. Vishu Mittal received the University Silver Medal at graduation and later earned an M.S. from Technical University Munich, Germany. Currently, Vishu Mittal works as a Senior GNSS R&D Engineer at Trimble, showcasing the success of UPES alumni in their professional careers.

Nawtej Dosanjh is the President and CEO of MirraU, a Florida-based start-up university focused on healthcare management education. He has extensive expertise in international academic impact, education program design, and digital education technology. Nawtej co-founded Unities, a digital economy think tank supported by the University of Exeter, and is a senior research fellow and advisory board member at Emory and Henry School of Business in Virginia, USA. His leadership and innovation have helped multiple institutions achieve degree-awarding powers and accreditation, as well as integrate emerging technology into curricula. Nawtej's research interests include higher education transformation and access to affordable quality education.

Saurabh Shanu is an Assistant Professor-Selection Grade at UPES, where he has been teaching for 7 years. Saurabh Shanu holds a Bachelor of Technology from ICFAI University and a Master’s in Computer Science from UPES, specializing in AI and ANN. Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science at UPES, Saurabh Shanu focuses on Complex Network Analysis for wildlife corridors. Saurabh Shanu has developed 'Animeter' for camera trap image analysis and has led various projects on wildlife conservation. Saurabh Shanu has published numerous peer-reviewed papers and received several best paper awards at conferences.

Manishankar received the Best Poster Presentation Award at the 3rd International Conference of Integrative Chemistry, Biology, and Translational Medicine (ICBTM2024) in Udaipur, Rajasthan. His research, titled "Gallbladder Cancer and its Association with Heavy Metals and Pesticides," was well-received. Manishankar expressed gratitude to his PhD guide, Professor Dr. Dhruv Kumar, and acknowledged the support from professors and researchers, including Professor Ram Sharma, Professor Padma Venkat, Dr. Kuldeep Roy, Dr. Arun Kumar, Ashok Ghosh, and Professor Maiko from the University of Tokyo, Japan.

Akshat Singhal, Prerna Choudhary, Urvashi Rathore, and Anmol Yadav, B.Tech. CSE students from UPES (2020-24), developed a project titled "Breast Cancer Classification using Deep Learning." The project focuses on early detection of breast cancer using advanced deep learning technologies, particularly Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN). This initiative aims to enhance the accuracy of breast cancer image classification, significantly improving patient outcomes and reducing mortality rates. The project emphasizes the pivotal role of machine learning algorithms in medical research and highlights the importance of timely detection and effective treatment strategies for breast cancer. The project's code can be accessed on GitHub.

Ashutosh Tripathi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES. Mr. Ashutosh Tripathi holds a B.Com and LL.B from the University of Allahabad and an LL.M from NLSIU, Bangalore. He specializes in Constitutional Law, Administrative Law, and Human Rights, with nine years of teaching experience, previously at Amity University Noida. Mr. Ashutosh Tripathi employs the Socratic Method in teaching and has published research on various legal topics in respected journals and conferences. His research interests encompass Constitutional, Administrative, International Law, Human Rights, and Environmental Law. Mr. Ashutosh Tripathi can be contacted at a.tripathi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a B.Tech. program with specializations in Aerospace, Chemical, Civil, Sustainability, Electrical, Electronics, Mechanical, Automotive, and Applied Petroleum Engineering. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Class XII PCM and valid scores from JEE Mains or other exams. The 4-year curriculum focuses on industry collaboration, innovative teaching, and practical experience through state-of-the-art facilities. The program promotes career opportunities in diverse engineering sectors, boasting a strong placement record. Scholarships are available for eligible students, and hostel accommodations are provided. Classes begin August 31, 2024.

Dr. Monalisa Anand is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES Dehradun. Dr. Monalisa Anand completed a PhD from BITS Pilani Goa in April 2024, focusing on Mathematical Modelling and Epidemiology. Dr. Monalisa Anand teaches courses such as Linear Algebra and Differential Equations and has experience as a teaching assistant. Dr. Monalisa Anand has published articles and received various awards, including a SERB International Travel Grant for a conference in Tokyo. Dr. Monalisa Anand is committed to inspiring students in mathematics through practical applications.

Dr. Ajar Rab is a Partner at ANR LAW LLP, Dehradun, with over 11 years of experience in international arbitration, corporate transactions, and commercial litigation, particularly in energy disputes and infrastructure matters. Dr. Ajar Rab has worked with government bodies and is an International Policy Consultant at Lexidale. Dr. Ajar Rab is also a distinguished author of legal texts on arbitration and real estate law, and has published influential papers in major legal journals, with contributions cited by the Supreme Court in significant rulings.

Dr. Pavan Kumar is selected as a Fellow for the South Asian Futures Fellowship Programme 2023, organized by the Council for Strategic and Defense Research (CSDR) in New Delhi with support from Friedrich-Ebert-Stiftung (FES) India. The fellowship runs from August 1, 2023, to July 30, 2024, and aims to promote 15 Early Career Researchers (ECRs) aged 25-35 from South Asia. Participants will explore Non-Traditional Security (NTS) and geopolitics topics, with five fellows required to participate in a 30-day residency at a non-domicile South Asian think tank.

The BA/BBA/B.Com. LL.B. Hons. program in Intellectual Property Rights at UPES School of Law offers a comprehensive understanding of intellectual property law. The curriculum covers copyright, trademark, patent laws, and real-world applications through practical experiences like mock disputes. Taught by experienced faculty, the program prepares students for careers as IP lawyers, consultants, and analysts amid a growing demand for IPR expertise due to digital advancements and globalization. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in higher secondary education, with selection based on ULSAT/CLAT/LSAT-India exam performance or board marks.

Dr. Ajay Kumar, a distinguished figure in Mechanical Engineering, has been recognized as one of the World’s Top 2% Scientists. Dr. Ajay Kumar serves on the panel of the University Grants Commission (UGC) in New Delhi as an evaluator for fellowships and research grants, particularly the Dr. D. S. Kothari research grant aimed at newly recruited faculty members. The recognition highlights Dr. Ajay Kumar's significant contributions to research and academia in the field of engineering.

Bhumika Ray is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, pursuing a Ph.D. in Organisational Behaviour and Human Resource Management at the Indian Institute of Management, Sambalpur, India. Bhumika Ray holds an MBA and a B.A. in Foundations of Management from the Indian Institute of Management, Indore, and a B.A. (Hons) in Sociology from Indira Gandhi National Open University. Bhumika Ray's research interests include Future of Work, Gig Employment, Employer-Employee Relationships, Psychological Contracts, and Well-Being. Bhumika Ray can be contacted at bhumika.ray@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Jhanavi Sharma and Rohan Kumar are MSc students specializing in Microbiology and Integrated BSc-MSc programs at UPES. They conducted a project titled COVAT study to assess the serological response to COVID-19 vaccines among the Indian cohort in Uttarakhand. This cross-sectional serosurvey was executed on May 3 and 4, 2023, on the UPES campus, funded by Genotypic Technology Pvt Ltd and UPES R&D. The study aimed to evaluate whether COVID-19 vaccines effectively induced antibody production amidst a growing number of cases in India, promoting informed decisions about booster vaccinations. Their mentor is Dr. Smriti Arora.

Dr. Shalendra Kumar is a distinguished professor in the Department of Physics at UPES, Dehradun, noted for significant contributions to materials science, particularly in nanomagnetism and carbon/metal oxide-based nanocomposites. Recognized among the top 2% of global researchers by Stanford University, Dr. Kumar has published over 300 research articles and has a high citation impact. With teaching experience across multiple physics subjects, Dr. Kumar fosters a dynamic learning environment and has guided more than 5 PhD students. He has received numerous grants and awards, emphasizing his international recognition and commitment to advancing scientific knowledge.

Mr. Amitabh Sharma is an Advisory Board Member at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) and a Partner at NorthExcel Associates. Mr. Amitabh Sharma has over 25 years of diverse legal experience in India, specializing in domestic and outbound Mergers & Acquisitions, Private Equity, Corporate-Commercial Advisory, and Infrastructure, Energy, and Resources Law/Policy. Mr. Amitabh Sharma has successfully represented major domestic conglomerates, multinational corporations, and financial institutions, with expertise in Project Development & Finance, Public-Private Partnerships, Corporate Litigation Strategy, and Regulatory & Policy matters.

Arup Majumdar is a Professor of Practice in Strategy at UPES Dehradun with over 30 years of corporate and academic experience, having taught at institutions like Shiv Nadar University and IMT Ghaziabad. Arup Majumdar focuses on experiential learning and employs case methods to teach strategy, organizational behavior, and leadership. Arup Majumdar has worked with major corporations globally and founded Trariti Consulting Group. Arup Majumdar aims to prepare students for real-world challenges using structured thinking and storytelling. Arup Majumdar holds the Emerson Technology Award and has published multiple cases in renowned academic platforms.

When choosing a university, students should consider academic quality, program availability, accreditation, admission requirements, location, living costs, and career support. It's essential to evaluate curricula and university facilities, ensuring the institution meets personal and professional goals. Selecting a university is a significant decision that affects future opportunities. UPES offers diverse programs across various schools and provides options like the Global Pathway Programme and the Design Your Own Degree. Located in Dehradun, UPES boasts a pollution-free campus and a focus on innovative, learner-driven educational methods, as well as support for holistic student development.

Dr. Touseef Iqbal, Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, possesses a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from Islamic University of Science and Technology, an M.Tech from Central University of Jammu, and a Ph.D. from NIT Srinagar. Dr. Touseef Iqbal specializes in image processing, computer vision, machine learning, natural language processing, and generative AI, with numerous publications in SCI and Scopus-indexed journals. Dr. Touseef Iqbal teaches various subjects, including data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and machine learning, informed by a diverse teaching philosophy incorporating essentialism and constructivism. Dr. Touseef Iqbal can be contacted at touseef.iqbal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Akash Jain and Arsh Bansal, 4th-year Bachelor of Pharmacy students at UPES, developed a nano biosensor for detecting chlorpyrifos pesticide in milk. The project addresses the critical issue of pesticide contamination in dairy, which poses health risks and is under-researched. Guided by Dr. Jyoti Upadhyay and Dr. Ashish Mathur, the students received extensive support from the School of Health Sciences and Technology and the Research & Development Team, enhancing their understanding of biosensors and research methodologies. This innovation aims to contribute to food safety and environmental protection.

Dr. Amit Kumar Chawla is a Senior Associate Professor at UPES, specializing in nanotechnology and material science with 15 years of experience. He has established advanced research labs and supervises the Centre of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology. Dr. Chawla's research focuses on thin film-based hydrogen sensors, hard coatings, and resistive random-access memory. His teaching philosophy prioritizes learner engagement and employs technology to enhance education. Dr. Chawla has published over 75 articles and holds memberships in professional associations. He has received awards, including funding from DST, for contributions to scientific research and knowledge dissemination.

Professor Rakesh Sah is a leading academic in the School of Design at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), with over 18 years of experience in design, education, and consultancy. Rakesh Sah specializes in Ceramic and Glass Design, holding a degree from the National Institute of Design and a qualification in International Business Management from The University of Salford. Rakesh Sah teaches various design courses and has significant involvement in research and community activities. Rakesh Sah's teaching emphasizes critical thinking and user-centric design, supported by numerous awards, including the Inlaks Abroad Scholarship. Rakesh Sah can be contacted at rakesh.sah@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Richa Chilana is a faculty member at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES and has achieved notable recognition as the co-editor of "Punching Up in Stand-Up Comedy: Speaking Truth to Power," published by Routledge in 2023. This work highlights Richa Chilana's dedication to amplifying marginalized voices and challenging social norms through comedy. Richa Chilana's contribution to this publication showcases expertise in comedy and social commentary, establishing Richa Chilana as a respected figure in the field and an inspiration for aspiring comedians and advocates for social change.

Dr. Kshitiz Mishra is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, holding a PhD in Economics from Shiv Nadar University. His research focuses on Macroeconomics, monetary policy, and development economics. Dr. Kshitiz has presented at major conferences and has published work in the Journal of Quantitative Economics. He teaches Macroeconomics, Mathematical Economics, and Intermediate Microeconomics, employing interactive teaching methods. Dr. Kshitiz has prior experience at India Development Foundation and has taught at various universities including Shiv Nadar University. He enjoys cooking, reading non-fiction, and fitness activities. Contact: kshitiz.mishra@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Souradeep Roy is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, specializing in nanotechnology and biomolecular sensor development for healthcare and environmental applications. Dr. Roy holds a B.Tech in Electronics and Instrumentation, M.Tech in Nanotechnology, and a PhD from Amity University, having conducted research in the UK. With over 30 publications, 4 patents, and awards for research excellence, Dr. Roy's teaching philosophy emphasizes fundamental understanding and multidisciplinary learning. Major research interests include nano-electrochemistry and connected health. Contact: souradeep.roy@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Kaushik Ghosh is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with 21 years of academic experience. Kaushik Ghosh earned a B.E. from Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology and a M.Tech and Ph.D. from Jadavpur University, focusing on Wireless Sensor Networks. Kaushik Ghosh has published over 40 research papers and designed a course on IoT for the MSME, Government of India. Kaushik Ghosh's research interests include Wireless Sensor Networks, IoT, and Machine Learning. Kaushik Ghosh has received multiple awards for research, including the Lifeway Tech India's Best Senior Researcher Award for 2022.

Rouzbeh Abbassi is an Associate Professor and Director of Research at the School of Engineering, Macquarie University, in Sydney, Australia. He leads the Civil Engineering Program and holds adjunct professor roles at Memorial University and the University of Tasmania. Dr. Abbassi earned a PhD in environmental engineering and has completed two postdoctoral fellowships. He specializes in risk and safety engineering for energy activities and collaborates on significant research projects. With over 150 published papers and an h-index of 34, he is an editorial member for several journals in process safety and integrated security science.

Dr. Divya Ahluwalia is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 19 years of teaching experience. She earned her Ph.D. from IIT Roorkee and has authored and edited research articles and books. Dr. Divya Ahluwalia's research interests encompass Control Theory, Educational Research, Dynamical Systems, and Renewable Energy. She teaches Engineering Mathematics and has led initiatives like 'Math-Mania.' Dr. Divya Ahluwalia received the Blackboard Catalysts Award in 2019 for innovation in education and is involved in various university committees and faculty development programs. Contact: dahluwalia@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BBA in Marketing Management program at UPES offers a comprehensive three-year undergraduate education focused on core marketing principles. The program includes market research, consumer behavior, product development, and a capstone project for real-world application. Graduates gain practical skills through internships, industry visits, and guest lectures. UPES is ranked 39th in India by NIRF 2023, and has partnerships with major companies for networking opportunities. Graduates can pursue careers as brand managers, digital marketing managers, or consultants, with salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum based on experience and skills.

UPES outlines its Terms and Conditions governing the use of its websites, emphasizing that information is subject to change due to academic reviews. The blog by Manas Ranjan Mishra discusses neurodiversity in the workplace, emphasizing the importance of designing inclusive environments for neurodiverse individuals. Neurodiversity includes conditions like Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), ADHD, and dyslexia, which often come with unique strengths and challenges. Employers are encouraged to accommodate these differences by creating adaptable workspaces that address sensory sensitivities and enhance productivity. Key design strategies include thoughtful use of lighting, versatile acoustic settings, and clear signage. Creating such inclusive workplaces not only promotes equality but also provides companies with a competitive advantage and contributes to a positive workplace culture.

The Integrated BBA-MBA program in Human Resource at UPES combines undergraduate and postgraduate studies focusing on HR. Students study Digital Human Resource Management, Compensation Management, and engage in practical experiences through internships and industry exposure. Graduates can pursue diverse careers in HR roles like HR manager, consultant, or talent manager, with starting salaries ranging from INR 6-30 lakh per annum. The program emphasizes strategic HR management, technology integration, and ethical practices. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Classes X and XII, and selection is based on performances in entrance exams.

Dr Ranjna Sirohi is an Associate Professor at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies in Uttarakhand, India. The article "Designing the Future: Trends and Strategies in Product Design" by Manas Ranjan Mishra discusses the evolution of product design over the last two decades, emphasizing the impact of technological advancements such as AI and IoT. It explores the need for balance between efficiency and human creativity, highlighting ongoing trends like human-centered design and sustainability. Mishra stresses that while processes will modernize, creativity remains vital. The future of product design will be shaped by regulations, data governance, and the increasing importance of meta-design in a digital world. Effective product design will integrate innovation while considering user needs.

Dr. Kirola's research focuses on human genetic diseases, particularly neurological disorders, leveraging multi-omics tools. Dr. Kirola's significant contributions include the identification of a SYNJ1 gene mutation related to early Parkinson's disease in India. Dr. Kirola has experience in teaching, mentorship, and reviewing for various scientific journals. Dr. Kirola actively seeks collaborations for research in neurogenetics and aims to integrate AI in genomics.

Rishabh Srivastava is a prominent data scientist based in Singapore and the Co-Founder of Data Narratives and Lok.ai. Rishabh Srivastava has leveraged artificial intelligence, data automation, and SAP for various commercial and public policy projects across numerous companies and governments. Prior to these ventures, Rishabh Srivastava founded a media automation company serving over 100 million unique IPs and developed data solutions for large enterprises in Asia. Rishabh Srivastava's work at Loki.ai provided data APIs for major Asian corporations, generating over 5 billion API requests. Rishabh Srivastava also created an AI suite for automated content generation that achieved significant success.

David Diop, the 2021 International Booker Prize winner, discussed his award-winning novel ‘Frère d’âme’ (‘At Night All Blood Is Black’) during an event hosted by UPES and the French Institute in India. Diop highlighted his writing process, particularly his use of stream-of-consciousness style to convey the experiences of Senegalese infantrymen in World War I. Diop was inspired by French soldiers' letters and sought to embody the emotional complexities of war. The translated title reflects deeper themes inherent in the original French title, merging concepts of brotherhood and conflict. Anna Moschovakis translated the novel, emphasizing literary techniques that enhance storytelling.

The M.Tech. Health, Safety, and Environment program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering prepares engineering graduates for managerial roles in health, safety, and environmental sectors. The curriculum includes topics such as fire engineering, process safety, and environmental regulations, emphasizing practical learning through industry exposure. Graduates are well-positioned for careers as Health and Safety Managers, Environmental Consultants, and Safety Engineers in sectors like construction and manufacturing. The program features strong industry ties for internships and placements, ensuring high employability rates. Graduates contribute significantly to sustainable practices and safety compliance in various industries.

Dr. R. S. Sharma is a prominent advisory board member at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. Dr. R. S. Sharma is a retired Senior Deputy Director General of the Indian Council of Medical Research. Dr. R. S. Sharma has held multiple significant roles, including Emeritus Scientist and Head of the Division of Reproductive Biology and Maternal Health. Dr. R. S. Sharma's contributions include developing national guidelines for ART clinics and drafting legislation for Assisted Reproductive Technology and Surrogacy in India. Dr. R. S. Sharma has received several prestigious awards for professional achievements, including lifetime achievement awards from ACE, ISSRF, and YUVA ISAR.

The M.Des. (Masters in Communication Design) program at UPES equips students with advanced skills in visual communication, brand identity, and design thinking. The curriculum includes hands-on projects in graphic design, typography, and layout, fostering critical and contextual understanding of the field. Students benefit from state-of-the-art facilities and mentorship from experienced faculty. Graduates are prepared for diverse roles such as graphic designers, art directors, and UX designers, with strong industry demand reflected in notable placements and competitive salaries. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in relevant qualifications and selection is based on exams and interviews.

The UPES Computer Science blog discusses various trends and topics within the computer science field, focusing on ethical dilemmas of artificial intelligence such as ChatGPT and its impact on work efficiency. Notable articles include insights on career benefits for M.Tech. graduates, the significance of BCA, and the appeal of artificial intelligence and machine learning as top career paths. The blog also highlights UPES initiatives, research funding, and alumni success stories, aiming to engage students on their academic and career paths in technology.

Dr. Minhaj Abdullah is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES with over 20 years of experience in animation and education. Holding a Ph.D. in computer science, Dr. Abdullah specializes in 3D modeling, animation, and e-learning. Dr. Abdullah has previously held leadership roles in academia and industry, managing production teams and delivering high-quality projects. Dr. Abdullah emphasizes a student-centered teaching philosophy and collaborates with students in various projects. Dr. Abdullah has received numerous awards, including the Golden Pixels Award, and has published scholarly articles and contributed to educational resources.

The webpage, authored by Ekta Kashyap, discusses International Trade and Investment Law (ITIL) as a promising career for law professionals. It highlights the significance of ITIL in facilitating global trade, managing legal disputes, and ensuring adherence to international regulations. The World Trade Organisation (WTO) is emphasized as a key player in ITIL's framework since 1995. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) offers specialized law programs, including BBA LL.B. (Hons.) in ITIL, combining strong curriculum and experiential learning, aimed at preparing students for lucrative careers in global commerce and government agencies.

Dr. Sushabhan Choudhary from the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES has secured a DST FIST project grant amounting to INR 11,400,000 for research on communication and battery infrastructure. The project focuses on developing a high-speed microwave telecommunications facility between the UPES Bidholi and Kandoli campuses to explore issues related to communications and weather in mountainous areas. Additionally, a battery management system will be established for designing, manufacturing, and testing battery packs to support various flagship projects. This initiative aims to enhance strategic engineering applications and infrastructure in these critical areas.

Vikash Kumar, Arihant Vardhan, Arpita Kumari, and Tanushpreet Kaur are B.Tech. CSE students specializing in Cloud Computing and Virtualization from the batch of 2020-24. They developed a web application called the Phone Book System, implementing a TRIE Data Structure for efficient contact management. The application allows users to store, search, and view contact information in a centralized platform, streamlining the process of managing contacts. By utilizing the TRIE Data Structure, the system enhances data retrieval speed and accuracy, providing an organized solution for managing essential contact details in a digital format. Download the application on GitHub.

The webpage "Sustainable Development at UPES" outlines the initiatives taken by the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) to promote sustainability. It focuses on environmental impact through actions like climate planning, establishing the Centre for Energy, Environment, and Sustainability Studies (CEESS), and implementing sustainable policies for purchasing and investment. Social impacts include promoting equality and health, while governance aspects cover anti-corruption, ethical conduct policies, and effective organizational practices. UPES emphasizes integrating sustainability across its academic and operational frameworks, contributing positively to environmental, social, and governance standards.

Suketu Sandeep Mehta, a current MBA Strategy and Consulting student at UPES, has achieved recognition by publishing a review article on the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee's meeting for September 2022 in Business World Magazine. This accomplishment highlights Suketu Sandeep Mehta's engagement with significant financial topics and showcases the academic excellence at the School of Business, UPES.

The webpage outlines the commitment of UPES (University of Petroleum and Energy Studies) to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), emphasizing the importance of education, research, and innovation in achieving sustainable development. UPES integrates sustainability into its curriculum and engages in community programs to address challenges like quality education, clean energy, and gender equality. Located in Uttarakhand's unique geographic setting, UPES aims to empower individuals through initiatives like leadership development and smart village projects. The university encourages collective efforts to create a sustainable and equitable future, inviting community participation in its SDG initiatives.

Dr. Sunita Varjani is a Senior Associate Professor at UPES's School of Advanced Engineering, specializing in environmental and industrial biotechnology, bioprocess technology, and waste management. She is a member of The National Academy of Sciences, India, and has held key roles in various academic institutions and government boards. Dr. Varjani's research focuses on pollution control and circular bioeconomy, evidenced by over 480 publications and recognition as a "Highly Cited Researcher." She adopts an interactive teaching approach, emphasizing real-world applications. Dr. Varjani has received numerous awards for her contributions to biotechnology and sustainable practices. Contact: sunita.varjani@ddn.upes.ac.in.

ABSIN is India's first AI-powered digital law professor, developed as a digital twin of Abhishek Sinha, Associate Dean and Professor at UPES School of Law. ABSIN integrates extensive legal expertise to offer personalized, interactive tutorials, revolutionizing legal education. This innovative approach aims to enhance learning experiences for students and pave the way for advancements in the field of law.

World Pharmacists Day 2023 was celebrated at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, Dehradun on September 25, focusing on the theme “Pharmacists strengthening health system-Angdaan Mahadaan.” This theme emphasized the importance of organ donation. The event featured speeches by key guests including Dr. S. Farooq and Dr. Raj K. Bakshi, discussions on healthcare, a skit on organ donation, and competitions to raise awareness. A book titled “Oxides for Medical Applications” by Dr. Piyush Kumar was launched. The celebration aimed to honor the contribution of pharmacists and promote organ donation awareness among students and faculty.

The B.Com - LLB (Hons.) program at UPES is a 5-year integrated undergraduate degree combining Commerce and Law. Eligible candidates must have at least 50% marks in classes X and XII. Admissions are through ULSAT or merit-based pathways like CLAT and L-SAT. The program includes tuition fees approximating ₹2,31,928 by the final semester and offers ten specializations, preparing students for diverse career opportunities in corporate and public sectors. UPES School of Law features experienced faculty, strong industry connections, and scholarships for eligible students, ensuring a comprehensive legal education and placement opportunities.

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) blog homepage features diverse categories covering advanced engineering, business, computer science, design, health sciences, law, and liberal studies. It serves as a resource for students and prospective applicants, providing insights about academic programs, placements, global opportunities, and campus life. Visitors can subscribe for updates and access various educational content. UPES aims to promote academic excellence and entrepreneurship while enhancing global exposure and student outcomes. The blog is a valuable platform for exploring university offerings and connecting with the UPES community.

The UPES Academic Calendar webpage provides important dates and details regarding academic events, holidays, and non-academic activities at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). It includes comprehensive information relevant for students, such as event schedules and eligibility criteria for various programs offered by UPES across its schools, including Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Design, Health Sciences, Law, and Liberal Studies. Prospective students can find resources for admissions, program information, and contact details for inquiries. The calendar is a vital resource for those planning their academic year at UPES.

Manish Kumar is a Professor and Head of the Department of Civil, Health, Safety, and Environment at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in Dehradun, India. He is also a Distinguished Professor in Water Science at Tec de Monterrey, Mexico. Manish Kumar holds a PhD in Environmental Engineering from the University of Tokyo and has supervised numerous PhD and master’s theses. With approximately 200 publications and a strong research focus on water-based waste epidemiology, Manish Kumar has received several awards and funds exceeding INR 50 million for research projects. He actively contributes to various scientific journals and committees, emphasizing sustainable development in education.

The Master of Computer Application (MCA) in Data Science at UPES School of Computer Science offers a comprehensive curriculum designed by experts, blending theoretical knowledge and practical experience from the outset. Integral components include hands-on projects, industry internships, and research opportunities. Graduates are equipped for various roles such as Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer, in sectors like finance and healthcare. The program boasts impressive placement statistics, with an average salary of 4.92 LPA and a highest CTC of 11.2 LPA, reflecting its industry relevance and effectiveness in preparing students for successful careers in data science.

Dr. Devender Kumar Saini is an Associate Professor at UPES School of Advanced Engineering. He earned an M.Tech. in Electrical Engineering from IIT Roorkee and a Ph.D. focusing on controller design for uncertain interval systems. Dr. Saini has published over 60 research papers and is an IEEE Senior Member. His research includes power system planning with distributed energy resources and electric vehicles. He emphasizes technical education for social benefits and has received multiple awards, including recognition from Southern Indian Railways for fault detection algorithms. Dr. Saini teaches various electrical engineering courses and mentors Ph.D. students.

Dr. Saurabh Kumar Bharti is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in dynamics, control systems, nonlinear vibration, and multibody dynamics. Dr. Saurabh has expertise in simulation tools such as MATLAB/Simulink and finite element analysis tools like Ansys. With prior experience at IIT Kharagpur and GLA University, Dr. Saurabh emphasizes understanding concepts in teaching. Dr. Saurabh has received multiple awards, including the Academic Excellence Award and MHRD scholarships. Research interests include nonlinear dynamics and structural dynamics, with seven SCI-indexed publications and a co-authored book chapter. Contact Dr. Saurabh at saurabhk.bharti@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage provides information about the Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Energy program offered by the School of Advanced Engineering at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). It outlines the course structure, eligibility criteria, admission process, and student support. UPES emphasizes preparing students for careers in the energy sector through comprehensive curriculum and industry connections. Prospective students can apply online, contact counselors, or download brochures for detailed insights into the program and its benefits for aspiring energy professionals. UPES promotes a strong academic and campus life environment conducive to learning and growth.

Dr. Raju Roychowdhury is an Associate Professor in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in emergent gravity, noncommutative geometry, and mathematical physics. After obtaining degrees from the University of Calcutta, IIT Kanpur, TIFR, and the University of Napoli Federico II, Dr. Roychowdhury worked in various academic positions in India, Korea, Brazil, and China. Dr. Roychowdhury's research interests include gauge theory, gravity, and geometry, with ongoing projects in emergent gravity and its geometric structures. Dr. Roychowdhury promotes an engaging and discovery-oriented teaching philosophy aimed at motivating students in physics.

Dr. Debashis Ghosh serves as an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in combinatorial designs and their applications in coding theory and cryptography. Dr. Ghosh has extensive teaching experience, offering courses like Advanced Engineering Mathematics and Number Theory. His research focuses on the construction and optimality criteria of designs. Dr. Ghosh has published articles in reputed journals and holds qualifications such as NET Junior Research Fellowship. He actively supervises student dissertations and participates in departmental committees, promoting a student-centric teaching philosophy that encourages question-asking and relevance to real-world applications.

Srinath G.M. serves as an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Liberal Studies, specializing in photography and documentary filmmaking. An internationally published photographer, Srinath G.M. focuses on crafting brand narratives and documercials. After earning a Master’s in Commercial Photography from Arts University Bournemouth, Srinath G.M. gained a Tier-1 Entrepreneur Visa to provide photography services in London. Research interests include the interplay of technicality and visual playfulness in photography. Committed to fostering authentic visual expression in students, Srinath G.M. teaches various courses, including photography, cinematography, and documentary filmmaking.

Kumar Gaurav is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Computational Fluid Dynamics and Aerodynamics. His research focuses on multiphase flow and high-speed flows, including high-speed underwater vehicles and supercavitating torpedoes. Kumar Gaurav previously taught Aerospace Engineering at MVJ College of Engineering, Bengaluru. His teaching philosophy promotes an engaging learning environment that fosters critical thinking and problem-solving. Courses taught include Computational Fluid Dynamics, Grid Generation, and Aerodynamics. Kumar Gaurav actively publishes research and participates in international conferences to contribute to aerospace engineering. Contact Kumar Gaurav at kumarg@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES Advisory Board webpage outlines the governance and oversight structure of the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. It provides a directory of board members, highlighting their expertise and contributions to UPES. The Advisory Board plays a crucial role in enhancing academic standards, guiding strategic initiatives, and fostering industry connections. The webpage emphasizes UPES's commitment to quality education and innovative research across various disciplines, including engineering, business, law, and health sciences. For further inquiries, contact information and support resources are available.

The webpage details the collaboration between UPES (University of Petroleum and Energy Studies) and Cisco to enhance B.Tech. Electronics and Communication Engineering programs. This partnership provides students with opportunities to intern, engage, and network with Cisco experts, a global leader in IT and networking. Students benefit from access to industry knowledge, enhancing their educational experience and career prospects in the field of telecommunications and technology.

Dr. D.P. Singh is an Associate Professor at UPES's School of Advanced Engineering. Dr. D.P. Singh earned a Ph.D. in Experimental Nuclear Physics from Aligarh Muslim University in 2010. With over 75 published research articles and 100 conference presentations, Dr. D.P. Singh’s research focuses on nuclear reaction mechanisms and the production of radionuclides. Dr. D.P. Singh teaches various physics courses, promoting an interactive learning environment. Recognized as a Young Scientist by DST, Dr. D.P. Singh has secured multiple research grants and has supervised one Ph.D. student. Dr. D.P. Singh can be contacted at devendrapal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Amit Awasthi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 12 years of experience in research and teaching in Atmospheric Sciences and Climate Change. Dr. Awasthi has published 4 books and 40 papers with a significant impact factor and citation count. His teaching philosophy encourages active learning and real-world applications. Dr. Awasthi has received numerous awards and grants, including international recognition during a Postdoc fellowship in Taiwan. His research focuses on aerosols' impact on health and climate, collaborating with global universities on significant environmental projects. Contact via aawasthi@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BBA in Green Energy and Sustainability program at UPES School of Business is a three-year management course aimed at equipping students with knowledge on renewable energy and sustainability. The program offers specializations in Sustainable Development and Green Energy Business, integrating practical experiences like internships and live projects. Graduates can explore diverse career opportunities in renewable energy, project management, and sustainability consulting, with starting salaries ranging from INR 4-10 lakh annually. The curriculum emphasizes practical learning, case studies, and exposure to industry experts, positioning students for success in the growing green energy sector.

Brigitta Varghese, a B.Des. student specializing in Animation and VFX at UPES (University of Petroleum and Energy Studies) from the batch of 2020-24, developed a project focused on mental health among the elderly. This initiative includes a motion infographic and an awareness video that highlights the challenges faced by elderly individuals and offers suggestions for support. The project aims to raise awareness about elderly mental health issues. Brigitta Varghese's mentor for this project is Anjali Nayar, an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at UPES.

Robert Lensink is a Professor at the Faculty of Economics and Business at Groningen University. He is recognized for his extensive theoretical and empirical research across regions from South America to the Far East and has received a royal decoration in his country for his contributions. Additionally, Robert Lensink holds positions as Professor of Finance and Development at Wageningen University, Professor Extraordinary at the University of Stellenbosch Business School, and serves as a Resource Person for the African Economic Research Consortium. His research interests include micro and macroeconomics, finance, gender, and political economy, and he has published widely in top economics journals.

Avimesh Sharma is an Assistant Professor Senior Scale in Game Design at the School of Design, UPES. Avimesh Sharma holds a master's degree in Painting (MFA) and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Indian Sculptures. With over 12 years in the 3D Games & Animation industry, Avimesh Sharma has contributed to notable video game titles like Darksouls-2 and World of Tanks. Avimesh Sharma has earned over 30 awards and teaches various courses, emphasizing hands-on learning and real projects. Avimesh Sharma's research interests include 3D modeling, animation, and game design, alongside actively engaging students in competitions and conferences.

The M.Sc. Physics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a 2-year postgraduate course encompassing advanced Physics concepts, with specializations in Astronomy & Astrophysics and Materials Science & Nanotechnology. The curriculum integrates research experiences through an MoU with Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observational Sciences. Graduates gain practical skills and placements in fields such as electronics, telecommunications, and academia. The program emphasizes hands-on learning in state-of-the-art labs and supports preparation for competitive exams like CSIR-NET. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in 10th, 12th, and relevant undergraduate studies.

The B.Sc. Physics by Research in Computational Physics program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a comprehensive four-year undergraduate degree that emphasizes practical and theoretical training in computational tools to solve complex physical problems across various disciplines. The program includes coursework in classical mechanics, quantum mechanics, and advanced programming, supported by hands-on research projects and access to high-performance computing facilities. Graduates are prepared for diverse careers, including roles in research, data science, and quantitative finance. The program also facilitates placements through strong industry connections, ensuring students are well-equipped for the evolving job market.

Dr. Ranjeet Kumar Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in Statistics and Statistical Process Control (SPC). He earned a Ph.D. from Banaras Hindu University and focuses on Statistical Inference, Quality Control, and Process Improvement in manufacturing. Dr. Singh teaches Undergraduate and Post-graduate courses, utilizing tools like TORA and Excel. He has experience in curriculum development and industry collaboration. His research interests include real-time process monitoring and data analysis. Recognized with UGC-JRF and UGC-SRF fellowships, Dr. Singh is committed to fostering a supportive learning environment and has published extensively in statistical journals.

The article by Kishore Gopal Tikale discusses key trends shaping modern mobility solutions aimed at enhancing sustainability. Essential trends include the rise of electric vehicles (EVs), which reduce carbon emissions; shared mobility services that offer cost-effective alternatives to car ownership; and the efficiency of transportation systems utilizing real-time data. Additionally, the article highlights the significance of autonomous vehicles and the emerging Mobility as a Service (MaaS) model that integrates multiple transportation modes. Connectivity is crucial for optimizing traffic flow and improving user experience, contributing to an environmentally friendly and efficient transportation future.

UPES offers a B.Sc. (Hons.) in Psychology and Behaviour designed for comprehensive understanding of human cognition and behaviour through transdisciplinary learning and experiential pedagogy. The program integrates practical applications, encouraging students to engage in active learning via internships and community projects. Faculty comprises experts from prestigious institutions, enhancing global exposure. Graduates are equipped for various career paths, including clinical psychology and user experience research, through training in data analysis and research methodologies. Admission is competitive, with a limit of 40 seats. Eligibility requires at least 50% in 10th and 12th grades.

Nadeem Yousuf Khanday is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, with degrees in Computer Science and Engineering from VTU, VGU, and NIT Srinagar. His academic achievements include passing competitive exams such as GATE and UGC-NET. Nadeem Yousuf Khanday specializes in image processing, computer vision, machine learning, and visual learning, contributing significantly through publications in SCI and Scopus-indexed journals, and holding a patent. He previously taught at NIT Srinagar and the University of Kashmir, showcasing dedication to education and student engagement. Nadeem Yousuf Khanday emphasizes diverse teaching philosophies and offers courses in data structures, operating systems, and machine learning.

The webpage "10 Great Things About Going to a University" by the UPES Editorial Team highlights the benefits of attending university, particularly at UPES in Dehradun. It emphasizes in-depth learning in chosen subjects, forming lifelong friendships, and engaging in diverse extracurricular activities. The university offers global opportunities with international partnerships, strong career support, research opportunities, and experiential learning environments. The UPES School for Life focuses on essential life skills, while the UPES alumni network provides valuable connections. UPES prioritizes student wellbeing with comprehensive support services, making university a transformative experience.

Pooja Gautam is an Assistant Professor at UPES School of Law with a B.A., LL.B. (Hons.), and LL.M. from Dr. Ram Manohar Lohiya National Law University. Currently enrolled in a Ph.D. program at NALSAR University of Law, Pooja Gautam qualified for UGC-NET in 2012. Pooja Gautam's research interests include Sports Law, Intellectual Property Rights, Human Rights, and Women's Rights. Teaching courses such as Criminal Law and Arbitration, Pooja Gautam employs a flipped classroom model. Pooja Gautam has a strong publication record and has presented research at various conferences. Pooja Gautam can be contacted at pgautam@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Durga Prasad Panday is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Water Resources Engineering and Management. His research focuses on water quality and quantity, including the study of hydroclimatic extremes and conflict resolution in water sharing using game theory. With eight years of teaching experience, Professor Durga Prasad Panday effectively utilizes physical and online teaching methods, incorporating real projects and visual aids. He teaches core civil engineering courses such as Fluid Mechanics and Groundwater Hydrology. He has won a GATE scholarship and actively reviews for leading journals in his field. Contact: dpandays@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Ph.D. in Biotechnology program at UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology equips students with advanced skills in genetic engineering, molecular biology, and more. The program spans 3 to 4 years, emphasizing original research, publication, and conferences. Highlights include access to advanced labs, industry collaborations, and professional development workshops. Graduates are prepared for careers in academia, R&D, biotech industries, and government roles, addressing trends such as personalized medicine and environmental biotechnology. Admission for July 2024 includes a last application date of June 3, 2024, and various key milestones leading to program commencement on August 12, 2024.

The webpage discusses the significance of the Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) in Game Design offered at UPES, emphasizing how graduates are revolutionizing the gaming industry. The four-year curriculum combines creativity with technical skills, covering topics like game history, character design, and programming. Graduates pursue careers as game designers, asset designers, and more. The rise of B.Des. in Game Design is linked to the demand for immersive gaming experiences and user-centric design. The program fosters collaboration and innovation, enabling graduates to excel in various roles across the gaming sector and contributing to the growth of indie game development.

Dr. Gurunadh Velidi, a faculty member at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, has received the SERB SIRE Fellowship, allowing Dr. Gurunadh Velidi to engage in advanced research on flame stabilization in unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) engines. This fellowship will take place at UNIST in South Korea, enhancing international collaboration and the exchange of innovative research ideas in the field of mechanical engineering. Dr. Gurunadh Velidi's achievement highlights UPES's commitment to fostering cutting-edge research and academic excellence.

The B.Sc. (Hons.) in Geology program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering spans three years, covering 147 credits under the UGC-choice-based credit system. Key topics include Structural Geology, Stratigraphy, and Geoinformatics, utilizing software like ArcGIS and ERDAS for practical applications. Graduates are equipped for diverse careers, such as Geotechnical analysts and GIS developers, addressing national projects like Digital India and Smart Cities. The curriculum encourages further studies and enhances employability in various sectors, including environmental consultancy and mining. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII (PCM/B) and selection involves a personal interview.

Jeeten Krishna Giri is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, holding a Ph.D. from Southern Illinois University Carbondale. Jeeten specializes in international trade and development economics, utilizing household survey data for policy-relevant research. Jeeten has taught at various institutions, including DIT University and Union College, focusing on Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Development Economics, and Econometrics. Jeeten's research interests encompass women empowerment, health, and regional wages. Jeeten received recognition as Best Student Teacher in 2017 and has published in esteemed journals. Jeeten’s teaching philosophy promotes student engagement and teamwork.

The B.Tech. Biotechnology (Bioinformatics) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology equips students with skills in computational tools and biological data analysis. The curriculum covers subjects like genomics, molecular biology, and data science, with practical experience through state-of-the-art labs and industry partnerships. Graduates can pursue careers as bioinformatics analysts, research scientists, and data scientists in biotechnology, healthcare, and pharmaceuticals. The program boasts excellent placement records and offers financial support for research projects. Eligibility requires 50% marks in X & XII with specified subjects. Admission is based on UPESEAT, JEE Mains, or equivalent scores.

Mansha Dhingra discusses the essential traits for success in corporate law on the UPES blog. Key traits include perseverance for problem-solving, sharp analytical skills to distill complex information, strong listening abilities to understand clients, effective multitasking to handle various responsibilities, sound decision-making for client interests, and public speaking skills for effective communication in legal settings. Aspiring corporate lawyers should cultivate these traits alongside completing a law degree, such as BBA LLB Hons. at UPES, to excel in the legal profession.

Vijay Laxmi Saini, a student from the School of Health Sciences & Technology, achieved a significant milestone by winning a gold medal at the 2023 International All Sports Games Federation Judo Championship held in Guwahati. This victory reflects Vijay Laxmi Saini's dedication, rigorous training, and exceptional judo skills amidst intense competition. Vijay Laxmi Saini's win serves as an inspiration for aspiring athletes in India, demonstrating commitment to excellence in sports and representing the nation on a prestigious global platform. This accomplishment highlights the potential of students at UPES in the field of sports.

Dr. Neelu Jyoti Ahuja from the School of Computer Science at UPES has been awarded a 32 lakh DST grant to develop an AI-powered snake-trapping device aimed at reducing snakebite incidents, particularly benefiting Scheduled Tribes in India. This innovative project seeks to automate the trapping and categorizing of snakes safely, without harm to the snakes or human intervention. The device will incorporate artificial prey and aims to enhance community safety while providing educational resources through Science and Technology Innovation hubs. This initiative offers a significant technological solution to snakebite prevention and management.

Project Utthan, initiated by UPES, aims to transform the villages of Dhalani and Koti into model smart villages, focusing on healthcare, education, and livelihood improvement. This initiative reflects a broader commitment to rural development in India, positioning these villages as pioneering examples in the movement towards enhanced societal welfare. Project Utthan is part of UPES's Corporate Social Responsibility efforts, highlighting the institution's dedication to social impact and sustainable development in rural areas.

The Ph.D. in Petroleum Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering focuses on comprehensive research in petroleum engineering. It allows doctoral students to explore topics like enhanced oil recovery and production optimization while integrating advanced analytical techniques. The curriculum is crafted by experts, promoting interdisciplinary collaboration and ethical practices. Graduates gain skills essential for careers as research engineers, industry experts, or consultants. The program also emphasizes international collaboration and provides support for conferences. Admission for the July 2024 intake includes multiple steps, with the last application date on June 3, 2024.

Dr. Nida Rahman is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, specializing in international trade and foreign direct investment. Dr. Nida Rahman contributes to understanding the Sino-US trade war and analyzes Free Trade Agreements like ASEAN-India FTA and RCEP. Dr. Nida Rahman has experience with the Ministry of Commerce and Industry and the Indian Council for Research on International Economic Relations. Dr. Nida Rahman conducts research on various economic topics, teaches economics courses, and has received awards including the BRICS International School 2022 scholarship. Dr. Nida Rahman can be contacted at nida.rahman@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Amal Mushthaq is a B.Sc. Physics (Hons.) graduate from UPES, who graduated in 2022. Amal Mushthaq was accepted into the master's program in Physics at Friedrich Alexander University, Erlangen, Germany, a prestigious European institution known for education and research. Amal Mushthaq's determination and hard work were significant factors in achieving admission to this renowned program, highlighting the accomplishments of UPES alumni. This achievement showcases Amal Mushthaq's commitment to advancing knowledge in the field of physics.

Dr. Gurunadh Velladi is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in aerospace engineering. His expertise includes combustion, propulsion, and fluid dynamics, with courses on Gas Dynamics, Jet Propulsion, and Combustion. Dr. Gurunadh Velidi has received multiple awards, including the SERB International Research Experience Fellowship (2022) and the Best Mentor Award (2019) from the Singapore Space Technology Association. He has extensive research experience, including a postdoctoral role at UNIST, and has led teams in international space competitions. Dr. Gurunadh Velidi emphasizes hands-on learning and critical thinking in his teaching philosophy.

The M.Sc. Physics program in Material Science and Nanotechnology at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides students with essential theoretical knowledge and practical skills in advanced materials and nanotechnology. The curriculum includes hands-on training in material synthesis and characterization for applications in health, clean energy, and aerospace. Graduates can pursue careers as research scientists, materials engineers, and nanotechnology specialists across various industries.
