The program emphasizes interdisciplinary learning, research collaborations, and support for competitive exams, ensuring high employability and career opportunities in rapidly evolving fields such as semiconductor manufacturing and renewable energy.

Dr. Sonali Vyas is an Associate Professor at UPES with over 12 years of experience in academia and research. As a Senior Member of IEEE and lifetime member of CSI, Dr. Vyas specializes in healthcare informatics, data analytics, and mining. Dr. Sonali Vyas has authored approximately 40 research papers and numerous books on machine learning and healthcare technologies. Previous positions include Assistant Professor at Amity University Rajasthan and Jaipur National University. Dr. Sonali Vyas’s teaching philosophy emphasizes critical thinking, engagement, and lifelong learning. Awards include Young Researcher Award 2022 and International Young Researcher Award 2021.

The Corporate Law (Hons.) program at UPES School of Law offers a comprehensive education in corporate legal frameworks, focusing on key topics like corporate governance, securities market regulation, and international trade law. The curriculum equips students with practical skills through internships and case studies, preparing them for various careers in corporate legal advisement, compliance, and law firms. Graduates benefit from a strong placement record, supported by the program's integration of practical learning and theoretical study. To enroll, students must have a minimum of 50% marks in higher secondary education and meet selection criteria based on entrance exams or board marks.

Akash Jain and Arsh Bansal, fourth-year Bachelor of Pharmacy students, developed a nano biosensor for detecting Chlorpyrifos pesticide in milk samples. Chlorpyrifos is widely used in agriculture and poses risks of mortality and neurotoxic disorders. The project, guided by Dr. Jyoti Upadhyay and Dr. Ashish Mathur from UPES, addresses the gap in pesticide detection in milk, emphasizing its environmental impact and affordability issues. The duo received substantial support from the School of Health Sciences and Technology and the Research & Development Team at UPES throughout their research process.

The "Mandatory Disclosure" page of UPES University outlines critical policies and committees that govern student welfare and institutional compliance. It includes details on the Student Grievance Redressal Mechanism, Anti-Ragging Committee, Anti-Discrimination Committee, Internal Complaints Committee for Sexual Harassment, and support for students with disabilities. UPES University ensures adherence to UGC regulations, promoting a safe and inclusive environment for all students. Contact information for key university officials and public information officers is provided for transparency. The page also mentions statutory provisions, annual reports, and various policies related to startups and environmental compliance.

Sustainable Development Goal 10 at UPES focuses on reducing inequalities within and among countries. This goal promotes policies that empower marginalized groups and ensure equal opportunities. Key objectives include achieving income growth for the bottom 40%, promoting inclusivity, and enhancing representation in global institutions. UPES implements initiatives such as Project Payal for girls' education, a wastewater reclamation plant, a skills development program for support staff, Project Educo using AR and VR for History education, and a virtual hackathon for individuals with disabilities. UPES also collaborates with the Indian Development Foundation to support education and vocational training for marginalized communities.

Dr. Vamsi Krishna Kudapa is an Associate Professor in the Department of Chemical Engineering at UPES in Dehradun since 2013, after serving as Assistant Professor and Head of Petroleum Engineering at Sri Aditya Engineering College. Dr. Vamsi Krishna obtained a Ph.D. in Oil and Gas Modelling and Simulation from UPES in 2018. Dr. Vamsi Krishna has 23 publications, 2 patents, 5 book chapters, and 1 book, focusing on solar energy in agriculture and enhanced oil recovery. Dr. Vamsi Krishna utilizes innovative teaching methods and has received multiple awards for research contributions, including the establishment of the “Digital Oil Field.”

Abhishek Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with over a decade of experience in the fashion industry, holding degrees in fashion technology and fashion management from NIFT. Abhishek Kumar has worked in garment export and product development for brands like Adidas and has expertise in international sourcing and apparel manufacturing. Abhishek Kumar is pursuing a PhD in fashion technology and teaches courses including garment construction, fashion marketing, responsible design, and smart clothing. Abhishek Kumar emphasizes an interactive, student-centered teaching approach to foster creativity and critical thinking. Contact Abhishek Kumar at abhishek.kumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech Computer Science and Engineering (Full Stack AI) program at UPES School of Computer Science, in collaboration with Xebia, is a four-year curriculum designed since 2022 to develop versatile professionals in Full Stack AI. Students gain skills in front-end and back-end development, as well as artificial intelligence technologies. The program includes subjects such as natural language processing and cloud computing, emphasizing practical learning through hands-on projects. Graduates can pursue careers as AI Software Engineers, Data Scientists, or AI Product Managers, and benefit from strong industry connections leading to high placement rates. Eligibility requires 50% marks in Class X and XII with a focus on PCM.

The UPES alumni association connects over 75,000 alumni globally, fostering professional bonds and friendships. The platform NEST provides lifelong support, career advice, and networking opportunities. UPES offers continuing education programs in Deep Tech and Technology Management to enhance alumni skills. The alumni network benefits from lifetime career placement assistance and entrepreneurial support through its start-up incubator, Runway. Scholarships for further education are available, and various alumni events promote engagement. Notable alumni include leaders in business and law, exemplifying UPES’s commitment to cultivating successful professionals across industries.

The UPES Organogram webpage presents a visual framework of the organizational structure of the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. It outlines the various schools within UPES, including the School of Advanced Engineering, School of Business, School of Computer Science, School of Design, School of Health Sciences & Technology, School of Law, and School of Liberal Studies & Media, along with their respective programs. The page facilitates accessibility for students, alumni, parents, and prospective applicants, providing critical information about admissions, academic programs, and contact details for inquiries.

Dr. Tarunpreet Kaur Ahuja is an Assistant Professor in Statistics at UPES, specializing in Sampling Theory, Quantitative Analysis, Operations Research, and Statistical Inference. Holding a Ph.D. in Statistics, Dr. Ahuja has previously taught at Uttaranchal University and other institutions, focusing on courses like Business Statistics and Research Methodology. Dr. Ahuja is UGC NET Qualified and received a Gold Medal in M.Sc. Statistics. Research interests include developing efficient estimators and addressing challenges in Applied Statistics. Dr. Ahuja emphasizes a dynamic learning environment, equipping students with practical skills in quantitative techniques and data analysis.

Dr. Sachin Pathak, a faculty member at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, holds a Ph.D. in Physics from IIT Delhi. His expertise lies in spintronics and magnetic materials, where he studies spin-dependent phenomena. Dr. Pathak has received notable fellowships, including the CSIR Research Fellowship and Yonsei Postdoctoral Fellowship. He has published around 34 articles and holds 2 patents. Dr. Pathak emphasizes fostering student curiosity and critical thinking in physics and materials science education, teaching subjects like engineering physics and quantum mechanics. His research contributions include advancements in magnetic memory technology and innovative methods for analyzing magnetic tunnel junctions.

Sustainable Development Goal 8 at UPES focuses on promoting decent work and economic growth through sustained, inclusive economic development. Key objectives include achieving 7% annual GDP growth in least developed countries, fostering innovation, and ensuring fair labor practices. UPES implements various initiatives like RUNWAY for student entrepreneurship, the LEAP and Pragati programs for leadership development, and community projects like Learnshaala and Lakhon Khwahishen aimed at education and empowerment. These efforts align with global priorities such as reducing youth unemployment and enhancing resource efficiency while combating forced labor and promoting safe work environments.

Professor Sushabhan Choudhury is a faculty member at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with 29 years of academic, research, and administrative experience. Professor Sushabhan holds degrees from prestigious institutions and previously served at North-Eastern Hill University and Sikkim Manipal Institute of Technology. Professor Sushabhan's research interests include wireless sensor networks, robotics, IoT, and machine learning. Professor Sushabhan emphasizes simulation-based projects in teaching to enhance problem-solving skills. Notable achievements include awards for research excellence, several patents, and funding for significant projects. Contact information is available at schoudhury@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Rajan Iyer is a Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with over three decades of experience in interior and furniture design. He holds a master's degree in industrial design from NID Ahmedabad. Rajan Iyer has significant industry experience, serving as HOD at MIT Institute of Design and consulting for Cochin Shipyard Ltd and Inspiration Architects & Engineers. He specializes in bamboo applications and conducts workshops on innovative design. Rajan Iyer emphasizes hands-on learning and tailored educational approaches, teaching courses on furniture design and retail spaces. Contact Rajan Iyer at riyer@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Aarushi Batra is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in Sports Law. Dr. Aarushi Batra holds a doctoral degree from the University of Delhi and a master's in law with dual specialization from the Indian Law Institute. Dr. Aarushi Batra has five years of academic experience and has taught at multiple universities. Dr. Aarushi Batra's research interests include Sports Law, Constitutional Law, and Gender Justice. Dr. Aarushi Batra has received awards for contributions to women's sports and has published extensively on gender and human rights issues. Contact Dr. Aarushi Batra at aarushi.batra@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The M.Sc. in Chemistry (Polymer Science) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering equips students with essential knowledge and skills in Polymer Science. The curriculum covers polymer fundamentals, advanced topics, polymer characterization techniques, and functional applications. The program emphasizes hands-on training and research-focused dissertations, contributing to expertise in cutting-edge materials, sustainability, and drug delivery systems. Graduates can pursue diverse careers as Research Scientists, Quality Managers, or Consultants in various sectors. The program offers dedicated placement support and strong industry connections, enhancing employment opportunities in leading polymer industries and research institutions.

Ashish Pratap Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with 13 years of teaching and over 10 years of industry experience. He has served as a Freelance Consultant and is the Managing Director of Chinensis Healthcare Pvt. Ltd., known for pioneering biodegradable cosmetics. Singh specializes in entrepreneurship, strategic management, and operations research, emphasizing practical application in his teaching philosophy. He focuses on developing students' strategic thinking through MBA courses on strategy. Singh has contributed to research, with papers under review and active participation in workshops to enhance his expertise.

The B.Sc. (Hons.) Chemistry by Research in Polymer Chemistry program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a four-year undergraduate degree focusing on polymeric materials and composites. The curriculum blends theoretical knowledge with practical laboratory skills, including polymer synthesis and characterization techniques. A significant research dissertation enhances critical thinking and problem-solving abilities. As India's first program in this field, it prepares graduates for careers as Research Scientists, Quality Managers, and Consultants in growing industries like polymer manufacturing. The program offers comprehensive placements and support for higher education and competitive exams. Minimum eligibility includes 50% marks in Class X and XII.

The MBA in Power Management (Power Business and Regulations) offered by UPES School of Business is a two-year program designed to equip graduates for leadership roles in the power and renewable energy sectors. The curriculum combines core business disciplines with specialized knowledge in power management, focusing on regulations, energy conservation, and data-driven decision-making. Students engage in hands-on learning through internships, live projects, and industry interactions, gaining insights from experts in leading firms. Graduates are prepared for diverse careers in consulting, business development, and regulatory roles, addressing the industry's demand for skilled professionals in power management.

Dr. Kanak Pal Singh Parmar is an Associate Professor in the Physics Department at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in Dehradun, India. Specializing in experimental material physics, Dr. Parmar focuses on colloidal and nanosized photocatalysts for energy harvesting. Holding master’s degrees in Optics and Physics, Dr. Parmar earned a PhD from the Norwegian University of Science and Technology. Research interests include photocatalytic water splitting and solar energy devices. Dr. Parmar has authored over 25 research articles, received several scholarships and fellowships, and actively engages in teaching engineering physics and optical sciences.

Dr. Atul Rawat is an Associate Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with over 16 years of experience in energy research and consulting. Dr. Atul holds a Ph.D. in energy management, a postgraduate degree in business administration from UPES Dehradun, and a degree in Mathematics. Dr. Atul's professional experience includes managerial roles at Ernst & Young, Deloitte, and Genpact. Research interests include energy policy, sustainable development, and climate change. Dr. Atul teaches Petroleum Economics, Natural Gas Markets, and Energy Management, focusing on creating industry-ready professionals through practical teaching methods. Dr. Atul has received the Best Teacher award at UPES.

The B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Graphics and Gaming) at UPES School of Computer Science offers a unique curriculum developed in collaboration with IBM, focusing on essential skills for the gaming industry. Students learn graphics development, game creation using Unity/Unreal, AR/VR technology, and 3D modeling while gaining hands-on experience. The program aligns with industry trends, tapping into the growing video gaming market projected to reach $295.6 billion by 2026. Graduates enjoy diverse career opportunities, with placements averaging 8.24 LPA. Eligibility requires 50% marks in Class X, XII, and PCM. Selection is based on UPESEAT or other exams.

Project Swachhta is a Corporate Social Responsibility initiative by UPES, aimed at supporting the Swachh Bharat Mission. The project focuses on cleaning streets, roads, and public spaces in Dehradun, encouraging local residents to participate in cleanliness drives. Project Swachhta seeks to instill a sense of responsibility towards cleanliness among the youth through voluntary work, enhancing community involvement in cleanliness efforts. Regular drives are conducted in areas near the UPES campus to promote and sustain environmental hygiene.

UPES offers a two-year MBA in Human Resource program designed to equip students with comprehensive knowledge in business administration and specialized HR skills. The curriculum includes subjects like Digital HR Management, Compensation Management, and HR analytics, with experiential learning through projects and internships. Graduates are prepared for diverse career paths, including HR managers and consultants, with placement opportunities at companies like Infosys and Amazon, and expected salaries ranging from INR 6 to 30 lakh per annum. Eligibility requires a minimum 50% in Class X, XII, and graduation from a recognized university. Selection is based on UPESMET or other national exams and interviews.

Sustainable Development Goal 16: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions emphasizes fostering peaceful, inclusive societies, ensuring justice for all, and establishing effective institutions. Its targets include reducing violence and abuse, promoting the rule of law, combating corruption, and ensuring public access to information. The initiative is crucial for sustainable development, aiming for societies where residents can live without fear, access justice, and participate in governance. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) implements this through a Legal Aid Cell, providing legal assistance and raising awareness among students about social issues to promote an inclusive legal aid society.

The Bachelor of Commerce (Hons) program at UPES School of Business is a three-year undergraduate course specializing in E-Commerce and Banking and Insurance. The curriculum covers essential subjects like accounting, finance, marketing, and business law, emphasizing practical training through internships. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII, along with a Group Discussion and Interview. The fee structure totals approximately ₹90,565 over six semesters. Graduates can pursue careers as e-commerce managers, digital marketers, or financial analysts, benefiting from strong industry connections and placement opportunities at top companies.

The M. Tech. in E-Mobility at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a specialized postgraduate program focusing on electric vehicles and transportation systems. The curriculum includes battery technology, electric drivetrains, and government regulations, combining theoretical knowledge with practical experience through labs and projects. Graduates will be prepared for roles in engineering, research, and project management within the growing electric vehicle sector. The program's future scope aligns with increasing demand for professionals due to stricter emission norms and advancements in battery tech. Admission requires a technical background with a minimum of 60% marks and GATE/NET qualifications preferred.

UPES recently celebrated significant victories in sports, with students, alumni, and staff excelling at various levels, including the Commonwealth Games. Notable achievements include Navneet Singh's Commonwealth silver and the cricket team's championship win. To further promote athletic excellence, UPES announced 50 sports scholarships under Project Vijay for cricket, football, and other sports, aiming to support talented individuals and enhance the university's sports culture. The scholarships, ranging from 35% to 100% off tuition fees, emphasize UPES's commitment to integrating sports into academic life and fostering a holistic development approach for its students.

UPES's Project EDUDHURMA, which stands for Education for Developing Humans for Righteousness and Mindful Actions, aims to uplift underprivileged communities in Dehradun through various educational initiatives. The program supports over a hundred families and includes four key projects: Protsaahan, aiding meritorious students from Purkal Youth Development Society; Utkarsh, focusing on holistic education; Dronasthali, enhancing government schoolteacher development; and Utthan, fostering community knowledge application. EDUDHURMA emphasizes social responsibility and community empowerment through education.

UPES highlights student testimonials showcasing transformative educational experiences at the university. Students like Suketu Mehta, Shweta Sharma, Navansh Jain, Anmol Singh Jaggi, Ankit Dubey, and Mudit Verma share how UPES aided their career goals through programs in business, design, and technology. Testimonials reflect personal journeys from various academic backgrounds, illustrating successful outcomes such as placements at organizations like KPMG, Flipkart, and ONGC. The page emphasizes the positive impact of UPES on student aspirational growth and career advancements, reinforcing the university's role in shaping successful professionals.

UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering with a specialization in E-Vehicle and Industrial Drives, designed to provide students with in-depth knowledge of electric vehicles and industrial drive systems. The curriculum includes core subjects like circuit analysis and power systems, along with hands-on labs, internships, and projects. Graduates are prepared for roles such as Electrical Machine Engineer and Power Electronics Engineer, with strong placement support in emerging sectors. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in Classes X and XII with a focus on Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics.

Sudha Tiwari, a faculty member at the School of Liberal Studies, was invited to present her research titled "The NFDC, New Indian Cinema, and the Contemporary Discourses on 'Good Cinema' (1960s to 1990s)" during the Karwaan: The Heritage Exploration Initiative's online talk in July 2022. The presentation discussed the history of the National Film Development Corporation of India (NFDC) and the New Cinema movement, part of Sudha Tiwari's upcoming book with Routledge. Karwaan, established in 2019, aims to facilitate public dialogues on histories, heritages, and cultures, bridging academia and public understanding.

Mr. Saurabh Jain is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 14 years of experience in computer science. He holds an M. Tech in Information Security from MANIT and is currently pursuing his Ph.D. at UPES. Mr. Jain has expertise in programming, information security, cryptography, and blockchain technology, and has published over 45 international research articles and patents. He emphasizes an engaging teaching philosophy that fosters critical thinking. Mr. Jain has also received several prestigious awards and is actively involved in academic activities, guidance, and mentoring. Contact: saurabh.jain@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES School of Computer Science offers outstanding placement opportunities, achieving a 5-Star QS rating for employability. The robust career services and industry partnerships facilitate significant student placements. In 2022-23, students enjoyed high compensation packages, with notable recruiters on campus. Mandatory summer internships lasting eight weeks to six months provide real-world experience, enhancing career prospects. The EDGE program equips students with essential skills for professional success, covering areas like entrepreneurship and employability. Comprehensive training, workshops, and mentorship further prepare students for a competitive job market in technology and related fields.

The BA (Hons.) program at UPES is a four-year undergraduate course offering specializations in English, History, and Political Science. Designed to develop critical thinking, analytical, and communication skills, the program includes core subjects in the first three years and an optional internship or research project in the final year. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in Class X and XII or valid SAT scores. Tuition fees range from ₹98,420 to ₹1,08,508 per semester. Graduates can pursue careers in publishing, media, education, and research, with opportunities for higher studies available.

Syed Mohd Raza Taqvi details his transformative MBA experience at Berkeley Haas through the Global Access Program, highlighting the program's diverse international student body from all seven continents. Taqvi emphasizes the enriching classroom environment, networking opportunities, and site visits to leading companies like Apple and Google, which enhanced his understanding of global business. Participation in events like the Berkeley-Stanford football game fostered camaraderie, while involvement in the Student Advisory Board developed his leadership skills. Taqvi expresses gratitude to UPES for facilitating this life-changing journey, which significantly expanded his cultural competence and career opportunities.

Prafful Kumar Gupta is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, Dehradun. Prafful Kumar Gupta holds an LL.B from the University of Lucknow and an LL.M with dual specialization in Constitutional and Criminal Law from National Law University, Delhi. Prafful Kumar Gupta's professional experience includes an internship at Allahabad High Court. Research interests focus on Criminal Law, Critical Criminal Studies, and Constitutional Law. Prafful Kumar Gupta's teaching philosophy emphasizes critical thinking and interactive learning. Courses taught include Criminal Law, Law of Tort, and Judicial Process. Contact is available via email at prafulk.gupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage for the U Hackathon 4 event hosted by UPES provides information about the competition designed for innovators, coders, and designers to showcase their skills. Participants are encouraged to solve real-world challenges through collaborative teamwork. UPES emphasizes creativity, technical expertise, and problem-solving abilities in a supportive environment. Key details about registration, event dates, and participation criteria are included, illustrating the hackathon's focus on innovation and technological advancement in a competitive format. Participants gain opportunities for networking and mentorship from industry professionals, enhancing their learning experience.

Dr. Mohd Imran Khan is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Business, UPES, with a Doctorate in Industrial Engineering from Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi. Dr. Mohd Imran Khan has over four years of teaching experience at Lovely Professional University and a background in Agricultural Technology. Research interests include Sustainable Supply Chain Management, Halal Supply Chain Management, Circular Economy, and Industry 4.0. Dr. Mohd Imran Khan emphasizes practical application of theoretical concepts in teaching, fostering critical thinking and interactive learning. Dr. Mohd Imran Khan has guided PhD scholars and published in top-tier journals.

Harshit Shukla is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in space engineering and rocketry. He focuses on space technology, rocket propulsion, and orbital mechanics, contributing significantly to these fields. Harshit Shukla previously worked at R.V. College of Engineering and the Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre, ISRO. His research interests include MEMS, aerospace propulsion, and combustion. Harshit Shukla emphasizes a student-centric teaching philosophy, fostering an inclusive environment. Courses taught include Rocket Propulsion and Aerodynamics. Harshit Shukla has received multiple awards and has been involved in numerous scholarly activities. Contact: harshit.shukla@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Mitali Chugh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with 22 years of teaching experience. Dr. Mitali holds a Ph.D. and M.Tech. in Computer Science from UTU, Dehradun. Dr. Mitali's research interests encompass Software Process Improvement, Knowledge Management, AI, ML, and DL. Dr. Mitali has authored over 40 research papers, received multiple awards, including the Research Excellence Award in 2019, and is a member of renowned technical societies. Dr. Mitali has also secured patents in innovative technologies and is actively involved in collaborative research projects internationally.

Kshitij Kumre is an Assistant Professor at UPES, specializing in Information Technology with an M.Tech from NITK Surathkal and B.Tech from NIT Agartala. Kshitij teaches "Design and Analysis of Algorithms" and "Linux Lab" while mentoring students and developing course materials. Kshitij's research interests include Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing, focusing on sentiment analysis and deepfake detection. Kshitij adopts a student-centric teaching approach, emphasizing practical application of concepts. Kshitij has participated in notable competitions and holds certifications in AWS Cloud Practitioner and Data Structures & Algorithms. Contact Kshitij at kshitijdeepak.kumre@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Project Samwedna is an initiative by UPES designed to support the children of construction workers on campus. This program offers educational opportunities, day-care services, mid-day meals, medical check-ups, and clothing through a day school setup. Project Samwedna aims to enhance the welfare and development of children who would otherwise lack access to these essential services due to their families' labor-intensive work in construction projects. The program demonstrates UPES's commitment to corporate social responsibility by improving the educational and health outcomes for these children's lives.

Dr. Pankaj Singh is an Assistant Professor at UPES School of Liberal Studies with expertise in History of Psychology, Cognitive Science, and Applied Ethics. He holds a Ph.D. in Philosophical Psychology from the Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur and has experience as an HR manager prior to academia. Dr. Singh’s research interests include Ethical Leadership, Philosophy of Mind, and Indian Philosophy, with publications in reputed journals. His teaching philosophy incorporates popular culture and interactive methods to enhance student engagement. Dr. Singh has received various fellowships and has trained over 1000 students in creating e-portfolios. Contact: pankaj.singh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Naval Kishore Sharma, a third-year student in the Integrated B.Sc.-M.Sc. Chemistry B.Tech program at UPES, completed a project focused on co-pyrolysis of plastic waste and biomass for hydrocarbon fuel production. This project contributes to the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan initiative. The study addresses the increasing plastic waste issue and explores the potential of transforming plastics and biomass into eco-friendly fuels and value-added products. These products can serve as chemicals and pollutant sorbents, promoting sustainable waste management practices. The project was mentored by Dr. Amit Kumar, an Assistant Professor.

Dr. Subhajit Basu is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. An environmental microbiologist, Subhajit specializes in aquatic/marine microbiology and biogeochemistry, focusing on microbial interactions in extreme environments, nutrient cycling, and microbial metabolites. With a Master’s in Microbiology from Bangalore University and a PhD from Goa University, Subhajit has worked at the Max Planck Institute and Hebrew University. His teaching emphasizes interactive learning, and he currently guides four PhD students. Subhajit’s research includes microbial ecophysiology in Himalayan ecosystems and has received multiple prestigious fellowships and awards.

Harsh Singh Rawat is a B.Des. student specializing in Animation and VFX design at UPES, graduating in 2024. Harsh Singh Rawat completed a project focused on digital artworks over the course of a year, involving environment study, concept art, and traditional painting. Each artwork took approximately three days to complete, resulting in a collection that highlights Harsh Singh Rawat’s dedication and creative journey in various art forms. The project was mentored by Anjali Nayar, an Assistant Professor at UPES.

Aditya Chandra, a prominent student from the School of Design at UPES, achieved significant recognition for his video game "A Thug's Ascension." The game was showcased at DevGAMM Lisbon 2023, a highly prestigious festival that featured only 25 selected games from hundreds of global submissions. This achievement highlights the innovative talent fostered at UPES, emphasizing its commitment to excellence in design and technology education. Aditya Chandra's work stands out in the competitive landscape of international gaming.

Dr. Gouranga Duari is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, holding a Ph.D. from Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi. Dr. Gouranga Duari's research centers on machine learning applications for outlier detection and pattern recognition, emphasizing data science and deep learning. Prior to UPES, Dr. Gouranga Duari served as a Teaching Assistant at Jawaharlal Nehru University. Dr. Gouranga Duari teaches courses in Problem Solving, Descriptive Analytics, and Machine Learning. Dr. Gouranga Duari has received the Swami Vivekananda MCM Scholarship and has published several scientific papers. Contact Dr. Gouranga Duari at gouranga.duari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The M.Tech in Petroleum Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering addresses the talent shortage in the oil and gas industry by equipping students with essential knowledge in areas such as petroleum geology, drilling, reservoir engineering, and enhanced oil recovery. This 2-year program includes hands-on training in state-of-the-art labs, internships, and soft skills development. Graduates can pursue diverse career paths with leading companies like Shell and Schlumberger, or in consulting firms such as Deloitte and KPMG. The program emphasizes current industry trends, technological advancements, and environmental considerations in petroleum engineering.

Gauri Salunke, Parth Vohra, Sanika Kashinath Shahane, and Satvik Goel achieved an Honorable Mention in the Design Intelligence Award 2023 for their innovative project, "Sensory Arcade." This interactive mat solution aims to enhance social skills for mildly autistic children in school environments. The project's recognition highlights the students' commitment to addressing societal challenges through creative design, showcasing the importance of innovation in supporting global issues. Congratulations are extended to Gauri Salunke, Parth Vohra, Sanika Kashinath Shahane, and Satvik Goel for this outstanding achievement in an international competition.

The B.Tech. Biomedical Engineering (Prosthetics) program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology focuses on designing advanced prosthetic devices. The curriculum integrates engineering principles, anatomy, and technology, preparing students for careers in healthcare and the biomedical industry. Key offerings include collaboration with GE Healthcare, hands-on experience with advanced tools, and exposure to industry trends such as bionic limbs and myoelectric prosthetics. Graduates can pursue roles like Prosthetics Engineers or Research Scientists and have excellent placement opportunities due to UPES's strong industry connections. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in relevant subjects.

The webpage from UPES outlines the eligibility and selection criteria for various undergraduate and postgraduate programs. For undergraduate programs, a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII is required. Specific programs, such as B.Tech, require 50% in PCM in Class XII. Postgraduate programs also require 50% in Class X, XII, and graduation. Candidates must also meet age requirements, with eligible candidates born on or after October 1, 1998. The selection process includes entrance exams like UPESMET-UG. Various schools and courses are detailed throughout the webpage, addressing specific eligibility for each.

The B.Tech. Computer Science & Engineering (Data Science) program at UPES School of Computer Science provides students with essential training in data extraction, analysis, and AI applications. The curriculum includes hands-on experience with technologies like SAS, Tableau, and TensorFlow, emphasizing real-world data challenges through capstone projects. Graduates are equipped for careers as data analysts and machine learning engineers, with placements averaging 8.7 LPA, attracting employers such as Google, Amazon, and IBM. The program addresses the growing demand for skilled data professionals, preparing students to make impactful contributions in various industries. Eligibility requires 50% marks in Class X, XII, and PCM.

On April 24, 2023, UPES hosted its first International Food Festival, celebrating cultural diversity with participation from over 60 exchange students across 27 countries, including Mexico, Bhutan, Ghana, and Nepal. The event featured various international cuisines, such as Kewa Datshi, Wai Wai Sadeko, and Chicken Shawarma. Students expressed their delight in showcasing their culinary traditions and bonding over food. Dr. Sheetal Khanka emphasized the festival as a means to promote cultural unity and is considering making it a biannual event due to its success and positive feedback.

UPES fosters entrepreneurship through the UPES Council for Innovation and Entrepreneurship (UCIE) by providing support like networking, marketing, and training for start-ups. Notable success stories include Agri Joy LLP, which delivers fresh produce via IoT technology; Umbeo Tech Private Limited, which creates a smart Sleep Detector to prevent drowsy driving; and Pasta Cucina, an Italian cuisine brand expanding rapidly. UCIE's focus areas include renewable energy and technology, aiming to connect UPES stakeholders to cultivate innovative solutions and economic growth in India's start-up ecosystem.

The BA Journalism and Mass Communication (Digital) – Media Management, Public Policy, and Strategic Communications program at UPES is a comprehensive 3+1 year degree aimed at preparing students for careers in mass media and digital communications. The curriculum integrates theory with practical training, focusing on media management and strategic communications, including social media strategies. Graduates gain skills relevant for careers such as media managers and communication strategists in various sectors. The program offers internships and hands-on experiences, emphasizing industry relevance and current trends in media, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for the evolving media landscape.

Manik Garg is a notable alumnus of UPES, graduating in 2020 with a B.Tech in Computer Science specializing in Cyber Security and Forensics. Currently a Compliance Product Owner at Adobe, Manik Garg has published a book titled "Unleashing the Art of Digital Forensics." Additionally, Manik Garg contributed two chapters focusing on International Cyber Space laws and the Dark Web within the publication. Manik Garg's achievements highlight the success of UPES graduates in the field of computer science and forensics.

UPES has collaborated with Tata Power, a leading Indian electric utility, to create and implement the curriculum for B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering, B.Tech. Electrical Engineering, and MBA Power Management programs. This partnership allows students to gain insights from industry experts at Tata Power, enhancing classroom learning with industry visits. Furthermore, UPES faculty provide short-term training programs to Tata Power's employees, bridging the gap between academic education and practical industry experience.

Anurag Sharma is an Industry Fellow and Professor in the HR & OB Department at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Anurag Sharma holds a Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, and a Postgraduate Diploma in General Management from NMIMS, Mumbai, with over 27 years of HR and management experience in companies like Reliance Industries Ltd and Tata Motors. Anurag Sharma is pursuing a PhD in Digital HRM and specializes in HR strategy, HR technology, analytics, talent management, and organizational development. Anurag Sharma emphasizes critical thinking and adaptation in teaching.

Dr. Prasanta Mandal is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with 15 years of post-Ph.D. experience. He obtained his Ph.D. from IIT Bombay in 2008 and has extensive postdoctoral research in plasmonics and photonics at institutions like TIFR Mumbai and Ajou University. His research focuses on the development of plasmonic and photonic metamaterials, solar energy harvesting, and SERS spectroscopy, leading to around 50 peer-reviewed publications and significant citations. He guides doctoral students and actively organizes research conferences, holding a SERB-funded project valued at approximately 18.8 Lakhs INR.

The Learning Development Center at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) recognizes the importance of hybrid and online education. UPES provides 24/7 access to learning materials utilizing a state-of-the-art virtual platform. The center promotes blended learning techniques, integrating e-learning, video lectures, and interactive digital textbooks to enhance student engagement and success. UPES has received several Blackboard Catalyst awards for optimizing student experiences and faculty development. The center focuses on creating a differentiated educational experience to support student achievement and career advancement.

Upasana is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at UPES. She completed her Ph.D. at the National Institute of Technology Patna, focusing on lung disease identification using computer vision and deep learning. Upasana holds an M.Tech. from the National Institute of Technology Meghalaya and a B.Tech. from DVSIET, Meerut. With 1.5 years of industry experience as a Health Officer, her research interests include medical image analysis and machine learning. Upasana has taught courses in Data Mining, programming, and machine learning, and has received several scholarships for her academic achievements. Upasana can be contacted via email at upasana@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Harshika Varma, a faculty member at UPES School of Liberal Studies, is set to participate in the CTeC Asia Conference 2023 in Taipei, Taiwan, from October 19-22, 2023. This conference focuses on technology's influence on communication and civic engagement. Dr. Harshika Varma has received a prestigious fellowship grant of approximately 1500 Singapore dollars to support attendance. Additionally, Dr. Harshika Varma attended the Google News Initiative - Trusted Media Summit 2023 in Singapore, engaging in critical discussions on misinformation and the role of AI in media responsibility.

The BA Digital and Mass Media (Broadcasting) program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is a six-semester course designed to provide students with essential knowledge and practical skills for the media industry. Specializations include Digital Audio Broadcasting, Digital Video and Audio Production, and Mobile Journalism. The program emphasizes hands-on training using cutting-edge technology and is taught by experienced professionals. Graduates are equipped for diverse careers in media, with competitive salaries ranging from 4 to 35 lakhs per year. The program also offers placement assistance for up to five years, ensuring strong industry connections.

UPES offers a BBA in Oil and Gas Marketing, focusing on creating skilled managers for the oil and gas industry. The curriculum combines management education with specialized knowledge of natural gas, refining, and petrochemical sectors. Students can specialize in Petroleum Business or Oil & Gas Operations and gain practical experience through internships and industry projects. The program emphasizes digital skills and data-driven decision-making, preparing graduates for roles in consulting, business development, and operations. Graduates can expect competitive salaries and strong placement opportunities with top firms in the industry, supported by UPES's expansive industry connections.

Dr. Shilpi Agarwal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with 18 years of educational experience. She holds Gold Medals in B.Sc. and M.Sc. and earned her Ph.D. from Uttarakhand Technical University. Dr. Agarwal has published over 34 research papers, authored two books, and holds four patents. Her research focuses on Catalysis, Biofuels, Waste Management, and Water Purification. With a commitment to innovative teaching, she employs modern methodologies and mentors students on research projects. Dr. Agarwal has received multiple awards and managed an industrial project with significant funding.

Abhishek Verma's article, published on May 15, 2020, presents five key tips for building confidence and self-esteem. The tips include treating oneself with kindness, embracing positive affirmations, recognizing individual uniqueness, practicing gratitude, and maintaining persistence in the face of challenges. Verma emphasizes the importance of self-belief, noting that overcoming self-doubt is essential for personal and professional success. The article encourages individuals to take charge of their lives through self-love and a positive mindset, highlighting that confidence can lead to significant personal transformation.

Siddharth Prakash is an Assistant Professor Senior Scale at the School of Design, UPES. He holds a bachelor's degree in automotive engineering from Malnad College of Engineering and a master's degree in Transportation & Mobility Design from IED Italy. With over 7 years in automotive design, Siddharth contributed to Tata Motors' Tamo Racemo as Exterior Designer and co-founded DAAC Metaworld. His research interests include Future Mobility, sustainable architecture, and furniture design. Siddharth emphasizes conceptual design in teaching and instructs courses like Automotive Sketching and Transportation Design Projects. Contact Siddharth at sprakash@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The webpage by UPES discusses the influence of the Metaverse on the media sector, highlighting its potential to enhance social interaction and create immersive content experiences. Media companies are adopting Metaverse technologies for audience engagement and monetization strategies, hiring talent to navigate this new landscape. The Metaverse allows users to participate in virtual simulations, impacting content consumption and ownership through NFTs and blockchain. UPES School of Modern Media prepares students for these emerging technologies with a comprehensive curriculum and state-of-the-art facilities, positioning them for careers in a rapidly evolving media environment.

UPES offers a B.Tech. in Food Technology that provides comprehensive education in areas such as post-harvest technology, food processing, nutritional composition, and food safety regulations. The program includes two months of industrial training and social internships, as well as research thesis support. Students gain hands-on experience with advanced equipment like GCMS and FTIR, preparing them for careers as Food Processing Operators, Research Scientists, and Food Inspectors. The program emphasizes practical skills aligned with industry trends, ensuring strong placement opportunities with top food processing companies, making it a valuable choice for aspiring food technologists.

Navdeep Bhatnagar is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), with over 15 years of experience in Electricity Trading, Distribution, and Management Education. Navdeep holds a Master’s degree in Energy Trading from UPES and a Bachelor’s in Commerce from H.N.B Garhwal University. Currently pursuing a PhD in Management, Navdeep serves on the Product Advisory Committee of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) and is a Subject Matter Expert in Electricity Trading Operations. Navdeep's research interests include Power Trading, Energy Risk Management, and Renewable Energy.

Dr. Sonali Vyas is recognized for her edited book "Edge-AI in Healthcare: Trends and Future Perspectives," published by CRC Press, Taylor & Francis. The book explores Edge-AI technology's role in enhancing data-driven decision making in healthcare, featuring 17 chapters authored by global researchers and experts. Additionally, Dr. Sonali Vyas was acknowledged as a Leading Professor in 2023 by Business Talkz and received the Young Researcher Award from the International UI Awards in 2022, highlighting her significant contributions to research, including her role as a Senior Member of IEEE.

Jharna Joshi is an Associate Professor at the School of Design at UPES, Dehradun, with over 20 years of experience in design and education. Holding a master's degree from NIFT, New Delhi, and training in Total Design Systems, she has worked with prominent organizations and introduced the online lifestyle brand "Bhauranngi." Jharna's research interests include sustainability and zero-waste fashion, while her teaching philosophy emphasizes hands-on learning and social responsibility. She teaches courses in Pattern Making, Fabric Science, and Design Research Methodology, and is actively pursuing a PhD in Design focused on sustainability in the garment industry.

The webpage discusses the increasing significance of social media marketing in modern business practices. It highlights that social media has transformed from a communication platform into a vital strategic tool for marketing and advertising. The growth of social media users in India has created vast opportunities for businesses to engage with audiences effectively. It notes the rising demand for professionals skilled in public relations, corporate communications, and data analytics. The UPES School of Modern Media offers a specialized BBA program to equip students with necessary skills in social media marketing and analytics for thriving careers.

The Self Study Report (SSR) for the Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) outlines the institution's commitment to quality education and continuous improvement. The report covers various criteria including curriculum design, teaching methods, student engagement, research promotion, infrastructure, and student support services. It highlights initiatives for curriculum relevance, employability enhancement, faculty qualifications, research funding, and student progression. The document emphasizes UPES's focus on gender equity, environmental sustainability, and community engagement, showcasing the university's ongoing efforts to meet national accreditation standards.

The MBA in Power Management (Green Energy and Transition to Sustainability) program at UPES School of Business equips graduates for leadership roles in the power and renewable energy sectors. The two-year full-time program integrates business fundamentals with specialized knowledge in green energy, including solar, wind, and electric vehicles. Emphasizing practical experiences like internships, live projects, and guest lectures from industry experts, it prepares students for careers as energy consultants and business analysts. The program boasts strong placement records with impressive salaries, addressing industry demands for skilled professionals in sustainable energy management.

The B.Tech. Aerospace Engineering (Defence Technology) program at UPES offers a specialized curriculum aimed at preparing students for careers in India's defence sector. The program covers weapon systems, radar technology, and cybersecurity, equipping graduates with essential skills for designing and maintaining defence equipment. Graduates can pursue roles in defence organizations, government agencies, and aerospace industries. UPES provides hands-on experiences through labs and internships, ensuring practical skills development. The program's promising future includes opportunities in missile systems and unmanned systems, bolstered by government initiatives supporting indigenous defence manufacturing.

The MBA in International Business program at UPES School of Business is designed to prepare students for the complexities of global business operations. The curriculum includes international trade, marketing, finance, and management, with a strong emphasis on critical thinking, leadership, and problem-solving skills. Students engage in practical projects, internships, and industry exposure to enhance their learning. Graduates are positioned for careers in multinational corporations and consulting firms, with increasing demand in international business roles influenced by e-commerce and sustainability trends. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in previous academic qualifications, with admissions based on entrance exam performance and interviews.

Prof. Karmeshu is a Distinguished Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES and Director of the Centre for Stochastic Modelling and Simulation. He chairs the Scientific Computing Panel at the Naval Research Board, DRDO, and is an Adjunct Professor at IIITM-Gwalior. His research focuses on non-linear stochastic modelling across various disciplines, emphasizing mathematical modelling and computational approaches. Prof. Karmeshu has published over 120 papers and received numerous awards, including the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize. He previously held positions at JNU and SNU and has extensive experience in teaching, research, and academic leadership.

The M.Tech in Computer Science & Engineering with a specialization in Cybersecurity & Forensics at UPES School of Computer Science prepares students for careers in the rapidly growing cybersecurity field. The program covers essential topics including network security, ethical hacking, and digital forensics, emphasizing practical learning through projects and collaborations with industry leaders like IBM and KPMG. Graduates can pursue roles such as Security Analysts and Digital Forensics Investigators, benefiting from strong placement opportunities, with average packages reaching 8.40 LPA. The curriculum is designed to align with industry trends, ensuring graduates are adept in cutting-edge technologies.

Vivek Kumar Pandey is an Assistant Professor-Selection Grade at UPES School of Design with over 20 years of experience in animation and academia. Vivek Kumar Pandey holds a Master's in Fine Arts and was awarded a BFA Gold Medal. With significant contributions to over 45 animated television shows, including roles at DQ Entertainments and Ekluvya ED-Tech, Vivek Kumar Pandey also taught at Annapurna College of Film and Media. Research interests include 2D animation and its educational implications. Vivek Kumar Pandey's teaching focuses on empowering students with technical and artistic skills necessary for the animation industry.

A team of geologists from the Energy Cluster at UPES Dehradun, including Dr. Girish Ch Kothyari, Dr. Atul K Patidar, and Dr. Uday Bhan, conducted a comprehensive study on the geohazard crisis in Joshimath, characterized by ground subsidence and infrastructural damage. Their research utilized satellite-based techniques and traditional geological mapping, revealing that 67.95% of the region is vulnerable to geohazards. The study highlighted contributing factors such as steep slopes, urbanization, and disrupted water flow. The findings aim to inform sustainable development and effective mitigation strategies, enhancing societal resilience in tectonically-sensitive Himalayan regions.

Dr. Niraj Shirish Mankad is a Professor and Associate Dean at the School of Business, UPES. Dr. Niraj Mankad holds a Ph.D. in Strategy from IIT Bombay and an MBA from Leeds University Business School. Dr. Niraj Mankad specializes in Strategic Thinking, Planning, and Implementation, with experience training executives from major companies and conducting research on digital technologies' impacts on business. Dr. Niraj Mankad employs student-centric learning strategies and teaches courses including Business Strategy and Innovation Management. Dr. Niraj Mankad's contact email is niraj.mankad@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Amaresh Jha is an Associate Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES with extensive experience in media, including roles at Zee News, News Express, and India TV. He serves as Editor for the International Journal of Politics and Media and has previously led the School of Media and Entertainment at GD Goenka University. Dr. Jha's research interests focus on Political Communication and Media Psychology. He emphasizes critical thinking in teaching and has published over 30 research articles. Dr. Jha has supervised doctoral scholars and received a research grant from the Indian Council of Social Sciences Research in 2019. Contact at amaresh.jha@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Surender Varma Gadhiraju is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES. He holds a Master's from IIT Roorkee and a PhD from IIT Bombay, specializing in change detection methodologies for satellite imagery. Dr. Surender Varma Gadhiraju has over 10 years of industry experience in data science and machine learning, working with companies like Dupont and Here Tech, and cofounding a fintech startup. His research interests include image processing, machine learning, and digital agriculture. Dr. Surender Varma Gadhiraju emphasizes active learning in his teaching and has received multiple awards for research contributions.

The UPES Scholarships page details the various scholarship opportunities available to students at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Approximately 55% of students receive need-based scholarships, totaling up to 2,335 scholarships, awarding 15% to 30% off tuition fees. Scholarships are categorized into academic, sports, alumni, and financial support based on merit and need, with specific criteria outlined for eligibility. Additional programs include M.Tech and M.Des fellowships, freeships for economically weaker sections, and scholarships for bonafide Uttarakhand residents. Key conditions include maintaining a minimum SGPA of 7.5 and timely fee payments.

Dr. Murali Pujari is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with expertise in wastewater treatment and membrane-based separation processes. Dr. Pujari earned a PhD from the Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati, and has 13 years of combined research and teaching experience. Dr. Pujari has published 16 journal articles and holds 2 patents. Current teaching includes courses like Mass Transfer Operations and Chemical Reaction Engineering. Dr. Pujari promotes interactive learning and has received recognition for research contributions, including a best paper award at GCRAM 2022. Contact: mpujari@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES alumnus and Commonwealth Games silver medallist Navneet Singh highlighted the importance of sports scholarships, particularly the newly announced 50 scholarships under Project Vijay for aspiring athletes. Navneet emphasized how these scholarships can alleviate financial burdens, allowing students to focus on sports while pursuing their education. The initiative aims to promote sports in India, with scholarships covering various sports like cricket, football, and athletics, offering tuition fee discounts from 35% to 100% based on achievements. UPES's Vice Chancellor, Dr. Sunil Rai, stressed the university's commitment to integrating sports into academics to develop talent sustainably.

Dr. Harshika Varma is a Senior Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Liberal Studies, specializing in Journalism and Mass Communication with a focus on Indian Advertising. She holds a doctorate in Journalism and Mass Communication, a business management certificate from IIT Delhi, and a master's from Panjab University. Dr. Harshika Varma has taught courses in Corporate Communications, Media Planning, and Brand Management. She promotes experiential learning, critical analysis, and advocacy for women's empowerment. Dr. Yogesh C. Gupta is an Industry Fellow at UPES, with a degree in Electrical Engineering from IIT-BHU, an MBA, and a PhD in Power Engineering. With over 31 years of experience, Dr. Yogesh specializes in Sustainability, Decarbonization, and Energy Efficiency. Previous roles include working with FICCI, UNDP, and the Ministry of Steel on energy efficiency projects. Dr. Yogesh has conducted extensive training and written articles for Scopus-indexed journals. Courses taught include Climate Change, Energy Audit, and Renewable Energy Technologies. Dr. Yogesh is involved in international projects and serves as a jury member for energy competitions. Contact: ycgupta@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Kirti Gupta, an MBA student from the School of Business at UPES, has achieved significant milestones during her academic journey (2021-2023). She secured an impressive INR 27.83 lakh package with Accenture in Strategies & Consulting and completed a summer internship at KPMG with a stipend of INR 50,000 per month. The UPES School of Modern Media highlights the crucial role of data analytics and visualization in transforming the media and entertainment industry. The school offers specialized programs in Journalism and Mass Communication that focus on Data, Analytics, and Visualization, preparing students for a data-centric media landscape. The B.Tech Biotechnology program at UPES's School of Health Sciences and Technology provides a comprehensive four-year curriculum totaling 160 credits, covering biochemistry, microbiology, molecular biology, and genetic engineering, alongside skill-based courses in data analysis and bioinformatics. The program emphasizes practical laboratory training and offers industrial visits and internships for real-world exposure. Mr. Sharad Abhyankar is a Senior Partner at Khaitan & Co., specializing in corporate and commercial law in Mumbai. With over 30 years of experience, Mr. Sharad Abhyankar advises both Indian and international clients on mergers and acquisitions, private equity, capital market transactions, and regulatory compliance, including telecom regulations and securities law. Mr. Sharad Abhyankar has contributed to policy formation for various government agencies in India and South Africa and has a proven record in navigating complex legal landscapes across diverse industries.

Dr. Roshni Sengupta is an Associate Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES, specializing in media, visual culture, and transnationalism, with a focus on Indian and South Asian cinema and diaspora communities in Europe. Dr. Rupinder Singh Sodhi, Managing Director of Amul, shared insights with UPES School of Business students about Amul's success as India's leading dairy brand, attributing it to consistency across business structure, product quality, communication, and human resources. Amul operates as a cooperative, ensuring fair prices for 36 million farmers while maintaining product integrity over decades. The cooperative follows an umbrella branding strategy, with a focus on minimal advertising costs while preserving brand identity. Leadership and innovation at Amul emphasize stakeholder care, supply chain efficiency, and digital advancements, contributing to its longstanding market leadership.

Dr. Jugnu Jain is the Chief Executive Officer and co-founder of Sapien Biosciences, a leading biobank in India. With over 30 years of expertise in life sciences, Dr. Jain holds a Ph.D. in Genetics from Cambridge University and postdoctoral training in Immunology from Boston's Dana Farber Cancer Institute. Dr. Jain has experience in drug discovery at Vertex Pharmaceuticals, covering various therapeutic areas. Under Dr. Jain's leadership, Sapien has ethically acquired around 280,000 human samples, aiding the development of personalized treatments. The LL.M. program in Corporate and Commercial Law at UPES School of Law prepares law graduates to tackle contemporary challenges in the corporate legal field. The curriculum integrates theoretical knowledge with practical application, covering key topics such as company formation, mergers and acquisitions, competition law, and commercial arbitration. The program emphasizes critical thinking, legal research, and industry integration through guest lectures and internships. Graduates can pursue careers as corporate lawyers, legal advisors, or compliance officers, benefiting from the program's focus on real-world challenges and the growing corporate sector's demand for legal expertise.

Suresh Eriyat is the Founder and Director of Studio Eeksaurus Production Pvt. Ltd., having graduated in 1997 from the National Institute of Design, specializing in Animation Film Design. In 2009, Suresh co-founded Studio Eeksaurus, gaining international recognition and winning awards like the Annecy Cristal and multiple national awards. With over 500 films and 200 awards to Suresh's name, Suresh is also a TEDx speaker and educator passionate about philosophy and culture.

Dr. Uday Bhan is a Senior Associate Professor and Program Lead at the Energy Cluster in the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES. With over 12 years of experience, Dr. Bhan has authored 30+ research papers and supervised PhD students. His teaching approach emphasizes project-based learning and real-world applications. He has received multiple awards for his contributions to academia and industry collaborations, establishing impactful programs within the petroleum and environmental sectors. Dr. Bhan's research addresses critical challenges in energy sustainability.

Aditya Mukherjee discusses career opportunities for individuals with a degree in User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) design. Companies increasingly prioritize UX design to enhance digital product interactions, meeting consumer expectations in a competitive market. UX designers focus on user journeys and task analyses to ensure ease of use, while UI designers emphasize visual elements and interactivity. The demand for skilled UX designers is rising, offering diverse career paths to positions like UX manager or creative director. UI design is also promising, requiring creativity and attention to aesthetics for effective digital interactions.

Sustainable Development Goal 2, titled "Zero Hunger," focuses on ending hunger, achieving food security, improving nutrition, and promoting sustainable agriculture. This goal addresses the complexities of food security, nutrition, and rural development through various initiatives, including ensuring year-round access to safe food, eliminating malnutrition, and increasing the productivity of small-scale food producers. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) contributes by operating a Labour School at its Kandoli campus, providing nutritious mid-day meals to 900 children of construction workers, thus supporting early childhood education and health.

Dr. Udai Pratap Singh is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Law, UPES Dehradun, with a doctorate in International Law from Dr. Ram Manohar Lohiya National Law University. Dr. Udai has participated in national and international conferences and can be contacted at udaip.singh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Deepa Joshi is an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), holding a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering. Dr. Deepa Joshi's expertise includes Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing, with a focus on medical applications. Dr. Deepa Joshi has published several research articles and is involved in multiple projects, including a collaboration with Doon Hospital. Dr. Deepa Joshi has over 8 years of teaching experience and emphasizes Project-based Learning for students. Dr. Deepa Joshi has received various awards for research contributions and educational excellence.

Mansha Dhingra discusses five key characteristics of good product design on the UPES blog. The essential factors are utility, which ensures a product meets customer needs; aesthetics, which enhances user appeal; simplicity, which allows users to intuitively understand the product; innovation, which introduces new and unique features; and longevity, emphasizing the importance of timeless and sustainable designs. Good product design not only improves functionality but also ensures market acceptance and user satisfaction. Dhingra's insights highlight the significance of these characteristics for successful product development.

The webpage details the career scope and opportunities following a Bachelor of Design (B.Des) degree from UPES, emphasizing the significant increase in enrolments and the degree's potential to enhance skills, earnings, and employability. The Bachelor of Design program fosters creativity, problem-solving, and practical design skills across various industries including fashion, graphic, and product design. Graduates are equipped for entrepreneurial ventures and have access to professional networking opportunities. The program offers advanced knowledge of design principles and trends, enabling students to excel in a competitive design landscape, ultimately enhancing career prospects and versatility.

Atul Kabtiyal, a dedicated MBA student in Oil & Gas Management at the School of Business, UPES, achieved remarkable success with a placement at Accenture Solutions Pvt. Ltd. Atul Kabtiyal demonstrated outstanding academic performance and industry-relevant skills, securing the highest package of 27.83 lakh. This achievement highlights Atul Kabtiyal's dedication and potential in oil and gas management, emphasizing the value of UPES education in fostering career opportunities for students.

Harshit Joshi, a B.Tech. student specializing in Cloud Computing and Virtualisation Technology at UPES, secured a job at Samsung, attributing his success to UPES's industry-aligned curriculum. The advanced subjects and engaging faculty at UPES prepared him for the workforce. Joshi emphasized the importance of practical training, including mock interviews and coding practice provided by the placement cell. He participated in student chapters to enhance leadership and technical skills. The curriculum's practical focus and support systems at UPES, including R&D labs, effectively equipped him for career challenges and opportunities in the tech industry.

The Ph.D. in Civil Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a research experience of 3 to 5 years, providing a monthly stipend of up to ₹30,000 and annual awards for academic excellence. Scholars benefit from state-of-the-art laboratories focusing on sustainability, and mentorship from esteemed faculty from IITs, NITs, and global institutions. Graduates find diverse career opportunities in academia, R&D, and industry, ensuring impactful contributions to civil engineering.

The curriculum covers critical topics, including transgender rights, wage laws, and social security, providing practical knowledge through lectures, seminars, and research projects. Graduates are prepared for diverse career paths in legal consulting, industrial relations management, and policy analysis, with strong placement opportunities. The program responds to industry trends such as the gig economy and technological advancements, emphasizing the protection of workers' rights and legal compliance with international standards.

UPES offers a Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) in Game Design that prepares students for careers in the gaming industry. The program blends computer science, creative writing, and graphic design, covering game mechanics, level design, character design, programming, and more. Students gain practical experience using industry-standard tools like Unity and Unreal Engine, and benefit from internships and networking opportunities. Graduates can pursue roles such as game designer, programmer, artist, and producer, with a 100% placement rate and an average salary of 6.30 Lakhs per annum. Sanoj Kumar is an Assistant Professor (SG) at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with expertise in applied mathematics, computer science, numerical analysis, optimization techniques, mathematical statistics, and computer vision.
