Ananya Goel's paper, "Exploring the Application of IoT Technology in the Development of Smart Cities," demonstrated significant expertise in IoT technology's role in future urban development. This research was also published as chapter 12 in "Visualizing and Sensitizing Innovations," enhancing Ananya Goel's recognition in the academic and research community.

UPES and KPMG in India have partnered to enhance industry-ready education for management students, launching two specialized MBA programs: MBA Strategy and Consulting and MBA Business Analytics. These programs integrate UPES's academic foundation with KPMG's industry insights, equipping graduates with essential skills in problem-solving, data analytics, business modeling, and consultancy. The curriculum includes hands-on projects, engagement with industry experts, and personalized career training, making graduates 30% more likely to secure employment shortly after graduation. This collaboration highlights the importance of blending academic rigor with practical application to prepare future leaders for evolving business landscapes.

The MBA Strategy and Consulting program in Collaboration with KPMG (Corporate Strategy and Innovation Management) at UPES prepares students for strategic decision-making roles in various sectors. The curriculum emphasizes Strategic Management, Innovation Management, and practical experience through live projects and internships. Graduates are equipped for diverse career paths, including roles such as Corporate Development Manager and Business Development Manager, with placement opportunities in prestigious companies like KPMG and Amazon. The program includes modern facilities and a focus on digital transformation and sustainability, ensuring graduates are competitive in the evolving business landscape.

UPES has partnered with Infosys to enhance the B.Tech. Geo Informatics Engineering program by incorporating industry-relevant modules taught by Infosys experts. The collaboration includes a Faculty Internship Program for faculty development and facilitates summer internships for students at Infosys. The Infosys Oil and Gas Practice provides GIS solutions that improve asset management by capturing and utilizing location-based data. This initiative aims to streamline business processes, enhance productivity, and reduce costs by up to 50%, ensuring that students acquire contemporary skills aligned with industry standards.

Dr. Keshav Sinha is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, specializing in Cryptography and Network Security. His research focuses on secure multimedia transmission and encompasses fields such as Data Security, Pseudo Random Number Generators, and cyber policy. Dr. Sinha previously held academic positions at Sarala Birla University and Usha Martin University. He teaches courses including Operating Systems and IT System Security. With a robust publication record, including SCIE journal papers and book chapters, Dr. Sinha is an active researcher and mentor, fostering excellence in students' academic pursuits. Contact: keshav.sinha@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Abhishek Sinha discusses the transformative potential of participatory learning for legal education in India, emphasizing a shift from traditional, lecture-based methods to more interactive formats. This approach enhances engagement through moderated discussions, case studies, and real-time assignments, fostering deeper understanding and retention among law students. While participatory learning is not yet widely adopted in India, it aligns with global practices and addresses the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical application. Dr. Abhishek Sinha advocates for a balanced integration of participatory methods with traditional teaching to prepare future legal professionals effectively.

Dr. Vijaya is an Assistant Professor of Finance and Strategic Management at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in Dehradun, India. Dr. Vijaya holds a Doctorate in Entrepreneurial Finance from Banaras Hindu University and is UGC-NET JRF qualified. Research interests include Crowdfunding, Entrepreneurship, and Behavioural Finance, with publications in journals such as Scopus and Web of Science. Prior to UPES, Dr. Vijaya worked at Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology. Teaching areas encompass Financial Management, Strategic Management, and Managerial Economics. Dr. Vijaya emphasizes ethical education and critical thinking. Contact via vijaya@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Garvit Khurana, Tanya Malhotra, and Vanshaj Goel, B.Tech. CSE students at UPES, represented the university at an International Innovation Competition in Sharjah, UAE, hosted by Skyline University College in collaboration with IEEE. Guided by Dr. Kingshuk Srivastava, the team presented their project "Automated Detection System of Animals on Railway Tracks using IoT Technology." As they begin their careers, Garvit Khurana joins Schneider Electric, Tanya Malhotra moves to Barclays, and Vanshaj Goel secures a role at Siemens EDA. This achievement highlights their innovation and readiness for the corporate sector.

The B.Sc. Computer Science (Data Science) program at UPES School of Computer Science offers a comprehensive education in data science, focusing on statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and a solid foundation in mathematics. Students gain hands-on experience with industry-standard tools such as NoSQL, R, and Python, preparing graduates for careers as Data Analysts, Software Programmers, and Machine Learning Engineers. The program emphasizes practical learning and has strong industry connections, ensuring high placement success. Eligibility includes 50% marks in Class X and XII with Mathematics or Computer Science as a major subject. The selection is based on a personal interview.

The BA/BBA/B.Com. LLB Hons. in Investment & Trade Law at UPES School of Law offers a comprehensive education in international trade and investment law. The curriculum includes courses on International Trade Law, Investment Arbitration, and WTO Law, equipping students with critical skills for legal and business environments. The program emphasizes practical exposure through internships and collaborations, enhancing career prospects in multinational firms, law institutions, and government agencies. Graduates will thrive in a globalized market, addressing legal challenges related to trade agreements and investment disputes, while navigating complex regulations and compliance requirements.

Dr. Utkarsh Jain is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, specializing in Nanotechnology, Biosensors, and Drug Delivery. His research includes the development of molecularly imprinted polymers and devices for monitoring health conditions like Diabetes and neonatal sepsis. Dr. Jain has published over 74 research articles, authored 2 books, and supervised Ph.D. students. His professional background includes roles at Amity University and post-doctoral research at the Indian Institute of Science. Dr. Jain has received multiple awards for his contributions to research and innovation in healthcare technology.

The UPES Faculty Sitemap lists various schools and academic programs offered by the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies. Programs include B.Sc., B.Tech., M.Sc., M.Tech., Ph.D. in fields such as Advanced Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Design, Health Sciences, Law, Liberal Studies, and Media. The webpage facilitates access to admission information, eligibility criteria, and connects prospective students with counseling services. Contact details for the campuses in Dehradun and New Delhi are provided, along with various support links for aspiring students and current offerings.

UPES School of Design student Kavya Jayaprakash participated in a semester exchange program at BESIGN – The Sustainable Design School in France, during which Kavya secured a four-and-a-half-month paid internship with Accenture, starting in March 2023. Despite initial fears, Kavya embraced the experience, engaging in diverse cultural interactions and working on a crucial project with Accenture and others, focusing on the future of human connections and mobility. The internship offers a monthly stipend of 1600 Euros and serves as a significant achievement in Kavya's academic and professional journey.

Sustainable Development Goal 12 (SDG 12) focuses on responsible consumption and production patterns, promoting efficient resource use, waste reduction, and sustainable natural resource management. Key objectives include implementing sustainable consumption frameworks, reducing food waste, managing chemicals and waste effectively, and encouraging sustainable business practices. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) contributes by utilizing solar energy, retrofitting campus lighting for energy savings, and supporting innovative student projects like flying cars and waste management systems. UPES emphasizes education on sustainability to enhance awareness and global competitiveness in sustainable practices.

Avni Joshi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design at UPES, holding a Master of Science in Multimedia and a Bachelor of Science in Animation and Filmmaking. Avni Joshi has nearly eight years of experience in 3D Animation Design, Game Design, and teaching. Previous roles include Assistant Professor at Avantika University and managing the Animation & Multimedia department at Apeejay Stya University. Avni Joshi's research interests involve user-friendly 3D rigging, animation storytelling, and game design. Avni Joshi emphasizes a teaching philosophy that fosters creativity and real-world experience in animation. Avni Joshi is also an Adobe Certified Trainer.

The webpage provides information about the Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech.) program in Electrical Engineering offered by the School of Advanced Engineering (SOAE) at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). It outlines the program's eligibility criteria, course details, and educational structure. Additionally, users can apply for admission, seek guidance from counselors, and access academic resources. The webpage emphasizes electrical engineering education and career opportunities, focusing on industry relevance and student outcomes. Contact information for inquiries and support is also available, along with campus addresses in Dehradun and New Delhi.

Dr. Sonal Talreja is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Computational Science. Dr. Talreja specializes in computational methods for studying electronic and optical properties of materials, contributing to advancements in fields like memory storage and nanotechnology. With experience as a global instructor and visiting faculty, Dr. Talreja employs an active learning approach in her teaching. Dr. Talreja has received multiple awards for academic excellence, published research in prominent journals, and actively participates in professional development initiatives. Dr. Sonal Talreja can be contacted at sonal.talreja@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The BBA in Digital Business with a specialization in Technology Infrastructure Management at UPES School of Business prepares students for the evolving digital business landscape. The curriculum combines business principles with specialized technology courses, focusing on areas such as network management and cybersecurity. The program emphasizes practical experience, innovation, and research, with opportunities for internships and industry involvement. Graduates are poised for various roles, including IT Manager and Cybersecurity Analyst, in sectors like telecommunications and healthcare. The program equips students with the skills necessary for leadership positions in a technology-driven business world.

UPES underwent NBA accreditation in multiple cycles. In 2019, two programs from the School of Engineering were accredited for three years: B.Tech Chemical Engineering (Refining and Petrochemicals) and B.Tech Automotive Design Engineering. In 2021, five programs from the School of Advanced Engineering received accreditation: B.Tech Mechatronics, B.Tech Fire & Safety Engineering, B.Tech Civil Engineering (Specialization: Infrastructure Development), B.Tech Applied Petroleum Engineering, and B.Tech Mechanical Engineering. In 2023, five MBA programs from the School of Business were accredited: MBA Aviation Management, MBA Oil & Gas Management, MBA Logistics & Supply Chain Management, MBA International Business, and MBA Business Analytics.

Dr. Pramod Kumar Painuly is an esteemed Industry Fellow and Professor at the School of Business, UPES, recognized as a leading oil and gas professional in India and globally. With over 30 years of experience, Dr. Pramod Kumar Painuly has held critical roles in companies like ONGC and Reliance Industries and contributes to various professional societies. Dr. Pramod Kumar Painuly's research interests include petroleum risk assessment and digitization in oil and gas. Dr. Pramod Kumar Painuly employs a hybrid teaching philosophy focusing on theory and project-based learning, guiding students in real-world applications of the oil and gas industry.

The webpage from UPES discusses a service error encountered when trying to access the modern media blog. The page indicates that the requested content cannot be found, prompting users to return to the homepage or explore other resources related to admissions, student outcomes, and various academic programs offered at UPES. For additional inquiries, users are directed to contact UPES via toll-free numbers or email. UPES offers degrees in fields such as engineering, business, law, media, and health sciences. The campus locations include Dehradun, with further details facilitated through the UPES corporate office.

Ramesh Kumar is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in Aerospace Propulsion. Ramesh Kumar has expertise in propulsion systems, including rocket and jet engines, and hybrid technologies. Ramesh Kumar emphasizes hands-on learning, fostering a collaborative environment, and mentoring students. Ramesh Kumar's research interests include turbomachinery and clean energy innovations for aerospace applications. Ramesh Kumar has a rich teaching history, having developed courses at IIT Bombay. Ramesh Kumar is actively involved in industry collaborations and manages the Aerospace Propulsion Laboratory, enhancing student opportunities in aerospace research. Ramesh Kumar can be contacted at ramesh.kumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES emphasizes academic excellence through innovative programs and initiatives designed to align education with industry needs. The university has achieved significant milestones, such as increased research output and the appointment of industry experts as Professors of Practice to enhance practical learning. Notable achievements include student placements at leading companies like Microsoft and Samsung, highlighting the effectiveness of UPES's advanced curriculum and supportive infrastructure. UPES also focuses on corporate responsibility and developing leadership qualities among students. The institution aims to empower future leaders in various fields through comprehensive academic support and opportunities.

UPES researcher Dr. Bhawna Lamba leads India's first microalgae-based wastewater reclamation project, inspired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Swachh Bharat Mission. The ₹73 lakh pilot project features an integrated wastewater plant that purifies sewage and generates bio-oil, biogas, and bio-manure, aimed at zero waste. Supported by the Department of Science and Technology, the facility includes an open pond and reactors that utilize algal purification, showcasing sustainability by reducing water usage and toxic contaminants. Dr. Lamba emphasizes its potential to address wastewater issues and contribute to clean energy solutions.

Dr. Piyush Kumar is an Associate Professor in the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES. Dr. Kumar holds a Ph.D. in Biochemistry and has expertise in aptamer-based diagnostics, understanding pathogenic bacteria, and developing non-antibiotic antibacterial therapies. Research interests include nanodiagnostics and tackling antimicrobial resistance. Dr. Kumar has published extensively in renowned journals and received multiple research grants. Courses taught include Biochemistry, Nanobiotechnology, and Bioinformatics. Dr. Kumar emphasizes interactive teaching and student engagement in learning processes, utilizing various instructional methods to enhance understanding and retention. Contact Dr. Piyush Kumar at piyush.kumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Gurumayum Robert Kenedy is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES Dehradun, since August 21, 2023. Dr. Gurumayum obtained a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from National Taiwan University of Science and Technology and previously worked as a research scholar, engineer, and intern in various institutions. Research interests include materials characterization of metallic and composite materials. Dr. Gurumayum teaches courses on Materials Science and Engineering and Manufacturing Processes, focusing on tailoring education to student needs and fostering discussions. Dr. Gurumayum received scholarships and awards, including the NTUST Doctoral Programme Full Scholarship.

The webpage discusses entrepreneurship at UPES, emphasizing the institution's commitment to adapting education through technology. UPES encourages innovation and various entrepreneurial initiatives, including a Start-Up Competition named ‘Take Off’ with significant cash prizes. Highlighted success stories feature UPES students and alumni launching diverse ventures, such as India's first digital pension platform and products focused on women's health. The blog showcases UPES's proactive approach in nurturing aspiring entrepreneurs by providing resources, competitions, and a collaborative environment aimed at fostering successful start-ups.

Ninian Peckitt is a retired maxillofacial surgeon and an advisory board member at the School of Engineering at UPES. Ninian Peckitt introduced innovative technologies like computer planning, photomorphanalysis, and CAD CAM in facial reconstructive surgery since 1999. Collaborating with engineers, Ninian Peckitt developed color stereolithography for 3-D tumor mapping, transforming complex surgeries into day cases. As an internationally recognized authority on engineering-assisted surgery, Ninian Peckitt has been a keynote speaker across Europe, the USA, Asia, and Australasia, contributing significantly to clinical practices and enhancing surgical outcomes.

Ashmeet Bhogal is a BSc Hons student in Chemistry at the UPES School of Advanced Engineering. Ashmeet has been awarded a patent for the invention titled "Device for Detecting Harmful Chemicals in Beverages." This innovative tool is designed to identify adulterants in drinks, significantly impacting public health. Ashmeet's achievement showcases the exceptional mentorship at UPES and the institution's dedication to research and academic excellence. The project was mentored by Dr. Shailey Singhal, a professor at UPES.

Ratin Mohan, a student from the School of Design at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), was recognized as a finalist in the prestigious Nature Electrified Design Contest, organized by Lexus India in April 2023 to align with World Earth Day. The contest featured a rigorous evaluation by a distinguished jury, selecting only a few exceptional designs that effectively represented the electrified natural theme and showcased creativity. This accolade highlights Ratin Mohan's design expertise and innovative concepts in the realm of sustainability and environmental inspiration.

Wockhardt Limited, a global pharmaceutical and biotechnology company, has partnered with UPES School of Health Sciences to enhance the B. Pharmacy program. The collaboration includes curriculum contributions from Wockhardt experts, delivery of specialized modules, and practical exposure through site visits to Wockhardt plants. Additionally, Wockhardt offers two-month summer internships across India for students. Faculty members from UPES will also receive training through a faculty internship program during semester breaks, ensuring the program remains aligned with industry standards and practices.

The webpage discusses the career prospects for graduates of the B.Com. in Banking and Insurance program. Aditya Mukherjee highlights that this degree significantly enhances job opportunities in various sectors including banking, insurance, corporate finance, and public accounting. Key job roles for B.Com. graduates encompass accountant, auditor, finance manager, actuary, and investment banker. The banking sector values accounting proficiency, while the insurance industry increasingly demands skills in AI and blockchain. Graduates can also pursue government jobs through entrance exams, with opportunities in public sector banks and organizations such as SBI, RBI, and LIC.

Arvind Singh Kushwaha is an Assistant Professor at the UPES School of Law in Dehradun. He holds a B.A.LL.B. (Hons.) from NUSRL Ranchi and an LL.M. from RGNUL Punjab. Arvind is UGC-NET, SET, and JRF qualified, specializing in procedural and emerging laws, with a focus on the criminal justice system. His prior experience includes a Senior Research Fellow role at the University of Delhi and advocacy in Delhi courts. Arvind teaches civil procedure, constitutional law, and organized crimes, and has published extensively in reputable journals. He encourages practical law application and student engagement in extracurricular activities.

Professor Robin Jeffrey is a Visiting Research Professor at the National University of Singapore and an Emeritus Professor at the Australian National University and La Trobe University. He is a leading scholar on Indian media and has authored influential works regarding Indian society, including The Great Indian Phone Book and Waste of a Nation. Professor Jeffrey's academic journey began as a school teacher in Chandigarh from 1967 to 1969. He earned a doctorate in Indian history from Sussex University in 1973 and has taught extensively in Australia while conducting research in India over several years.

The Alumni Achievements page of UPES highlights the accomplishments of notable alumni. This includes Anmol Jaggi, a B.Tech alumnus and founder of Blusmart Mobility; Mudit Verma, also a B.Tech alumnus and co-founder of Raymach Technologies; and Ankit Dubey, a M.Design alumnus serving as Product Design Lead at Flipkart and Cleartrip. The page serves to showcase the successful careers and entrepreneurial ventures of UPES alumni, illustrating the institution's impact on their professional journeys. This emphasizes UPES's focus on student outcomes and successful placements.

The B.Tech. Sustainability Engineering in Circular Economy program at UPES prepares students for careers as sustainability officers and engineers combating sustainability challenges globally. The curriculum integrates economics and resource management to address environmental concerns while promoting equitable access to resources. Students can study abroad at prestigious universities, engage in hands-on projects, and participate in community initiatives. Graduates will find diverse career opportunities in renewable energy, waste management, and sustainable manufacturing. Admission requires 50% marks in Class XII, and selection is based on UPESEAT, JEE, Board Merit, SAT, or CUET performance.

UPES and KPMG in India have partnered to co-design and co-deliver MBA programs, including Strategy and Consulting and Business Analytics, at the UPES School of Business. MBA students will benefit from access to KPMG subject matter experts through in-person and virtual lectures, as well as practical experience via case studies and mentored projects. Upon completion, students will receive an MBA degree from UPES along with a certificate from KPMG in India, enhancing their academic and professional qualifications in the field of business education.

Dr. Parswajit Kalita is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in ion irradiation-induced effects in materials. Dr. Kalita's research focuses on radiation damage tolerance and mechanical energy harvesting for electronics and biomedical applications, particularly in fission/fusion reactor materials and self-powered devices. Dr. Kalita earned a PhD in Physics from the Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, and has participated in research at Universite Paris-Sud, France. Dr. Kalita employs a project-based teaching philosophy and has received multiple awards, including the Graduate Student Award from E-MRS and grants from the DAE-BRNS and UGC-DAE CSR.

Prof. Aanchal Sharma is an Associate at UPES with over ten years of experience in communication, focusing on strategic business communication and qualitative research. Prof. Aanchal's research explores communication management for social change and gender issues. Prior roles include faculty positions at FORE School of Management and Symbiosis International. Prof. Aanchal employs innovative teaching methods to engage students in communication skills essential for managerial decision-making. Notable achievements include being a gold medallist in Gender and Development Studies and conducting interdisciplinary research using qualitative methods. Prof. Aanchal is also UGC NET qualified in Journalism and Mass Communication.

The School for Life at UPES focuses on reimagining education to prepare students as future global citizens and leaders. The curriculum emphasizes broad-based learning experiences, equipping students with critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and adaptability for a dynamic world. Programmes include Core Specialization, Exploratory Electives, Signature, and Life Skills courses, fostering autonomous learning and personal development. Students engage in co-curricular activities and social internships, which are integral to developing character and empathy. The School for Life aims to create 21st-century learners who can navigate and contribute to a competitive global workforce.

Dr. Bharat Ankur Dogra is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business at UPES, specializing in Aviation Management and Mechanical Engineering. With over a decade of experience, Dr. Bharat holds a Ph.D. and dual Master's degrees. He has published numerous research papers and filed four patents, focusing on aerospace, aviation, and mechanical engineering. Dr. Bharat teaches various courses, engages students through interactive methods, and has received multiple awards for academic excellence. His research interests include digitalization in aviation, propulsion, additive manufacturing, and product design. Dr. Bharat actively participates in academic conferences and scholarly activities. Contact: bdogra@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Shibam Talukdar is an Assistant Professor of Law at the School of Law, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies, Dehradun. Shibam Talukdar holds a B.A., LL.B. (Hons.) from National Law University and an LL.M. in Constitutional and Administrative Law from Gujarat National Law University. Shibam Talukdar's research interests include Constitutional Law, Cyber Law, and Biotechnology Law. Shibam Talukdar teaches Jurisprudence and Environmental Studies and Law, and has experience in both academia and industry. Shibam Talukdar actively participates in scholarly activities, presenting at conferences, publishing articles, and editing a multi-author volume. Contact Shibam Talukdar at shibam.talukdar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The "How to Apply" page on the UPES website provides a step-by-step guide for prospective students seeking admission for the AY 2024-25. Applicants must choose a course, fill out an application form, pay a fee of Rs. 1350, and submit required documents, including academic records and identification. Additional documents are needed for Uttarakhand domicile applicants. After submitting, candidates will receive updates regarding entrance exams or interviews via registered contact details. Successful applicants will get a provisional offer letter and must pay an acceptance fee to secure their admission before the offer expires.

The M.Des. (Masters) in Transportation Design program at UPES equips students with innovative skills for sustainable transportation solutions. The curriculum covers automotive and urban design, emphasizing hands-on experience with tools like CAD and 3D printing. Students gain industry exposure through internships with leading companies such as Maruti Suzuki and Kia Motors. The program focuses on electric vehicle technologies and addresses current urban mobility trends. Graduates pursue careers as Transportation Designers, Design Strategists, and Project Associates in a growing field with a high demand for skilled professionals, offering promising placement opportunities.

The article "Importance of Communication Skills for Effective Leadership" by UPES Editorial Team emphasizes the critical role communication plays in leadership. Effective communication fosters trust and engagement between leaders and their teams, influencing both internal and external business outcomes. The article outlines why leaders must communicate clearly and address the importance of active listening and empathy. It suggests strategies for enhancing communication skills, such as maintaining an open-door policy, tailoring messages to audiences, and being receptive to feedback. Overall, the ability to communicate effectively is portrayed as essential for successful leadership.

Dr. Gaurav Bhardwaj is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in Robotics and AI. Dr. Gaurav Bhardwaj completed a PhD at IIT Roorkee focused on bipedal robot trajectory planning and has a MTech in Information Technology from IIIT Allahabad. Dr. Gaurav Bhardwaj's research includes published papers and a design patent for a bipedal robot. With experience as MD and CEO of a robotics startup, Dr. Gaurav Bhardwaj emphasizes innovation in teaching, aligning with industry needs, and has secured various grants for research and development activities. Contact Dr. Gaurav Bhardwaj at gaurav.bhardwaj@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Sakthivel S. is an Advisory Board Member at the School of Engineering, UPES, and serves as Assistant General Manager at Tata Consulting Engineers Ltd. in Mumbai, India. Dr. Sakthivel specializes in green chemicals, green fuels, energy transition, and decarbonization. His expertise includes process engineering, technology analysis, and techno-economic analysis. Dr. Sakthivel has extensive experience in pilot setups, process hazard analysis, and research, and has guided PhD dissertations while publishing multiple papers in national and international peer-reviewed journals.

UPES offers a variety of specialized minors for the School of Law. Key minors include Artificial Intelligence, focusing on data mining and visualization; Digital Marketing, encompassing social media and SEO; Digital Transformation, covering marketing analytics; Start Your Start-Up, highlighting entrepreneurship; Business Analytics, addressing big data; Financial Analysis, focusing on valuation and financial services; Family Business and Entrepreneurship; International Business; Operations/Project Management; and School for Life courses that enhance soft skills. Each minor equips students with practical skills relevant to current industry demands, preparing them for diverse career paths within the legal and business sectors.

UPES offers B.Sc. admissions for 2024, with applications closing on August 31, 2024. The B.Sc. program spans four years and provides specializations in Physical Sciences, Data Science, Cyber Security, Health Sciences, and Liberal Studies. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% marks in senior secondary education with relevant subjects. Notable industries partner with UPES for student placements, achieving a 94% placement rate in 2022-23. Students have access to a vibrant campus, advanced labs, and various career opportunities in sectors like healthcare and biotechnology. Interested candidates can apply through the UPES website.

Justice VK Maheshwari is an Advisory Board Member at the School of Law, UPES. He was born in Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, and earned a B.Sc. and LL.B. degree in 1972. Justice VK Maheshwari joined the Uttar Pradesh Judicial Service in 1975, ranking second, and served in various judicial roles before becoming a District and Sessions Judge in 2003. He was the Registrar General of the High Court of Uttarakhand from 2004 to 2009 and served as Vice-Chairman of the Uttarakhand Public Services Tribunal in 2016. Justice VK Maheshwari also contributes as an honorary faculty member for ONGC, THDC, and NHPC.

Dr. Bikarama Prasad Yadav is recognized as an Outstanding Mentor at UPES, notably for leading the NPTEL online course on Electronics Waste Management. Dr. Bikarama Prasad Yadav received the 2nd best project award from Delhi Metro Rail Corporation in 2006-2007 and contributed to ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 accreditations for multiple organizations between 2006 and 2011. Dr. Bikarama Prasad Yadav was named "Best Safety Staff" in 2008-2009 and is certified as a Lead Auditor for Environmental and Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems.

Sustainable Development Goal 6 (SDG 6) at UPES emphasizes ensuring universal access to clean water and sanitation by 2030. Key objectives include improving water quality, managing water resources efficiently, and engaging communities in decision-making. UPES has initiated significant projects like the innovative wastewater reclamation plant developed by Dr. Bhawna Lamba, supported by a ₹73 lakh project using microalgae for sewage treatment. The university is recognized as a ‘Zero Water Discharge’ campus, achieving 89% water savings through effective rainwater harvesting and efficient water recycling practices. The initiative aligns with India's broader “Clean India” mission.

Dhiren Swami, a B.Des. Transportation Mobility Design student at UPES (2018-2022), achieved first prize at the ADI Pune Design Festival 2023 for designing the B22 electric bike model. Dhiren Swami reflected on the journey as enriching, characterized by valuable learning experiences and innovative user scenarios. The project aimed to meet the new generation's mobility needs, culminating in the meticulous design and rendering of the electric bike solution. Dhiren Swami's achievement highlights the importance of creativity and practical learning in design education.

Dr. Sanjeev Kumar is a Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in material and organic chemistry with a focus on nanotechnology. With 14 years of teaching and research experience, Dr. Kumar has established innovative research labs. His research interests include Catalysis, Semiconductors, Magnetic Nanoparticles, and Wastewater Treatment. Dr. Kumar's teaching philosophy promotes creativity through learner-centered education. Courses taught encompass Organic Chemistry, Spectroscopy, and Nanotechnology. He has received notable awards, including a UGC-DAE project, and has published over 35 scholarly articles. Contact: skdubey@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Neelu Jyothi Ahuja, a Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, has over 24 years of academic experience, including 17 years at UPES. Dr. Ahuja specializes in AI applications, notably in education, and leads significant government-funded R&D projects worth over 1.5 crores since 2013. Dr. Ahuja's current projects involve developing an AI-based snake trapper and tools for individuals with learning disabilities. A prolific researcher with over 70 published papers, Dr. Ahuja has received multiple awards for contributions to education, including the Himalayan Nari Shakti Award and the Leading Women Researcher Award.

Sandeep Pratap Singh is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Computer Science, currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering after completing an M.Tech. in the same field. With over 10 years of academic experience, Sandeep Pratap Singh has expertise in image processing, computer vision, and security, having published research in high-impact SCI/SCOPUS journals. Sandeep Pratap Singh has held various administrative roles and organized numerous academic events. Sandeep Pratap Singh teaches diverse computer science courses, emphasizing a teaching philosophy that fosters curiosity among students. Contact Sandeep Pratap Singh at spsingh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology has partnered with Doon Medical College to collaborate on joint research projects, facilitate student exchanges, and provide internship opportunities. The partnership aims to enhance academic information sharing and organize joint conferences. Doon Medical College, located in Dehradun, is recognized for its excellence in medical education and patient care, committed to maintaining high standards in training, research, and patient services. This collaboration reflects a mutual commitment to advancing medical knowledge and professional development.

Prabhakar Dabral is an Assistant Professor – Senior Scale at UPES's School of Design, known for his expertise in illustration and publication design, as well as visual storytelling. He holds a degree from AIFD, Bangalore, and a post-graduation from the National Institute of Design, Gandhinagar. Prabhakar's professional journey includes roles as a Stylist, Communication Designer, and educator at various institutions. His research interests encompass visual narratives, art therapy, and learning experience design. Prabhakar Dabral emphasizes a teaching philosophy centered on experiential learning and deep conceptual understanding while engaging students through innovative methodologies.

Pranav Khalikar highlights the significant benefits of participating in a student exchange program. The key advantages include boosting self-confidence through new experiences, meeting diverse people from various backgrounds, exploring Europe with extensive travel opportunities, learning new languages, enjoying global cuisines, and enhancing employability. Pranav’s experience at the University of Maribor, Slovenia, enriched his personal growth and skills, transforming his academic future and increasing his job market competitiveness. Pranav encourages students to seize similar opportunities for a life-changing educational experience.

The BA in Journalism and Mass Communication (Digital) - Digital Publishing and Website Management program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is a 3+1 year course designed to equip students with essential skills in digital media and communications. The curriculum covers media writing, digital production, social media strategies, and data analysis, blending theory with practical experience through internships and projects. Graduates can pursue careers as digital content creators, online journalists, and social media managers, with placement opportunities in top media organizations. The program also emphasizes emerging technologies, ethical reporting, and digital media entrepreneurship.

UPES provides resources for parents to support their children’s educational journey at UPES. The UPES Parents section highlights the university's commitment to innovative learning and student success through various events, scholarships, and success stories. Parents can explore campus life, testimonials, and insights on how UPES prepares students for the industry, emphasizing all-round development. The university offers a dynamic curriculum across multiple disciplines including engineering, business, law, and health sciences, ensuring students are equipped for top job placements. UPES fosters a nurturing environment that encourages exploration and growth for its students.

UPES provides a supportive educational environment for students, enhancing their academic and personal growth. The university offers diverse programs across multiple schools, including Engineering, Business, Health Sciences, and Law, aimed at fostering innovation and global perspectives. Key resources include the Student Portal, comprehensive academic offerings, scholarships, and campus life activities. Notable recent events include the Spandan 2024 sports festival and UKTI Literature Fest. UPES also emphasizes student success stories, showcasing accomplishments that reflect the university’s commitment to holistic development and industry readiness. For more information, prospective students can access admissions resources and program details easily.

The UPES webpage discusses the future of international business in the post-COVID era, highlighting five key areas of change. Businesses must innovate and adapt to remote work, requiring professionals to upskill in international business laws and cultural understanding. There is a shift from China to other countries for operations, necessitating strategic workforce planning and human resource management expertise. Additionally, supply chain and financial strategies will change due to production challenges, emphasizing international logistics and finance skills. Corporate social responsibility will gain importance, making advanced skills crucial for success in international business careers. UPES prepares students for these demands with a strong program and impressive placement statistics.

Dehradun, known for its educational institutions and natural beauty, offers numerous hangout spots for college students. Key locations include the Forest Research Institute, featuring Greco-Roman architecture and several museums; Tapkeshwar Temple, a picturesque temple dedicated to Lord Shiva; Robbers Cave, a natural cave with cold springs, ideal for picnics; and Lachhiwala, a serene area perfect for relaxation and trekking. These affordable attractions cater to students seeking enjoyable experiences amidst Dehradun's lush environment, making the city an inviting destination for leisure and socializing.

The webpage details that two programs at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) School of Business—Master of Business Administration (Oil and Gas Management) and Master of Business Administration (Logistics and Supply Chain Management)—received specialized accreditation from the International Accreditation Council for Business Education (IACBE) in 2017. UPES is noted as the only university in India with IACBE Accreditation, emphasizing the institution's commitment to quality business education.

Dr. Abhishek Bharti is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, Dehradun. Dr. Bharti holds a Ph.D. in statistics from Banaras Hindu University and specializes in applied statistics, mathematical demography, stochastic processes, and public health. He has published significant research on conception rates, parity progression, infant mortality, and maternity care. Dr. Bharti teaches Business Mathematics, Business Statistics, and Business Research Methods. He is a member of the International Indian Statistical Association, Indian Society for Medical Statistics, and Indian Association for the Study of Population. Dr. Bharti received the Junior Research Fellowship in 2013.

UPES has established partnerships with AIIMS, Drishti Eye Institute, Merck Life Science, and Taipei Medical University to enhance research, academic exchanges, and participation in international events. The collaboration with AIIMS Rishikesh focuses on developing health infrastructure in Uttarakhand and joint research proposals. Taipei Medical University aims to foster student exchanges and joint projects in pharmaceutical sciences. The agreement with Drishti Eye Institute promotes academic exchanges and joint research initiatives. Additionally, UPES and Merck Life Science will work together on skill development programs for students in scientific training related to biopharmaceuticals.

The webpage provides information about the Master of Science (M.Sc.) program offered by the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES. The program focuses on applied sciences with a strong emphasis on advanced engineering concepts, preparing students for careers in engineering and technology. The webpage includes details about eligibility criteria, the application process, and the educational structure. Prospective students can contact UPES for counseling and queries. The campus is located in Dehradun, and the program aims to equip graduates with the necessary skills for professional success in the engineering field.

The M.Sc. in Chemistry (Organic Chemistry) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a comprehensive curriculum focused on advanced organic chemistry concepts, including bio-organic molecules, heterocycles, and natural products. Students gain practical experience in modern laboratories and engage in research projects, preparing them for diverse careers in academia, research, and industry. The program also emphasizes eco-friendly chemical processes and innovative materials. Admission requires 50% in relevant subjects, and selection is based on personal interviews. The program is backed by dedicated placement assistance to support graduates in securing promising career opportunities.

Vijay Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, holding a Ph.D. and M.Sc. in Statistics from IIT Bombay. His expertise includes advanced statistical methodologies, data analysis, and proficiency in software such as R, Python, and IBM SPSS. Prior to UPES, Vijay Kumar was a Research Associate at IIT Bombay. His research interests focus on applied statistics, probability, and stochastic processes. Vijay Kumar emphasizes a student-centered teaching philosophy, fostering engagement, while teaching courses in biostatistics and statistics. Vijay Kumar has published several papers in reputable journals and has achieved notable academic rankings in IIT JAM and GATE.

The article "Unleashing Creativity: Exploring the Intersection of Design and Innovation," authored by Manas Ranjan Mishra, discusses the evolving relationship between design and innovation in the face of rapid technological growth. It emphasizes that design has transitioned from mere aesthetics to a critical tool for solving real-world problems and enhancing user experience. Mishra stresses the importance of inclusive, sustainable design that considers the impact of automation on employment. The piece advocates for frameworks that promote equitable technological advancements, ensuring that innovation serves the greater good while addressing ethical concerns in a competitive landscape.

The B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering specializing in Digitalization of Process Technology at UPES School of Advanced Engineering prepares students for modern industry by integrating chemical engineering principles with digital technologies. The curriculum includes core subjects like thermodynamics and fluid mechanics, alongside digital tools for process optimization. Students gain hands-on experience through labs and internships. Graduates can pursue careers in various sectors, including chemicals and pharmaceuticals, with opportunities at leading companies such as ExxonMobil and Reliance Industries. The program emphasizes sustainability, entrepreneurship, and innovation, aligning education with Industry 4.0 demands.

The BBA (Green Energy & Sustainability) - Sustainable Development program at UPES prepares students for management roles in green energy and sustainable development industries. This three-year full-time program emphasizes knowledge of non-conventional energy sources, sustainability practices, and includes practical elements like internships and industry projects. The curriculum integrates the three pillars of sustainable development: environmental, social, and economic sustainability. Graduates can pursue diverse career paths, including roles in renewable energy, sustainability consulting, and corporate sustainability. The increasing demand for professionals in this field ensures robust placement opportunities and competitive salaries.

Rashika Srivastava, an esteemed alumna of UPES, graduated in 2016 with a BBA in Aviation Management. She is the current Director of RCube Healthcare Industries Pvt. Ltd. and has been honored as a Woman Business Leader in India. Rashika Srivastava furthered her education with a Master's degree from the University of Northampton. With a focus on innovation and growth, Rashika Srivastava is dedicated to enhancing the company's impact within the Pharmaceutical Industry, showcasing leadership and a commitment to excellence in her field.

Dr. Uday Bhaskar Sharma is an Assistant Professor at UPES School of Liberal Studies, specializing in Mathematics, particularly in combinatorics and group theory. He leads the B.Sc. in Applied Mathematics and Statistics program. Dr. Sharma completed post-doctoral research at IISER Pune and TIFR Mumbai, and earned his Ph.D. from the Institute of Mathematical Sciences, Chennai. His teaching philosophy emphasizes student-centric learning and hands-on experiences. Dr. Sharma has published four research papers and has two more in progress. He received the University Gold Medal during his Master's at the University of Hyderabad in 2011.

The B.Tech in Sustainability Engineering offered by UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a four-year program that prepares students for careers in sustainability by focusing on Sustainability Management and Circular Economy. This program addresses sustainability challenges, emphasizing engineering practices and policies aligned with the UN's Sustainable Development Goals. Graduates gain skills for roles such as sustainability specialists and managers, with a 100% placement rate and expected salaries of 8-10 lakhs per annum. The program includes exclusive courses, collaboration with international universities, and exposure to cutting-edge sustainability practices, ensuring relevance in a growing market focused on eco-friendly solutions.

The MBA in Digital Business at UPES School of Business offers specializations in Web Design and Development, and Cloud Computing. The program addresses the demand for professionals skilled in digital strategies and transformation, featuring a robust curriculum developed with industry collaboration. Students engage in hands-on projects and internships while learning core business principles and advanced digital skills. Career prospects include roles in UX/UI design, digital marketing, and e-commerce. The program sees placements in top companies like Flipkart and Accenture, with starting salaries ranging from INR 4-15 lakh. Applicants must have 50% marks in past academic qualifications.

Sustainable Development Goal 11 (SDG 11) focuses on making cities and human settlements safe, inclusive, resilient, and sustainable. Key objectives include providing affordable housing, enhancing access to basic services, improving transport systems, preserving cultural heritage, and minimizing environmental impacts. UPES engages in various initiatives like Project Utthan for rural development, and Project Artisan promoting local craft, alongside programs like M.Tech in Disaster Management and B.Tech in Sustainability Management. These efforts aim to empower communities, enhance livelihoods, and promote sustainable practices across urban and rural areas.

Mahesh Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Modern Media, UPES, with 16 years of experience in studio management, production, coordination, and administration. Mahesh Sharma specializes in conducting workshops on camera operation, editing techniques, and special shoots, fostering student growth in media production skills. Research interests include advancing media production techniques, especially in camera work and editing. Mahesh Sharma has been recognized for excellence in administration during previous roles, including Manager Broadcast at Omnific Global Communications Pvt. Ltd. and Studio Incharge at CNEB News Channel. Mahesh Sharma is dedicated to promoting continuous improvement and creativity in education.

Dr. Bhupendra Singh is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at UPES's School of Computer Science, with over eight years of teaching and research experience. Dr. Singh specializes in IoT, Computer Graphics, and Gaming, combining academic expertise with 3.5 years of industry experience at Sapient Consulting. Dr. Singh's startup, Sense 3D Technologies, focuses on gesture-based controllers for gaming. Key interests include healthcare applications and Human-Computer Interaction. Dr. Singh has five patents and over ten published research papers, and has authored a textbook on 3D Graphics Programming. Dr. Singh emphasizes foundational knowledge and practical lab work in teaching.

Nikhil Tikhe is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, specializing in System Design, Design Thinking, Industrial Design, Craft Development, Material Manipulation, and Prototyping. With a strong advocacy for environmental sustainability, Nikhil Tikhe emphasizes user-centric and ergonomic design solutions. Nikhil Tikhe's experience includes roles at Parul University and Bhanwar Rathore Design Studio, alongside significant research in Indian craft techniques. Nikhil Tikhe’s teaching philosophy focuses on foundational design principles and promoting sustainable practices, aiming to inspire students to create innovative solutions that positively impact society.

UPES is actively contributing to the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) through various innovative projects. Key initiatives include Project Naman, which supports families of martyrs; Project Vikalp, empowering rural women; and Project UK, improving rural livelihoods via small watermill enhancements. UPES has also implemented health, education, and gender equality programs, such as “We Care” for mental health support and Shakti for women's leadership development. Furthermore, UPES focuses on clean energy with a solar power plant and engages in community development projects. UPES promotes collaboration, education, and awareness to ensure sustainable progress for future generations.

Sustainable Development Goal 14 (SDG 14) focuses on conserving and sustainably using the ocean and marine resources. SDG 14 addresses marine pollution, biodiversity protection, and sustainable fisheries. Key objectives include reducing marine pollution, managing coastal ecosystems, combating ocean acidification, regulating fishing, conserving marine areas, and enhancing economic benefits for small island developing states. The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) actively contributes to these goals through various projects, such as reducing fishnet entanglement of dugongs and offering relevant academic programs in Geology, Environmental, Earth, and Marine Sciences.

The Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) and All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Rishikesh focuses on enhancing academic and research collaboration. The agreement aims to foster academic excellence in health sciences and technology, facilitate exchanges of students and scholars, promote joint research projects, and organize conferences. UPES and AIIMS Rishikesh plan to develop health infrastructure in Uttarakhand, highlighting their ongoing collaborations in fields like microbiology and clinical research, with recent joint publications gaining international attention.

UPES offers M.Tech. admissions for 2024, closing on August 31, 2024. M.Tech. is a two-year postgraduate degree available in various specializations, including Computer Science and Engineering, Chemical Engineering, and Petroleum Engineering.Eligibility requires a minimum of 60% marks at the higher secondary level and a relevant undergraduate degree. The program focuses on industry-relevant skills, boasting a 96.55% placement rate with over 760 recruiters in 2021-22. Scholarships and fellowships are available based on merit. Interested candidates can apply online or offline, with application fees set at Rs. 1350.

The MBA in Power Management program at UPES prepares graduates for leadership roles in the power and renewable energy sectors. The two-year curriculum combines business fundamentals with specialized knowledge in areas such as Power Business and Regulation, and Green Energy Transition. Students engage in internships, industrial projects, and utilize cutting-edge tools like Python and SPSS. Graduates have promising career prospects with top organizations, facing high demand in roles such as Power Consultant and Sustainability Specialist. Eligibility requires a minimum 50% in Class X, XII, and graduation from a recognized university. The program emphasizes practical experience and industry connections.

Apoorva Jha, a student in the MBA Aviation Management program at UPES, has achieved an outstanding placement at Accenture Solutions Pvt. Ltd. Apoorva Jha's impressive academic performance and skills have resulted in a lucrative job offer with a package of 29.4 lakh. This accomplishment highlights Apoorva Jha's potential and capabilities in the field of aviation management, showcasing the high placement success rates of UPES graduates.

Dr. Prabhat Ranjan Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in swarm intelligence, optimization techniques, and natural language processing. His research examines energy transition technology and economic development. Dr. Prabhat's teaching philosophy focuses on student engagement and practical applications of technology. Courses include Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Java programming. He earned a Ph.D. from Wuhan University of Technology and has published in renowned journals. Dr. Prabhat's innovative projects address optimization and cloud computing challenges. Contact Dr. Prabhat at prabhat.ranjan@ddn.upes.ac.in for inquiries.

Dr. Vipin Gaur is an Institutional Representative for UPES involved in prestigious international projects "Belle" and "Belle II" at KEK (Japan). On September 28, 2022, Dr. Gaur facilitated a visit from the DST Secretary to the Belle II project. Previously, during Dr. Gaur's tenure at KEK via Virginia Tech (USA), the Indian Ambassador and the Science & Technology Counselor engaged with Dr. Gaur and other Indian principal investigators at KEK. The Belle projects receive full support from the Government of India, aimed at advancing mega science and technology initiatives.

Piyush Rawat is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, since June 2022. Piyush Rawat earned a Ph.D. from NIT Hamirpur in 2022 and an MTech in Computer Science and Technology in 2018. Piyush Rawat's research focuses on Wireless Sensor Networks and IoT, with publications in SCI/Scopus/ESCI-indexed journals. Piyush Rawat employs a teaching philosophy that emphasizes mutual learning and deeper understanding through articulation of concepts. Courses taught include Data Communication and Computer Networks and Digital Logic. Piyush Rawat has qualified GATE multiple times and actively participates in scholarly activities. Contact at piyush.rawat@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The blog post by Shailja Katyal Verma highlights how education serves as a transformative force for underprivileged youth. Supported by Purkal Youth Development Society (PYDS) and UPES, students like Astha Rana, Akash Pal, Amisha Chauhan, and Anchal Tailwal have secured full scholarships, significantly altering their life trajectories. UPES initiated Project Protsaahan in 2018, providing comprehensive financial support for deserving PYDS candidates. The project has facilitated access to education for 15 students to date, reinforcing UPES's commitment to inclusion and the empowerment of aspiring professionals from low-income backgrounds.

Mohit Singh, an alumnus of the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), graduated in 2017 with an MBA in Power Management. Mohit Singh is currently the Assistant Vice President of Climate Connect Digital and has received the distinguished Solar Quarter 40 Under 40 Award for Young Indian Solar Pioneer. This award recognizes individuals under 40 who have significantly contributed to solar energy in India. Mohit Singh was the youngest recipient on the list of 40 honorees, with the physical award event set for October 2023.

The School of Law at UPES offers comprehensive legal education, emphasizing outcome-based learning and innovative teaching methods. In the 2022-23 academic year, UPES achieved notable placement success with partnerships ensuring students gain industry exposure. The career services department facilitates summer internships lasting from eight weeks to six months, helping students align with their career goals. The EDGE program enhances skills in entrepreneurship and employability, while various workshops prepare students for professional challenges. The School of Law proudly maintains a strong track record of high placements and competitive salary offers for graduates.

The webpage provides detailed information about the Ph.D. in Engineering program at UPES University for the 2024 admission cycle. The program offers research-based education across various engineering disciplines, with a duration of 3 to 6 years. Candidates must hold a Master's degree with at least 55% marks. The program includes advanced coursework and research, with specializations available in areas such as Aerospace, Chemical, and Civil Engineering. Admission deadlines include a final application date of June 3, 2024, with interviews scheduled for July 18-22, 2024. Full-time students may receive a stipend and fees are structured at INR 25,000 per semester after waivers.

Dr. Kapil Kumar is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Dr. Kapil Kumar holds a Ph.D. in Medicinal Chemistry from the National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education and Research (NIPER) Mohali, India. With over 11 years of experience, Dr. Kapil Kumar has published over 34 peer-reviewed articles and participated in various national and international conferences. Dr. Kapil Kumar's research focuses on pharmacological synthesis related to cancer, diabetes, and infectious diseases, and includes numerous awards and grants for research initiatives. Dr. Kapil Kumar employs an active learning approach in teaching.

UPES offers B.Com. (Bachelor of Commerce) admissions for 2024, with a closing date of August 31, 2024. The three-year program covers core subjects in commerce and finance, with specializations such as B.Com. (Hons.) and B.Com. Banking, Insurance & Management. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in class X and XII. The program includes a curriculum focused on financial accounting, economics, and business management, enhanced with AI and ML tools. Graduates have diverse career prospects in finance, accounting, and business roles. UPES also provides a vibrant campus life and various scholarships.

Dr. Debashis Majumder is a Professor at the School of Design at UPES, specializing in Industrial Design and Transportation and Mobility Design. With over 30 years of experience, Dr. Debashis holds a PhD from UPES, a master's from NID, and a bachelor's in mechanical engineering. Dr. Debashis has worked with top companies like Tata Motors and Mahindra Defense before entering academia. Research interests include Furniture Design, Military Vehicle Design, and Design Management. Dr. Debashis emphasizes a multidisciplinary design approach and teaches various courses like Design Process and Transportation Design. Notable awards include multiple Best Paper Awards and significant contributions to design research.

The M.Tech. in Construction Technology and Management program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering aims to develop specialized skills in civil engineering. The curriculum covers areas such as construction management, financial planning, project management, and offers electives in building efficiency, forensic engineering, and disaster management. Students undergo practical training through internships with construction firms, enhancing real-world skills. Graduates are prepared for roles such as Construction Project Manager and BIM Manager, addressing increasing industry demands linked to smart cities and infrastructure development. The program ensures strong placement support and industry connections to facilitate successful career opportunities.

Prof. Bhaskar Bhatt serves as the Dean of the School of Design at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) and has over 22 years of experience in design education and institution building. Prof. Bhaskar Bhatt oversees undergraduate and master's programs, aligning curricula with industry trends. A member of the CII National Committee for Design and advisory member for Gujarat's Student Startup Policy, Prof. Bhaskar Bhatt has held leadership roles at various prestigious institutions. Prof. Bhaskar Bhatt's research includes affordable med-tech innovation and public health design, collaborating internationally on projects with Johns Hopkins University.

The UPES webpage on Safe Hostel and Safe Haven outlines safety measures for students in hostels. Key protocols include deep cleaning and sanitization, strict access control, social distancing, and health screenings at entry points. Meal services are organized in shifts to avoid crowding, and there are available medical services, including telemedicine and a psychologist. Employees must adhere to health protocols, ensuring minimal contact and social distancing. The page emphasizes a comprehensive approach to wellbeing and safety, ensuring a secure environment for all residents and staff at UPES campuses in Dehradun.

Dr. Tarandeep Kaur Bhatia is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 6 years of research and teaching experience at three universities. Dr. Tarandeep Kaur Bhatia earned a Ph.D. in Computer Science Engineering from Deakin University, Australia, and is a Gold Medalist in M.Tech. Dr. Tarandeep Kaur Bhatia holds 22 patents and has published over 28 research papers. Research interests include Vehicular Ad-hoc NETworks, Data Congestion, Networking, Software Engineering, and Artificial Intelligence. Dr. Tarandeep Kaur Bhatia is also involved in various editorial and review activities in academic journals.

The B.Tech (Civil Engineering) - Transportation Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides a comprehensive curriculum emphasizing planning, designing, operating, and managing transportation systems. Students explore multidisciplinary concepts and gain expertise in AI, machine learning, and virtual reality applications. The program prepares graduates for in-demand roles in transportation planning, infrastructure development, and sustainable projects amidst evolving industry trends. Students benefit from strong placement support and practical exposure through projects and internships. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Classes X and XII, with selection based on UPESEAT, JEE, or other criteria.

The webpage discusses career opportunities and the scope of chemical engineering, highlighting its relevance across various industries, including pharmaceuticals, food processing, and environmental remediation. Chemical engineering transforms raw materials into useful products, and the Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech.) program offers specializations in energy systems, petrochemicals, and digital process technology. Potential career paths for graduates include petroleum engineers, data analysts, energy engineers, and chemical process engineers, each with unique responsibilities and growth opportunities in a rapidly evolving field. A degree in chemical engineering provides a pathway to impactful and rewarding careers.

Sanjay Rawat, an alumnus of UPES, graduated in 2016 with an MBA in Power Management. Currently serving as Assistant Manager at Accenture Technology, Sanjay Rawat has received notable recognition, including the distinguished Master's Award and a patent, showcasing his innovative contributions. Furthermore, Sanjay Rawat was honored with the FY23 Q2 Accenture ACE Award, reflecting his dedication and commitment to excellence in technology at Accenture.

Dr. Vibhu Jately serves as an Assistant Professor (Selection Grade) at the School of Computer Science, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), since October 2021. Dr. Vibhu Jately holds a Ph.D. from G. B. Pant University and has over 8 years of experience in teaching and research. Dr. Vibhu Jately's expertise includes power electronics in renewable energy systems and AI techniques for microgrid planning. Dr. Vibhu Jately has published numerous articles and has led European-funded projects. Courses taught include Power Electronics and Nonconventional Energy Resources. Contact Dr. Vibhu Jately at vibhu.jately@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Anand Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES). Dr. Anand Kumar received a B.E. in Electronics and Communications Engineering, an M.E. from Birla Institute of Technology, and a Ph.D. from the National Institute of Technology. Dr. Anand Kumar's research interests include underwater acoustic communication, channel estimation, and machine learning. Dr. Anand Kumar has experience as a Project Associate in underwater sensor networks and has taught various computer science-related courses, focusing on innovative problem-solving approaches and inclusive teaching methods.

Lavendra Kumar Shukla is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, specializing in Transportation Design. With a background in architecture, Lavendra Kumar Shukla has experience in the real estate industry and has worked at TATA ACGL. Lavendra Kumar Shukla's research interests focus on enhancing educational methodologies for design students. Lavendra Kumar Shukla teaches courses such as 3D Printing and Vehicle Styling Projects and led a team to second place in the World Design Challenge. Lavendra Kumar Shukla aims to incorporate practical insights into teaching while pursuing a future PhD. Contact Lavendra Kumar Shukla at lovendrak.shukla@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The collaboration between UPES School of Design and Istituto Europeo di Design (IED), Italy, aims to enhance research and facilitate international student exchange. IED offers programs in Design, Fashion, Visual Arts, and Communication. This partnership will enable joint educational projects, promote student mobility for intercultural competence, facilitate faculty exchanges, and broaden cooperation between IED and UPES. Additionally, UPES students will have access to IED programs at a reduced cost, enriching their academic opportunities and global exposure in the design field.

UPES, established in 2003, is Asia's first energy and core sector university, now recognized for its innovative and industry-focused education. It ranks 46th overall in NIRF 2024, with high placements in engineering, management, and law. UPES offers diverse programs across various schools, including Advanced Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Design, Health Sciences, Law, and Liberal Studies. The university emphasizes academic excellence, global citizenship, and entrepreneurship through initiatives like the 'Runway' incubator. UPES promotes values such as respect, innovation, inclusivity, and sustainability, while fostering a collaborative learning environment for students.

The M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence at UPES is a two-year program designed to meet industry needs through a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical application in AI and Machine Learning. The curriculum includes two hands-on projects and an industry internship, ensuring job-readiness. Students gain expertise in programming languages and work with leading IT companies through partnerships with organizations like IBM and AWS Academy. High demand exists for graduates, with opportunities as Data Scientists, AI Engineers, and Machine Learning Developers. Scholarships and financial aid are available to enhance accessibility.

The BBA (Analytics and Big Data) program at UPES, Dehradun is a three-year course designed to equip students with essential skills in data analytics and programming languages such as Python and R. The curriculum covers data manipulation, statistical analysis, data visualization, and machine learning, with an emphasis on practical applications through projects, internships, and industry interaction. Graduates can pursue diverse career paths like Data Analyst and Business Analyst, with placements in companies including Flipkart and Deloitte, often starting with salaries between INR 6-30 lakh per annum. Admission requirements include a minimum of 50% marks in Classes X and XII.

Dr. Priya Ranjan is a professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with expertise in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. Dr. Ranjan graduated from IIT Kharagpur and earned M.S. and Ph.D. degrees from the University of Maryland. His research interests include Networking, Delays, Nonlinear Dynamics, and Sensor Networks. Dr. Ranjan's teaching philosophy emphasizes student-driven exploration. He teaches various courses and has received awards from agencies like NSF and DARPA. Dr. Ranjan has published over fifty research articles and collaborates on projects in biological computation and oncological image processing. Contact: priya.ranjan@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES offers industry visits for students across various schools, enhancing their education and practical knowledge. In 2014, M.Design Transportation students toured TVS Motors and Tata Elxsi Ltd., learning about design and manufacturing. In 2015, students visited Hero MotoCorp and Bajaj Auto, exploring innovative production techniques. The School of Advanced Engineering conducted tours to Siemens Ltd. and DRDO, focusing on AI and advanced technologies. The School of Computer Science organized visits to Sun Mobility and NxtGen, discussing emerging tech trends. These industry visits significantly enrich student learning experiences and promote industry connections.

The Integrated BBA-MBA in Marketing Management program at UPES provides a comprehensive education in business, marketing concepts, and management strategies. It emphasizes experiential learning through internships and projects, equipping students with skills in areas such as digital marketing and consumer behavior. Graduates are prepared for roles such as marketing manager, brand manager, and digital marketing specialist across various industries. The program supports real-world insights through industry expert sessions and hands-on projects. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Classes X and XII, and selection is based on entrance exam performance.

Akash Banerjee, founder and host of 'The DeshBhakt', delivered a masterclass at UPES about the significance of satire in journalism. He discussed how humor amplifies the impact of facts, particularly amidst political censorship and a polarized media landscape. Banerjee emphasized the distinction between satire and comedy, noting that, unlike traditional comedy, satire engages with serious societal issues. During the session, he addressed the challenges of producing satirical content amidst political scrutiny, the evolution of digital media, and the financial model of independent journalism reliant on audience support rather than advertising.

Dr. Ajit Yadav is an Assistant Professor of Finance at the School of Business, University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) in Dehradun, India. Dr. Ajit Yadav holds a Doctorate in Finance from Banaras Hindu University and has qualified UGC-NET JRF. Research interests include Standard Finance, Asset Pricing, and Behavioural Finance, with publications in Scopus and Web of Science journals. Dr. Ajit Yadav has two years of academic experience, teaching subjects like Financial Management and Financial Analytics. Dr. Ajit Yadav emphasizes ethics, critical thinking, and a nurturing learning environment for students. Contact Dr. Ajit Yadav at ajit.yadav@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Mousim Mitra is a Professor of Practice in Graphic Design at the School of Design, UPES, with over 25 years of experience in Advertising, Graphic Design, and Retail Design. An alumnus of the National Institute of Design, Mousim has held leadership roles in various design firms and has significant industry experience across multiple sectors. His research interests include typography, fashion communication, and advertising. Mousim teaches courses such as Typography and Creative Writing, focusing on real-world projects to enhance student creativity. His work has received multiple awards, and he actively contributes to fine arts and educational publications.

Dr. Hemant Petwal is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Computer Science and Engineering, UPES. He earned a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology in 2021. Dr. Hemant specializes in soft computing and optimization algorithms, with teaching subjects including Python Programming and Machine Learning. He has published over seven research papers and holds two patents. Dr. Hemant believes in integrating real-world applications into teaching to foster critical thinking and creativity among students. Previously, he worked at Bennett University and has industrial experience as an Oracle developer.

Manorma Bhandari is a Ph.D. Scholar in the Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences at UPES, belonging to the 2021-2024 batch. Manorma Bhandari earned the 2nd Prize for Best E-Poster Presentation at the International Conference on Nanopharmaceuticals and Neurological Disorders 2023 (ICNAND2023), which took place from February 2-4, 2023, at Indira Gandhi National Tribal University, Amarkantak, Madhya Pradesh, India. The presentation focused on "Identifying the potential natural compounds against mGluR5 using in silico approach," exploring herbal medicines for autism targeting synaptogenic pathways. Manorma Bhandari's research includes in silico drug discovery and natural compound isolation.

Dr. Kaushik Ghosh, a faculty member in the School of Computer Science at UPES, achieved copyright for creating a novel traffic control solution based on traffic density, designated as "A SOLUTION FOR TRAFFIC CONTROL BASED UPON TRAFFIC DENSITY." This initiative addresses inefficiencies in current fixed-timing traffic systems prevalent in Indian metro areas, proposing a dynamic approach that adjusts signal timings based on real-time traffic volume. The solution utilizes a simulation framework developed with Proteus, aiming to optimize traffic flow and enhance intersection efficiency, demonstrating a shift from manual to automated traffic management systems. Copyright Registration Number: SW-15781/2022.

Graduates can pursue careers in food industries, public health, and environmental organizations, capitalizing on trends in sustainable practices and biotechnology.
