NBA aims to ensure quality and relevance in professional and technical disciplines, improving educational outcomes and employability of graduates. UPES is dedicated to maintaining high accreditation standards under NBA for its various academic programs, enhancing the educational experience for students.

The webpage discusses the concept of a video resume, highlighting its importance as a modern tool for job applicants. Dr. Balendra Pratap Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES, specializing in Astrophysics and Astronomy. Dr. Balendra Pratap Singh's research focuses on alternative theories of gravity, black holes, and cosmology, with over ten publications and significant citations. Dr. Balendra Pratap Singh has received multiple awards, including the Best Researcher award by GECL-2022.

Dr. Kaustav Padmapati is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES. Dr. Kaustav specializes in political science, international relations, American studies, and gender studies, with notable expertise in US foreign policy and East Asian politics. Contact Dr. Kaustav at kaustav.padmapati@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES blog by Diana George discusses how prosthetics can transform disabilities into opportunities. The field of prosthetics is projected to grow by 20 percent over the next decade, focusing on the design and creation of artificial devices to replace lost body parts. Aspiring prosthetists need specialized education and training, such as UPES' B.Tech. in Biomedical Engineering. Key skills required include communication, attention to detail, patience, and physical stamina. Graduates can pursue various roles, including biomedical researchers and clinical engineers, or continue higher education. Overall, the advancements in prosthetics significantly enhance mobility and quality of life for individuals with disabilities.

The B.Sc. Food, Nutrition & Dietetics program with a specialization in Nutraceutical and Nutritional Policy at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology equips students to address nutritional needs and influence public health policy. The curriculum includes hands-on training, emphasizing practical skills and industry exposure. Key topics include human nutrition, nutraceuticals, and policy impacts. Graduates can pursue careers as dietitians, nutrition consultants, or in policy development. The program offers strong industry connections, enhancing placement opportunities. It aligns with trends in personalized nutrition and increasing demand for functional foods and sustainable practices in health.

The B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Internet of Things) program at UPES School of Computer Science offers a comprehensive education in IoT technologies, focusing on sensors, networks, and data analysis. The curriculum prepares students for careers in smart cities, healthcare, and other industries. With partnerships, including one with IBM, students gain practical experience and industry insights. Graduates can pursue roles such as IoT solution architect or embedded systems engineer, benefiting from strong placement opportunities with leading companies. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in Class X, XII, and PCM. Admissions are based on UPESEAT or other entrance exams.

Prasun Chakraborty is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with a focus on design and illustration. He holds master’s degrees from the National Institute of Design and the Government College of Art and Craft. Prasun's career spans various textile industries, and he is currently pursuing a PhD on Indian political cartoons. He emphasizes a supportive teaching philosophy and teaches courses in sketching, color theory, digital design, and more. Prasun has authored books and papers on political cartooning, participated in exhibitions, and explores societal challenges through his research.

Rohit Ranjan is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in Corporate Laws and Access to Justice. His research focuses on the Right to Equality and Socio-Legal Rights. Rohit Ranjan holds an undergraduate degree from National Law University in Ranchi and an LLM from Tata Institute of Social Sciences in Mumbai. With 7.5 years of experience in academia and industry, including work at Snehadhara Foundation, Rohit Ranjan promotes disability rights and inclusive legal frameworks. He teaches Jurisprudence, Family Law, and Law of Crimes, advocating for critical thinking and student engagement. He has authored publications on disability rights and empowerment.

The UPES School of Liberal Studies offers a Bachelor of Arts program designed to equip students with media literacy for the evolving media landscape. The BA curriculum includes specializations like Journalism and Mass Communication and Digital Mass Media. Students gain practical experience through state-of-the-art studios, internships, and industry collaborations. The program emphasizes critical media analysis and content creation across formats. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Class X and XII, with fees structured per semester. Career opportunities range from journalism to digital media roles, supported by faculty expertise and global partnerships.

Dr. Panduranga Ravi Teja is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in 5G network technologies and game theory to optimize resource allocation. Dr. Panduranga Ravi Teja's research includes efficient resource management for telecommunications and machine learning applications. Dr. Panduranga Ravi Teja's teaching philosophy emphasizes practical applications of theory in advanced networking and telecommunications. Dr. Panduranga Ravi Teja teaches courses on networking architectures, Data Science, AI/ML, Digital Electronics, and IoT, aiming to equip students for future technological challenges. Dr. Panduranga Ravi Teja is actively involved in collaborative research and international projects.

The webpage discusses five promising career options for graduates with an M.Sc. in Biochemistry. Graduates can pursue roles such as Biochemist, Research Scientist, Clinical Biochemist, Teacher, or continue their education with a Ph.D. Biochemistry plays a vital role across various sectors, including medicine, agriculture, and pharmacy, helping in drug development, disease treatment, and analysis of nutritional content. The UPES program offers a multidisciplinary, research-focused education that prepares students for diverse careers in biochemistry, emphasizing critical thinking and real-world application in solving societal challenges.

Dr. Priyanka Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, India, with a PhD in Data Science from IIT(ISM) and IIRS (ISRO). Dr. Priyanka Singh has received multiple awards for contributions in machine learning and spatial sciences. Prior to UPES, Dr. Priyanka Singh held a faculty role at Symbiosis International University and served as a Postdoctoral Research Associate at IIRS, ISRO. Research interests include Data Science, Geospatial Technology, and Health GIS. Dr. Priyanka Singh is also involved in significant projects like IBIN and has authored award-winning publications. Contact: Priyanka.singh@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Seema Shukla is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES, specializing in sound design and media content creation. Dr. Seema Shukla studied at the Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute and Punjabi University. Prior to academia, Dr. Seema Shukla worked as a sound designer in Bollywood and Tollywood with notable films like My Name is Khan. Dr. Seema Shukla’s documentary, 'Santitaion,' won the Best Critique award at a 2022 festival. Dr. Seema Shukla's teaching emphasizes innovative methods and critical thinking in audiovisual and media education.

Sudeept Maharana is the Vice President and India Head of Priceline Technology India LLP, part of Booking Holdings, which is the world's largest travel technology company. Sudeept has held leadership roles at IBM, Oracle, and KPMG, and has experience working in the US, UK, Sweden, and India. Sudeept is a Computer Engineering graduate from NIT and is pursuing a Ph.D. at IIT Jodhpur. Sudeept specializes in product engineering and artificial intelligence, particularly in deep learning and machine learning. Sudeept enjoys reading and watching movies and is married with one son.

The Master of Design (User Experience & Interaction Design) program at UPES is a two-year postgraduate course aimed at developing UX/ID specialists. The curriculum includes research-based learning and hands-on projects in advanced interaction design, taught by experienced faculty. Students benefit from state-of-the-art facilities, internships, and industry expert collaborations. The program anticipates a growth of 30% in job opportunities, particularly in UI design for emerging technologies. Graduates can pursue careers as user researchers, usability analysts, information architects, or interaction designers, with competitive placements from top companies. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in relevant educational qualifications.

UPES offers a B.Tech in Aerospace Engineering with a specialization in Avionics. This program focuses on advanced skills required in aerospace technology, including avionics system design and maintenance, preparing students for careers in the thriving aerospace sector. The curriculum includes hands-on training in state-of-the-art laboratories and projects that align with industry trends. Graduates can pursue opportunities in various aerospace roles, with potential salaries ranging from 4 to 10 lakhs annually. UPES emphasizes placement support, assisting students in securing positions in leading aerospace and technology firms.

The B.Tech. Applied Petroleum Engineering (Intelligent Petroleum Systems) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is designed to equip students with essential skills for the evolving petroleum industry. The curriculum includes reservoir engineering, drilling, production engineering, and intelligent technologies like AI and data analytics. The program emphasizes practical training through internships and industry exposure. Graduates can pursue careers as Reservoir Engineers, Drilling Engineers, and Production Engineers, with a strong placement record, achieving 100% success and high salary packages. The growing digitalization of the petroleum sector enhances the demand for skilled professionals from this program.

Mansha Dhingra's article on the UPES website discusses the MBA in Human Resource Management, highlighting the importance of HR professionals in organizations. The article outlines key job roles such as Training Manager, HR Entrepreneur, Talent Management, Employee Relation Manager, and Public Relations Manager. Each role has specific responsibilities that contribute to employee satisfaction and organizational efficiency. The importance of pursuing an MBA from a reputable institution like UPES, known for its strong industry connections and successful placements, is emphasized. The article indicates that an MBA in HR is a sought-after specialization with numerous career opportunities.

UPES student Muskan Handa, specializing in Big Data within the B.Tech. program at UPES School of Computer Science, has secured a job at Microsoft with an annual package of INR 50 lakh. Muskan impressed interviewers by advancing directly to the final round. Despite facing initial challenges in college, Muskan learned the importance of self-competition and discipline over motivation. She credits her family and UPES mentors for their support and guidance. Muskan emphasizes the value of self-discipline and focusing on quality skill development to succeed in competitive environments.

Arunkumar Ranganathan is the Associate Vice President-Head of Domain Consulting Groups for Energy, Utilities & Services at Infosys Limited, with 28 years of experience in consulting and global leadership, focusing on the Energy, Utilities, and Resources sectors. Arunkumar Ranganathan specializes in digital transformation, strategic consulting, and operational guidance for oil and gas clients. Arunkumar Ranganathan contributes to Infosys’s Energy as a Service offerings and is involved in the company’s ESG core group. Arunkumar Ranganathan's professional affiliations include the Society of Petroleum Engineers and the Mining Engineers Association of India.

Alok Singh, a student of M.Tech. in Automation and Robotics Engineering at UPES (University of Petroleum and Energy Studies), developed RoboBin – a Smart Dustbin. This innovative project features a dustbin that functions like a line-following robot, equipped with a user detection sensor. RoboBin opens its lid when a user approaches to dispose of waste and automatically closes when not in use. When full, it navigates to larger disposal bins autonomously. The project highlights advancements in robotics and automation, contributing to cleaner environments by minimizing waste exposure.

PLL Annapurna is an Associate Professor at UPES with 20 years of educational experience, specializing in language learning and teaching. Annapurna served as Coordinator of Language Labs from 2014 to 2020, enhancing student communication skills. Annapurna has published five research papers and presented at 13 conferences. Teaching courses like Communication Skills and Ethical Leadership, Annapurna emphasizes student-centric learning and uses technology to enrich lessons. Annapurna has received awards for dedication and contributions to education at UPES. Research interests include advertising language and inclusivity. Contact information includes annapurna@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES School of Computer Science offers a Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA) program specializing in Artificial Intelligence (AI), recognized as a pioneering initiative in India. The curriculum emphasizes practical applications, mathematical foundations, and includes four real-world projects and a mandatory three-month internship. Graduates are equipped for careers as AI engineers, data scientists, and machine learning specialists, addressing industry demands in sectors like healthcare and finance. The program supports research opportunities and boasts strong placement statistics, with an average salary of 4.35 LPA. Eligibility includes 50% marks in Class X and XII with Mathematics or Computer Science.

The article by Mansha Dhingra discusses eight emerging trends shaping the future of Human Resource Management (HRM). Key trends include the growing acceptance of remote work, globalization, technological advancements, evolving employee expectations, workforce diversity, changing skill requirements, re-engineering work processes, and increased employee involvement. HRM must adapt to be more employee-oriented and agile in response to these disruptions, ensuring effective workforce management and strategic planning. As the work environment changes, HR professionals need to focus on employee engagement and talent development to meet contemporary business demands.

Dr. Soumyaranjan Sahoo is an assistant professor in the Civil Engineering Department at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) since August 2023. Dr. Soumyaranjan Sahoo earned a doctoral degree from the Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee, focusing on the structural application of recycled aggregate concrete. Dr. Soumyaranjan Sahoo's research interests include sustainable concrete and non-destructive testing. Courses taught by Dr. Soumyaranjan Sahoo include Concrete Technology and Structural Engineering. Dr. Soumyaranjan Sahoo has received the MHRD fellowship during postgraduate and doctoral studies.

Prof. Chandra Mani Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES. He has taught courses like Data Structures, Machine Learning, and Software Engineering, and won several awards, including the Teaching Excellence Award in 2013. Prof. Sharma has published approximately two dozen SCIE/Scopus indexed papers and is involved in startup mentorship. Prof. Chandra Mani Sharma's email is cmsharma@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Shubra Dabral has achieved a significant milestone by successfully clearing the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) 2024. Shubra Dabral's success reflects a dedication to academic excellence and positions Shubra Dabral as a promising talent ready to contribute to multiple disciplines in the future.

Dr. Shiladitya Bhattacharjee is an Assistant Professor (SG) at UPES School of Computer Science with over 7.6 years of teaching and research experience. Dr. Tanu Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over seven years of teaching experience. Dr. Tanu Singh emphasizes student-centered learning and real-world problem-solving in her teaching philosophy. The UPES blog outlines five reasons why theatre is an effective medium for personality development. Theatre fosters confidence by helping students perform in front of audiences, enhances communication skills through dialogue delivery, promotes creativity and social awareness, instills teamwork through collaborative projects, and builds discipline through structured rehearsals. Celebrating World Theatre Day, UPES emphasizes the importance of theatre in enriching student lives and building a culture of creativity through various clubs and events. Theatre serves as a vital platform for personal growth and self-expression among students at UPES.

Ekta Yadav is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, Dehradun. With prior experience at Lovely Professional University, Ekta Yadav focuses on teaching Company Law, International Human Rights Law, and more. Her research interests include human rights in corporate governance and various contemporary legal issues. Ekta Yadav employs the Socratic method in teaching, fostering critical thinking and practical legal skills among students.

Dr. Shailey Singhal is a Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 23 years of experience in fields including waste management, bioenergy, and catalysis. Dr. Singhal earned a Ph.D. in 2005 from C.C.S. University and has published 58 research papers, authored 10 books, and holds 5 patents. Recognition includes multiple awards for teaching excellence and significant grants for research. Contact: shailey@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES offers various Capability Enhancement and Development Schemes aimed at enhancing student employability through the EDGE (Enhanced Development Growth & Enrichment) program. This includes Employability Boot Camps, which provide work readiness workshops, and career counseling services via the EDGE community page. The Personality Enhancement Program (PEP) and Placement Selection Improvement (PSI) focus on soft skill development and preparing students for industry expectations. Additionally, UPES provides personal counseling, remedial coaching, and yoga and meditation sessions to support students' mental and physical health, ensuring a holistic approach to student development and career readiness.

Dr. Ratnesh K Pandey is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with expertise in accelerator-based research, ion-induced material modification, and nanotechnology. Dr. Pandey holds a Ph.D. in Physics from the University of Allahabad and has authored 30 publications with an H-index of 10. His research focuses on materials science and includes projects on tungsten carbide nanostructures and gas sensing systems. Dr. Pandey promotes an interactive and student-centered teaching philosophy, offering courses in various physics disciplines. He has received significant research funding and awards, including international travel support and fellowships.

Dr. Piyush Gaur is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 9 years of experience in experimental and computational biomechanics, focusing on nanocomposite applications in aerospace and defense. Dr. Piyush Gaur has published over 20 research papers, delivered 15 conference presentations, and holds 10 patents. Previously an Associate Professor at Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science, Dr. Piyush Gaur teaches aerospace structures and Computational Mechanics. Research interests include human body modeling and impact mechanisms. Dr. Piyush Gaur promotes active and project-based learning methodologies in teaching. Gaytri is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, with over six years of teaching and research experience. She specializes in machine learning, image processing, and IoT, fostering an interactive and practical learning environment. Gaytri emphasizes the application of theoretical concepts in real-world contexts and uses active learning techniques. Her research includes significant publications and participation in prestigious conferences, demonstrating commitment to advancing knowledge. Courses taught include programming languages, computer organization, IoT, and database management. Gaytri can be contacted at gaytri@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Ph.D. program in Electronics Engineering at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a rigorous curriculum designed to produce skilled researchers. Spanning 3 to 5 years, the program includes teaching roles and comprehensive coursework in core electronics areas. Candidates receive a stipend of up to ₹30,000 and can earn a ₹2,00,000 annual grant with NET-JRF or INSPIRE fellowships. The curriculum focuses on disciplines such as VLSI design, embedded systems, and next-generation networks like 5G/6G. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in academia, research, and advanced electronics industries. Admission for July 2024 intake has specific application deadlines.

Deepanshu Singh Satwaliya is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Science at UPES, holding a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from F.G.I.E.T, Raebareli, and an M.Tech from NIT Hamirpur. With over three years of teaching experience and GATE qualifications, Deepanshu Singh Satwaliya's research interests include Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Deepanshu Singh Satwaliya's teaching philosophy emphasizes individual student talents and lifelong learning. Courses taught include Computer Organization, Digital Logic Design, and Machine Learning. Deepanshu Singh Satwaliya has published research papers nationally and internationally and can be contacted at deepanshus.satwaliya@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Arti Singh is an Associate Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, Dehradun, specializing in pharmacology and toxicology with a Ph.D. in Pharmaceutical Sciences focused on neuroscience. Dr. Arti Singh's research includes mitochondrial dysfunction in neurodegenerative diseases and chemobrain, with significant grants and fellowships, including a DST SERB grant of 34.25 lacs. Dr. Arti Singh has published over 50 papers and is involved in various neuroscience societies. Dr. Arti Singh employs innovative teaching methods to foster student engagement and understanding of pharmacology and related subjects. Contact Dr. Arti Singh at Arti.Singh1@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech. Electronics and Computer Engineering (5G & 6G Technology) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is designed to provide students with essential skills in 5G and future 6G technologies. The curriculum covers advanced topics like electromagnetic waves, antennas, and mobile communication, combining theoretical knowledge with practical experience. Graduates can pursue careers as wireless network engineers or IoT architects, with job opportunities from major companies like Ericsson and Qualcomm. Admission requires 50% marks in Class XII with a focus on Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. Selection is based on exams like UPESEAT and JEE.

Shaoping Bai is a Professor in the Department of Materials and Production at Aalborg University, Denmark. He earned a PhD in Robotics from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, in 2001. Dr. Shaoping Bai's research focuses on mechanism theory, rehabilitation and assistive robots, parallel manipulators, kinematics, and human-robot interaction. He is the coordinator of the EU project AXO-SUIT and the project leader for EXO-AIDER in Denmark. Dr. Shaoping Bai has also edited numerous books and served on editorial boards for journals including the ASME Journal of Mechanisms and Robotics and IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters.

The B.Tech. Biomedical Engineering program at UPES School of Health Sciences and Technology is an interdisciplinary course designed to equip students with skills in medical device design and health science. The curriculum merges engineering, computer science, and design, and includes hands-on projects and industry internships. UPES aims to meet international standards, preparing graduates for roles such as Biomedical Materials Engineer and Clinical Researcher. The program also aligns with India’s "Make in India" initiative, promoting indigenous healthcare solutions. Graduates enjoy excellent placement opportunities due to UPES's strong industry connections, making it a leading choice for biomedical engineering education.

The Department of Mechanical Engineering at UPES offers advanced programs focusing on Automotive Design, Aerospace, and Mechanical Engineering, emphasizing innovation and interdisciplinarity. Established in 2005, the department provides undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs with specializations in areas like Space Technology and E-Mobility. UPES promotes industry collaboration, hands-on learning through state-of-the-art laboratories, and participation in national and international events. The curriculum includes a Choice Based Credit System, Project-Based Learning, and access to modern tools, preparing students for careers in engineering and research globally, supported by a vision of ethical and competent professional development.

The M.Sc. Physics (Astronomy and Astrophysics) program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides in-depth knowledge of space science, including the study of celestial bodies and advanced observational technologies. The curriculum covers theoretical and observational astrophysics and includes collaboration with the Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observational Sciences. The program emphasizes research and practical training, preparing graduates for careers in academia, research institutions, and the space industry. Graduates can pursue roles such as educators, data scientists, and instruments engineers. The program supports students in placement and competitive exam preparation.

The Ph.D. program in Business at UPES School of Business provides a comprehensive research-focused curriculum for scholars and industry professionals. Led by experienced faculty, students engage in advanced business concepts, conduct original research, and prepare for careers in academia or industry leadership. The program lasts between 3 to 6 years. Eligibility requires a Master's degree with a minimum of 55% marks; relaxations apply for certain categories. With tuition fees of INR 25,000 per semester for full-time scholars and a monthly stipend, graduates can pursue various roles in academia, research, and the corporate sector. The upcoming application deadline is June 3, 2024.

The Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology provides an advanced program focusing on research and innovation in biomedical engineering. Available as full-time or part-time with a duration of 3 to 6 years, candidates must have a B.Tech./B.E. or M.Tech. in engineering or an M.Sc. with at least 60% marks and relevant qualifications such as GATE. The program emphasizes cutting-edge research in areas like Biomaterials and AI applications in healthcare. Graduates are well-equipped for diverse careers in academia, industry, and research, with opportunities in personalized medicine, microfluidics, and more. Key admission dates for July 2024 include the last application date on June 3, 2024.

Gaurav Misra is the Cluster Head at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES. Gaurav Misra is India's first ISTD certified life skills educator with international recognition from CTAUN, United Nations. Gaurav Misra is a Fulbright Fellow and has extensive teaching and training experience across multiple countries, coaching over 15,000 youth. Gaurav Misra emphasizes life skills like communication and leadership in education, using gamified pedagogy. Gaurav Misra's scholarly work focuses on life skills training, with a Ph.D. in progress. Gaurav Misra has received multiple awards, including the 2023 Academic Excellence Award from UPES.

Project Vriddhi, initiated by UPES, aims to enhance educational opportunities for primary school students in English and Mathematics, combating inter-generational poverty and marginalization. The initiative is led by UPES faculty as mentors, with support from student volunteers. Its goal is to ensure every child can achieve their full potential through quality education.

Amit Kataria serves as the Chief Human Resources Officer at Minfy Technologies Pvt. Ltd., leveraging 18 years of global experience in Information Technology. Amit Kataria is passionate about developing innovative talent acquisition strategies to address the tech skill shortage. As Head of Human Capital Management at Hanu Software Solutions, Amit Kataria leads the design and implementation of comprehensive HR programs, focusing on talent development through initiatives like Hanu Azure Academy. Amit Kataria is committed to enhancing employee engagement and fostering a positive workplace culture, driving the company’s success in creating a great work environment.

Dr. Santosh Kumar Chaudhary is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES. Research expertise includes protein structure determination, drug design, and protein engineering. Dr. Santosh's research interests focus on post-translational modifications to dynamically reprogram cellular functions. Courses taught include Structural Biology and Genetic Engineering. Dr. Santosh has received several fellowships and published extensively in scientific journals. Contact at santosh.chaudhary@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Jimmy Mangalam is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in nanotechnology, nanoelectronics, renewable energy, and water purification. Dr. Mangalam holds a Ph.D. in Chemistry from ICTM, Technische Universität Graz, Austria, and has a background in efficient perovskite solar cells and flexible electronics. He teaches Physics of Materials and Inorganic Chemistry lab courses. Dr. Mangalam emphasizes student engagement and real-life applications in his teaching. For inquiries, Dr. Mangalam can be contacted at jimmy.mangalam@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES offers a diverse range of scholarships for the 2024-25 academic year to support students in their educational pursuits. Scholarships include Academic Scholarships based on Class 12 performance, Bonafide Uttarakhand Student scholarships with a tuition waiver, and specific programs for M.Tech and MBA. Additional options include Sports Scholarships based on performance and Financial Support for students facing financial hardships after enrollment. There are also scholarships for children of UPES employees. A total of 2700 scholarships are available, awarded on a merit basis, with benefits up to 30% on tuition fees. Applications are open from June 1-30, 2024.

Rajiv Narang serves as the Director of the Process Economics Program at S&P Global in New Delhi, India. Rajiv Narang is a Fellow of IChemE UK, a senior member of AIChE, and has served in leadership roles in the Indian Institute of Chemical Engineers. Rajiv Narang holds a degree in Chemical Engineering from IIT Delhi and an MBA.

Margan Sinha, a 2013 graduate of UPES with a B.Tech in Electronics Engineering, has achieved notable success by clearing the Bihar Public Service Commission (PCS) exam. This achievement underscores the quality of education at UPES and highlights Margan Sinha's commitment to public service and governance.

It features information about academic programs across various disciplines such as engineering, business, computer science, design, health sciences, law, liberal studies, and more. Essential resources include contact details for inquiries, admission alerts, and links to academic calendars and scholarship information. Users can apply, chat with counselors, and explore international admissions. The content aims to keep stakeholders informed about the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies.

Mariyam Ilyas Siddiqui is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, and a founding member of the School for Life. With a Ph.D. in English Literature from Aligarh Muslim University, Mariyam specializes in Postcolonial Studies and Science Fiction. Courses taught include Learning How to Learn, Human Rights, and Postcolonial Literature. Mariyam also leads an Urbanization Cluster and serves as a Proctor to support student engagement. Passionate about theatre, Mariyam has conducted workshops and received accolades from theatre veterans. Research interests focus on Latin American literature and popular culture. Contact: msiddiqui@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The MBA in Aviation Management (Airline Service Operations) program at UPES School of Business provides a comprehensive curriculum covering aviation operations, regulations, and market dynamics. It includes specialized training in aviation finance, airport management, and airline operations, emphasizing practical experience through internships and live projects. Graduates can pursue diverse roles such as Airline Manager and Aviation Consultant, with strong placement opportunities at firms like Vistara Airlines and Accenture. The program prepares students for managerial positions within the aviation sector, focusing on hands-on learning and modern technology skills, addressing the industry's growing demand for skilled professionals.

Dr. Muthukumar Ka is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, specializing in Artificial Intelligence (AI) in healthcare. He received the MEXT scholarship from the Japanese government and focuses on infrared imaging applications. Dr. Muthukumar has extensive experience as an AI engineer and researcher at institutions like MOTIV Research Co. and Keio University. His teaching philosophy emphasizes active learning and critical thinking, and he teaches courses like "AI for Everyone" and "Applied Data Science." Dr. Muthukumar has participated in numerous workshops and has received various awards and scholarships for his academic contributions.

Dr. Yog Mishra is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Management from Banaras Hindu University. Dr. Yog Mishra's expertise includes electronic word of mouth (e-WoM) and social media communication. Prior to UPES, Dr. Yog Mishra served at Amity Business School and the Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta, and has significant corporate experience. Dr. Yog Mishra teaches Marketing Management, Social Digital Media Marketing, and International Marketing. Research interests include quantitative research, social media marketing, and digital marketing. Dr. Yog Mishra emphasizes experiential learning in teaching methods. Contact Dr. Yog Mishra at yog.mishra@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Siddharth Jain is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in energy systems and sustainable energy pathways. Siddharth Jain holds master's and doctoral degrees from the Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee and has a background in mechanical engineering. Siddharth Jain's research focuses on biomass and bioenergy, waste-to-energy technologies, and life cycle assessment. Previously, Siddharth Jain served as a Post-Doctoral Fellow at the National University of Singapore and has been recognized among the world's top 2% researchers by Stanford University. Siddharth Jain received multiple awards for teaching and research contributions.

Dr. Ajay Prasad serves as a Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with over 22 years of academic experience. Dr. Ajay's expertise includes Computer Architecture, Network/Data Security Principles, and Cloud Systems. He has held leadership roles, such as Head of Department, and has contributed to multiple MOOC courses. Dr. Ajay focuses on Outcome-Based Modern Teaching Methodologies and supervises PhD scholars. Research interests encompass Security, Digital Forensics, IoT, and Cloud Computing. Dr. Ajay has received awards for contributions to cybersecurity awareness and published work in international journals and conferences. Contact at aprasad@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a 2-year M.Sc. program with specializations in Applied Sciences and Applied Geology. Admission requires 50% in 10th, 12th, and relevant graduation. The program includes theoretical classes, practical sessions, and research work, preparing graduates for diverse careers such as Research Scientist, Analyst, and Software Developer. The fee structure varies by program, with tuition ranging from ₹35,000 to ₹39,000 per semester. The curriculum, designed in collaboration with industry experts, ensures relevant education. UPES also provides extensive placement support, with a high placement record and opportunities for internships and skill development.

Dr. Anil Kumar Sinha is a professor at the School of Advanced Engineering at UPES and is a leading expert in synchrotron beamline design and development at Indus 1 and Indus 2. His research focuses on electrode materials for sodium and lithium-ion batteries, hydrogen production, and materials characterization, with over 250 publications. Dr. Sinha has established coin cell fabrication facilities and oversees the Central Instrumentation Centre at UPES. He has received multiple awards from the Department of Atomic Energy and is actively guiding four Ph.D. students while teaching Mathematical Physics and related courses.

The B.Sc. Computer Science with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at UPES School of Computer Science offers a rigorous curriculum focusing on mathematical foundations and practical applications in AI and ML. Students engage with industry-standard tools like TensorFlow and PyTorch, gaining hands-on experience through projects and research. The program emphasizes statistical skills, preparing graduates for high-demand roles such as Machine Learning Engineer and Data Scientist. Graduates benefit from strong industry connections and placement opportunities, positioning them for successful careers in various sectors, including healthcare and finance. Eligibility includes a minimum of 50% in Class X and XII with Mathematics or Computer Science.

The Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC) at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) aims to enhance institutional quality through proactive systems and structures. The IQAC focuses on promoting best practices in academic and non-academic performance, ensuring stakeholder awareness of quality and excellence. The cell engages in accreditation and ranking activities with bodies like NAAC and IACBE. The IQAC leadership includes Dr. Ram Sharma as Chairperson and a diverse advisory committee. Key responsibilities include conducting reviews, gathering feedback, and fostering a culture of quality across the university's programs.

Dr. Vijendra Singh is a Professor in the School of Computer Science at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies in Dehradun, India. He holds a Ph.D. and an M.Tech in Computer Science from Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra. Dr. Vijendra specializes in machine learning with a focus on medical applications and has published extensively in high-impact journals. He has served as Editor in Chief and on various editorial boards. Dr. Vijendra has 20 years of experience in research and teaching, guiding Ph.D. students and teaching courses in artificial intelligence, data mining, and big data analytics.

Dr. Himanshu Kesarwani is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in petroleum engineering. He holds a bachelor's, master's, and doctorate in petroleum engineering, focusing on drilling fluid design and chemical enhanced oil recovery. Dr. Himanshu has published numerous papers and has over 300 citations. His research interests include drilling fluid formulation, cement slurry testing, and nanotechnology applications in the oil and gas industry. He fosters an engaging classroom environment, emphasizing critical thinking and lifelong learning. Dr. Himanshu received multiple seed grants for research initiatives during his career.

Jyoti Upadhyay is a Senior Associate Professor in the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, holding an M. Pharm in Clinical Research and a Ph.D. in Pharmaceutical Sciences. Her research focuses on maternal and child health, congenital disorders, and the effects of persistent organic pollutants. Jyoti Upadhyay coordinates the ADR Monitoring Centre at UPES and is involved in a DST-funded project on community resilience against COVID-19. With over 40 published papers in indexed journals, Jyoti Upadhyay specializes in clinical research and pharmacology. Contact Jyoti Upadhyay at jupadhyay@ddn.upes.ac.in.

UPES has partnered with Microsoft to enhance educational offerings in various interdisciplinary programs such as B.Tech. and M.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics, Computer Science Engineering, B.Pharmacy, MBA Analytics, and design courses. The collaboration has established an Artificial Intelligence lab, granting students access to the Intelligent Cloud Hub program and certifications upon completion. UPES students will benefit from cutting-edge infrastructure, curriculum including Azure, IoT, AI, ML, web development, and data sciences, and hands-on training from Microsoft experts. Additionally, students are encouraged to participate in regional and national hackathons and receive developer support.

UPES offers the Bachelor of Business Administration program with applications closing on August 31, 2024. The BBA program emphasizes both practical and theoretical knowledge, preparing students for careers in various sectors such as finance, marketing, and business management. The eligibility criteria require a minimum of 50% marks in Class X and XII. Admission is based on UPESMET-UG or equivalent national tests. The program provides robust placement opportunities, boasting 100% placements and over 125 recruiters in 2022. UPES also offers scholarships and excellent campus facilities to enhance student experiences.

The B.Tech. Electrical Engineering in 5G & 6G Technology program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering provides comprehensive education in wireless communication, focusing on the principles and applications of 5G and emerging 6G technologies. The curriculum covers essential topics like network slicing, ultra-reliable low-latency communication, and IoT. Graduates can pursue careers with leading companies such as Ericsson and Qualcomm, or continue advanced studies. Admission requires a minimum of 50% marks in Classes X and XII with specific performance criteria. The program combines theoretical learning with hands-on projects to ensure industry readiness.

Satya Harpalani serves as the Associate Dean of the College of Engineering, Computing, Technology and Mathematics at Southern Illinois University (SIU), USA. Satya Harpalani holds a PhD from the University of California Berkeley, an MS from Virginia Tech, and a BS from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur. With over 30 years of experience, Satya Harpalani's research focuses on fluid dynamics in coal/shale, coalbed methane recovery, and CO2 sequestration. Satya Harpalani has led research projects worth approximately $15 million, funded by various U.S. governmental bodies and private industries, including projects in India.

Dr. Gopalakrishnan is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 26 years of experience in heterogeneous catalysis. He has conducted significant research, securing funding of 1.49 crores for two projects, and has published 14 papers in recognized journals. Dr. Gopalakrishnan completed his Ph.D. from Anna University in 1995 and has held various academic positions, including abroad. His teaching focuses on real-world applications, covering subjects like Thermodynamics and Polymer Science. He has received prestigious grants from entities like CSIR and Indian Oil Corporation. Contact: gopalakrishnan@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Richa Chilana is an Assistant Professor (Senior Scale) at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES, specializing in literature and cultural studies over thirteen years, with a focus on popular fiction, crime fiction, stand-up comedy, and singlehood studies. Richa Chilana received her degrees from Maitreyi and St. Stephen’s College, and a doctorate from JNU. Richa Chilana's research explores the complexities of veiling in Indian English writing and the aesthetics of stand-up comedy in India. Richa Chilana has published books and organized various educational seminars, emphasizing an engaging, democratic teaching philosophy. Richa Chilana can be contacted at richa.chilana@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Aanchal Sharma is an Assistant Professor at the School of Business, UPES, with over ten years of experience in communication. Aanchal Sharma focuses on strategic business communication, culture, and qualitative research methodologies. Aanchal Sharma's research examines communication management for social change and gender. Aanchal Sharma has previously taught at recognized institutions and has industry experience with SBI Card and Ameriprise Financial. Aanchal Sharma holds a doctoral degree from MICA, Ahmedabad, and is a UGC NET qualified professional in Journalism and Mass Communication, with awards for academic excellence and participation in international research programs.

Dr. Deepak Bangwal's article discusses the future of Human Resource Management (HRM) in relation to technological advancements. With the rise of automation, HR professionals need to adapt to changes like Digital Workers, which automate routine tasks, enabling HR teams to focus on strategic initiatives. Additionally, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing talent acquisition by improving candidate matching and efficiency. Hyperautomation technologies are transforming employee onboarding, making it more seamless and efficient. The collaborative integration of technology and human skills is essential for driving innovation and improving workforce management in the evolving business landscape.

Amit Gurung is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, with a Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from the National Institute of Technology Meghalaya, India. Amit Gurung has over 15 years of teaching and research experience, with numerous publications in SCI/Scopus-indexed journals and a filed patent in Kyoto, Japan. Amit Gurung's research interests include formal methods, high-performance computing, digital image processing, and machine learning. Amit Gurung's teaching philosophy emphasizes practical applications of theoretical concepts, and courses taught include Computer Networks and Software Engineering. Contact Amit Gurung at amit.gurung@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Sc. Microbiology program at UPES focuses on the biology of microorganisms, offering specializations in food/environmental microbiology and medical/pharmaceutical microbiology. The four-year curriculum includes certifications in microbiology, with opportunities for research and internships. The program emphasizes AI applications in healthcare, hands-on learning, and access to advanced facilities. Graduates can pursue careers in various sectors, including healthcare, biotechnology, and research, with robust placement support from UPES. Eligibility requires a minimum of 50% in relevant subjects, and selection is based on a personal interview.

UPES alumnus Kuldeep Parashar co-founded PensionBox, India's first digital pension platform, in 2021 to address the retirement planning issues faced by non-government workers. Inspired by creating a retirement plan for his parents, Kuldeep and his brother Shivam Parashar aim to customize pension solutions tailored to individual needs. PensionBox integrates existing corporate retirement benefits and provides users the ability to customize plans easily. With over 160,000 users and significant funding from notable investors, PensionBox seeks to empower millions of Indians to achieve financial independence for retirement through innovative digital solutions.

Dr. Abhishek Sinha is the Dean of the School of Law at UPES and a dual qualified corporate lawyer in England & Wales and India with over 18 years of post-qualification experience. Formerly an Equity Partner at leading Indian law firms, Dr. Abhishek Sinha specializes in corporate laws, including M&A, PE, and JVs. Since late 2019, Dr. Abhishek Sinha has focused on bridging academia and the legal industry through NotJustLex, a startup recognized by the government that trains legal professionals using participatory learning. Dr. Abhishek Sinha is a two-time TedX speaker and has received numerous awards for contributions to legal education.

Chhotelal Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science, UPES, having joined in July 2023. Chhotelal Kumar holds a Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology Patna, focused on session-based recommendation systems, along with an M.Tech and B.Tech in Information Technology. Teaching areas include GATE Computer Science and placement preparation, emphasizing data structures, algorithms, computer networks, and database management systems. Chhotelal Kumar's research interests encompass recommendation systems, data mining, machine learning, and emotion recognition. Chhotelal Kumar is affiliated with IEEE and has published various research articles. Contact Chhotelal Kumar at Chhotelal.kumar@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The M.Sc. Nutrition and Dietetics program at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology is a two-year comprehensive course focusing on nutrition and dietetics. It covers clinical nutrition, public health nutrition, and holistic wellness among other areas. Specializations include Dietetics and Holistic Wellness, and Nutraceutical and Nutritional Policy. The program emphasizes practical learning through labs and internships, equipping students with skills needed in the healthcare sector. Graduates can pursue careers as Registered Dietitians, Sports Nutritionists, and Public Health Nutritionists. UPES boasts strong industry connections and commendable placement records with an average annual salary of 4.36 Lakhs.

Dr. Charu Srivastava is an Associate Professor at UPES School of Law, holding a Ph.D. in Copyright Law from GNLU and an LL.M. from NLSIU. Dr. Charu is a co-founder of The IP Press, ranked among the top 100 IP blogs globally, focusing on intellectual property concerns. With nearly ten years of academic experience, Dr. Charu has developed courses in Trademark and Copyright law, while actively participating in research and academic collaborations. Dr. Charu’s scholarly work includes articles on private law issues and participation in international conferences, enhancing expertise in various IP laws. Email: csrivastava@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is a rigorous 3 to 4-year course focusing on computational fluid dynamics, materials science, and propulsion. The curriculum emphasizes original research leading to a dissertation, providing students with access to modern facilities and expert mentors. Graduates are prepared for diverse careers in academia, industry, and government, with opportunities in aerospace R&D, spacecraft development, and commercial spaceflight. The program aligns with emerging trends in sustainable aviation technologies and artificial intelligence, addressing the aerospace industry's critical challenges. Key admission dates for the July 2024 intake are provided.

Dr. Parteek Prasher is an Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, recognized among the World's Top 2% Scientists for 2021. He serves as Associate Editor for the journal Frontiers in Drug Delivery and holds the TARE fellowship from DST-SERB, India. His research focuses on sustainable drug delivery systems and small molecule inhibitors for adenocarcinoma. Previously an Assistant Professor at Lovely Professional University, Dr. Parteek teaches Organic Chemistry at UPES and has received multiple academic awards including the Research Excellence Award. Dr. Parteek is active in the multidisciplinary Respiratory and Inflammatory Research 'RAIR' team. Contact: pprasher@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Gagan Anand is a Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, specializing in the concentration of Calcium in Strontium Bismuth titanate ceramics for high-temperature sensor applications. With over 23 years of teaching experience, Dr. Gagan earned a doctorate in physics from Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad. Research interests include Bismuth layered ferroelectric materials and Nano-Fluids. Dr. Gagan has published 30 research papers and received awards such as the Young Scientist Award. Dr. Gagan promotes active learning through diverse teaching methods, actively contributing to the academic community as a reviewer for scientific journals. Contact: ganand@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Padma Venkat serves as the Professor and Dean of the School of Health Sciences and Technology at UPES, bringing over 31 years of expertise in Microbiology, Biochemistry, Phytochemistry, Ayurveda, and Public Health. Dr. Padma Venkat previously held the position of Professor and Dean at SRM Institute of Science & Technology and has worked at the University of Cambridge as a Research Scientist. Dr. Padma Venkat's research focuses on safe drinking water, nutrition, and wellness, along with various community projects aimed at improving health and empowerment. Dr. Padma Venkat has published extensively and is active in scientific advisory roles.

Ivan Lee is an Advisory Board Member at UPES and a Senior Lecturer at the University of South Australia. He holds degrees including B.Eng., M.Com., MER, and Ph.D. from The University of Sydney. Previously, Ivan Lee worked as a software development engineer at Cisco Systems and an Assistant Professor at Ryerson University. Ivan Lee has contributed to significant conferences and has received multiple awards for research papers. Research interests include intelligent sensors, multimedia systems, and data analytics, with over 150 peer-reviewed publications in notable journals.

The blog post from UPES discusses various career options available after earning a B.Sc. in Chemistry. It emphasizes the versatility of the degree, leading to fields such as Research and Development, the Chemical Industry, Pharmaceuticals, and Environmental Science. Key job roles include Research Scientist, Quality Control Analyst, and Environmental Consultant, among others, with average salaries ranging from $45,000 to $90,000 depending on the position. The article highlights the significance of a B.Sc. in Chemistry as a stepping stone towards higher education or immediate professional engagement, underlining the importance of Chemistry in diverse sectors.

UPES highlights the benefits of pursuing an M.Tech. in Computer Science, emphasizing the advanced technical skills and deeper understanding of complex systems gained through this postgraduate program. An M.Tech. opens diverse career opportunities in software development, data analysis, cybersecurity, and research. Graduates are in high demand, with the program focusing on both technical and soft skills crucial for leadership roles. UPES offers a comprehensive curriculum featuring industry-relevant specializations, expert faculty, and modern resources. Students interested in advancing their careers in technology are encouraged to apply to the M.Tech. program at UPES.

Dr. Manish Mishra serves as an Assistant Professor of Statistics at the School of Liberal Studies, UPES. He holds a Ph.D. in Statistics from Banaras Hindu University and has received notable fellowships such as the Junior Research Fellowship from the University Grants Commission and INSPIRE fellowship from the Ministry of Science and Technology, Government of India. Dr. Manish Mishra's research interests focus on estimation in sampling surveys, calibration, imputation, and non-response error estimation, with contributions published in multiple peer-reviewed journals. His teaching philosophy emphasizes high expectations and student engagement.

The B.Tech. program in Electronics and Computer Engineering with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at UPES School of Advanced Engineering is designed for the Industry 4.0 era. This program integrates foundational engineering principles with advanced AI and ML techniques, preparing graduates for careers in various sectors including robotics, healthcare, and finance. Key features include a rigorous curriculum, practical hands-on projects, and industry interactions. Graduates have job opportunities with leading companies like Microsoft and IBM. Admission requires a minimum of 50% in Classes X and XII with specific criteria for selection based on entrance exams.

Somnath Banerjee is an Advisory Board Member at UPES School of Engineering and a Reliability Manager at Halliburton, Norway. With over 30 years in the Upstream Oil and Gas Industry, Somnath Banerjee has expertise in Wireline and Formation Evaluation. Somnath Banerjee holds a B.E. (Hons) in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from BITS Pilani. Somnath Banerjee has contributed to Remote Operations and has experience in technical training and workforce development. Somnath Banerjee taught Petroleum Engineering courses at UPES and served as Faculty Advisor for the UPES SPE Student Chapter.

In the article by Ekta Kashyap, published on October 8, 2022, the critical role of journalists is emphasized in today's information-driven society. Journalism provides accurate and insightful news, influencing public opinion and decision-making. With significant media advancements, including digital platforms, the demand for trained professionals in journalism and mass communication continues to grow. The UPES School of Modern Media prepares students for various media careers by bridging theory and practice, ensuring graduates are equipped for the evolving media landscape. Quality journalism remains essential to combat misinformation and promote informed engagement among citizens.

Ms. Himani Nautiyal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Health Sciences and Technology, UPES, with 7.5 years of experience in Pharmaceutical Sciences. Ms. Nautiyal completed M. Pharm. (Pharmacology) from Uttarakhand Technical University and is pursuing a PhD at UPES. Research interests include Molecular Pharmacology and Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome. Ms. Nautiyal has published research articles, presented at conferences, and has experience advising B. Pharm. and M. Pharm. students. Her teaching approach promotes critical thinking and simplifies complex concepts in Pharmacy. Ms. Nautiyal can be contacted at himani.nautiyal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Gaurav Mittal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, specializing in family law, constitutional law, and criminal law. Gaurav Mittal completed B.Com. (Hons.) from Delhi University, LL.B., and LL.M. from the Faculty of Law, University of Delhi, and is pursuing a Ph.D. at UPES. With academic experience at ICFAI University since 2014, Gaurav Mittal teaches Contract Law and Family Law and employs innovative teaching methods. Gaurav Mittal has published multiple articles in reputed law journals and received awards for academic excellence, including the Hiralal Daga Memorial Medal. Contact Gaurav Mittal via email at gaurav.mittal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

The B.Tech in Electrical Engineering program at UPES School of Advanced Engineering offers a modern curriculum that blends essential electrical engineering principles with advanced technologies. It covers topics like power systems, control systems, and digital electronics while emphasizing practical skills through hands-on projects, internships, and collaborations with industry. Specializations include E-vehicles, AI/ML applications, and Nanoelectronics, preparing graduates for diverse careers in electrical industries. The program boasts a 100% placement rate, with an average salary of 5.1 LPA. Eligibility requires 50% in Class X and XII, focusing on PCM. Admission is based on UPESEAT, JEE, or merit.

Sanjay Mitra is a Professor of Practice at the School of Public Policy, IIT Delhi, with extensive experience in various crucial governmental roles, including Chief Secretary and Defence Secretary. Sanjay Mitra holds degrees in Physics from Delhi and Economics from Himachal University, along with an MPA from Harvard University. Sanjay Mitra retired in 2019 and currently serves on multiple boards, including the Supreme Court Committee on Road Safety and L&T Independent Company. Sanjay Mitra is also a Visiting Faculty at IIM Kolkata and a Board Member at The Neotia University, Kolkata.

Tusitta Rai, a B.Tech CSE student from UPES's 2022-26 batch, showcased remarkable dedication by participating in the 65th National Shooting Championship Competitions. Tusitta competed in multiple 10M Pistol events, including the ISSF National and Civilian Championships for Women and Junior Women. Inspired by her father, Tusitta balances her intense shooting passion with the rigorous demands of Computer Science Engineering, emphasizing the importance of time management and discipline. Tusitta believes in maintaining a harmonious balance between academic responsibilities and personal passions to achieve success in both areas.

Dr. Rahul Singhal is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES. Dr. Rahul Singhal completed a B.Tech in Electrical Engineering from GB Pant University, an M.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering from IIIT Delhi, and a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from MNIT Jaipur, where Dr. Rahul Singhal received a full-time fellowship. Dr. Rahul Singhal's research interests include control systems, robotics, and model predictive control. Dr. Rahul Singhal has published over 15 articles and reviewed more than 20 for international journals. Dr. Rahul Singhal promotes critical thinking and open dialogue in teaching. Contact Dr. Rahul Singhal at rahul.singhal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Manisha Malik is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with a Ph.D. from IIT Roorkee, specializing in optimization and operations research. Dr. Malik teaches Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Optimization Techniques, and Operations Research, focusing on real-world applications of mathematical concepts. Recognized with the "Dr. Sushil Sharma Excellence in Doctoral Research Award" in 2023 and various travel grants, Dr. Malik contributes significantly to scholarly activities, including research on fuzzy multi-objective programming and multi-criteria decision-making problems. Dr. Malik's teaching philosophy emphasizes active engagement and fostering a passion for mathematics among students.

The National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) Outcome for University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) details the accreditation process over two cycles. During the first cycle, the NAAC peer team visited from November 10-15, 2008, granting UPES a Grade B and CGPA of 2.72. The second assessment on September 4-7, 2013, resulted in a CGPA of 2.79. The second cycle's accreditation took place from February 25-27, 2021, awarding UPES a Grade A with a CGPA of 3.02, valid from March 1, 2021, to February 28, 2026.

The B.Tech Civil Engineering program at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) offers a four-year curriculum with specializations in Transportation Engineering, Environmental Engineering, and Construction Management. The program emphasizes practical skills and industry relevance, featuring collaborations with firms like L&T and membership in the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). Graduates achieve a 90% placement rate, with diverse career opportunities in construction, consulting, and government sectors. The curriculum integrates advanced technologies and includes research opportunities at national and international institutes. Admission requires 50% marks in high school with specific criteria based on entrance exams.

Siddhi Deshpande, Bhasha Maheshwari, and Shruti Bamb, students specializing in Industrial Product Design at UPES, received a Special Mention Award in Product Design at the MIT-WPU National Design Award 2022 for their innovative project, Vendo. Vendo is a unique menstrual hygiene product designed as a combination of a sanitary napkin vending machine and an incinerator. This eco-friendly solution provides easy disposal of used napkins and ensures the availability of sanitary napkins for a nominal fee of INR 5, addressing hygiene management in public restrooms sustainably and accessibly.

Shubham Joshi is an Assistant Professor at the School of Law, UPES, holding a Gold Medal from the National Law School of India University, Bengaluru. Shubham Joshi has an integrated LLM and MBA from Germany, graduating in the top 1% with a best master’s thesis award. With six years of experience as a litigation and transactional lawyer across India and Europe, Shubham Joshi specializes in conflict management, commercial laws, and legal innovation. Shubham Joshi employs a practical, engagement-focused teaching philosophy and mentors students in moot courts and ADR competitions. Shubham Joshi's research interests include dispute resolution, ESG, and digital transformations in law.

Ritika Bisht, a standout student in the MBA Strategy and Consulting (KPMG) Program at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), achieved a significant placement at KPMG, being recognized as the valedictorian of her batch. Ritika Bisht's accomplishments reflect her dedication and academic excellence, showcasing the effectiveness of the MBA program in partnership with KPMG. Additionally, Ritika Bisht balances her professional life with a passion for volleyball, which contributes to her well-rounded character.

Avimesh Sharma received the Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishna’s Teacher Honor Award on March 21, 2023, recognizing Avimesh Sharma as the best teacher in Art & Design for the year 2023. This prestigious accolade, awarded by Monad University, highlights Avimesh Sharma's exceptional teaching skills and significant contributions to the education sector in the field of Art & Design. The award underscores Avimesh Sharma's commitment to excellence in teaching and academics within the School of Design at UPES.

Dr. Prashant Shukla is an Assistant Professor at UPES, specializing in Machine Design and Waste Management with an M.Tech and PhD. Over 10 years, Dr. Prashant Shukla has made significant contributions, holding around 23 intellectual property rights and four patents. Dr. Prashant Shukla’s research interests include machine design, waste management technology, and automotive technologies. Dr. Prashant Shukla emphasizes project-based learning in teaching courses like Engineering Mechanics and DFMA. Recognized for excellence, Dr. Prashant Shukla mentors students in prestigious competitions, fostering innovation and research opportunities. Dr. Prashant Shukla can be contacted at pshukla@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Sanjaya Sharma is the Founder and CEO of Recommender Labs, which specializes in AI and Machine Learning solutions. After graduating from IIM Ahmedabad in 1980, Sanjaya Sharma joined the Tata Administrative Service and worked in Indian Hotels and Tata Unisys. In 1990, Sanjaya Sharma founded Tata Interactive Systems and later Tata ClassEdge in 2010. After a 35-year career with Tata, Sanjaya Sharma established Recommender Labs in 2016, which is now part of KPMG’s Lighthouse group. Sanjaya Sharma's expertise spans over three decades in the technology sector.

Alok Jhaldiyal is an Assistant Professor at UPES's School of Computer Science, specializing in core computer science and courses in cybersecurity and data analytics. Previously associated with IIT Bombay as a Research Associate, Alok Jhaldiyal's research focuses on remote sensing and GIS, particularly enhancing LiDAR data processing for autonomous vehicles. Alok Jhaldiyal's teaching philosophy emphasizes equipping students with fundamental knowledge and real-world applications through activities and practical sessions. Courses taught include Operating Systems, Data Communication, Python Programming, and Big Data Analytics. Contact Alok Jhaldiyal at ajhaldiyal@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Dr. Surbhi Saraswat is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Science at UPES, with over 5 years of experience in Big Data, conducting seminars and workshops. Dr. Surbhi completed a PhD in 2020 from IIT (BHU) Varanasi and was a Post-Doctoral Researcher at University College Cork, working on the European Union’s BRAINE Project. Dr. Surbhi's research interests include Big Data Processing, Artificial Intelligence, and IoT. Dr. Surbhi emphasizes student engagement through hands-on learning and assessments aligned with learning objectives. Dr. Surbhi has published multiple research papers and holds a granted patent.

Suvendu Manna is an Assistant Professor at UPES, holding a PhD from IIT Kharagpur. His research emphasizes waste management and green energy, focusing on the repurposing of solid wastes for construction materials, nanomaterials synthesis, and affordable water filters for rural areas. Suvendu Manna has 9 years of experience in academia, supervising 7 PhD students while engaging in consultancy for Oil India Limited. His research areas include solid waste management, green energy, and environmental microbiology. Suvendu Manna has published extensively, securing several prestigious awards and grants throughout his career.

Dr. Atul Kumar Patidar is a Senior Associate Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 15 years of experience in petroleum exploration and academia. His expertise includes upstream oil and gas business, basin analysis, and seismic interpretation. Dr. Patidar has published over 40 research papers and leads industry-academia collaborations to enhance R&D participation. He previously worked at Reliance Industries Limited and is involved in national hydrocarbon assessment projects. His teaching emphasizes critical thinking and integrates field-based learning experiences, covering courses in geology and petroleum engineering. Dr. Patidar has received multiple research fellowships and awards.

Dr. Ashishi Puri is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, starting her role in September 2023. Dr. Ashishi Puri completed her Ph.D. from the Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, focusing on biomedical MRI data reconstruction, machine learning, and deep neural networks. Dr. Ashishi Puri has published research in international journals and presented at the 10th International Conference on Bioinformatics Research and Applications in Barcelona, Spain, in September 2023, receiving travel grants from SERB and DORA. Dr. Ashishi Puri emphasizes a student-centered teaching philosophy that fosters engagement and critical thinking.

UPES is recognized as a leader in research and innovation within India's higher education, emphasizing financial support for academic research per the National Education Policy 2020. UPES has achieved a 370% increase in scholarly output since 2018, with a significant portion of publications involving international collaboration. Notable research initiatives include nanotechnology sensors for disease detection and wastewater reclamation projects. UPES attracts eminent faculty, including Nobel Prize nominees, to enhance educational offerings. Collaborations with global institutions and industry leaders, including Bajaj CSR, foster research excellence and innovative solutions to critical challenges.

The M.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics (Dietetics & Holistic Wellness) at UPES School of Health Sciences & Technology is designed to prepare students with essential skills in nutrition evaluation and tailored dietary planning. The program emphasizes preventive measures, disease management, and holistic wellness, covering nutrition science, therapeutic nutrition, and clinical training. Students participate in practical training, seminars, and internships, gaining industry exposure. Graduates can pursue careers as clinical dietitians, researchers, or in community nutrition. The program has strong placement support through collaborations with healthcare organizations, ensuring successful career prospects.

Siddhartha Mukherjee is an Assistant Professor at the School of Design, UPES, with nearly a decade of experience in architecture and industrial design. Siddhartha attained a bachelor's in architecture from Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University and a Master's in Industrial Design from IIT Bombay. Siddhartha's career includes roles at Godrej and Boyce, focusing on innovative security solutions. Research interests include furniture design and sustainable cooking appliances. Siddhartha's teaching philosophy promotes a collaborative teacher-student dynamic. Siddhartha co-authored works on usability in stationery and the historical journey of Dehradoon. Recognized with the HUDCO Best Practices Award in 2023, Siddhartha highlights significant contributions to architecture and design.

Awadh Pratap Singh is an Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies at UPES, with a Ph.D. in Mathematics from IIT Roorkee, supported by a merit-based scholarship from the MHRD. Dr. Awadh Pratap Singh specializes in Operations Research, Data Envelopment Analysis, Fuzzy Set Theory, and Nature-inspired Algorithms. Dr. Awadh Pratap Singh is actively involved in research and has published numerous papers in esteemed journals. Dr. Awadh Pratap Singh employs a student-centric teaching philosophy, emphasizing strong foundational knowledge and interactive learning. Courses taught by Dr. Awadh Pratap Singh include Real Analysis, Differential Equations, and Operations Research.

Aditya Mukherjee discusses how social media has transformed news consumption, highlighting a decline in print media as people turn to platforms like Facebook and Twitter for news. Despite this shift, India is projected to become the world's fifth-largest newspaper market by 2026. Mukherjee raises concerns about the rise of fake news and social media's role in shaping information through algorithms and peer sharing. Surveys indicate many users receive news from social media before traditional outlets. The article emphasizes the importance of verifying sources and distinguishing opinion from fact in today's fast-paced information environment.

Donga Ramesh Kumar is an Assistant Professor at the School of Advanced Engineering, UPES, with over 13 years of educational experience and one year of research experience. Donga Ramesh Kumar specializes in mechanical engineering, focusing on areas such as Solar Thermal Technologies, Concentrated Solar Power, and Computational Fluid Dynamics. Donga Ramesh Kumar employs a student-centric teaching philosophy, emphasizing real-world applications. Courses taught include Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer Processes. Donga Ramesh Kumar has published in prestigious journals and received an all-India rank of 285 in GATE 2006. Contact Donga Ramesh Kumar at rkdonga@ddn.upes.ac.in.

Ms. Tullika Jesrani is the General Counsel at Kimberly-Clark (India), where Ms. Tullika Jesrani also serves as a Board Member and a member of the Country Leadership Team. With over 17 years of experience, Ms. Tullika Jesrani possesses expertise across various sectors including FMCG, Pharma, and CPG. Ms. Tullika Jesrani is responsible for overseeing legal strategy, risk management, and provides legal advice and leadership within the organization. Ms. Tullika Jesrani's role emphasizes strategic leadership and comprehensive oversight of legal aspects at Kimberly-Clark.

UPES has achieved notable milestones in research, significantly surpassing global averages with a research output growth from 0.7 papers to three papers per faculty, totaling over 1400 indexed outputs by mid-September 2022. The university features 24 faculty members in the top 2% globally, with remarkable contributions from distinguished professors. UPES nurtures a research culture through financial support, dedicated facilities, and extensive databases, while planning to recruit 1000 PhD scholars over four years. Faculty contributions include prestigious fellowships and recognition, enhancing the university's commitment to innovative, industry-aligned education and research excellence.

UPES students share memorable moments from campus placement interviews that led to lucrative job offers with companies like ONGC, Schlumberger Limited, and McKinsey and Company. Notable experiences include Anjali Kukrety describing the color purple creatively, Anvesha Singh receiving feedback on her confident smile, and Aprajita Katiyar being advised on the importance of longevity in a job. Students emphasize the significance of maintaining eye contact and effectively answering unexpected questions, showcasing their adaptability and communication skills. These anecdotes reflect diverse interview dynamics and the valuable lessons learned by UPES students.

The Avant-garde Pharmaceutics Laboratory at UPES offers students hands-on training in drug formulation across various dosage forms, including solid, semi-solid, and liquid. Equipped with advanced technology such as HPLC and UV spectrophotometers, the lab enables practical learning of key formulation processes and quality control. Students like Vaibhav Pandey and Anshuman Tripathi highlight the invaluable experience in creating dosage forms, reinforcing theoretical knowledge with practical skills. Faculty members Dr. Rajendra Awasthi, Dr. Prashant Shukla, and Dr. Gunjan Bonde provide specialized guidance in pharmaceutical formulations and drug delivery systems, preparing students for careers in the pharmaceutical industry.

The BA Journalism and Mass Communication (Digital) program at UPES School of Liberal Studies is a comprehensive 3+1 year course focusing on digital media. It offers specializations in Media Management, Digital Publishing, Social Media and SEO, and Data Analytics. The curriculum includes hands-on experience through internships and projects, preparing graduates for roles like digital journalists and content creators. Industry partnerships ensure strong placement opportunities with organizations like Times of India and NDTV. The program emphasizes practical learning and skills relevant to media trends, ensuring graduates are job-ready in the evolving digital landscape.

The webpage discusses five career paths for aerospace engineering graduates, focusing on aeronautical and astronautical engineering. The demand for aerospace engineers in India's growing aerospace and defense industry is highlighted, driven by increased air travel and ISRO’s initiatives.
